I highly recommend them to anyone looking for trusted, reputable, and effective dog trainers! Just call and talk with Gina--you'll see what I mean!

I have a teacup Pomeranian and have been through 2 training facilities and numerous groomers over the years. I was losing all hope of house breaking our boy and finding a groomer that knew exactly how to groom a long haired dog. I have to say that I am SO lucky and blessed that friends have introduced me to Applied Canine Concepts and Gina and Fabian! They have a beautiful training facility in Palm City with an AMAZING groomer! Cindy (the groomer) cut Tito‚Äôs hair perfectly and just enough, but not too much as I was so worried it would be cut too short like in the past. She knows her stuff and the results are the best we have had so far! I will recommend them to anyone and everyone! My brother just got a German Shepard and I told him to trust no one else except Applied Canine Concepts (due to all of the wasted time and money on other places locally). They were so accommodating in teaching my brother the skills as well as his new puppy. I will most definitely use them in the future if I ever need training tips and tricks and I just started scheduling grooming appointments for every 2 weeks to keep Tito looking good now that I have finally found the most perfect place! Highly Highly recommend!!! The facility is absolutely beautiful and so clean, with amazing staff! I honestly can‚Äôt pick a favorite! I love them all!

We have a two and a half year old Lab that loves to run, away. No sense of recall, just chase. Our neighbors sent their two year old German Short Hair Pointer for training with Gina and Fabian and I was extremely impressed with the results. That was all I needed to make contact with Gina for an evaluation with Fabian.
I believe our dog worked primarily with Riley, with excellent results. Providing us with a healthy, more obedient pet. No more worrying about him darting out in front of a car. We couldn‚Äôt be happier with the results. Riley did an excellent job ‚Äòtransitioning‚Äô our dog back to us after his training, wonderful with the dogs and communicating with us as clients. Fabian and Gina have an excellent reputation and we fully understand why. Thank you and your team for an outstanding experience, and a safe and happy dog.

I had been searching for a dog to add to my farm when I came across a dog Gina was sponsoring to a new home.  She  had trained him as a puppy and knew the ins and outs of this particular dog. Taro needed a unique situation, and after discussing with Gina, I decided to bring him to the farm.   Gina was honest and forthright through the whole process, but was confident that Taro would do well in the right environment and the proper follow up to the training she had already instilled in him.
Fast-forward to now, and Taro is one of the best things ever to happen to me, and has been a wonderful addition to my farm. He is exactly as Gina described, and his training is superb.  Gina checked in quite often the first few weeks to make sure everything was going okay, and to offer training advice if I had any questions.  The level of commitment she has shown to dogs she has trained really shows.  She is always a text or phone call away if a training situation arises. The support from her and Applied Canine Concepts has allowed me to develop a relationship with Taro that otherwise would not have been possible.

Our experience with ACC has been incredible. We just had our 2nd dog trained, we come back for refreshers and they are so patient with ME! Our dogs are good citizens & go with us everywhere with no problems. As we have rescued both dogs they had issues that are no longer problems. They taught me to be firm with love & kindness! Both Gina and Riley are our K-9 Heros!

This company runs very spiteful, worked there was only given a verbal warning for an absence and then went straight to a final and was told not to miss 6 weeks. No write up was given to me. When I missed due to a medical emergency and proof was given.. I had my client ‚Äúcovered‚Äù for me for the rest of the week when in reality Monday came and they removed my client from me NO update no meeting no email nothing. On top of when I worked, I told them I HAVE to leave at 1 and sometimes they‚Äôd sit around and have me there til 1:30 they don‚Äôt respect peoples times as well as their communication is unprofessional.  They do things very unprofessional and I‚Äôve heard this isn‚Äôt the first person they‚Äôve done this too. They will move spiteful when they don‚Äôt get their way they take away your hours and will favorite others that are their puppet. please consider losing hours whenever you don‚Äôt give them their way. They hired me knowing when I started I had no reliable transportation and I needed to be home for my son by 2 so I have to leave at 1 and my time wasn‚Äôt respected. They have too many kids in one small clinic as well, they take in too many children with not enough staffing which was said by a supervisor as well as little space and then you have clients who have higher behaviors putting other clients in situations that they are being hit, rooms as small as fitting maybe a queen size bed with 3-4 RBTs and 3-4 clients, not safe.
Painted the room walls and ceiling, replace broken window pane, provide insight on ways to improve maintenance on building for future plans.

As a parent of ACG Therapy Center my daughter has been attending the center for Speech and Occupational therapy four days a week. I‚Äôm very impressed with the facility and therapist. We have been coming since April and it feels like home away from home. Everyone including clients, parents and staff are very respectful of each other. I would recommend anyone to ACG facility.

I loved ACG they were wonderful with my daughter, they helped her with talking clearer and depression now her confidence is up the roof she was 4 at time was there till she was 5.5; but now I need to bring her back due to school counselor seem can‚Äôt maintain or have time to help her learning I know ACG will get job done she‚Äôs now 8 in 2nd grade. The task they give parents and goals for kids to reach is phenomenal they are for parents and children I always refer them to anyone first everyone employed there care and respectful they‚Äôre more concerned about the children well being than treating them as a patient I‚Äôm greatful for that. So if you become part of ACG family be prepared for phone calls if kids late or miss appointments lol they take it seriously! Good job ACG

My son did speech therapy there for about 10 months. This therapist was Jennifer and we had free service through the Early Steps program. Jennifer was amazing. She was kind and easy-going and great at her job. Theo was 2 and full of toddler righteous. Jennifer made it fun and welcoming for him. Just had our re-assessment and he is now above his age group in language. The front desk staff were always friendly and organized.

I have been working with Physical Therapist, Mick Janusko for the last few months.  My progress has been steady and I see improvements.  The dry needling has been helpful in releasing scar tissue.  Mick is smart,  professional,  a great  communicator, and honest. His office is very clean. He is easy to access and responds to questions quickly.   He makes individual treatment plans and ALWAYS asks if I need clarification or have questions.  He demonstrates exercises for me if needed.  He is kind, funny, and caring.  I am glad I found him!

We had a great experience with ACTive Family PT. Mick was professional, yet established a comfortable rapport with my 11 year old. He was flexible with our schedule,  and got my son back on the baseball field in time for a big tournament. I‚Äôd highly  recommend them to anyone!

Mick has been more than a physical therapist at CF904.  He has been a team mate, and someone who has involved himself with the community.  He is constantly asking how certain members are doing after he has treated them.  He is always communicating what to look out for for those members he has treated, and how to help them during class. As a business partner, he has been fantastic.  As a therapist, he rises above.  He isn‚Äôt a ‚Äútreat you forever‚Äù therapist, but one who wants to get you fixed, healed, and on your way to continue accomplishing your goals.  He is very conscious of what his clients take best to as far as treatment plans and is very sensitive if there are certain treatments or rehabilitation exercises that a patient may not enjoy or doesn‚Äôt work for them.  He is constantly researching, teaching, and educating his clients.    Anyone can treat, but it takes a great therapist to arm their clients with wisdom and knowledge for their health and well being.

Dr. Mick is an amazing PT. He is extremely attentive, responsive, genuine, supportive and customizes the therapy to what works best for the patient. I'm so glad I was referred to Dr. Mick because otherwise I probably would have bargain shopped my insurance policy's providers and missed out on making a much smarter investment in my short and long term health and wellness. Dr. Mick helped me develop a strategy to continue training while rehabbing a strained tendon that has been a trouble spot for many years. He got me healed enough to complete my goal race, and designed a very manageable strength training plan for me to eliminate the weaknesses that caused the injury in order to prevent a recurrence. I would and do highly recommend him to anyone in need of physical therapy.

My son has been going here for Crossfit with Mick and has had a great experience. He always has a great workout with him, and he helps him through the exercises. My son has gained more confidence because of how supportive and friendly Mick is. He is always willing to work with me on scheduling and is flexible when I need to reschedule. I highly recommend Mick if you're looking for a crossfit coach.

I have been receiving physical therapy for my knee after reconstruction surgery.  My therapist, Claudia Castillo, has worked diligently with me to gain strength and movement.  She encourages me when I want to quit too soon.  Through her efforts, I am stronger every day and  improving with each session. A special mention to Rosy and Monica who are very friendly and willing to assist.  I strongly recommend Advance Therapy Works and Claudia Castillo.

I highly recommend Advance Therapy Works! The service and attention here are truly exceptional. From the moment you walk in, the staff makes you feel welcomed and cared for. The therapists are knowledgeable, attentive, and genuinely committed to helping you recover and feel your best. They take the time to listen, explain everything clearly, and tailor the treatment to your specific needs. Thanks to their expertise and support, I‚Äôve made great progress. If you‚Äôre looking for quality physical therapy with a personal touch, this is the place to go!

I can't say enough good things about advance Therapy works, Claudia and Monica.  Their professionalism, deep knowledge of the physical therapy and dedication to their patients are unmatched.  They identified the issues I needed to address and provided exercises that made a huge difference. I'm incredibly grateful for their expertise.

Five stars are not enough to do this review. Advanced Therapy Works offers so much more.
I have been going to Advanced Therapy Works after a knee replacement. I can only  say I have the highest regard for the staff.
From the waiting room to the the evaluation to the therapy room I am always met with smiles and the friendliest welcome.
Therapist, Claudia and Rosy are exceptional.
They are attentive to my needs. Their experience and knowledge has me walking without a limp. My pain has decreased so much with their approach to therapy.   It‚Äôs a joy to go to my appointments.
I hope as you search for therapy you will consider Advanced Therapy Works.
For a short time I went to Cora.  There is no comparison. There I was treated like a number at Advanced Therapy Works I am a person who is respected and valued with all that Claudia and Rosy have to offer. It wasn‚Äôt until I switch to Advanced that life became wonderful againüåª

I cannot express enough how happy I am with Advanced Therapy Works! Their professionalism, great communication, ethics and welcoming manner are unmatched! I‚Äôve had a few clinics in the past to compare them with and I can certainly say they are the best! Since the moment you come in through the door, you can feel you are in the right place as you cross paths with other patients acknowledging the same‚Ä¶ They offer treatment to kids and adults and they take their time to connect with each patient accordingly. In my particular case, my 3 year old was diagnosed with autism at 18 months. He needed treatment in physical therapy, OT and Speech! After a few clinics, results started feeling discouraging and not progressing at all. I refused to believe this was the only kind of help my son could get and that‚Äôs when I found Advanced Therapy! In a few months here has my little boy more engaged, saying and repeating tons of words and able to communicate when before here was zero to none! I am beyond grateful for this place and will recommend it to anyone looking for the right help!
The Doctor and staff are very caring and really want you to feel better. They have rehabbed me after neck and back surgery . Would recommend to anyone who is suffering .

I have to been to several physical therapists in the past, but my most recent experience has been the best. The friendly and positive atmosphere but most importantly the most professional and effective physical therapists I have ever had!  I went in with a pinched nerve and shooting pains in my arm, but
after several sessions, I am pain free and I owe it all to AIM REHAB SERVICES. I highly recommend them for any physical therapy needs 10/10!!!

Dr.Aime and his staff Maiana,are the most professional friendly motivating rehab facility that i have had the plesasure of using. After my surgery they worked me back into shape. THANK YOU AIM REHAB SERVICES !!
P.S. Every one that works at Aim Rehab, From the receptionist to all the therapist are totally heart warming professionals.
Five star Facilty!!

I returned to AIM Rehab Services after a few years. They are the absolute best in the world of rehab providers. An old problem recurred, and my first and only choice was AIM. My therapist, Mariana Arroyo was truly excellent. I was the only patient she worked with the entire session. In my experience, no other rehab service does this. Just as it was the time before, my strut & swagger are back, at the tender age of 82. Do not even consider another service. AIM is my first choice, and truly believe it should be yours.

I had therapy for six weeks with Mackangelo Devi. He is an excellent occupational therapist. He is kind and patient but knowledgeable and tenacious in his therapy. After receiving therapy, I was able to regain full strength in my left hand. I am planning to come back after having surgery in my right hand.

I met Matthew, the OT therapist, through a recommendation from my pastor and friend whose children are cared for with professional excellence and, most importantly, the love he has for children. There are no words to thank Matthew for the great work he does and continues to do with my child and we are beyond grateful. My child has had positive and excellent changes in everything. My child loves him and his parents are happy that she is his OT therapist. His attention to us and our parents is the best since he always explains to us about the work he does with my child and the progress, clarifying any doubts and goes the extra mile with good humor and the best attitude and empathy. He earned our respect, heart and is part of the family since we became very fond of him. I recommend Matthew 100%. I thank God for knowing him and helping my son and all children in his needs.

I am very happy with AKL Pediatric Therapy service. They are very quick. I'm very happy with my son's Ocupational Therapist, Mathew.  My son connected very easily with him and he has been improving a lot. He's the best Therapist that I have found for my son. He's friendly, loves to work with kids and uses different strategies to make the Therapy enjoyable. Thank you for helping my son.

I would give AKL a 10-star review if I could!  My teenage daughter's OT therapist Dominick is AMAZING!  She ended the school year with teachers commenting on her improvements.  That speaks volumes of the hard work they both put into the therapy session strategies.  I highly recommend AKL services!

My son has been seeing Lianet at AKL for at least two years now and has made such strides with her. She has been absolutely amazing with him. She is very meticulous with the skills and crafts that she uses specifically for him. She is patient with him during times of behavior concerns and has educated herself on his diagnosis to assist her in bettering her care plan for him. I am grateful for Lianet and all she has done to help my son progress. Great therapist!

We are very satisfy with AKL Pediatric Therapy, the therapist has helped the kids, they are always happy when they learn to do pies, waffles and other goodies and he also helps them with subjects they maybe have hard time with. My kids really enjoy working with their therapist Mathew.

provider_name: ALPI Child Development & Family Services Center
review_text: If your looking for the best education learning center for your children this is the place! The teachers are caring and hard workers, you can tell they take their job very seriously. The improvements in my daughter have been incredible. 10/10

provider_name: ALPI Child Development & Family Services Center
review_text: My son attends ALPI his teacher's (Ms. Elsie and Ms. Brittany) are wonderful. Front office staff is great and stays on top of everything. Speech and OT does a wonderful job with him as well. Transportation is provided as well, that's a great help. I would highly recommend this school for early headstart and headstart. Can't wait for my other 2 little one's to attend this school.

provider_name: ALPI Child Development & Family Services Center
review_text: My daughter has been attending for two years with Mrs. Alvarez and Miss. Alexa classroom. My daughter is always happy to go to school everyday and when she comes home from school there is plenty to talk about what she learned in the day. The administration is also amazing and very easily to communicate with for anything. Way to go team!!!

provider_name: ALPI Child Development & Family Services Center
review_text: 5 stars school teachers and staffs are great. Specially Mrs. Willis room 7 and Mrs. Maria room 4 they are wonderful with the children. Both of my kids go there, best school to start your children.

provider_name: ALPI Child Development & Family Services Center
review_text: Good school, although I believe they should be a little more notice when your child has functions or school activities instead of a couple days before.The staff are all very nice and do the best they can and have to work with, bit I would gladly donate supply for a little more learning and creativity for the kids.

Trina is the best! My son started occupational therapy earlier this year and has improved so much in so many areas. Trina is knowledgeable in so many aspects including nutrition. My son is a picky eater and suffers from constipation.  I have followed her advise and I have seen so much progress in him.  She has done in a few months what I was not able to achieve in years. She is amazing and a great asset to AMP.  Thank you so much for sharing your knowledge and always giving your input about all my concerns.

AMP Pediatric Therapy has been a wonderful partner in our child's developmental journey. We cannot say enough great things about Alex Perez, who has been an incredible physical therapist for our son. Thanks to her expertise, support, and dedication, he has made significant progress in catching up developmentally. Alex not only connects deeply with our child but also provides invaluable guidance to our family ‚Äî helping us understand what we can do at home, communicating effectively with other providers such as Early Steps and the public school system, and offering emotional support as parents navigating this path.

The administrative team at AMP is equally impressive, making a potentially overwhelming process feel seamless. Their communication is consistently clear and proactive, whether it‚Äôs coordinating appointments, handling insurance matters, or helping us understand the steps involved in therapy. Every therapist we‚Äôve encountered ‚Äî physical, occupational, and speech ‚Äî has demonstrated a high level of professionalism, compassion, and skill. It‚Äôs clear that AMP Pediatric Therapy is staffed by a team of truly gifted individuals who care deeply about the children and families they serve.

We‚Äôre so thankful for AMP Pediatric Therapy and especially Alex Perez! When we started, my daughter couldn‚Äôt walk and had developmental delays ‚Äî now she‚Äôs walking on her own! Alex is incredibly patient, skilled, and encouraging.

One of the best things is that AMP provides therapy right at your home or child‚Äôs school, which made everything so much easier. We‚Äôre truly grateful for the care and progress we‚Äôve seen. Highly recommend!

I would highly recommend this therapy for your child. Mrs. Alex is amazing, my son started therapy with her for about one and half years and my son did great. I saw lot of improvement with him. She has great knowledge in her field and possess vast experience. Also she is very friendly, my son would wait for her to come for therapy treatment. The best part was that she came to us instead of us going to her. Thank you Alex for your time.

We‚Äôve had the pleasure of working with Alex Perez for the past two months, and I can honestly say the experience has been transformative for our child. From the very first session, Ms Alex demonstrated not only deep expertise in pediatric physical therapy but also a connected with my child in a warm, encouraging, and patient manner.

Our child came in with a gross motor developmental delay, and the progress we‚Äôve seen under her care has been nothing short of incredible. Each session is thoughtfully planned, with activities that are both fun and effective.

Beyond the therapy itself, what stands out most is her genuine passion for helping children thrive. We‚Äôve felt supported and empowered throughout the process. Our concerns that were shrugged off by multiple pediatricians were not only heard but actually evaluated by Ms Alex. She truly goes above and beyond, and we are deeply grateful for the role she has played in our child‚Äôs development.

I would highly recommend AMP Pediatric Therapy to any parent seeking a skilled, compassionate, and dedicated pediatric physical therapist.

I would not recommend this place to anyone. The place looks old and outdated, but the real problem is with the staff, We took our child there for speech therapy and the girl (Jennifer) who was assigned to our case is really impatient and has a bad attitude. Not patient enough to deal with children and she has a bad temper, she was very agressive with my wife when she tried to assist her and help her how to deal with our son to get better results. Then she got upset and told my wife that "WE ARE DONE HERE" Then my wife took our son and left. Never going back there. What a shame that a place like that would hire agressive and impatient employees. She should never have a job dealing with kids with a temper like that.  She is the one who needs anger management therapy. Stay away from this place if you don't want your child having a horrible experience that will scar him/her for life!

Extremely rude staff! They beat around the bush and gave me nothing but conflicting information regarding my daughter's admission. It's next to impossible to get through to the person you need to get to and when you finally do, what they tell you will be different from what you'll be told the next time you call. Absolutely horrible experience!
Ann Storck Center provides an exceptionally unique service to individuals with profound disabilities, and its direct-care staff provides a high caliber of service.
Give someone love and receiving love back with the big beautiful facials expression on their faces for thirty-one year's  and I love all fourty-six plus ADT and PPC That's my joy making them HAPPY
Nurse Kisha‚Äôs is awesome. Very companionate to the residents and their families.

Peichi "Peggy" Yen is a Fantastic acupuncturist. Peichi "Peggy" Yen takes the time to listen, and I always leave feeling  100% better after the acupuncture treatment. Julie at the front is always pleasant and happy to help. All the staff are always considerate and helpful. Thank you all. I highly recommend Arc Acupuncture.

I went 1 time for treatment of pain in both of my thumbs (arthritis). Got acupuncture and a bit of electrical stimulation. 1 time. I was mostly pain free for 2 weeks‚Ä¶ Price was a bit steep because my crap insurance doesn‚Äôt cover any of it but what price are you willing to pay to be rid of incessant, nagging pain? I‚Äôll figure it out. Couldn‚Äôt schedule a follow up due to work conflicts but will reschedule as soon as practical

Very friendly and helpful. I really looked forward on getting my messages. They helped so much with my neck pains and headaches. The staff is especially outstanding and very amable. They made me feel welcomed.

I‚Äôve gone to the Port Orange office on two separate occasions and they have been terrific!!  All the staff are compassionate and professional. They are a great team and very good with the patients. I enjoy the my acupuncture it helps with relieving pain.

Dr. Luanis and Ashley are amazing. They make you feel so seen and understood. Dr. Luanis is so knowledgeable; I‚Äôve had psychiatrists that don‚Äôt know why I feel/do what I do but she figured it out immediately and helped me immensely. She never judged me or dismissed what I said, she took the time to truly listen and treat me, and when the treatment didn‚Äôt work she would revise it again and again until she found the perfect one for me. Because of them I‚Äôve been able to grow and become a better partner, friend, and person. My quality of life increased in a way I thought could never happen. I searched for so long to find doctors and therapists like this and I can truly say they are the best. When someone tells me they‚Äôre thinking about getting help I always recommend them. I am absolutely confident and trust in their ability to understand and help anyone.
Love this place! The providers and staff are amazing, they really go above and beyond to help you get better. I highly recommend this place.
The staff is amazing team. They are so welcoming and made me feel so ok. The girls are all smiles and you can tell management has assembled a great team to attend to all our needs.
It‚Äôs a very lovely place and the clinical crew is amazing

provider_name: ARCH Mental Health & Healing Center, LLC.
review_text: Anna and Bri are the ABSOLUTE BEST therapist around (and I‚Äôm not just saying that). I have never met two people who are so kind and patient and understanding. They truly care about your well-being and truly just want what is best for you. They are not therapist who just want to quickly medicate you and get you out of their office. If you can‚Äôt make it into the office they have no problem with telehealth over the phone. If I could give 100 stars I would!!!

provider_name: ARCH Mental Health & Healing Center, LLC.
review_text: We have been seeing therapist at Arch mental health and healing for over a year. Myself and my 4 year old son to address parent child interaction and wellness. We highly recommend the services which have helped us a lot.

provider_name: ARCH Mental Health & Healing Center, LLC.
review_text: Annie is a blessing. She's helped me deal with my anxiety and stress to make life better during a very difficult time due to my husband's brain tumor. Sometimes life takes a turn and things can change in a blink of an eye but know your not alone. I highly recommend her to everyone. Her daughter is just as sweet as her. Lovely professional counselor

provider_name: ARCH Mental Health & Healing Center, LLC.
review_text: Anny is fantastic! Found her almost a year ago and she has helped me thru my PTSD and when our life got turned upside down with news and my children needed someone, I didn't need to search.  She works so well with children and adults I would recommend her to anyone that asked me.

provider_name: ARCH Mental Health & Healing Center, LLC.
review_text: Mrs Anny is a great counselor  and makes me feel completely at ease. Only had 2 sessions with her , but she's already helped me a lot. I recommend her to anyone looking for someone you can trust  to have your best interest at heart. Thank you

We purchased our daughter‚Äôs service dog through ASA Service dogs in 2022.  Atlas is the best trained dog and provides invaluable service to our daughter. I‚Äôve been very impressed with the support provided to my daughter after taking ownership. Amanda has been instrumental in teaching my daughter to be an excellent service dog handler. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this organization.

Words can‚Äôt express how grateful we have been for ASA and Amanda! After researching service dog organizations all over the country, we were so lucky to find one so close that offered autism service dogs. From the moment we first applied, Amanda has been communicative and open throughout the entire journey. Our pup came to us nearly 4 months ago and is not only the sweetest dog, but also incredibly trained in her commands. In our short time, she‚Äôs traveled with us to amusement parks, stores, on cruises, etc. and it‚Äôs a testament to the amazing training she‚Äôs had from ASA, Amanda and her puppy raisers. We can‚Äôt recommend this amazing organization enough!

ASA Service Dogs Inc. is an incredible organization. Our 5 year old son was diagnosed with ASD in 2022 and life has been a whirlwind since then. Navigating daily life and figuring out the best way to provide him a sense of comfort and safety in new / different situations has been a constant stream of learning and accommodating. Through ASA Service Dogs our son now has a companion that can help him through social meltdowns, stimming, and moments of high stress. Through their amazing effort and diligence we now have a new furry member of our family that not only helps our son but helps us. I can not recommend ASA enough. Thank you for all you do!

I could only say good things about Amanda and ASA Service Dogs team. I researched many organizations and places where to find a seizure response service dog for our three year old. Everything was explained in detail and Amanda worked with us via email to take care of all the paperwork. Our daughter finally has her service dog and we are completely happy of how well trained he is and such a sweet dog. The process took about 18 months and it was definitely worth the wait. Thanks to ASA service dog our little girl has a best friend for life to protect and comfort her

Working with Amanda and ASA service dogs has been such a wonderful experience, and truly a life changing one. I was at a point with my ptsd and anxiety where I could no longer even step out onto the front porch of my house nor had I for almost three years at that point.
In October of 2022, I was blessed with Inky, and now I can't imagine my life without him. No matter how difficult it is for me to go out, I know I can with him by my side every step of the way. He's my furry guardian angel.
Amanda has been absolutely amazing every step of the way. Despite how hard it is to talk to others with my anxiety, I always feel a sense of comfort and ease when communicating with her.
She truly cares about both the dogs and people she works with and I'm so very blessed to have found this organization. When I first contacted Asa, I wasn't very hopeful, I had previously worked with a different company for a service dog and the treatment I had received left me incredibly broken. Right off the bat, the difference between that organization and Asa service dogs was mind blowing.
I can't begin to accurately describe what this has done for me. I continue to express my gratitude for what's been given to me. For those needing a service dog, Asa service dogs is the organization I highly recommend. It's a decision I was truly blessed with.

I had a great experience at ASR for my tennis elbow treatment. My therapist, Matt, created a personalized plan that included targeted exercises and manual therapy. The staff was friendly and supportive, making each session enjoyable. I‚Äôm thankful for their help. I highly recommend!

I was recommended ASR from a DR and friends. After going for over a month I can see why now.

Matt F is literally the best PT. He goes above and beyond and more importantly cares.

If you‚Äôre looking for a Physical Therapist, etc. Look no further than ASR and more importantly Matt F. He is the best of the best.

Dr. Anika Arevalo is an exceptional physical therapist. Her years of experience at the University of Miami have clearly equipped her with the clinical expertise to quickly identify the root cause of pain and create an effective treatment plan. I was amazed by how well the dry needling worked‚Äîmy chronic back pain resolved within just a few weeks.
Even though my back pain completely resolved, I kept going because Dr. Arevalo also helped me build strength in my core and stabilize my SI joint. She‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable about functional movement and core muscle training. Even my gait has noticeably improved. Most importantly, my back and glutes are significantly stronger now and I was able to avoid surgery.

Dr. Arevalo is professional, attentive, and extremely knowledgeable. I only wish I had found her sooner. Highly recommend for anyone dealing with back pain or looking to improve their strength and stability!

I couldn‚Äôt walk for weeks due to sciatica and lower back spasm.Not be able to walk and do everyday activities was very hard for me. At some point I was feeling depressed. I learned about ASR Sports Medicine through social media, so I decided to visit them.Upon arrival Matt McGowan welcomed me. After I described to him my situation,Matt started working out with me right away. Day by day, week by week, my progress to full recovery was very successful. I am very thankful to BIG Matt and his ASR TEAM (Matt and Anika) for support.  They are very knowledgeable and professional therapists. Highly recommended üôå

This was my first experience with physical therapy, and I honestly couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better one than at ASR Physical Therapy. I came in with knee pain that had been lingering for a while, and Anika was amazing from day one. She‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable‚Äîespecially with dry needling and strengthening exercises‚Äîand she made me feel confident that my knee pain would improve.

Anika took the time to explain everything, answered all my questions, and built a plan that was really personalized. The dry needling helped relieve a lot of the pain and tightness, and the exercises actually worked‚ÄîI started noticing improvements pretty quickly.

The whole team at ASR is welcoming and professional, and the atmosphere is friendly and low-stress. I‚Äôm so glad I went and would definitely recommend them to anyone dealing with pain or recovering from an injury.
I‚Äôm a volunteer at the Autism Acceptance Centre and they‚Äôre amazing and compassionate! They make our friends feel seen and have amazing activities and trips planned for all occasions. Love them!

If you are thinking about you or your loved one attending this center, I would not hesitate. We are so grateful my adult kid has such a safe, loving place to go for an occasional day out of the house. They provide such fun outings for them. The owners/caregivers are fabulous
The people who run this organization are amazing! Their care and compassion are truly unique. If you are looking for services to aid adults on the spectrum, I would recommend this place.

AVION Physical Therapy is awesome! The AI running analysis was such a cool tool and gave me really clear insight into my form. Dr. Brandon is super knowledgeable and explains things in a way that actually makes sense. The whole vibe is friendly and professional, and I left feeling confident about my recovery. Definitely recommend!

My experience at AVION has been amazing! They did a very thorough assessment and have taught me many stretches and strengthening exercises that have got me out of my pain. So not only am I now pain free but they also taught me proper form for exercises that I can carry over to the gym such as squats and deadlifts and how to do them properly for my body. I also love that they do hands on soft tissue work which helps relieve tight painful areas. They are truly so knowledgeable and genuinely the nicest people! Brandon and Andrew are the best! This place is doing everything right! Highly recommend!!

The team at AVION Sports Rehab is the best I‚Äôve ever worked with. Hands down, bar none.

I met Andrew, one of the owners, at an event my gym was hosting and chatted with him about my upcoming left lateral meniscus repair surgery. As a full time trainer, I was worried about recovery time and regaining full functionality and mobility post-op. He listened intently and explained about all his clinic has to offer.

They work almost exclusively with not just athletes - but people - of all levels, their PTs and staff are fully certified and are always looking for opportunities to continue their education. AVION also has the latest in sports rehab and physical therapy tech, from dry needling, cupping, red light therapy, and blood flow restriction therapy. The center itself is also clean, spacious, well maintained and stocked with everything for rehab and prehab!

My PT, Nicole, is on a different level. She‚Äôs incredibly intelligent, has a lot of experience, meticulous in her attention to detail, is an athlete herself and is a joy to work with. I‚Äôve worked out for years and have had to recover from my share of injuries and I can honestly say she‚Äôs the best PT I‚Äôve had the pleasure of working with.

I cannot recommend the team at AVION enough. As a fitness professional, I feel at home here. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not normal to exercise in pain.‚Äù This is the first sign you see when you walk into the clinic and it‚Äôs a statement the team here lives by with every second of every session.

Thank you to Andrew, Nicole and the entire team.

So far so good, I took this place as a referral specifically by Brandon. I really enjoy the dry needling and cupping when I leave my pain levels are down. And we‚Äôve been working a lot of exercises for my posture which I feel like slowly, but surely it‚Äôs working. Definitely recommend this place and Brandon.

I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough! From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted with a warm, welcoming smile from Arzoo at the front desk‚Äîshe‚Äôs incredibly sweet and always makes you feel at ease. The entire space is clean, modern, and has such a positive atmosphere that instantly lifts your mood.

I came in a couple of months ago with severe neck pain that was affecting every part of my day. I worked closely with Brendan, who was not only knowledgeable but also genuinely invested in my recovery. He took the time to explain everything, tailored my therapy to my needs, and always pushed me just enough to see progress without overwhelming me.

If you‚Äôre struggling with neck issues, or really any kind of pain, this is the place to go. The team here truly knows what they‚Äôre doing, and they care. Highly recommend ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: AVS Equine Medical and Surgical Hospital
review_text: Hands Down the Best experience with our Mare who just foaled on Memorial day (4 days ago). She had huge abdominal and side swelling even after the placenta was out. We noticed she wouldn't lay down and it was hard for the baby to get her head around the swelling to nurse. Thinking the worst (poss. Internal abdominal tear/multiple hernia's), we called AVS and within minutes was txtd and sent pics. They called and kept in contact with us til we were walking through their doors with Mom and Baby in hand. They got to work Quick, not only was our furmembers needs Important to us have to admit so was the $$$ of the bill. Our concerns disipated after we were allowed to stand with the Dr. And watch while he explained everything to us and a treatment plan. Yesss!! Sounds Great, so now the thought is do we have to mortgage our house!?! Nope Not even close. Amazingly the bill was doable and treatment seemed the correct course of action. I can't be MORE THANKFUL for This Team, Dr. Fisch and his Staff ARE AMAZING!!

provider_name: AVS Equine Medical and Surgical Hospital
review_text: What an amazing facility and staff! I needed an emergency vet, after hours, very late at night for my horse. My mare was going septic and she needed a vet right away, Dr Fisch answered the phone and walked me through the process. He explained what his care plan was going to be and how long he expected her to be hospitalized. I am so grateful for Dr Fisch and his staff coming in after hours to take excellent care of my mare. His staff was kind, friendly and helpful. He called me every single morning to update me and ensured me that we were on track with his care plan. He took my wallet into consideration with every testing recommendation. He answered all of million questions and was very thorough. He really wanted to help my mare and that meant so much to me. I hope to not have any more after hour emergencies‚Ä¶ but if I do, I will definitely be calling AVS first! Thank you so much Dr Fisch!!!

provider_name: AVS Equine Medical and Surgical Hospital
review_text: I purchased several very injured/ sick horses for rescue. Without being an established client, Dr. Golden and her amazing team jumped into gear to home visit my herd upon arrival to evaluate and treat my horses  (with no notice). Once treated, I was allowed to ask 100s of questions. Each question was answered with kindness and patience. Dr. Golden and staff have now saved two critical horses with life ending injuries. Somehow she saved both. I am amazed at the level of care being given.  I could not ask for better care.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!! If you really want the best outcome for your horse., I highly recommend this vet!

provider_name: AVS Equine Medical and Surgical Hospital
review_text: Knowledgeable,  friendly, patient, and just nice. Beautiful facility with great employees.  my horses and I love them. ‚ù§Ô∏è

review_text: Dr Lacey and MA are the best! They take great care of my horses!

If you‚Äôre looking for a place that truly cares for your child I highly recommend ABA Star Therapy. The staff at ABA Star Therapy goes above and beyond for all the kids. You‚Äôll definitely feel welcomed by everyone and see just how great the environment is.

My daughter Amirah has been with ABA Star therapy for over a year now after a big move from Atlanta. My daughter was previously received ABA from a company that we adored so it was imperative that when we transitioned to Miami the center we chose would be just as amazing. From the very beginning Ron and Leor made the process flawless for us. I was told from so many companies that we'd have to wait for 8 months to a year for services. Not here. I don't have a worry in my mind when I drop her off everyday because I know there's something new she's learned everyday. Thank you all so much for what you do. Great company! My some loves his therapist Ms. Brenda and the whole team is amazing and helpful. The center is clean and has so many things for the kids to use or play with.

Amazing service and the employees there are so kind and willing to help in any way that they can. My family and I are thankful for being part of ABA Therapy of Palm Beach. My son has improved since being here for almost one year. My son‚Äôs RBT, speech and OT therapists , Analyst and the owner of the Agency have been great to us. I am more than thankful for finding great and trusting therapist for my son.

My child is blessed to have found the best place to receive his speech, occupational therapy, and RBT. You can find everything in one place. If you are looking for a place to help your child, this is the best you will find. provider_name: Abacus Therapies - ABA Therapy for Kids
review_text:
I recently reached out to Abacus Therapies seeking support for my 6 year old daughter, and while they couldn't accommodate my insurance plan, the experience was still incredibly positive. From the moment I dialed their number, I was greeted by a lady whose kindness and professionalism left a lasting impression.

Despite not being able to offer services, she went above and beyond to provide guidance and support, steering me towards alternative options that could better meet our needs. Her empathy and willingness to assist, even in my situation where they did not take my insurance, truly demonstrated the commitment of Abacus Therapies to supporting individuals and families.

While I can't speak to the quality of their therapies firsthand, based on this interaction alone, I have no doubt that Abacus Therapies prioritizes customer care and goes the extra mile to ensure every individual receives the support and guidance they need. If their level of service over the phone is any indication, I would wholeheartedly recommend reaching out to them for assistance.

provider_name: Abacus Therapies - ABA Therapy for Kids
review_text:
We had the pleasure of having Sara and her team for the autism course, and we were very pleased with it. The content was insightful and well-structured, providing valuable information and practical strategies for working with autistic individuals. Sara's expertise and passion for the subject were evident throughout the course, making it engaging and informative for all participants.
In addition, we would like to commend Vanessa for her outstanding management of the logistics and organization of the event. She ensured everything ran smoothly and efficiently, allowing us to fully focus on the learning experience. Overall, we highly recommend Sara and her team's courses and appreciate Vanessa's efforts in making the event a success.

Thank you

provider_name: Abacus Therapies - ABA Therapy for Kids
review_text: The Abacus team's dedication to helping children succeed is amazing!  They create an environment where kids can genuinely be themselves and also grow.  I highly recommend them to any parent seeking ABA Therapy for their child.

provider_name: Abacus Therapies - ABA Therapy for Kids
review_text: My son receives therapy with Abacus since his  autism diagnosis, the improvement in all his behavior are impressive, his academic development is also huge, as a mother I could not be more grateful for all the therapist and BCBA from this wonderful company, they are really advocate for their clients.

provider_name: Abacus Therapies - ABA Therapy for Kids
review_text: The worst ABA therapy center I‚Äôve ever encountered. Starts all the way up to one of the cofounders and trickles down to the terrible unprofessional of BCBA‚Äôs and ‚ÄúRBT‚Äôs‚Äù. It was a wonderful experience for children and the elderly. They have a fantastic team and have gave excellent care of my family members. They are very professional, dedicated, and understanding of the clients needs. They exceded my expectations.

It is a worderful experience for children and parents. The environment is welcoming, the care for the children is excellent, and the staff is very professional. I love the team at Abby Pediatric Care. I highly recommmed it to anyone looking for a trustworthy place for their children‚Äôs care.

I highly recommend Abby PPEC for your children. They are a fantastic team and have been taking excellent care of my little one from day one. Their team is professional, compassionate, and truly understands the unique needs of each child. With personalized care plans, expert staff, and a nurturing environment, they go above and beyond to ensure every child receives the highest quality of care. Their dedication and attention to detail make them a trusted choice for pediatric care and support.

I wholeheartedly recommend Abby PPEC! If you have a child who needs medical services, nursing attention, and therapies, this place is the perfect match! The incredible staff work hard to help those children grow, progress, and acquire the abilities they need. They truly make miracles possible.

My boy started here a few months ago and it was very nerve racking due to his past experiences(he was dragged by his wrist and traumatized at his old school) then we came here and his separation anxiety quickly improved ü•π‚ù§Ô∏è i now hear all day about Ms dina and how amazing she is ü•π‚ù§Ô∏è he loves going to school again. He went from needing me to go with him to cheerfully waving goodbye and RUNNING to ms dina‚ù§Ô∏è i cant even find the words to describe how HAPPY I am with this center an the staff‚ù§Ô∏è im so excited to see where he goes thanks to the help of Ms Cory, Ms dina, Ms Cristina and all of ability learning ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è you guys are amazing!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüëèüèΩüëèüèΩ
Love coming here they are all very wonderful and do amazing work with all the kids

It's been hard finding a place that fits my kid's needs. Ability is great because they have occupational, physical, speech, and behavior therapy and do their best with our crazy schedule. Can't thank Mr. Daniel enough for all he's done for my kid and making strategies to help my kid grow.
My grandson loves going to school because of all the teachers in this school. He looks forward to getting up in the morning getting dressed. He has come along way, in a great amount of time.
My daughter's favorite place and she has learned so much from all the amazing teachers.

We are so thankful to Ability Plus Therapy and Courtney! My 4 year old daughter had a severe elbow break that required two surgeries. She had lost a lot of her range of motion which required her to go to physical therapy. My daughter was afraid to go to physical therapy at first,  but Courtney made her feel so comfortable and made all of the exercises so fun! Now, Avery considers Courtney her best friend, and best of all, her range of motion is back!

Doesn‚Äôt get any better than Ability Plus Therapy! From the caring dedication of the therapist to the kind and efficient front desk staff, this center is truly the best! The owners care and offer state of the art equipment for your child. Have a question or concern they are there with the wisdom and understanding you expect from a therapy center. We are so blessed to have Henry learning from Ability Plus! He has come a long way and I know he will reach his full potential with their direction!

Our daughter has been coming to Ability Plus Therapy since 2019 - coming back every 6 months for a PT Intensive. I honestly do not have a bad thing to say about any of our experiences. We have been so fortunate to work with some of the BEST physical therapists in the state - Mandi, Heather & Tonya are beyond AMAZING!!! Mandi has been our primary therapist for most of the intensives and our daughter has come to love & adore her as if she was family. She actually gets so excited to start each intensive and is sad when they are over. I have never doubted any of their abilities - and I‚Äôm always in awe of how they adapt to any situation and problem solve on the spot. They make each exercise fun which is a huge bonus for our daughter in order to keep her engaged. And while we have not done any occupational therapy while there, we have come to know several of the therapists (Corrine & Tally) and they are equally as AMAZING!

I love that they have a large enough space to be able to do so many activities without ever feeling cramped for space like other facilities we have been to. Also to note, they do utilize the Therasuit with PT intensives and I highly recommend!

We‚Äôve been lucky to do her last 2 intensives with another friend with similar attributes - which is highly motivating for the both of them! And now we will be life-long friends!

I can‚Äôt express enough how amazing ability plus therapy is! They went above and beyond for my family and my daughter during her time there, Miss.Jennifer was her speech therapist and she is amazing! She‚Äôs very informative on what she does with your child and gives you tips and things to work on at home! I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough!

Ability Plus was a complete answer to prayer. I had been struggling with finding a PT for my youngest son (who has a diagnosis of HIE and developmental delays) because I felt like none of them would listen to me. This is definitely not the case at Ability Plus! We were blessed to be partnered with Mandi Porter, who is one of the most patient people I have ever encountered. She has a wide variety of tools that she uses when treating my son and she really honors what he shows her. She is able to identify when to push him and when to back off. He loves her very much and smiles just when we mention her name.

We just completed our 3rd round of intensive therapy through Ability with Mandi and we are blown away by how God has used Mandi and Ability to help our son. He has far surpassed what the doctors originally said he would be able to do.

The three stars are because of friendly office staff and the friendly PTA,Tyler, and the two techs, Diana and Brandy, plus the fact I learned some exercises from Tyler. My concerns are that I saw a PT once for a quick evaluation and was set up with a session with a Physical Therapy Assistant- who did a few EXCELLENT sessions and then I was passed off to techs/aides who are not licensed or certified as Physical Therapy Assistants. I saw no credentials or badges so this is left me to figure this out. The techs/aids tried to perform manual massage on me with what I believe to be very little training. It‚Äôs my understanding this is outside the scope of a tech/aid. On Fridays only the techs saw me without a Physical Therapist or Physical Therapy assistant on the premises. Diana and Brandy often tried to do the best they could and were exceptionally kind. A chiropractor was working in his office on Fridays. However it‚Äôs my understanding that legally, in Florida, a chiropractor cannot supervise aides or techs in the practice of physical therapy. When one tech told me she‚Äôd be working with me one Friday because she lost a game of rock, paper, scissors, I asked to only work with Tyler again, the certified Physical Therapy Assistant. I was told the PTA didn‚Äôt work on Fridays so I made appointments for the other days and was told in the afternoons there might be a lag while he worked with other patients. The staff kindly made the adjustment and were professional. More frequently Tyler asked if he could just finish up with me on another day because he was running out of time/seeing so many patients. The last assessment suggested I would benefit from continuing for a while longer. However the last time I was there Tyler said stiffness was normal at my age and shrugged and said he‚Äôd catch me next time.That was the second day in a row. I was just going and doing exercises I knew how to do. I could have voiced my frustrations earlier and I don‚Äôt know if it would have changed much or I would have been perceived as difficult; by now I already felt like a huge inconvenience. I‚Äôve been in physical therapy two other times in my life. The last time it was about two or three years ago with South Florida Ortho in Tradition (SFO). At SFO, techs/aids assisted PTAs and PTs but did not take over patients. At SFO, although exercises and stretches were increasingly performed with more independence, there was always SOME one-on-one guidance and time with a PT or PTA at every session. This time SFO‚Äôs PT practice was so full they referred me here (to Action) up so I wouldn‚Äôt have to wait so long, which I respect. However, if there isn‚Äôt adequate time to see every patient in this practice (Action) at a particular time/day and with a PT or PTA present, some patients shouldn‚Äôt be scheduled. If I had been told there wasn‚Äôt adequate PT/PTA staff or supervision available I could have sought therapy elsewhere. Instead, it seems like the focus on profit and quantity is at the expense of consistent patient care and quality here.

Update- the licensed professional to which the response to this review refers is a licensed chiropractor who was in his office there on the Fridays  I was seen. There was no PT or PTA present with the techs/aides who were working with patients. It is my understanding that a chiropractor cannot provide supervision to PTs, PTAs, or their techs/aides.

I didn‚Äôt realize how much of a difference this treatment program would make in my life until I actually saw the results and went through it all. At 41 years old, I have more energy than ever before, my back and neck issues are rectified and gone, and I‚Äôm able to perform at 100% in my trade because of the amazing work that Active Med Pros did on me.
