We‚Äôve had a really positive experience with Angel Speech & Therapy. The therapists are kind, patient, and clearly know how to connect with kids. My child actually looks forward to coming, which says a lot. We‚Äôve noticed real progress, not just in speech but in confidence too. The place has a warm, welcoming vibe, and you can tell the staff really cares. Definitely glad we found them.

I‚Äôve personally spent time at Angel‚Äôs Animal Sanctuary and can confidently say the animals here are treated with nothing but love, care, and respect. Every animal is healthy, well-fed, and clearly adored ‚Äî they‚Äôre treated more like family pets than anything else.
It‚Äôs sad to see false reviews spreading, because the truth is the complete opposite of what‚Äôs being said. The sanctuary is a safe, peaceful place where the animals‚Äô well-being always comes first. Anyone who visits can immediately feel the compassion and dedication that go into caring for every single creature here.
If you‚Äôre thinking about visiting, volunteering, or supporting the sanctuary ‚Äî do it. You‚Äôll see firsthand how much heart and hard work go into keeping these animals happy and thriving.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Angel‚Äôs Animal Sanctuary ‚Äì A True Haven for Animals!

Angel‚Äôs Animal Sanctuary is nothing short of extraordinary! From the moment you arrive, it‚Äôs clear how deeply loved and well-cared-for every animal is. The sanctuary grounds are clean, peaceful, and beautifully maintained ‚Äî a true reflection of the compassion that drives this place.

Each animal is in remarkable condition, healthy, happy, and full of personality. It‚Äôs heartwarming to see how much time, attention, and genuine affection the volunteers pour into their care. The dedication of the staff and volunteers goes far beyond expectations ‚Äî they treat every creature like family and ensure their physical and emotional needs are met.

Whether it‚Äôs rescuing, rehabilitating, or simply offering lifelong sanctuary, Angel‚Äôs Animal Sanctuary truly lives up to its name. It‚Äôs an inspiring example of what love and kindness can achieve. I can‚Äôt recommend visiting, donating, or volunteering here enough ‚Äî this sanctuary is a blessing to both animals and the community! üêæüíõ

Angels Animal Sanctuary is a lovely place, situated on many acres, that cares for animals in need - like horses, pigs, roosters, emus, dogs, cats, and many others. The sanctuary has buildings and areas set up specifically for the needs of the particular animals.
It is a pleasure to participate in their fundraising activities for the needed money to care for their animals. The sanctuary offers events like yoga, sound healing, retreats and even comedy shows to name a few!
Thank you, Angels Animal Sanctuary, for providing a very important need to our community, and in such a loving and all inclusive way.

I had the most incredible experience at Angels Animal Sanctuary Wellness Retreats! From the moment I arrived, I was welcomed with warmth and kindness by Angel, and Anita as well as Leroy, and Cornelius‚Äîtruly the most beautiful souls to meet. The glamping tent I stayed in was beautifully outfitted, offering the perfect balance of comfort and being connected to nature and the animals. The food was absolutely delicious, prepared with such love and care. The guests were such a beautiful gift to meet as well, and I enjoyed the connection and conversations. ü•∞
What made this retreat so special was the heart and soul behind it. The sanctuary‚Äôs mission to provide a loving home for rescued animals is nothing short of inspiring. As we learned the touching stories of each animal, it became clear that this is a place where healing, compassion, and connection flourish. The people and the animals here are all on a shared journey of love and hope. I left feeling rejuvenated, deeply grateful with a renewed sense of purpose for my own mission. This is truly a magical placeüèïüå†üíúüêéüêñüêëüêêüêáüêæü¶Éüê¢üêÇ In gratitude for your kindness and hospitality.

Such a beautiful place. I was lucky enough to get to visit and help out with the animals on a recent trip to New Smyrna. So grateful to learn from Gina, Angel, Brandy and Joy, and Cornelius. I love how these animals get a second chance at life. Many rescued would have been meat. Such big personalities too. Particularly the sheep and pigs. I also love the excellent relationships Angel and Anita fostered with volunteers. A real family feel. Thank you so much. I hope I get to see you and the animals again one day ü•∞ Thank you for what you do and everything you taught me.

Angelic Steps Therapy is an Amazing ABA therapy center!
Our BCBA, Julieta does her job very well and is very organized. We always feel that she listens to my family's needs and we have seen big improvements in my younger brother over time.
The owner, Nicole, is always supportive and caring with my family; we are very grateful for her and the staff.
Thank you very much Angelic Steps Therapy for your hard work and for all of the efforts that you provide to my family every day!!

The initial outreach part was good. My inquiry was well received and contact was frequent until I turned in all requested documentation and Angelic waited to hear from my insurance company.

After that point, they never reached out. I always had to initiate contact by asking when we might proceed to the next stage of the intake process. I was always politely told that the person I contacted would ask her manager and she would let me know. She never did. They then went completely unresponsive and I finally had to fire them due to this wholly unprofessional turn they took, but not before they made me waste too much of my time.

Any provider that cannot be bothered to provide substantive answers to questions from would-be patients (especially children) who have already turned in all their medical history and insurance information should not be in business, or at the very least, the unresponsive employees should no longer have a job there.

Angelic Steps is wonderful. My child goes there and they not only care about these kids but actively advocate for them. Simona in particular just goes above and beyond. My child was in public school, where the try to accommodate him, and now he's in a place that is specifically designed for him. Night and day difference. Highly recommended.

I hope that many people will be interested in this comment. This center is the worst there is and I'm not talking about the workers but about the people who run it directly because the owners don't live here and it seems that they don't know in whose hands they are putting their business. Bad advice, don't even apply to work there or take your children. Wait for more comments.
Miss Victoria is amazing with our daughter, we love Angelic steps for all the things they‚Äôve done ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Angels of Care Pediatric Home Health
review_text: Angels of Care is a wonderful place to work! The staff goes above and beyond every single day. They are attentive, experienced, and truly care about the children they serve. We are lucky to have such a devoted and trustworthy team in our corner.

provider_name: Angels of Care Pediatric Home Health
review_text: I am proud to be a nurse working with Angels of Care. This company puts their heart and soul into the care of their patients. The same love and caring goes toward their staff. I have been a nurse for 16 years and never have I felt so at home with a company. If you are searching for care of a loved one or want to join an amazing team of healthcare professionals don‚Äôt hesitate in giving Angels of Care a call!!!

provider_name: Angels of Care Pediatric Home Health
review_text: I am so excited to be working bedside again and being a nurse and a mom to a medically complex son as well I knew I wanted to give pediatric home health a go.  Angels of Care hands down caught my interest and I am proud to be a nurse with this company.  I have felt supported from the start, communication is excellent, and I always feel listened to when I voice a suggestion or concern.  From both a healthcare provider perspective and a parent perspective I highly recommend this company!

provider_name: Angels of Care Pediatric Home Health
review_text: Looking for an amazing company to care for your child? Angels of Care is the best!!!! Communication with the staff is top tier; day or night.  They are always so helpful and attentive. All of the nurses are positive, welcoming and consistent. I am glad to have them in my life and my sons as well. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better company to trust with my child. Truly angels!!!

provider_name: Angels of Care Pediatric Home Health
review_text: Angels of Care has some of the most passionate and dedicated staff. Their team truly cares about their nursing staff and their clients. They work around the clock and are in constant communication with one another to get the Jacksonville kiddos the best care they can!

Thank you to Dr Gintert and Staff for their awesome hardwork. Had cold laser surgery on my French Bulldogs nose and soft palate and couldn‚Äôt be happier with the outcome. The communication and attention to detail have been outstanding. The price was also very affordable. Kudos to you guys for being an outstanding clinic! Would recommend over and over!

Wonderful office with an amazing team. Everyone here is so gentle and kind to my pup who can be very shy. I love the slow approach and fear free handling that they practice. So glad I found such a great hospital. Very reasonably priced as well :) love u guys!

Did a google search to find somewhere close to get my cockatiel's nails trimmed and get established with a vet and found this gem! Everyone we encountered were helpful, compassionate and kind and you can tell they all really love the work that they do. Thank you for taking such great care of Cyber.

We have been taking all of our pets here for 10 years. The staff is always friendly. The doctors are very knowledgeable and have always diagnosed problems accurately and quickly. I feel very comfortable taking my pets there, knowing that they will get taken care of by experts. I always recommend them to family and friends nearby.

As a longtime client of Animal and Bird Hospital, I would definitely recommend them. All the staff, whether it be any of the Vets, the technicians or the office staff are caring and knowledgeable. The manner in which they handle each problem that they undertake is done in a professional and caring manner.
Helped our red foot tortoise princess peaches get wonderful medical care and receive important information to care for her.

We take our 110 pound Great Pyrenees Anatolian Shepherd here. Dr. Tony and his staff are wonderful. Everyone is super nice and go out of their way to help and answer any questions. Our dog is super protective of his family and they accommodate well with this and everyone tries to make him as comfortable as possible. Each visit our dog gets better and better. Our cat also comes here and we have also taken our bearded dragon and our husky here as well. We have been going here for years.   Very happy with their services.
Dr. Tony saved my leopard gecko's life, and I am forever grateful. I cannot recommend this place highly enough!

We are a senior / Hospice dog sanctuary and long-standing client of this amazing veterinary practice.  From scheduling our appointments to the appointments themselves, Dr. Tony and his staff have always been friendly, caring and  very knowledgeable.  We are never rushed and the time is taken to address our questions and concerns.

With the help of Dr. Tony and his staff, we have had to say goodbye to many of our senior / Hospice fur babies. These decisions are never made lightly and we have relied on this wonderful group of people to help us make the decision best for our pets. Every single euthanasia experience involved an open discussion, careful consideration of the issues at hand but most importantly‚Ä¶compassion for the tough decision we were faced with and the ultimate loss of a loved one.

Dr. Tony and his staff fight the good fight alongside us - ensuring our senior / Hospice dogs are getting the best care possible. It is because of this, we trust Dr. Tony and his staff implicitly.

I called this place for the very first time to get some clarification, since their intake form online is vague. Whoever answered the phone was so condescending that I instantly knew I would never bring my pets here. I asked a simple question about whether they take mice and if they could determine gender in a couple of weeks to prevent breeding. First, I was told flat-out ‚Äúno.‚Äù When I clarified, she changed her answer to ‚Äúyes, but not while they‚Äôre this young‚Äù and then proceeded to tell me I should be able to figure it out on my own... when that‚Äôs literally the issue I was calling about. Instead of being helpful, she was rude and dismissive. If this is how they treat potential clients, I can‚Äôt imagine how they treat actual patients. I‚Äôll be taking my business to an exotic vet that actually respects and values their clients.

I have taken my family dogs to Dr. Finkelstein for 15+ years at this point. This vet and his staff fully care about and support all of their patients and are wonderful to work with. They know their customers and patients by name and have been there for me for routine and urgent situations. I have moved all over Tampa as a young adult and will still make the drive to bring my pets here.

I absolutely cannot rave enough about this practice.  I have now been here three times with our pets. I am always offered same day or next day access to see the vet. My wait time has never been more than five minutes.  Dr. Finkelstein and his staff are absolutely phenomenal.  They sit and talk with you, listen and explain every detail of your pet's plan of care. And most of all the pricing is reasonable. I am absolutely thrilled to have found such an awesome clinic.
Absolutely wonderful vet.  Dogs are always happy to be there.

Went for a second opinion and Dr Brett was awesome and took his time with my senior pup and to go over a treatment plan for him. Great staff. No push for unnecessary test that would stress my guy out. Definately going to switch the rest of my fur babies (3 dogs and 3 cats) to him.

Thank you is not enough to express our gratitude to Angel and Dr. Finkelstein for the loving care and genuine caring they gave our sweet Maggie (Labradoodle) and to us. If you need a vet, love your pet and want the best, go here.

Everyone at the Animal Cancer Care was so caring and always extremely conscientious and attentive to our Bailey. We went there for months and they always treated us with the utmost kindness and respect. The Oncologists and the entire staff were outstanding in both their skill and compassion for us and Bailey. Unfortunately, our  sweet Bailey passed a few days ago and after my tearful call to them, they were so kind and caring in their immediate email expression of sympathy. This was not the ‚Äúclub‚Äù we wanted to be a part of, but I can honestly say, that the Doctors and the staff went above and beyond in their skill and their care of Bailey and us throughout the entire process of his treatment for Lymphoma, We are forever indebted to them for the additional 1 1/2 years, that we had with our Baileyüêæ‚ù§Ô∏è

In March we learned that our precious rescue dog, Tina Turner, was diagnosed with potentially incurable cancer. With the excellent medical treatment given by Dr. Camps and her caring associates, we are happy to report that Tina is doing remarkably well. She is happy, playful, and so loving. Obviously we cherish every moment we have with her. What an incredible medical team to give us more time with Tina.
This review is entirely unsolicited and from grateful pet owners.
Paul Hood

Obviously not a good reason to be there. But the staff was kind, caring, and friendly. They took good care of my pup, discussed all the options available Tonia, and let us really decide how we wanted to proceed. Should you find yourself in a similar situation, I definitely recommend them.

Awesome people working here. Only went once so far; we saw Dr. Gallagher. She and both her assistants were wonderful. They really "listened" to us regarding our dogs medical history which is very, very important. They all seemed to genuinely care about our dog and her well being. We are extremely happy so far! üêæ‚ù§

All five star ratings?  I wonder why? Dr.  Brandi is the best that's why.  She took the time each and every time (we've been seeing her several times a year for 3 years) to hold my hand and answer any and all questions about our baby.  She truly cares and it shows.  Unfortunately, due to the pandemic and some personal reasons she has closed her practice ( hopefully just temporarily) and we were forced to find another specialist.

Let's just say the new vet confirmed what we already knew.  Dr. Brandi is pure gold.  We would LOVE to see her return to her practice.  We're certain that we aren't the only ones.

I have waited several months to leave a review. My Golden Retriever Grace was diagnosed with Leukemia in early January 2025. We started treatment at the University of Missouri Animal Hospital. I had sold my condominium and needed to relocate to Florida. I chose Animal Cancer Care Clinic for continued treatment. I also took her to two local animal hospitals. She was a difficult case with alternate diagnosis between acute and chronic leukemia. Her blood work was highly elevated. However, our experience between the University of Missouri and Animal Cancer Care Clinic was night and day. The University setting is a hospital with many doctors, students and all kinds of cancer treatments with numerous facility types and options. ACCC is a retail, storefront operation with traveling doctors who are trying to see as many patients in a day as possible. Many of the Doctors attended the same University and have found their way to Florida. We went to the Melbourne Clinic, I think they have an HQ in Orlando. I experienced long wait times before you see your Oncologist, you only get 10 minutes with your Oncologist and then it is support staff during appointments, and you never hear back from your Oncologist if you have questions between treatments. You call the main number and a support person is the go-between.  The human correlation to a ‚Äúpatient first‚Äù or ‚Äúpatient care‚Äù orientation is not their primary objective. I heard from both organizations there are too many pets and too few Oncologists after the pandemic. They are overworked and under staffed. If you love your pet as we all do and have a somewhat complicated case or want to spend more time with your Oncologist I strongly recommend the University setting. If I had it to do over I would have gone to the University of Florida. If you have a simple case and need basic blood work and treatment ACCC is a solid option as there are not many choices. The first photo is Grace after her last swim, the other two when she was healthy. Good luck and God bless.

Dr. Moore and her team are absolutely the best! The way Dr. Moore explained what is going on with our pup is very much appreciated. She was detailed and patient and answered all of my questions. I never felt rushed, which was very much appreciated. A special shout out to Tyler, Ty, and Ashley. You went above and beyond and your kindness does not go unnoticed. Thank you for treating Piper like your very own. I knew she was in great hands. Thank you all!

I‚Äôve been wanting to write a review for the animal care cancer clinic for the past few months. We found out our little bear had lymphoma from our vet after taking a sample. Called animal care cancer clinic and they were booked out for a month but was able to get us in within a few days (at a different location). Dr. Woods bedside manner is amazing and was one of the best doctors we could have had. Our baby unfortunately did not make it and passed away a month after her initial diagnosis. I can not stress enough how much the techs and doctors here are so incredibly kind. This is one of the most traumatic and painful experiences to go through but everyone was understanding and showed so much compassion. Thank you to everyone here (especially Angel) who tried helping our little baby and gave us that little bit of extra time to spend with her.
Dr. Moore has been taking great care of Gelatin for a while now. We never feel rushed even though I‚Äôm sure they are very busy. He recently had surgery with Dr. Ruddle and she was wonderful as well.

We first visited Animal Cancer Care Clinic when our dog Nash was diagnosed with soft tissue Sarcoma. We have been going there for more than a month now and every visit is just great. The staff is beyond friendly and always engaging with animals and owners. The girls at the reception and the nurses are extremely helpful and make the visit much easier! Special thank you to Stephanie and Dr. Roof that take care of Nash. It‚Äôs the first veterinary office that he comes in and wags his tail! We are still in the middle of treatments but very hopeful thanks to the team! They also always listen when we had any concerns and call us back with any updates from the doctor or nurses.

I cannot express enough how happy I am with this clinic. I took my sweet boy in today because he‚Äôs been feeling sick. For background my boy was adopted two months ago and is very stranger danger. The medical team took their time with him and made this such a positive experience for my baby. They won him over instantly with treats and also understanding and taking their time with him. The doctor is also amazing, I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôm being pushed to do the most expensive thing or unnecessary things, only what‚Äôs needed for a diagnosis.

I went there to find out why my dog‚Äôs breath was smelling very badly And he was coughingand I had spoken to a female on the phone several times who seems concerned and we tried to get him in had to reschedule a couple times but finally got him in and I was feeling happy about it. When I got in I noticed right away the bedside manner of the vet tech wasn‚Äôt that good at all so I thought well maybe the doctor will be better. The doctor came in and shook my hand did not really do anything to my dog other than say he was gonna give him a chest x-ray because he had been doing some coughing he gave him a chest x-ray came back and told methat there was opaque Looking in my Dogs chest x-ray. I asked him what that meant he said he didn‚Äôt really know. He acted very strange like he was almost afraid of my dog . My dog loves people and there‚Äôs no reason to be afraid of him at all he‚Äôs sweet . He was frightenedwhen they cut his nails And they took him away from me which I could‚Äôve told him was just gonna make it worse,  whatever  they did To him,he was screaming in the back. It was so bad my son and I tried to get up and go find the room that they had him in we didn‚Äôt know what they were doing to him. So the vet tech  brought him back and his nails were still as long as when he went back there. I get it if it hurt him then just stop and tell me but instead they charged me for it and his nails are still long. The vet still has no answer answers as to what‚Äôs wrong with him he put him on the medication he was already taking From when he saw his old vet  he had been going to before but I thought maybe he needed a second opinion. WELL don‚Äôt believe the Affordable part they did nothing to him but a chest x-ray and didn‚Äôt even give me the medicine I had to order it off for chewy for an additional $38 and that‚Äôs only cause I was the first time Customer would‚Äôve been more. The vet bill itself,. $480 later I still don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs wrong with my dog he‚Äôs being given steroids which is making him pee everywhere and I don‚Äôt feel like it‚Äôs helping anything. If anything I feel like it‚Äôs worse. Long story short this place I feel is a bait and switch and I‚Äôm not even so sure they barely have any experience and if they do I don‚Äôt know where their experience is from because I certainly didn‚Äôt think the doctor knew anything of what was going on and he didn‚Äôt even address the smell that I went there for in my dog‚Äôs mouth when I had spoken to the Female on the phone two times about looking for a bad tooth or a tooth infection. This doctor the male doctor, mentioned something about bronchitis but did not given antibiotic just a cough tablet with a steroid and when I called to tell him my dog was acting very strange on this medication he just told me that‚Äôs normal and I need to come back for a check up I‚Äôm not going back there no way! I feel like these are the kind of places that can cause more harm than good to your pet! Just save yourself and don‚Äôt go there you‚Äôll come out poor and now I have to find another vet and probably pay another $500 to really give me an answer.

I love going to the Animal Care Clinic of Largo. All of the staff are amazing at their jobs and make you and your pet both feel comfortable. The times I went was for my cat while also bringing my mother in laws cat to be checked out it was amazing, and again, to get a new puppy, his shots.

We took our dog Abby there to have a cancerous lump removed, and her teeth cleaned while she was out. They removed the cancerous lump and cleaned her teeth, but while doing that, they broke her jaw in two places. They explained it doesn‚Äôt happen often, that doesn‚Äôt matter to me. It was my dog that had happened to, no excuses.!

I love this clinic! It‚Äôs like an hour drive for me but it‚Äôs worth it. They‚Äôre all the time super punctual, all the staff is super friendly and professional and they are all the time very accurate on the diagnostic. Love this place!

Wonderful staff and doctors! Always very friendly and helpful.  They offer options instead of pushing expensive treatments as the only choice. As a senior with a senior dog, that helps so much and doesn't make me feel guilty when I can't afford a certain treatment. Love this office!

My son has a Chiweenie who has vasculitis in both his ears. We were referred to Animal Dermatology South for treatment. It was abundantly clear why the reviews were so high. From the minute we walked in the door, we felt special. From receiving an extremely quick appointment to the level of care and treatment and, of course, the professionalism from everyone. The entire time we were there, we felt comfortable and not rushed. We live over 90 miles away and spent the entire ride home talking about what an awesome experience it was. So, on behalf of ourselves and Oscar M. Weiner, we would like to say thank you very much to Dr Bridget and staff. You girls absolutely rock!

Staff here is great and you get good service. I feel my dog received a good diagnosis and hopefully will be on the way to recovery. My only complaint is the price of the products they sell that you can get elsewhere for much less. They sold me a shampoo for itching that works great but I got home and priced the same shampoo on Amazon for half the price. My advice is to go for treatment, but check the prices elsewhere for any products they suggest. Except for prescribed meds. Then of course you get from the vet.

I do like the veterinarian at this office, she took her time and explained her diagnoses and my options. The office staff unfortunately is horrible. They only make appointments 30 days out. They state will call you to schedule your next appointment and they never do. This has happened twice now. I wonder if the owner is aware of all the business they are loosing. It seems to be an endless cycle, they always want to see you back in a few months and will not refill your prescriptions unless you go.

When we brought Paisley home from the shelter, we knew it was going to be a long medical road for her- specifically related to her ears. She probably went years without adequate treatment of her allergies and infections, which lead to a misshapen flap, drug-resistant organisms, and limited quality of life.
We tried every ear drop, in every dose, for what seemed like forever, but her ears were still painful and her personality reflected that.
With Dr. Canfields guidance we moved forward with the LATERAL WALL RESECTION surgery and we couldn't have made a better choice for our girl, Paisley. Now 4 months post-op and this is a completely different dog. She is happy, she runs, she plays, she's no longer painful in that ear, and the surgery didn't leave her completely deaf.
A million thanks go out to Dr. Canfield and his incredible team. This isn't our first medically needy rescue dog and certainly won't be our last. No matter what, we know we will definitely bring all of these cases to Dr. Canfields' care and expertise.

provider_name: Animal Emergency And Urgent Care Center
review_text:
I went to the emergency clinic last night with my dog Lulu, who wasn‚Äôt feeling well. The staff welcomed us right away, gave Lulu a pain injection, and sent us home with some medication.

Not long after‚Äîmaybe 30 minutes later‚ÄîI had to rush back because Lulu was still nauseous. In moments like that, I tend to have panic attacks, and this time was no different. I started to lose my breath and felt like I was about to faint. That‚Äôs when Shantell stepped in. She came over immediately, handed me some water, and calmly guided me through breathing exercises.

Her kindness and quick response made all the difference in that overwhelming moment. I‚Äôll be forever grateful for the way she helped me. üôèüèºü©∑

provider_name: Animal Emergency And Urgent Care Center
review_text: We rushed our little fur baby to this urgent care on a Saturday night at 11 pm and they were so wonderful to work with. Dr Oscar was the most supportive vet and asked us so many questions so he could learn our baby‚Äôs habits to diagnose why he was sick.  The front desk people were friendly and helpful as well.  Our baby had to stay for treatment and iv therapy but I felt so much trust in them. When we picked him up they gave us a folder with how to care for him, all of his test results, his labs, X-rays, ultrasound etc were all there for us to take to the specialist for follow up.  I was really happy with his care.  Thank you to the staff and to Oscar! Chevy is so happy to be home and feeling better.  Oh and they worked with our insurance company and submitted the invoice directly for us.  I‚Äôm so grateful for Trupanion.

provider_name: Animal Emergency And Urgent Care Center
review_text: I dropped my cat off here on Friday morning at 6 am because he was throwing up clear liquid and different length strands of yarn. I was concerned there was more inside of him and he would die. They got to work quick, running bloodwork, doing X-rays, and then removing the yarn. They even provided the yarn back to me, which was a crazy amount. And they showed me photos of the procedure which I really appreciated their in depth recap of everything that happened. I called a few times to check on him and every time the people at the desk were so nice. I felt so comfortable and involved. He‚Äôs home now and getting his after care. Thank you for saving my baby‚Äôs life!

provider_name: Animal Emergency And Urgent Care Center
review_text: I was pleasantly surprised with our experience here. We brought our schnoodle Oliver in with a bout of pancreatitis from switching to a food brand I won't mention. From the beginning Oscar was extremely helpful and gave my boy the treatment he needed that the urgentvet we brought him to the night before was unable to provide . He was kept for 3 days and I was given frequent updates on his progress. He is doing so well and I truly felt he was happy and felt safe there. The cost was very  fair for 3 days of 24 hour observation and the quality of care was fantastic. I also wanted to to shout out Kelsey who is a vet tech there.  A colleague of mine happened to know her and she sent over frequent updates on Oliver and played with him when she could. Thank again for saving our dog. Will absolutely come again !

provider_name: Animal Emergency And Urgent Care Center
review_text:
Had a great experience due to the unpleasant circumstances, everyone was very attentive and welcoming.
Petra and Luis Bolfer Thank you.

Petra the way you handled the situation when you could see that my pet cat was in distress was honestly incredibly reassuring and you made everything calm & steadfast I appreciate you doing everything that you did to make us feel so comfortable and welcomed.

Luis Bolfer thank you for working with me and being so transparent, you also made us feel welcomed and comfortable .

Thank you.

I highly recommend this emergency vet care hospital, really and unforgettable experience.

Thank you Animal Eye Clinic for helping Whiskey! Before and after pictures below. Doctor Brown & all staff were very patient, kind, and loving with Whiskey during the first appointment & surgery day. As soon as we needed this to be handled our first appt was scheduled in one week for cryo therapy. The results are phenomenal. We are thankful we got this taken care of ASAP. Thank you again Animal eye clinic in Tallahassee!

One of my favorite things to hear at a doctor is 'if you asked me to do XYZ today, I'd refuse'. My dog had cataracts since birth and we took a while to decide to do surgery, and were told it's actually getting better! Gives you a good indication of their priorities. Well done ‚úÖ

We have a Boston Terrier with some cloudiness and vision problems in his old age. Dr Brown was recommended by our regular vet and has been an absolute pleasure to work with in Tucker's treatment. He's attentive, kind, clearly loves animals and will tell you straight up what's going on and what he'd do if it were his dog. That is all you could ever hope for out of a doctor (human and animal alike) cannot recommend him enough.
Doctor Brown repaired my cat's only remaining eye from a cataract. He had become blind and confused and was afraid to go outside. He is recovering nicely. I'm so grateful.
Have to say this eye clinic has the best drs, nurses, and techs! It's a shame they r only in Tallahassee once a week. But I would travel to Jacksonville if needed. They r that good

Doctors Warren and Ewald have saved Shelby from cancer (Dr. Warren) and blindness from a cataract (Dr. Ewald). She's 8 days post cataract surgery and loving life.

The doctors and all the staff members are the most amazing and caring people and I trusted them twice with my baby and they saved her twice.

I can't recommend anyone more.
They're THEE best.

Had a great experience with Animal Eye Doctors! Dr. Warren and staff were all amazing and took superb care of my baby. Pellet‚Äôs punctured cornea has healed beautifully thanks to their expertise and help.

Dr. Warren and her staff have treated my various dogs over the years.  Many times my rescues need special eye expertise and attention.  Animal Eye Doctors offers a professional atmosphere and treatments.  I am very picky about my pets health and treatments....Dr. Warren and staff are the best!
Awesome doctor and staff. Took care of my little 4 pound Shih Tzu who had to have eye removed. She's doing great.

DVM Warren was highly recommended by our Vet who we trust. Our cat Zeus had an ulcer and bad eye infection, such a quick turn around since the first visit, made all the difference in his heeling.
Staff was amazing, especially Fabi, she was great with Zeus, handled him with care and made him feel very comfortable, very confident with office procedures. We knew he was in good hands all around here at Animal Eye Doctors.

Wonderful staff and techs. Dr Hempstead was kind, professional, and very thorough which put us at ease immediately. The procedure went great and the go home care was well explained.  All our questions or concerns were addressed and we felt well taken care of.  His eye has healed extremely well!

Can't say enough good things about Animal Eye Specialty Clinic. My senior golden retriever's eye had changed in appearance and Dr. Julie Hempstead easily diagnosed her with golden retriever uvietis, despite other vets disregarding it as 'normal'. She and the techs provided guidance to help manage the pressure in her eyes, preventing her other eye from losing vision. The staff is caring and took such great care of my girl. The receptionist is a ray of sunshine and always ensured I received medication promptly. The vet techs also always went above and beyond to calm my dog's nerves during exams. Great experience during the 1.5 years my dog was a patient. Highly recommend!
If your beloved fuzzy friend is having eye issues I'd definitely recommend this doctors office. They where straight forward no back and forth, they actually care to help you and your animals.
Dr Hempstead and her staff were great. They saved our Dorothy‚Äôs eye, we are very grateful!  They were efficient, caring and reasonably priced

Dr. Hempstead refused to help my dog with cataracts after diagnosing being blind at 2 (gladly took my payment with no hesitation)  because he was not fixed for "ethical" reasons. Insinuated I was a dog breeder and her femboy nurse spoke down about personal choice about my dog (behind my back, but of course in listening range) stating "i would cut mine off for my vision" Dr. Hempstead carries an elitist sense of morality that overbears her passion as a human as well as empathy for animals.

I have gone to Animal General Hospital for many years. Always very professional and great with my Yorkies. Very caring. I also go to the groomer in the same building. I have used this groomer for over 3 years at another site. Highly recommend them.

The staff and doctors here are amazing and super helpful. My indoor cat got out and was attacked.  This facility got me in same day I called. My 11 mon cat was examined and diagnosed within 15 minutes. I didnt have to wait.  I was worried about the invoice but turns out they are affordable and I highly recommend them to all pet owners.
We love this vet, he's amazing with our dogs Nugget and Toby.  I think he's giving my dog years on he's life with his heart condition.

Took amazing care of my Pup! Highly recommended, very kind and knowledgeable staff. Clean and well maintained office. Make your next pet appointment at Animal General Hospital for there next visit, thanks again to the Staff, everyone was Fantastic !
We have been seeing Dr. Borrego for 27 years. There is no one else like him or his amazing staff. I recommend Animal General to anyone who needs a vet.

We made an appointment for an annual check up, some medical issues we wanted to discuss, and vaccines.  They seemed confused about the annual check up part when we got there. My first visit to them was interesting and a little confusing. The small building is very very old from the inside and out, and the 2 people that work there are not exactly friendly or welcoming but they are nice. They weren‚Äôt very personable in our appointment, or asked very many questions but they did their job. It was confusing because it seemed they didn‚Äôt know why we were there. And we repeated that we wanted an annual check up and discuss other things. They do not do annuals but they were kind enough to do most of the normal things like bloodwork, stool and urine samples.

I love this small practice. The office feels so homey and comfortable and Dr Fasano treats very holistically and has a lot of techniques to offer. My cat Raki got an exam and acupuncture and a chiropractic adjustment on his first visit. He‚Äôs being treated for a lot of things and I have to say for all that he‚Äôs been steadily improving. Going to this office is the least stressful of all the vets I‚Äôve been to and I know my boy‚Äôs health is in excellent hands.

INCREDIBLE VET FOR DOGS WITH BAD HIPS. Dr Fasano and Courtney at Animal Healing Solutions are absolutely incredible! I brought my elderly golden doodle to Dr Fasano who was recommended by a friend of mine.  Our golden doodle started limping as a puppy when she was only eleven months old. At that time, we took her to our vet and a specialist. The specialist diagnosed her with severe dysplasia, but because she was so young they didn‚Äôt recommend hip surgery. They also let us know that both hips were so severe that hip surgery may not be an option in the future.  Heartbroken we starting researching everything, and we were very fortunate to keep her pretty much limp free with special food, supplements, water therapy, specific exercises, red light therapy, massages and limited pain meds. However, at a little over 11 years old, she started having a lot of issues walking, and began limping again.  She was also showing pain by her personality changing.  Our regular vet put her on additional pain medicines to help.  We also consulted regarding hip surgery but were told she was not a candidate due to the severity of both hips. So we asked our vet about alternative therapy and he said we could try it.  That‚Äôs when we started with Dr. Fasano who started acupuncture and added additional supplements to the regime we already had in place. Right away after starting the acupuncture and new supplements, we noticed marked improvement in our dog.  She was limping less and could walk up stairs. After her third treatment the improvement was incredibly noticeable not only in her movement, but in her personality too! She went back to her happy, sweet and playful self. We are so excited that we are going to continue this treatment for her with Dr. Fasano! We also learned that acupuncture can help with a host of additional animal illnesses and issues, so we will be bringing our two senior cats who both have issues related to kidney and thyroid. My friend who recommended Dr Fasano said when her regular vet only gave her cat 6 months to live, her kitty lived another 2 years coming to Dr Fasano! We still love our regular vet, but coming to Dr Fasano for the additional treatment and supplements has made a world of difference and we are so grateful. Also, Courtney who runs Dr Fasano‚Äôs office is amazing and the prices are very reasonable. I highly recommend this practice!

God bless Dr. Fasano, I‚Äôm so glad I found her practice. Inside is so calming and the room feels and looks like a room in a house, it was so cozy. My staffy who is normally extremely anxious at the vet was the calmest I‚Äôve ever seen him. And he loved Dr. Fasano as well. As soon as she came in the office she sat down to get more to his level and he was comfortable from that moment. She prescribed multiple things for us to try for my baby‚Äôs yeast issues, one of which she concocted while we were there. They also accept the Care Credit Card and are affordable. The lady at the desk was very sweet also.  I cannot thank you enough. I finally see the light and feel like my Phantom will finally heal. I will tell everybody about you guys!

Acupuncture has saved our little rat terrier from a second back surgery.  She was able to regain control of her back legs almost immediately and then after a few sessions and weeks, she was back to her old self. Even jumping on furniture (which we limit). We do follow ups every 4 to 6 weeks now. This was life changing and saving for our Dixie Ann!

provider_name: Animal Health & Rehab Center (AUSTIN DANIELS ANIMAL HOSPITAL)
review_text:
I recently took my furry baby, who is truly like my child, to this incredible place, and I left with such peace in my heart. The care and attention she received from the doctor and staff were beyond anything I could have hoped for. It‚Äôs clear that everyone here genuinely cares about the well being of our furry family members they treat them with love and compassion, not as just another number.

What makes this place even more special is that it‚Äôs not just a veterinary clinic it‚Äôs also an animal health and rehab center where our furry babies can receive therapy. The combination of medical expertise and rehabilitation services ensures that every furry baby is given the best chance to heal, thrive, and live their happiest life.

I‚Äôm overwhelmed with gratitude and even moved to tears knowing my baby girl is in such good hands. This is more than just a facility; it‚Äôs a sanctuary for our pets and a blessing to our community. If you‚Äôre as selective as I am about who cares for your pets, let me assure you this is the place you‚Äôve been looking for.

Thank you for your kindness, dedication, and genuine care. May this place always be blessed with abundance and continue to bring comfort and healing to so many. God bless

provider_name: Animal Health & Rehab Center (AUSTIN DANIELS ANIMAL HOSPITAL)
review_text: These people are miracle workers. They've given back so much life to my old pup, and Dr. Sanchez is not only knowledgeable, but she uses common sense in her assessments and prescriptions. Money well spent.

provider_name: Animal Health & Rehab Center (AUSTIN DANIELS ANIMAL HOSPITAL)
review_text: Dr. Sanchez extended our oldest husky‚Äôs life by 3 years with conservative laser therapy. We got to enjoy him a while longer thanks to her and her staff. She also diagnosed our middle husky with diabetes and is currently his PCP. They also treat our youngest‚Äô allergies and tummy issues. My husband and I cannot be thankful enough for the care, attention, and professionalism demonstrated by Dr. Sanchez, Dr. Cerda, and the staff at Animal Health and Rehab. We would not take our dogs anywhere else.

provider_name: Animal Health & Rehab Center (AUSTIN DANIELS ANIMAL HOSPITAL)
review_text: Dr. Sanchez is one of a kind. A gentle soul, a truly good person. And a great doctor.

provider_name: Animal Health & Rehab Center (AUSTIN DANIELS ANIMAL HOSPITAL)
review_text: She‚Äôs a good doctor. The staff really cares about their patients. El Papito has made strides. Thanks!

Brought my female rescue here last Wednesday for her spay and I'm so happy I found this place!  Appointment availability was impressive, and the staff was absolutely amazing!  Their care and compassion and professionalism really shows!  If I ever need spay or neuter services again I will for sure bring my pup here!

I took my six-year-old dog here to get spayed. The staff is so friendly and they took such good care of her. I felt extremely comfortable and confident in the veterinarians ability to do the surgery. They recommended her using a surgical suit for recovery instead of a cone on her head, I was a little concerned, but it worked out perfectly for her. She hasn‚Äôt really had a problem wearing it and she never messed with. her stitches. It has been over a month since she had the surgery and she is doing great.
((I shared a pic of her in surgical suit a few hrs after getting her home after surgery.))
Very professional work.  My 2 corgis don't even have to stop by to the clinic after surgery. Decent price. Incision went pretty smoothly! Thank you for your hardwork!

I called around multiple places trying to book a frantic appointment for my female German Shepherd puppy to get neutered, since we have her brother, I am so worried about her going into heat. Luckily I spoke to Eden on the phone who was very knowledgeable about dogs and was able to assure me that waiting for her to go through at least her first heat was a good idea, and was able to give me lots of good information on signs of her going into heat and ways to prevent pregnancy between her and her brother, the prices are very fair and although it‚Äôs a farther drive for me, I feel most comfortable going here as they obviously care about the well-being of the animal!!!! üíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñüíñ

Absolutely horrible experience for the first time after getting seven other animals neutered at this location. Had proper shot records, but was told they could be forged. Unbelievable then was told needed to add all of the shots that were current to the price of the  spay.  Absolutely disappointing service after many years of coming here not happy at all. You would think after have 7 rescue dogs come here you would be treated better. And the best part is they could care less if you come there or not. Well guess what, there are SEVERAL other places with the same pricing. You just lost an over 10 year customer. And not just me everyone that rescue animals that ask me where to go. SHAMEFUL

provider_name: Animal Health Center of Land O' Lakes
review_text:
We‚Äôve been with this practice for about 15 years, and from the start we were drawn in by the welcoming, family-like atmosphere and the kindness of the staff and doctors. Over the years, some changes have come with the shift to corporate ownership; some good, some less so. The biggest drawback has been the noticeable increase in pricing and the tendency to charge for things that were once complimentary or very low cost.
That said, what keeps us here is Dr. Saladino and the incredible team. Dr. Saladino truly embodies everything a great doctor should be. She always puts her patient‚Äôs best interests first, takes the time to explain options, and never pressures us into treatments we don‚Äôt feel comfortable with or can‚Äôt afford. She has earned our complete trust.
The support staff, from the front desk to the vet techs, are equally outstanding. We have always felt listened to, never rushed, and treated with genuine care. Their dedication shines through in everything they do.
While we do wish the corporate side of things didn‚Äôt feel so focused on higher profits, we can‚Äôt say enough about the people who make this place special. Because of Dr. Saladino and the amazing staff, we wholeheartedly recommend this practice.
Fun pic of our girls, Tessa and Leia, after they visit Dr Saladino!

provider_name: Animal Health Center of Land O' Lakes
review_text: I cannot say enough good things about this vet!! We had our first visit yesterday for my 11 year old male dog. The staff was very sweet and helpful with checkin and check out. They even gave me information on their urgent care and emergency locations I had no idea existed. The prices were better than most vets in my opinion. The first exam was free and I forgot to ask at the desk as I was wrapped up in the good news of our dog. I called and they had already credited it back to my account for later use or I can get it refunded. The doctor was very thorough and asked questions I would not even think of. They started with xrays and bloodwork and even took us back to look at all the xrays. They did not push for unnecessary treatment or tests. The entire staff took good care of our boy and were caring. The doctor even called the next day herself to check on Bubba and wants a follow up the next week to see if he's feeling any better. I will definitely go back as we have other dogs and so glad we had an experience that was great and did not feel money driven like alot of places have become these days. Thank you again everyone at Animal Health Center!!

provider_name: Animal Health Center of Land O' Lakes
review_text: Drs. Saladino and Parker are exceptional. The entire staff is knowledgeable and friendly. We've lost two pets and adopted one since we started going to AHC LOL. And through the ups and downs, they've been compassionate and kind. Megan was our vet tech today and was very personable and helpful.

provider_name: Animal Health Center of Land O' Lakes
review_text: My baby needed emerge surgery. The staff made sure to get her in immediately. With this unexpected surgery, they understood my situation and went out of their way to help me get her the surgery she needed.  Amanda U and Amanda D were absolutely amazing and made sure she got the help she needed.  Really from top to bottom, if you need a vet for your fur baby or have an emergency this is the place to go. 5 stars doesn't even put into words how amazing everyone here is. Highly recommend

provider_name: Animal Health Center of Land O' Lakes
review_text: Dianne and Amanda U were great, they are courteous and always helpful. I have known Dianne since I was a K-9 Officer for about 10 years, (I'm now retired). She is a great asset to the Health center.

Dr. Collazos is THE best cat doctor I‚Äôve come across in all my years of rescuing. We run a rescue and my cats have been misdiagnosed before by others but he gives the correct diagnosis and treatment. His bed side manner is great as well.

The staff there is wonderful, Dr Ready was great with my doggo, offered options and listened to my concerns and the tech Meghan was just as sweet with my dog and handled him like her own, woldn't go anywhere else.
The best vet clinic ever. Great doctors and staff that actually care about your pets and you.

The awesome team at Animal Health are always thorough and compassionate with the health and well-being of our two cats and two dogs.  Their care and kindness shines through the moment we come through the door, throughout the appointment and any follow ups.

Thank you AHVC!
Raven, Juno, Magnolia & Maxx

Everyone here is super nice! I'm probably known as the chicken lady üòÇ. I first brought My pet silkie Bakugou (black chicken) in for beak trims, and the staff were always super nice and helpful in giving us instructions and suggestions. Then my pet chicken Pidge (Brown and black chicken) was injured by my Turkey and we Immediately took her here. She's now well known in the office, because I bring her in every week! Dr. Readdy takes incredibly good care of her every time! I adore this vet and I'm incredibly happy I found it ‚ù§

We love the staff at Animal Hospital at Baldwin Park. We see Dr David for acupuncture. He always listens and addresses all our concerns. Our technician today was Griffin he made sure to address all our needs and even helped us out to the car. All the technicians and doctors are great and attentive. My dog has IBD and it‚Äôs nice that any of the treats they have out are hydrolyzed so I don‚Äôt have to worry about him getting something he shouldn‚Äôt have. I‚Äôm so happy to have a place to take my pet that offers such a wide variety of treatment options.

Dr. Sara Stevens and the entire team at Animal Hospital at Baldwin Park have been absolutely amazing. From the moment we walk in, they make us feel welcome, and I can tell they truly care about my cat‚Äôs well-being.

What really sets Dr. Stevens and her staff apart is their incredible communication. Even when I haven‚Äôt had an appointment, they have always been kind enough to answer my questions and provide guidance through email. Their quick responses and willingness to help, no matter how small my concern, have given me so much peace of mind.

Dr. Stevens explains everything clearly, listens carefully to all my worries, and always takes the time to make sure I understand what‚Äôs going on. The entire team is gentle, compassionate, and professional ‚Äî I always feel my cat is in the best hands.

If you‚Äôre looking for a vet who combines top-quality care with genuine kindness and excellent communication, Animal Hospital at Baldwin Park and Dr. Sara Stevens are the best choice. I‚Äôm so grateful for everything they do!

I really appreciate the service and attention my dogs receive from Dr David and the staff that work at the hospital , I couldn‚Äôt ask for a better veterinary doctor !!
He‚Äôs amazing with my babies and very knowledgeable too .
I totally üíØ recommend this business for every pet(owner)  lover ü´∂üèª

Dr. David and vet tech Chelsea were incredible. There were times I didn‚Äôt understand things, and they were very patient in re-explaining and hearing me out. Chelsea has an outstanding amount of empathy, wonderful energy, and calmness. It is very easy to tell that they have knowledge in how to communicate and validate a patient‚Äôs concerns. Chelsea even spotted a very minor detail/mistake on a health report from another place for my dog. She is very attentive to small details which I so appreciate because I feel that many vets just skim through reports. Everyone made it easy and stress free to bring my dog reactive pup inside and through places. They stayed aware for her, and respected her boundaries. Also well done working with my shy, nervous pup!!

I have gone to this Animal Hospital with all of my pups. First experience was after my 4 month old catahoula broke her leg at the dog park. First person I met was Jaclynn at the front desk and she has been there ever since watching and loving our dogs as they age. Overall, the staff at this facility is always very welcoming and will never go anywhere else.

I went to Animal Hospital of Fort Lauderdale today for our first visit for my dog Emily. This is a wonderful place! Everyone was so kind and you could tell it was genuine. They truly love animals and want to take the best care of them and their clients. Dr. Jones was amazing! Every single person I met was lovely and I am so happy to have finally found my new vet! Highly recommend!

I waited several months before posting this review, not out of emotion, but to share a precautionary statement for anyone considering the Animal Hospital of Fort Lauderdale.

I previously worked in the veterinary services industry and have seen bad care before, but nothing compares to the negligence of this practice.

The front desk is inconsistent and often misleading. The vet techs were fine, and did their jobs. But Dr. Jones misdiagnosed my puppy, never weighed her, and prescribed antibiotics at less than half the correct dosage. When I raised concerns, she denied her own statements and spoke down to me instead of taking accountability.

I was also charged for a ‚Äúwellness visit‚Äù that was NOT performed. When I complained, the owner dismissed my concerns, reducing them in a condescending way to a coworker, which was both insulting and unprofessional.

Additionally, do not purchase their ‚Äúpackages.‚Äù They are not true packages, but essentially payment plans‚Äîyou are charged at every visit rather than paying upfront for bundled services. The front desk staff is inconsistent, and in my experience, some were not fully honest until I was already in the office.

While the owner was nice at first‚Äîeven offering to drop off medication to me free of charge and in a random parking lot on his way home ‚Äîhe rescinded the offer immediately after meeting my handsome significant other, which was inappropriate and unprofessional.

Overall, I cannot recommend this clinic. I would not bring my pets here under any circumstances. Even in emergencies, I fear they would prioritize speeding through the process over providing proper, ethical care. I would never bring my pets here again. If you value honesty, proper care, and transparency, look elsewhere.

We brought our brand new puppy Daisy üåº to Animal Hospital of Ft.Lauderdale .  everyone from the girls who met us at the desk to the nurse Melissa, to Dr Christine Fellacher who gave her the wellness check were Professional, friendly, and full of information for our little girl. We‚Äôre bringing her back for her round of vaccines and will definitely continue our visits.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
We visited Animal Hospital of FL for the second time yesterday, and once again, the experience was excellent. From the moment we walked in, the front desk staff was friendly and helpful.

Both times we were assisted by Priscilla, the vet tech, and she is absolutely amazing. She was professional, kind, and attentive ‚Äî not just with us, but especially with our pet. She remembered our dog‚Äôs name, condition, and treatment from our previous visit, which really made us feel cared for.

The treatment plan they gave us was accurate, and our dog has shown great improvement since.

Big thanks to the entire team! If you go, I highly recommend asking for Priscilla ‚Äî she truly knows what she‚Äôs doing.

Dr. Jones and the entire team are wonderful! They took such great care of my dog and addressed all my concerns with warmth and professionalism. The staff is always friendly, welcoming, and truly cares about their furry patients. Highly recommend!

provider_name: Animal Hospital of New Port Richey
review_text: We've been coming here for a while with our two girls. The Drs and staff are wonderful. They take great care of our girls. This is the first bet we've ever stuck with.

provider_name: Animal Hospital of New Port Richey
review_text: Dr. Presley and her staff, literally, saved my dog, Lexi Lou.  Dr. Presley did emergency surgery to remove a foreign object.  I am soo thankful to Dr. Presley and her amazing staff.  Animal Hospital of NPR is the only Vet for our dogs!

provider_name: Animal Hospital of New Port Richey
review_text: We have brought our dogs here since 2017.  You can tell they love what they do and care about your pet.  They always answer our questions in a manner we can understand instead of throwing a bunch of medical speak around.  They don't rush the appointment and are very accommodating if you need assistance getting your pet to/from your car.  I recommend them all the time on Nextdoor.com when people are seeking a veterinarian.  I'd highly recommend them to care for your pets, you won't be disappointed!

provider_name: Animal Hospital of New Port Richey
review_text:
I have been using this veterinarian since 2023. However, Dr. Presley was my vet for my cats in Pittsburgh. The staff is extremely friendly & caring. They are all animal lovers. I have always gotten good advice. I accept their suggestions & recommendations. I would never go to another vet.
Miso, Bella & Oscar

provider_name: Animal Hospital of New Port Richey
review_text: The entire team at Animal Hospital of New Port Richey provides an experience for both you and your pet!  Courteous, professional service and timely communication!  I was MOST impressed with this team and their dedication and compassion!  Clearly sets a bar!

The staff is genuinely caring and empathetic toward all of our needs. They are very thorough. We are fortunate to be able to have a veterinary office that is friendly and knowledgeable. Our pups are healthy and continue to remain that way!

Everyone there was Great! They understood me and my dogs needs. Jenni was awesome wonderful, caring and gentle. My baby can be difficult, they showed they care for the well-being of my pet. Dr. Jason was just as caring and throughly answered the questions I had. I'm happy I decided to change to them. Thank you ALL for everything! God Bless. ü•∞üôèüòá

We called for an appointment bc our dog,  Shadow had been vomiting and wouldn't eat.  They fit us in the very next morning.  The staff and the Doc were all so very supportive and kind.  They ran some tests and every test came back in the normal range.  He was put on a rice and chicken diet and has bounced back to his normal buy quirky self.  We are so pleased with every aspect of our visit there and the outcome.  Big thank you to all involved with Shadow on that day!
Everyone was very attentive to our needs and made us and Bella welcome.  The inside is very clean and bright. We loved the separate areas in the waiting area.

Fellow Humans, please listen! If you have been struggling to find an affordable and compassionate animal doctor for your fur babies... look no further! I'm serious! Dr. Jason and his staff are ALWAYS welcoming and friendly. The vibe is always positive/uplifting.
They have been there for my family through the loss of our Chug, Theodore! One of the worst days of my life was made so much easier/more tolerable, with the way this office staff treated me and my sweet pup as I had to say goodbye furever.
They are also so understanding of my anxiety ridden blue nose pitbull. They take their time with him and never force him to do anything he isn't comfortable with!
I'm so relieved to have found someone who actually cares about our pets! Do you know how I know? They call me... a couple days later after EVERY appt... to make sure my baby is doing okay! That is a quality Doctor! Hats off to Dr. Jason and his amazing team!

My 13 1/2 yo chihuahua was very sick, vomiting, unable to eat, and lethargic.  Our regular Vet at another facility could not see her.  A friend told me about Animal Hospital of Regency Park, I called and got right in.  We were seen by Dr. Colon, and I explained that finances were an issue and she was most gracious in preparing an itemized list and cost of what she recommended as well as informing me of a modest route.  I opted to proceed with her recommended treatment.  The entire staff was wonderful, and it wasn‚Äôt just me that they treated kindly and professionally, but everyone who came in received the same excellent care and concern.  I was given information of an ER, should we need more assistance when the office was closed.  We did need the ER, and unfortunately my Bella passed away peacefully.  I can‚Äôt praise Animal Hospital of Regency Park enough!  I will never forget how I was treated and the wonderful care my Bella received.  I HIGHLY recommend them for your beloved pets!  You will not be disappointed.
Took my Molly for check up... They were totally awesome. They are of very informative about the test that they did. I will be telling everybody about them and their services thank you AHRPüíû

I was referred to Dr. Michael Canfield by my regular vet after a chronic issue with my nine-yr. old Labrador's footpad could not be solved, and I could not be happier with the experience and outcome.

Not only did Dr. Canfield correctly diagnose the problem, which turned out to be related to my dog's advancing arthritis causing a weight-bearing issue in that foot, but he also gave me a management plan for Piper that's been working well for a year now that allows her to exercise and have a great quality of life.

It's that kind of problem-solving, out-of-the-box thinking that makes Dr. Canfield an extraordinary veterinarian, and his kindness, not only towards his animal charges but their fretting owners as well make him a standout. Dr. Canfield's staff are also all very knowledgeable, kind and courteous, making Animal Dermatology South absolutely worth the long drive up from Palm Harbor to get the best of care for my dog. Thank you!

From the moment we walked into your office, and Todd greeted us, I felt reassured that she was in the best possible hands.

Molly‚Äôs ear issues had been a source of concern for us. The compassion, patience, and expertise both Todd and Dr. Colon showed throughout her treatment made all the difference. You not only addressed the medical concern with outstanding professionalism but also treated Molly with such kindness and gentleness that I knew she was truly cared for.

Thanks to your dedication and skill, Molly appears to be so much more comfortable and happy‚Äîand as her mom, that means the world to me. It‚Äôs rare to find a team that combines medical excellence with genuine compassion, and both of you exceeded all expectations.
Everyone was amazing! My 10 year old terrier had dermatology surgery. She did very well ! Thank you very much! Gina Hines RN

We needed to find a place to board our pup while we went on vacation for a week. Being new to Port Richey,  I looked up reviews for places in the area. I was attracted to Animal Inn because they have outdoor play areas for their boarders. I made a reservation for my Poppy girl and decided to take her there a few days ahead of time to check the place out and so it wouldn‚Äôt be such a shock for her when we had to leave her there. The staff was so friendly and welcoming! They put us and more importantly our pup at ease! It‚Äôs very obvious that they love animals and Poppy loved them back! She did great while we were gone and ate well which is usually an issue when she boards. We absolutely recommend Animal Inn for your fur baby!! üòä
Thank you for taking such good care of my chi‚Äôs. They were happy little babies when I picked them up. Great job!!

Overall I had a good experience and I would definitely go back in the future, if I need boarding! My only complaint is that my dog rubbed her nose creating a scratch, I wish someone would have contacted me to let me know rather than waiting until I picked her up. It was not an emergency and will heal on its own, so I understand why they did not contact me, but I would have preferred that they had.

I will definitely be returning in the future, as the staff is very nice and professional, and most importantly my dog seemed to have a good time!

First time customer visiting from New York. Very happy with their services. Very friendly staff. Nice facilities. My dog came home smelling nice and clean.  Will definitely use them again. Very reasonable  prices. Love the place.

Have boarded my beloved Alvin the Malti-Poo here twice, 3 days each time. Each time he was happy, looked healthy and well cared for. I had been boarding him elsewhere and he was obviously stressed and unhappy when I brought him home. Animal Inn is great. Animal lovers, budget friendly, and most of all, I do not ever worry about Alvin when he is there.

The staff here is very kind and helpful. They offer wonderful pet care and I‚Äôve yet to meet a Dr that hasn‚Äôt shown true compassion for their patients.
It‚Äôs clean and decorated nicely with cute art throughout the facility!

Dr Laura Young was wonderful with our ‚Äúdifficult‚Äù dog. Answered all of our questions and offered treatments keeping our budget in mind! Kudos to Abby the vet tech as well! Our first visit went so smoothly!

After moving to the area we had to find a new vet for our two cats and have had a great experience with Animal Medical Clinic in Melbourne. The staff were kind and knowledgeable in our initial visit. After learning that one of our cats required dental work, we were a little hesitant at first just because we were so new. However the entire process was smooth and efficient. We were given helpful updates during the procedure and felt that they had our pet's best interests & comfort at top of mind. We are glad to say that we have found our vet for years to come!

This was my first time at this vet and first time personally having to bring an animal of mine to the vet. I was impressed with how clean and well coordinated the office was, especially during the busy holiday season. From the receptionist to the vet tech and doctor, everyone was super kind and did their best to make me and my kitten comfortable, which she definitely was! This is a great office and I know my cat will be in good hands when she returns for more care.
This place has been great for my dog, Lincoln. The staff and Dr. Robert Young have treated him most excellently. They also honor Internet pricing for medication if you can find it less expensive.
Always happy to bring my pup here! They take great care of her and are all so kind and knowledgeable. Won't go anywhere else!

My Dogs have always been the #1 thing in my life (as I've always been single). Their well-being and comfort is always very important.  For years Animal Medical Hospital has treated and cared for my companions in the best ways possible. From annual shots to major surgeries their up to date knowledge and truly sincere concerns (& occasionally condolences) have completely assured me that my pet partners are in the best of hands.
The Drs and techs/staff  always take time to explain things and answer every question and concerns.  The office is very efficient and the facility is always clean (without that hospital-like smell)  My Dogs have always been happy and anxious to enter the door at Animal Medical Hospital,  which helps me too !

I can't speak highly enough for Animal Medical Hospital. They're a Gem in the St. Petersburg community. My Corgi, Olive, ruptured her left hind CCL back in 2024. Dr. Clark was quick to diagnose the injury and confirmed it with testing and Xrays. Dr Clark and his team were the best. He didn't do the hard sell on surgery; However recommended it. He educated me on the benefits of repairing CCL injuries via surgery but there were alternatives. For us because Olive was just 3 years old at the time, surgery was the best option. Olive had an excellent surgery and was walking a day later and her full return to activates was about 6 weeks after surgery.

On Feb 13th, 2025, Olive ruptured her right hind CCL while playing at the dog park. Was this a surprise? No. Why? Because Dr Clark had advised me back in 2024, it was very likely that the opposite knee would rupture in the next year or so. I was prepared and educated. Once again, Dr Clark and his team were amazing. Olive is well on her way to making another fine recovery thanks to Animal Medical Hospital, Dr Clark, and his Team.

As for pricing, they left me surprised both times because they're not only competitive but do much, much better than any Veterinarian in St. Pete.

Baby Girl, black kitty,  was referred to radioactive treatment for thyroid issue few years ago. Normal now. Needs no special food, meds or treatment. I trust Dr Clark. Oh, his other patient, her companion, Mufasa.

The vets here, specifically Dr Ruiz, are incredible. They helped treat my cat Pumpkin with FIP. We are very grateful for the help of the staff and their patience with my many phone calls, texts, and last minute appointments.

My 86-year-old mother fell in a parking lot and originally used another rehab companies and complained they hurt her. She now has been getting physical and occupational therapy from AnneRose Therapy and health. Mom has made tremendous progress. They are extremely professional and mom loves them all! She does more because they are very gentle and have excellent skills. She is on the road to recovery. She has much more mobility and is now able to wash her hair. Thank you, so much from our entire family for the care and recovery you are giving! I highly recommend AnneRose Therapy & Heath Services!

Big shout out to Marie Desir of AnneRose Therapy & Health Services LLC. Marie, along with my mom, discussed goals that they both wanted to accomplish during their sessions together. I've watched Marie with my mom, and was very impressed with her interaction with her. Marie kept in contact with me about my mom's progress throughout. I HIGHLY recommend her!!

My name is Rasheed and I have been receiving excellent OT services from Marcia Pendl with AnneRose therapy for over two years now. I have seen a lot of improvement with my grip, pinch and upper body strength. My OT is very, very professional and knowledgeable with adaptive equipment and modifications to help me regain my skills to live independently at home and in my community. Marcia is very compassionate, shows empathy and genuine concern during our therapy sessions. I highly recommend AnneRose Therapy and their 5 Star therapists!

I am the daughter of Anita Penso who has received OT therapy from Marie for a broken shoulder Therapy past few months. My mother, at 92, was not a candidate for surgery but was prescribed PT and OT. I have worked with many therapists over the past two decades with several members of my immediate family. I have never met anyone as dedicated, patient and emotionally involved in her clients well-being as Marie. My mother has made excellent progress according to Dr Woods, her orthopedist. I can‚Äôt thank Marie enough for giving my mother back her mobility and keeping me informed, every step of the way! Thank you, Marie!!

AnneRose Therapy & Health has been a pleasure working with. Marie my occupational therapist has helped me have better use of my fractured hand.
She is kind explains all the exercises in detail makes sure I am doing them correctly. So grateful that now I can finally use my hand much better!!
Thank you Marie

I've been taking lessons at Annwyn for over a year now and have recently bought a horse that I now board there.  I can't say enough good things about the facilities, the amazing care given to my horse, the people that work there, the other boarders and students, the trainers and the owner. It has been an all-around amazing experience for me and my new family member.

We have been at Annwyn Equestrian Center since Feb'21 with our then 6 month old filly "Porsche". My husband and I adore both Kathleen and her Mom, Susan and the wonderful staff - especially Morgan!!!   We love watching "Porsche" learn from being in a "herd" and grow into a lovely quarter horse!!  We cannot wait to begin training her with the help of Kathleen and staff; and see how much more she matures and grows with their guidance.  All in All a 5 star facility!!!
Great riding lesson for the kids!!!!  Staff is awesome!!  Horses look well kept and the instructor  taught my children how to care for the horses.  My kids loved every minute!!!!
This place is heading downhill fast. Ever since their new scheduling system it has been an absolute nightmare. The instructor doesn‚Äôt even know how to use it.

Hurricane Dorian was bearing down hard on the Treasure Coast of Florida.  I started to search for a safe haven to take my beloved horses to and get out of harms way.  Annwyn Equestrian Center answered my prayers!  I contacted the barn and got a quick response...Yes, they could accommodate my 4 horses.  I made a reservation and hoped I would not need to use it.  Well, Dorian stayed scary so I left for Annwyn.  The owner, Kathleen Petersen, texted with me often inquiring about my trip and arrival.  She greeted me warmly and helped me unload... amazing personal touch.  I met the barn manager, Lacy, and was instantly grateful for her cooperative attitude and "whatever you need" way of getting us settled in and through our stay. The entire staff was very helpful and courteous...even while my Beagle barked for hours on end from my truck!   They took care of my horses as I would. They were friendly, courteous and understanding in our time of need. I highly recommend this farm for evacuation.  I wish I lived closer so I could take lessons at this farm.  Just wonderful!

I just want to show my unconditional gratitude to Anthony ,Melissa ,and Liz for there comfort support and understanding. Its been a long recovery effort for me since my accident. There experience in Physical healing is outstanding. I recommend Dr. Pribila to all. Let there knowledge and experience be the alternative to surgery.
He treated me 7 years ago and fixed my hip, today I returned because my hip moved again and he adjusted it again. He is very good in his evaluation and in his work, recommended 100%, thank you

I loved coming here for my treatment! The staff is great & so welcoming. Dr. Blackburn listens to your concerns and is transparent about everything. I have been a client of Apex ever since I played Pro Football a few years ago. Apex has been a game changer for me since suffering a foot injury while training for a marathon. Apex were so accommodating in getting me a fast appointment early on a Saturday morning, were able to provide diagnostics, and with therapist Ashley‚Äôs help I‚Äôm on a healing course to still be able to run my race! As an athlete, I‚Äôve been to many PT clinics over the years and Apex is, by far, the best. They offer regular evening hours, which is a game-changer for anyone who works during the day. Wowowowow! Apex simply rocks! Angie and Joe have a first class team and environment that wills u to heal and get stronger.
