It was a pleasure to attend Baptist Health Physical Therapy and I would recommend this place to anyone looking for physical therapy and rehabilitation.

provider_name: Baptist Health Physical Therapy & Rehabilitation | Coral Gables
review_text: I had 2 hand surgeries with Dr. Ouellette, Carpal tunnel & trigger finger & The other hand was a wrist reconstruction. Both surgeries went well, She‚Äôs an amazing surgeon. Afterwards, I started therapy at Baptist health Miami Gardens and my therapist was Evelyn. I was very impressed with how organized and on time they‚Äôre scheduling was. I never had to wait to see her! Evelyn is very knowledgeable about strengthening exercises, diets to reduce inflammation and different exercises and therapies I could do at home!  Really appreciated her positive attitude and encouragement! I highly recommend this facility! ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

provider_name: Baptist Health Physical Therapy & Rehabilitation | Coral Gables
review_text: The front desk staff is amazing! very helpful and attentive. The Physical Therapists are amazing people, they really do care about your progress and they will push you to help you progress with your recovery. I've never came across a great team as the PT department and the Front desk!

provider_name: Baptist Health Physical Therapy & Rehabilitation | Coral Gables
review_text: It has been a great experience here since the start. The whole team has been great but a special shot out to Evelyn. She has been incredibly knowledgeable and has helped me rehab my knee to the fullest. Highly recommend this place!!!!
Great place to have your knees looked at. Certainly gives you an air of confidence right by the Dolphins training center. Bad news....2 knee replacements. Yikes.
Out on a Monday night for the match up between my FINZ and  Titans. I was pumped for the game but was DEFLATED by the play calling on both sides of the ball.
Best place for an MRI, CT Scan, Bone Density Scan, or Lung Screening; Physical or Occupational Therapy; or to see an Orthopedic Specialist.

Amazing place to watch some good old football. The grass fields are pristine. I really enjoyed how nice the staff are. It is located near the hard rock stadium so it‚Äôs nice to be able to see the stadium in the back drop. The most wonderful staff.
Don't expect to get an autograph. Crazy. Otherwise awesome

Everyone I have come in contact with has been very knowledgeable and professional.  With each visit, they ask my level of pain and focus their exercises on helping eliminate my pain and improve my health.
I was very satisfied with Baptist Beaches Cardiac Rehab. All the staff were very helpful. Due to having appointments, it forces one to exercise consistently and under monitored conditions.

I feel the staff helped me immensely on every detail and I feel much better for attending
It will. Help me get motivated to continue a healthy lifestyle
Very professional,  and everyone who works there has been terrific. Highly recommend!
Great staff, good program, good variety of equipment and convenient location.

Appointments scheduled quickly, all sessions have been started on time with therapist.  Assessment was thorough, explanation of issue and what needs to be done clear and easily understood.  Therapist listens well to my feedback, exercises are geared toward my pain level/ability/goals.  Exercises are sent to Med Bridge so I have information needed to continue work at home.  Office staff is knowledgeable, courteous and friendly.  Office and therapy area is clean, well organized and bright.
Highly recommend

Brandy, my PT, and Jennifer, my PTA, are great! I have only had four sessions but feel my strength and balance are already improving through my sessions at Baptist South and doing the recommended exercises at home and in the neighborhood pool.
Physical therapist, David Eldridge is outstanding at his job. He is caring and extremely professional.  His knowledge and expertise have been invaluable during my rehabilitation

Both Candace and Brandy are exceptional and I always feel better when I leave from PT and massage sessions.
They listens to patients and are professional.
I really love to go to the therapy and wish to go twice a week.

Shey is wonderful and helps me with my appointments.

I will happy to recommend Candace and Brandy to my family and friends.

The Physical Therapist I currently have has been very good. She has never been late and she listens to me about those injured areas that need therapy. She has also corrected my stretches that I have been doing wrong.

This has been one of the best horseback riding experiences that I have encountered in south Florida! I went for a 90-minute ride and enjoyed every single minute of it. The ranch is so well maintained and the staff is very welcoming. I had the opportunity to ride Doug who was the sweetest horse and was guided by Michele who was amazing and very experienced! I also appreciated that the ride was private as opposed to being in a group. The scenery is stunning and peaceful. I cannot wait to go back!

Bar-B-Ranch is truly one of a kind.
I‚Äôve been riding here since I was little, and it‚Äôs played a huge role in shaping my love and understanding of horses. Bar-B doesn‚Äôt just teach you how to ride, they also teach you how to connect with horses through natural horsemanship, in a way that prioritizes the horse‚Äôs well being and spirit.
The horses are incredibly well cared for and live happy, beautiful lives. Every experience I‚Äôve had at Bar-B has been positive. The staff always goes the extra mile to make sure riders feel safe, comfortable, and are learning something every time they‚Äôre out on the trail.
The trails are scenic, peaceful, and the perfect place to enjoy nature on horseback. I truly don‚Äôt think I could ever find another ranch like this one. It‚Äôs a special place that I‚Äôm incredibly grateful for.

My daughter, April, has been going to this ranch since she could ride ponies and grew up going to the day camp and we‚Äôve always loved the safe and happy environment the ranch provides. The trails have beautiful views and the horses are very well taken care of. She‚Äôs 20 now and has been working there for many years she‚Äôs made some of her best friends and best experiences at this ranch, from Halloween rides to gaining a lot of confidence. The owners Jason and Sam have taught her so much and take care of them like family. They make it such a happy and therapeutic environment. I‚Äôve done many trail rides here as well and always have the best time, I highly recommend, so thankful to Bar B Ranch!

I‚Äôve been coming to Bar B since I was 7 and all i can say is how blessed and grateful I am to have a place to call home like this! I‚Äôve met my life long friends here and grew up riding and learning from these amazing horses. Sam and Jason have taught me everything i know and i can‚Äôt ever find the words to let them know how grateful i am for everything ‚ù§Ô∏è Definitely highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to ride horses and get to know more about these amazing animals! No one loves their horses like Bar B does ‚ù§Ô∏è

My boyfriend took me here for my 25th birthday celebration, and we did the 1.5-hour ride. Let me tell you‚Äîthis place, the horses, and the staff truly made it an amazing experience. Our tour guide, Kat, was incredible! She‚Äôs so knowledgeable, full of great energy, and offered such helpful insights. She even taught us a few new riding tricks and shared interesting details about the ranch and the park.

The horses were unbelievably sweet and patient. You can tell this place genuinely cares‚Äînot just for the animals, but also for their campers and staff. There‚Äôs a real sense of comfort and compassion all around. We‚Äôre already looking forward to coming back!

This agency is the best ABA therapy agency in Miami. Words are not enough to express how satisfied I am with everything they have done. The love and dedication the whole agency puts in their service, it shows they truly care about the wellbeing of their patients.

It has been a blessing to have found Baracusa Health Care for my daughter's therapy with autism. The team is dedicated and compassionate, and have always been willing to go above and beyond to ensure my daughter receives the support she needs. We have only been in this country for 6 months and thanks to Maydelis we were able to achieve the therapies in this short time. Anyone who knows the subject knows that it is a long process but when things are done with love you can see the results. For the family that is looking for a therapy agency for their child, this is it.

I want to express my sincere gratitude to Baracusa Health Care for the support and therapy they have provided to my daughter with autism. Their manager, Maydelis, has been a true angel in our lives, and her dedication and professionalism have been instrumental in my daughter's progress. The therapy has been tailored to my daughter's specific needs, and we have seen great progress in her development and confidence. I recommend Baracusa to any family seeking support and therapy for their child with autism.

There are few words to express my gratitude to Baracusa Health Care, its entire staff, and especially its manager, who welcomes you from the first day and addresses all your concerns, providing the most comprehensive service. I say this with complete confidence because I've been to several agencies and never felt so well cared for. Thanks to them, my daughter now enjoys quality service where we see results from day one.
This place is amazing. The horse are wonderful and being able to ride in such a peaceful setting has truly no comparison!!!
In love with this place. Too many positive vibes. üòÅ Also, great horses, very well taken care of.
Best barn out there! They take exceptional care of there horses. Barbie is the best!
Wonderful review

provider_name: Bark Busters Home Dog Training Fort Myers
review_text: We have a New Leash on life! After our 1st session with Sharon, we are confident we are on the road to easing the severe separation anxiety our Sparky has. He came to us in Jan after being rescued from Helene and losing his mom. We love him so much,  and wanted to help him be happy when we aren't home.  We tried everything,  we thought, then called bark busters. We know it will take time but we feel sure we now have the tools needed to speak Dog language.  I'll update in 2 months, but he was so responsive today, it was really remarkable.  We highly recommend Sharon.

provider_name: Bark Busters Home Dog Training Fort Myers
review_text: Sharon has been absolutely amazing with our cockapoo! From the very first session, she gave us clear, practical strategies that worked right away. She is patient, professional, and truly understands dog behavior. Our pup has made huge progress thanks to her guidance, and we feel so much more confident as owners. Sharon not only trained our dog but also taught us how to communicate better with him, which has made such a difference in our daily lives. We are so grateful for her help and highly recommend her to anyone looking for effective, compassionate training!

provider_name: Bark Busters Home Dog Training Fort Myers
review_text: Our session with Sharon was amazing! The change in our puppy‚Äôs behavior feels miraculous but the secret was training me, not the dog. :)   I highly recommend Sharon.  She was patient and thoughtful.  She was easy to work with and full of insight.   I love seeing someone love their job, and you can tell she does.  Thank you! Our home is much more peaceful and quiet now that our puppy doesn‚Äôt think she has to protect us from every single shadow or noise.

provider_name: Bark Busters Home Dog Training Fort Myers
review_text: Sharon is truly a master at training and has taught me the importance of ‚Äúspeaking dog‚Äù. I have a completely new understanding of how to communicate with all of our dogs but it‚Äôs been transformative for our new addition to the family Stella who is 1. It‚Äôs going to take a lot of practice and consistency but I saw immediate improvement following Sharon‚Äôs visit. The dogs know I‚Äôm different. We have three so my communication is very important. Sharon is kind compassionate and very patient. She has also responded to every follow up question I‚Äôve had and continues to offer support. I am so grateful for my experience with Sharon and love this method of training that is about the trust bond between you and your dog and not about treats or clickers! I am so glad I trusted Sharon to teach me!! I highly recommend Bark Busters Pinellas!!!

provider_name: Bark Busters Home Dog Training Fort Myers
review_text: Sharon is excellent and we would absolutely recommend her services to others. We reached out to her with assistance for our six month old golden retriever. Sharon is very responsive, thorough, patient, kind, and explains the rationale behind dog behaviors. She taught us how to communicate with our puppy in a way she would understand. Additionally, there are no fear-based tactics and you do not have to rely on treats to correct behavior. Sharon remains flexible and available for ongoing needs and provides several supplemental materials for ongoing reminders. We saw immediate improvements in our ability to communicate with our puppy and in our puppy‚Äôs behaviors after the first meeting. Another big perk is that the training can be ongoing (if needed) for the life of the dog. I am so thankful that we found Sharon!

provider_name: Bark Place - Where K9s Always Come 1st
review_text: If you know anything about corgis, you know they are food motivated. I mean really food motivated. My corgi Winston would trade me, for a single slice of cheddar without a second thought.  So imagine my shock when this morning, Winston refused breakfast. Why? Because he saw me dressed and thought I might leave without taking him to Bark Place. He parked himself by the door, eyes locked on me, in a mild panic thinking I was going to not take him today. Let me be clear: Winston was willing to skip a meal for Bark Place. That tells you all you need to know about this fantastic place and how much they truly will take care of your dog.  Just be prepared, your dog will start choosing them over you.

provider_name: Bark Place - Where K9s Always Come 1st
review_text: This place is the greatest find for my dog in Fort Myers! My young golden retriever has gained so much confidence in socialization with other dogs. All the dogs are amazing and friendly screened by the owner personally. Trusting someone with your fur family is hard but the staff make this experience for the dogs wonderful! Photos of the doggy campers are posted on Facebook almost daily! I can‚Äôt recommend this place any more highly! Thank you Bark Place!!!

provider_name: Bark Place - Where K9s Always Come 1st
review_text: We absolutely love Bark Place.  We come to Ft Myers every Spring and are so grateful that our active Goldendoodle has a safe, fun, and caring place to play.  The staff is incredible and the care top notch!

provider_name: Bark Place - Where K9s Always Come 1st
review_text: Bark Place is the best!  Baxter gets so excited when he knows it's a daycare day.  He absolutely loves going to spend the day with his friends.  Jennie is so knowledgeable and caring.  She loves what she does and it shows. I'm also very comfortable boarding him with Jennie knowing that he is always safe and in a comfortable home setting.  So happy I found this place.

provider_name: Bark Place - Where K9s Always Come 1st
review_text: THE BEST DAYCARE AND BOARDING (in home) Business in Fort Myers!!!   My two dogs have been going there for the past 2 years for both daycare and boarding and absolutely love it ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è  The owner, Jennie Curtis, is the best with dogs!!  She treats them all like one of her own.  It is very safe, very well monitored, professional and very clean facility!!!!!!!

Our family is so happy to have found Lauren for our daughter's speech therapy!  She has such a bright and engaging personality, and most importantly, she makes each session fun with unique games/activities!  Our daughter looks forward to her appointment every week!
Great counseling services for families and individuals. I appreciate Billy's professional approach very much, his services are definitely recommended.

What a knowledgeable and caring group of people at Barr and Associates!  My experience at Physical Therapy after rotator cuff repair surgery was the best!  Because of their one-on-one attention to their patients, I was reassured and cared for when I was in pain after my surgery.  Victoria and Jen were the main therapists I saw and they were truly caring and awesome in helping me recover.  Vicky at the front desk always greeted me with a smile.  Thank you to all of you who made my experience the best it could be!

I had a painful shoulder impingement. I thought I might need surgery do to the amount of pain I was in. Susan was able to start relieving the pain from the first visit. It was a slow but effective process. I am so happy to be out of the daily pain I was in before coming to Barr and Associates. They truly have healing hands!
Jen C was my therapist and she was amazing.   This place made PT a great experience.  Dr Barr was very attentive and the entire staff were very professional.  I‚Äôm thrilled with my outcome.

I've been to a few physical therapy practices and I must say this one is unique because not only are you with one person or close to an hour but you are in a room separate from other patients not like song PT operations that look more like a gym with a whole bunch of people thrown together and one therapist dealing with three or four patience at a time. I would very much like to thank Dr Jennifer and Rosalind for their dedication to me is a patient and I look forward to going there every time. I had a problem with my elbow something called tennis elbow which involves some tearing of the tendons that attach the muscles in your forearm to the bone on your elbow. It's very painful and we worked through some of the pain and disability with some great technology such as ultrasound therapy an low light laser therapy. Thanks again folks for a helpful and pleasant and healing experience.
The  very best PT in Daytona Beach! I have had two knee and a hip replacement. The therapist work 1 on 1 and that makes rehab faster and BETTER!

provider_name: Barrett Outpatient Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine Center
review_text:
This rehab center was wonderful. A large, clean, well organized center. The people working there were very friendly, including the therapists that worked with me. I mainly saw Archana, which was nice to see one PT, who followed my progress throughout each visit. She tried different techniques to help my balance issues, and kept me motivated with words of encouragement. My visits are done, but I will hear her in my head as I‚Äôm doing my exercises at home now!
Many thanks to Barrett Outpatient Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine‚Äîand Archana, for all your help!

provider_name: Barrett Outpatient Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine Center
review_text:
I went to see Josee an occupational therapist to get a brace for my right hand as I have early onset Parkinson‚Äôs disease and tend to get troublesome trigger finger/thumb. I had already bought a brace at CVS which worked well to stabilize/ straighten my thumb. My orthopedist suggested I get a custom skin colored brace - I didn‚Äôt want to invest a lot of money on this as I said o had already bought a brace at CVS. After my initial evaluation with Josee I asked her to run it through my insurance and also asked her for an estimate. She said it wouldn‚Äôt cost more than ‚Äòa few hundred‚Äô. Someome from rehab later called me to say it was approved and to come in for an appointment. I got fitted for a brace which was extremely uncomfortable and painful and I could not wear it more than 2 hrs. I came back to see Josee and as she said she didn‚Äôt have time to make a new one we did some hand exercises. She said she would order a thinner material for a new brace that would be more comfortable. I came back 2 weeks later to get fitted and the material had not arrived so I rescheduled the appointment. Next time around I got fitted for the new brace with the new material. I must say I was disappointed in how this brace looks. While it‚Äôs slightly more comfortable it‚Äôs still more uncomfortable than my CVS brace and it looks like a 10 year old made it in arts and crafts class. Two weeks later I get a bill for $738 for this ‚Äòbrace project‚Äô . I was shocked especially when Josee assured me it wouldn‚Äôt cost more than a ‚Äòfew hundred ‚Äò which in my mind is $200 tops, especially for a piece of plastic sheeting melted in a hot water bath that took 20 mins to make. The initial eval
should have been $35, the one session where I did exercises also $35. These are my insurance copays. All in I didn‚Äôt expect to pay more than $270 for this. I‚Äôve contacted Josee as surely someone must have made a mistake and she told me to call billing. When I talked to billing they told me contact rehab. So here I going in circles. This is the second time Morton Plant overcharges me for a procedure and doesn‚Äôt give me an accurate estimate. Next steps are the AMA, the consumer protection board, the Florida Department of Health and if needed, small claims court. Frankly the over billing at Morton Plant has to stop. So I am giving you one more chance to correct this.

provider_name: Barrett Outpatient Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine Center
review_text: I suffered an ischemic stroke at age 56 leaving me with left sided hemipilegia . After 1 1/2 years of working with therapists who did not know what to do with me (and struggling on my own) I finally had the great fortune to land at PTAK Orthopedic and Neuromuscular center at Morton Plant Mease Hospital. Here I found hope, support, and a skilled team specializing in stroke recovery. Archana pushed me (hard) to realize my full potential and is clearly passionate about her job.  I will be forever grateful to her for helping me. I highly recommend this team for stroke rehab and wish I had found her sooner. 5 stars given to the check-in staff and scheduling department as well .  Thank you !

provider_name: Barrett Outpatient Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine Center
review_text: My experience with occupational therapy was wonderful.  Josee and Amber helped improve my range of motion and reduce my pain. I made steady progress during OT and after.  They provided invaluable resources and information.

provider_name: Barrett Outpatient Rehabilitation & Sports Medicine Center
review_text:
Martin is such a good teacher/therapist!
He carefully explains exercises and watches to give pointers to make sure the exercises are done correctly. He takes time to explain things. I learned so much from him and I feel much better!

Dr. Delucia is very thorough in her approach to your pet.  She cares for your pet with love and kindness.  Her staff are very friendly and prompt to give the best service possible.  Brandi is well versed in international travel documents if you need to take your pet abroad.  The office always has a seasonal photo booth set up for you and your pet when you enter their lobby.  This Veterinarian thinks of it all!

My baby boy was looking miserable, felt warm, AND HID FROM FOOD I OFFERED HIM! Something‚Äôs wrong. I called and got an appointment right away. The doc was quick to give him an xray and come back with results (my boy has pica‚Ä¶ I was worried he might have a blockage). No issues there, WHEW! But the doc said he has a high fever and he wanted to give him fluids and an anti-nausea shot. Once we got home, my boy looked so much happier and was purring up a storm. He‚Äôs sleeping off the fever now, but when I check on him, he looks comfortable and happy to see me. I‚Äôm so relieved! This vet is AWESOME and everyone there was so super nice!

Dr. Ayo Akande and staff Went above and beyond for my baby.after finding out he needed surgery after ingesting something from outside that was stuck in his intestines. And was about to not make it.
Not knowing how extensive the surgery would be until he got in, and I had to sit and wait and pray, and it turned more extensive and more dangerous, and they had to remove a part of my dogs large intestine and reconnect it back together. Which sounds terrifying as a mother.
And He was so honest with me and kept me updated through out and I luckily followed everything he recommended after surgery.
And  I am so lucky and grateful he was such a great surgeon and vet and the wonderful staff that cares so much and follows up and I still have my baby to this day years later.
You will be grateful and a little more at peace knowing your dogs in such good hands here. If I could give 10 stars I would. Absolutely phenomenal people and vets. ‚ù§Ô∏è

I needed my one year old puppy to get neutered under short notice & they were just wonderful. They fit him in for surgery within the next two days and they did a great job. Beautiful clinic, clean, and they really care about our pets. Constantly communicating with you and making sure you‚Äôre at ease. Thank you guys !

Bartram Park took amazing care of our baby girl Nala ‚ÄúBiggy Smalls‚Äù with all of her initial vaccines and wellness checks. The staff is friendly, caring and has the perfect touch to make everyone comfortable. Thank you for taking care such great care of our baby girl and giving her so much loving in the lobby.

The best place for neurodivergent preschoolers! The teachers and the staff are very attentive and utilize the diverse range of techniques to help kids advance with their skills. The facility is very clean and includes classrooms with tons of visual support, OT rooms, gymnasium and 4 different playgrounds including the one with the fountain that my son absolutely loves. Ms. Paz is one of the best teachers I have met, and the progress my son has made in her classroom is immense. This school is a blessing, and we truly appreciate the opportunity to attend.

Most wonderful place. Very caring teachers and staff.  Such an awesome experience. We've been so lucky that our son is part of this school.  Going to miss everyone once the new school year starts since our son will be attending a different school.

Would give it zero stars if I could. My son ended up fracturing his elbow because of this school. During school hours under the supervision of the adults that work here, my son ended up fracturing his elbow, they saw that he couldn't move his arm at all and yet they refused to call 911.  The nurses exact words were "we didn't see any bone sticking out or blood so we didn't think he needed it" when I asked why he wasn't treated. My son cried in pain for hours before he finally got some relief with medicine at the hospital that is LITERALLY ACROSS THE STREET FROM THIS SCHOOL. He had to wear a cast for a month, do you understand how traumatic that is for a 3 year old to have to go through? Even more so a child with special needs.
The staff is incompetent for this and should not be working with special needs children if they cannot properly and effectively protect them. After this I removed my son from their school, I do not trust his safety in their hands. Worse of all, they have refused time and time again to let me see the footage of my son getting injured, apparently I'm suppose to take their word for it and be ok with that. It honestly feels lioe they have something to hide since they refuse to be transparent about the situation.

Something like this should never happen at a school that ONLY takes care of special needs children. You have been warned.

I'm in love with Baudhin Preschool. We heard great things before my son was enrolled and I see why! He has only been in school for a few months and his speech, behavior, etc. has all changed so much. They are very supportive and have many trainings and meetings for the parents, siblings, and even grandparents. I'm so thankful for the teachers and staff. Its so comforting to go to the school and everyone knows your name and your child's name. The facility is Gorgeous, very clean, and modern. I love the set up of the classrooms! They send home a detailed notification everyday explaining what my son did throughout the day. (I love that) If your child has been diagnosed with Autism this is the school for them!
Loved, my soon did 3 years and I was super pleased, they did a great job. We love Mrs Taylor.

Christine and her team are extraordinary. Their methodology and skills, from training, enrichment days, and extracurricular activities, have been an excellent tool for Ramon's behavior. (9 months golden doodle). I can trust my furry love is in good hands.

About three months ago I was looking to get some help for my brand new 10 week old bullterrier puppy Luna. She is a sweet dog but very stubborn and was systematically chewing every piece of wood in the house, doing a lot of nipping/biting And had a couple  accidents in the house. I went online and found BAUSERS Pet training in North Miami and went by to talk with the owner Christine. This is a detailed review, but I promise it‚Äôs worth the read! About four months ago, I found Bailey on the streets and decided to adopt him. He‚Äôs 6 years old and was incredibly sweet and friendly with both dogs and people when we first took him in. However, after he was neutered, Bailey became reactive and aggressive toward other dogs, both on and off leash.

We also learned that Bailey had been living on the streets for a long time and had been abandoned multiple times, which meant he came with some emotional baggage. He struggled with severe separation anxiety, barking for hours when left alone, which led to frequent complaints from our neighbors. Since Bailey goes everywhere with me, the thought of starting a new job and leaving him at home alone left me feeling anxious and overwhelmed. I couldn‚Äôt even consider doggy daycare because I was terrified he might get into a fight with another dog.

I was completely overwhelmed‚Äîhaving no experience training a dog, I didn‚Äôt know where to start. After countless hours searching for affordable options that combined daycare and training, I finally found Bauser‚Äôs.

In just over a month, Bauser‚Äôs has transformed life for both me and Bailey. I was initially hesitant to leave him there because I wasn‚Äôt familiar with the staff or how things worked, but my worries disappeared after his first day. The team at Bauser‚Äôs is incredibly patient, kind, and attentive to both Bailey‚Äôs needs and my concerns.

Bailey has already made tremendous progress, especially around other dogs. Bauser‚Äôs provides daily report cards detailing what Bailey worked on, areas for improvement, and tips for practicing at home. They also share videos of his training sessions, showing me how to continue the lessons myself. They‚Äôve even started carefully introducing Bailey to other dogs, which has made a huge difference in his behavior outside of daycare.

Most importantly, Bailey loves it there. He‚Äôs always so excited when we arrive, and just the other day, he didn‚Äôt even want to leave!

His journey is far from over, but I‚Äôm beyond thrilled with the progress he‚Äôs made so far. I‚Äôm deeply grateful to Christine and the entire Bauser‚Äôs team for the care, support, and dedication they‚Äôve shown to Bailey. Thank you for everything! üòä

He‚Äôs been taking care of our two Goldens whenever we‚Äôre out of town or just need a quick potty break during the day, and we couldn't be happier. Derrick always checks in and sends us pictures during walks. Our pups absolutely love him, and we always know they‚Äôre in great hands. Highly recommend!

Best dog care business in town. He walks my dog and feeds my cats. My babies are very territorial and don‚Äôt trust easily. Derrick has a gift that makes animals feel safe. He has been a good sent. Thank you Beach Dawg üôèüèæ
Derrick is passionate about pets, he will treat your pet like family. He realizes pets mean so much to us emotionally and mentally and he will treat them with  love, care, and attention.

Love Derrick.
I‚Äôve seen him handle and care for a giant Tank of a dog with a lot of care and tenderness. I can‚Äôt think of anyone better to care for my dog while I‚Äôm away. He definitely is a great friend of man‚Äôs best friend.
Derrick is a gentle , caring and uplifting with all animals. He took great care of my dog Silver while I was on vacation. I strongly recommend his services.

We cannot recommend Jet Set University (and their boarding facility, Jet Set Pet) enough! Our dog, Caesar, has gone from learning basic commands and manners to mastering advanced behaviors, all thanks to their incredible team. Not only did they help train Caesar, but they also gave us the confidence and skills to continue working with him at home.

The staff is always happy, kind, and you can truly see their passion for animals and watching them grow. Communication has been clear and consistent every step of the way, and they‚Äôve always been attentive to Caesar‚Äôs needs. We‚Äôve loved every second of working with them for both training and boarding, and we are so grateful for the positive impact they‚Äôve had on our pup and our family!

A special thank you to Chanin and Shantal who worked with us directly and whose patience and dedication truly helped Caesar thrive.

Our Australian Shepard loves Loves LVOES Jet Set Pets!! She was attacked at a dog park about a year ago and my Husband and I were very nervous to drop her off for boarding. But Jet Set Pets is amazing! The way they pay attention to details and truly care for your dog is great. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to take their dog to a fun and safe place.

I can not say enough amazing things about Jet Set! They have transformed my pup to an amazing my companion who I can take anywhere.  She was unruly and reactive and now can heel, place, stay, come and is so very happy! They are a text away anytime I have a concern and love on her everytime they see her! I love this place and the trainers!!!

Five stars for Jet Set Pets! As first-timers to dog boarding, we were naturally apprehensive, but Jet Set Pets made the experience seamless and worry-free. From the very first interaction, their team was incredibly responsive, answering all our questions and easing our concerns. The staff were not only friendly but also showed genuine care and affection for our furry family member. We were particularly impressed with the cleanliness of the facilities, ensuring a healthy and safe environment for all pets. It's clear that Jet Set Pets goes above and beyond, and our dog returned home happy and well-cared for. We couldn't have asked for a better boarding experience and highly recommend them to any pet parent!

I admit! I am a worry wart. I am one if those people who literally HATES to travel because I don‚Äôt like to leave my dogs. Why? Because I worry!  But I DON‚ÄôT worry when they are at Beaches Jet Set Pets. There, I know they are SUPER particular to honoring my notes and concerns, and my dogs are SO loved while there with exceptional personal attention! My dogs don‚Äôt do playgroups as two are anti social with  other dogs, and my third. Is a senior. They all stay separately, as per my wishes, but are all taken out together as a family to play and potty daily! They are happy, loved, clean, and no worse for the wear when I pick them up! There is such peace of mind I get from knowing they are safe and happy with exceptional personal attention so they feel loved and secure! They are not stressed, exhausted, zombies when we pick them up-rather, happy and enriched from all the attention they recurved! You can even book all kinds of bonus treatments if you so desire! My pups have been on the receiving end of the nightly cuddle session/story book time when they stay longer than one night! If you are a worrier like me, and feel like nothing is ever good or safe enough for your dogs, and as a result, hate leaving them....give Beaches JSP‚Äôs a try! I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll be disappointed!  Becky Rosa, mom to Annie, Dewey, and Mr Bill

I feel like me and my child got so lucky!! Kristi is just the best and really cares about the kids. She has helped my child‚Äôs meltdowns improve dramatically! Beaches nature therapy is the best of the best, I wish we came sooner!!
Kristi is so wonderful! She has helped me and my family so much and I see drastic improvements in my child. I am so grateful for her help and can‚Äôt thank her enough!
Kristi is so amazing and helpful! I‚Äôve noticed a complete change in my child after her services! She is the #1 occupational therapist at the beach!
Kristi is amazing. She made such a difference in my childs life. I can‚Äôt thank her enough ‚ù§Ô∏è

Therapists are helpful, but office staff completely inept. An error on their part has cost me money and when I called to get clarification, they offered no help. There are so many other choices for care, definitely find a place with better communication and honest staff. 10/10 do not recommend.

Judy Schrader is an amazing therapist and I recommend her to everyone. She is phenomenal at helping people come away with a place of peace and victory through difficult situation‚Äôs. She just knows how to help you fix those issues!
Lucy Lauer is the best therapist I have ever worked with. She uses mindfulness to help people with eating disorders and anxiety. My sessions with her have been life changing.

I highly recommend Lucy Lauer for eating disorders. As a therapist I have consulted with her and received invaluable feedback. I have worked closely with Lucy and have seen her warmth, her caring and her straight-forward approach to working with her clients.
Therapist did not show up

My primary care doctor referred me to Beachside PT, and I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful. They reached out to me quickly, and from the very first call, I was impressed. Chelsea at the front desk should be the gold standard for customer service. Her phone etiquette, professionalism, and genuinely warm personality immediately put me at ease. Walking in a bit nervous, she made the check-in process smooth and stress-free.

I was paired with Dominick for my sessions, and he continued that same high level of care. He greeted me with professionalism and kindness, took the time to listen, and explained everything he was going to do in a way that made sense. He was patient, moved at a pace I was comfortable with, and made sure I felt confident each step of the way. One thing I especially appreciated was that they created a personalized exercise program just for me - and gave me access to it through their H2 Health app. Having everything right at my fingertips has made continuing my therapy at home so much easier.

On a later visit, the office was noticeably busier, but still impressively organized. Despite the increased flow of patients, everyone received attention, and the staff remained upbeat and fully engaged. You can tell how much the team enjoys what they do - every interaction was personal, and they even spoke to  people calling them by name.

The facility itself is super clean, welcoming, and there‚Äôs plenty of convenient parking. All in all, Beachside PT offers an outstanding combination of professionalism, personalization, and a truly supportive environment. I‚Äôm so glad my doctor referred me here - I feel like I‚Äôm finally on the right path to recovery.

- Nicole

Chelsea was very nice and very accommodating as far as scheduling and welcoming
Jason is Who I worked most with, and he was excellent in his care for me and Dom set up my plan to get me back in action, fully functional and confident in my strength downtown Beachside physical therapy is the best place that I have been and I have had a lot of physical therapy they take time they talk to you. They generally care. I am very grateful.

I started going to BPT shortly after my knee replacement surgery. The entire staff, from Chelsea in the front desk to the therapists Dom and Jason, were great to work with. The team is very caring, professional, and knowledgeable. Dom and Jason were very patient and pushed me just enough to make the progress I was hoping for. Through their attentive treatments, manual therapy, and exercises, I have regained enough strength and mobility to continue working on my own. Thank you so much. I highly recommend this team to anyone in need of physical therapy.

Shout out to Chelsea who was an amazing help getting some insurance snags smoothed out even before my son came in for his first appointment. Now that his treatment has ended, I can promise from observing that every patient who comes in is treated with kindness and respect. My son is 12 and while he enjoyed all the fun and friendly banter, I appreciated how well the therapists communicated with him and encouraged him during his sessions. Thank you guys for all you did- I am so grateful my son is out of pain and getting stronger everyday.

From the moment I walked through the door, I was treated like a long lost friend. Overtime I I felt like a part of the family.. not only was their care outstanding but their facility was always clean and organized and it created a professional atmosphere. With their expertise and encouragement, my shoulder is much stronger now, and I am able to return to work. Dominic and Jason and Chelsea  will always be grateful for everything you helped me through..  You are both amazing and I wish you nothing but the best in life. God bless

provider_name: Beachside Physical Therapy - Indian Harbour Beach
review_text: I apologize that it took so long to leave this review. After Double hit replacement surgery in 2024, I was under the care of this facility for almost the entire calendar year. My recovery has been fantastic, and I cannot say enough nice things about the quality and credibility of the staff. Special shout-out to Kevin,  Sarah and Micki.... And I do not want to forget about Mike !  All of the therapists that worked with me were extremely thorough and patient, it really was a very personalized treatment program in an environment that just absolutely promotes healing. My recommendation for this facility is 100%, and for those considering on doing your therapy and recovery here, be confident your results will be just as great as the work you put into it. Many Mahalo's to the entire staff once again, you guys rock

provider_name: Beachside Physical Therapy - Indian Harbour Beach
review_text:
Everything about Beachside Therapy is 5 star.  They are there to help the client, thus they start out with where you currently are with movement and discuss where you want to be.  Each person receives their own personalized treatment plan and assigned therapist.  Your therapist truly cares that you reach your goal. You become a team.  I have had P.T. many times in the past.  Unfortunately, I usually left before I reached my goal because it became a  chore when staff didn't seem to care whether my movement improved or not.
Try Beachside, they are "head over heels" better than the rest. Best of all, I can use my shoulder even better than before my break. Thank you to this professional, caring group.

provider_name: Beachside Physical Therapy - Indian Harbour Beach
review_text: After a successful bilateral hip replacement in New York, I returned to Florida knowing I would continue PT. From the start Sara was interested in my goals and outcomes. Being a very knowledgeable therapist, as well as a yoga teacher, she was exactly the gift I needed....I'm a yoga teacher too! I highly recommend her not only because she's one of the best therapists around, but her demeanor, optimism and attention was so welcome during a time of intense healing and recovery.

provider_name: Beachside Physical Therapy - Indian Harbour Beach
review_text: My hip range of motion is back to where it was 30 years ago and I will take it!  To be 72 and to have my hip use be close to what it was in my 40's is almost a miracle.  No surgery either!  Everyone that worked with me added their own special twist to my improvement. Courtney, who rotated through Beachside and worked with me a few times, added some techniques that marked my greatest  steps to improvement.  I will be forever thankful for Sarah, Mickie, Marilyn, and Courtney. Elexis always brightened my day, and Meagan kept things running like clockwork.  What a great team! What a positive and joyful atmosphere you have at Beachside Physical Therapy! I will miss going there actually. Thank you! God bless.

provider_name: Beachside Physical Therapy - Indian Harbour Beach
review_text: My journey to recovery was amazing. Great staff. I received an injury on the job to my SI joint, and with a little over 8 weeks with physical therapy, I was back to normal. No pain meds after the 2 week of therapy, no invasive procedures, just physical therapy by their Amazing Staff. Mickey and Mike did my therapy and  mein they are super heroes. Thanks to them both and God , I‚Äôm back to normal. God bless their healing hands. I recommend Beachside . Desiree

Beachside Therapy was exactly what I needed‚Äîand more than I bargained for! A big shoutout  to Mike who kept my progress running smoothly, and Blake was equal parts motivator and, dare I say, a meaner‚Äîin the best way possible. He knew just when to push, when to challenge, and when to throw me a lifeline of encouragement. I may have called him a meaner once or twice (okay, maybe more), but deep down I knew it came from a place of genuine care and expertise. Recovery wasn‚Äôt easy, but with their support, it became something I could laugh through, cry through, and ultimately grow from. Highly recommend if you want to heal with heart and a little sass.

Samantha was my PT person and she could not have been any better. Although I was hesitant to go to PT for my balance issues I will have to admit I believe the exercises help my balance. Samantha help me to learn how to walk with the cane. That will be very beneficial to me in the future. The reason I rated it four stars instead of five was not directed to Samantha, but there was an employee that spoke bad about the facility and I don't think a customer should have to hear that type of a conversation.
I had physical Therapy on my knee after a fracture of my knee cap.  I worked with Blake and Mike. They were helpful and friendly. My knee is much better now.

The therapists at this Beachside Therapy on Wickham road are so wonderful. I felt so cared for, they work together and all of them care about your recovery.  I would recommend them to everyone. Thank you for the care and time you gave me.

Very caring, knowledgeable staff. Thanks for all you're doing to help me get stronger.
Samantha Lavooy is wonderful.

My mother went to Beachside physical therapy and she was very happy. She truly enjoyed having Peyton and Katelyn. They were amazing with her therapy and helped her getting back her balance. Michelle the front desk person was also amazing. She worked with my  daughter to make sure my schedule didn't conflict with other appointments I had. Overall I give this place more than 5 star rating. If you need physical therapy call and have them get you back to recovery.
J. Moreno

This place is wonderful. Every member of the team is very nice. Especially the therapist Peyton Richardson has been fantastic in her treatment. Always concerned and attentive to everyone. She likes to know how I feel each day and that's nice because as a client you feel good that they care about you. My first language is Spanish and she communicates with me excellently. I appreciate all her efforts.

Peyton and the team here are phenomenal. Everyone here is always very positive and happy, which makes the process so much easier. I highly recommend beachside physical therapy to anyone in need! You‚Äôll definitely leave this place feeling much better! Thank you all so much! üòÅ

The staff here is thorough with great attention to detail. I came in after having complete knee reconstruction and wanted a complete program without overdoing it. The lead physical therapist designed an excellent program for me and after 10 weeks I was pretty much at 80%, but she recommended another four weeks which got me to about 95%. The crew is a fun bunch and I almost miss going to physical therapy.

Peyton was wonderful to work with. For me personally, the establishment was hard at times to be in because so many people are talking across the room at each other and the physical therapists are having to manage multiple patients at a time. It was very overstimulating at times. Peyton did a really good job and managing her time between patients and I was really grateful that she was my PT. I had to work with Paul one day and I feel like everyone but me got his attention and I ended up leaving my appt early because I kept waiting around for him to work with me. I‚Äôd go back there if I needed to but only if I got to work with Peyton.

Drew and his staff were very professional, yet at the same time were friendly and relaxed making me feel like I was among friends. Drew's work is exceptional and his assessments fair and accurate. Thank you Beachside for making a difficult process smooth and easy.

Drew was very professional and helpful like others have said he makes the process of getting help easy. He helped one of my family members. Very knowledgeable in the recovery and placement into an appropriate facility. 5 Stars all the way!

I wish to share this with others who find themselves in a place that might seem difficult as I have. Six months ago at the age of 64, I found myself being overwhelmed by events from early in my life. I could not seem to get past my thoughts and feelings on my own. I was at a point to where I could not complete daily tasks without becoming lost. I realized I needed professional help. I reached out to Beachside Recovery Intervention + Consulting. There I found the help and professional assistance that I so needed. Drew has been instrumental in helping me get some peace and resolve back in my life. I still have a long ways to get back to where I would like to be. With Drew's help and EMDR, I am sure I will get the results I have so desperately been seeking. If you are in need of professional assistance, I strongly recommend BRIC! Thank you Drew for all your help!!
Sincerely Alicia

Beachside Recovery has genuinely transformed my life. After carrying emotional trauma for years, I finally found someone that‚Äôs straightforward, compassionate, and laser-focused on results. From the very first session, I felt safe enough with Drew to dig into issues I didn't know I'd buried for decades‚Äîand the progress came much faster than I expected.

Since beginning EMDR, my outlook is brighter and more optimistic. I speak up with confidence instead of shrinking back, and I no longer hesitate to set boundaries or share my needs. My relationships‚Äîboth at home and at work‚Äîhave improved dramatically. I‚Äôve stopped apologizing for simply existing and started owning who I am.

If you‚Äôre tired of feeling stuck and ready for real change, Beachside Recovery is the place to do it. I highly recommend it!

Drew has been working with my 9.5yr old boy/girl twins. He‚Äôs been a great at getting them comfortable. Opening them up and encouraging them to share their experiences/feelings. They are both completely different yet he‚Äôs able to tell and adapt to each of their little personalities! They‚Äôre both thriving and it‚Äôs definitely a large part bc of Drew!

The staff is unbelievable especially Diana trauma therapist, Gerry, Mo and Brandon in PHP. As far as the beach goes you can only try to get on a list after detox approximately 7 days. They drive 11 people to the beach. There is a list for bowling once a week.  A free 15 minute massage is offered if you get on the list once a week. You need to pay for the hour massage, acupuncture, sound therapy and Reiki. The pool is great but can't be used until after detox. It has set hours. You Can‚Äôt bring anything with alcohol like perfume and mouth wash. The facility runs pretty cold so bring warm clothes. They hold your razors/ sharpes, suntan lotion and phones plus anything on their list where the techs are located. No phone unless you have a business it‚Äôs a set 2 hours that you pay for. It‚Äôs from 3-5 or 6-8. The food is okay but remains the same except for the specials. Smoking and vaping is allowed outside in certain areas but sometimes done in no smoking areas. Music is outside but controlled by the techs. The massage chairs are nice but there are only 2 that work out of four. People are late to meetings and constantly go in and out plus hardly ever on time. Activities are often canceled. They just hired a person to run activities. Hopefully things will get better. Overall the residents are welcoming, supportive and caring. If you have a positive attitude and want to learn it will be fun and you won‚Äôt want to leave. PHP is a step forward to getting on the right track and re emerge into society. Do the work and you will benefit. This was my first rehab. It was very clean and classes where good. If you want to learn you will. Go in with a positive attitude and you will do great.

Beachside is a wonderful environment that truly cares about your goals and needs. If you're in need of inpatient therapy I would highly suggest Beachside. At first I really did not want to come but I met many lifelong friends and really discovered myself. The building is clean and well cared for. The staff is lovely, and will accommodate you best they can. The pool, gym, and other amenities are very nice and well kept. I highly recommend anyone who needs a little or a lot of mental health help to choose beachside. The community is overwhelmingly welcoming, after my 30 days I was incredibly sad to leave and it's almost hard to understand I unfortunately won't be back. Beachside is the right choice if you're looking to do it right, I would do it 100 times over again if I could.

I had such a great experience!
I was not at all interested in coming to treatment initially but it didn‚Äôt take me long to feel welcomed and excited to be at Beachside. My therapist, Sarah, was absolutely fantastic and if I could keep her in my pocket I would.
Seeing Jerry at the nurse‚Äôs window was always a highlight of my days.
Ellis and T are also wonderful (thank you Ellis for the coffee!).
Thank you Beachside for the wonderful experience and for equipping me with the tools I needed!

Having never gone to a Rehab facility I wasn't sure what to expect.
The staff was friendly, the therapist great and the clinical crew were awesome.   The environment is clean and the food is good.  I feel the 30 day program was a good fit for me.

My 30-day stay at Beachside Rehab was a life-changing experience, and I can confidently say I couldn't have chosen a better place for my recovery journey. The sense of community here is truly special; it became everything to me during my time there and made life long friends.
I'm incredibly grateful for the support and care I received from the staff. A special thank you to Tyler and Mela, the techs, who were always there with a helping hand and a kind word. Molly and Diana my therapists, provided invaluable guidance and understanding, helping me navigate my challenges with empathy and expertise.
Christian kept us busy with off site activities. Everything from the beach to horse therapy.
Kristine, the alumni coordinator, has been amazing with helping me transition back to the real world. The entire team at Beachside Rehab is top-notch, and I highly recommend their program to anyone seeking a path to recovery.

My experience at Beachway was a 100/10. The life skills I learned are priceless and that‚Äôs putting it lightly. Beachway was the third treatment center I had been to, following the sudden loss of a loved one. I had prior sobriety before beachway and was convinced that I was only there because of a death, and that that was why I was spiraling. The staff at Beachway saw I needed much more help than that. They all knew before I did that if that death didn‚Äôt happen, I probably wouldn‚Äôt have stayed sober anyway. There was still much more therapy to be done, and more to learn.
The staff took a genuine care in doing so, and looking back at their clinical process they are nothing short of a power house of a team. I never felt so cared for as a human being by people that just met me. The staff quickly became my family, cheering me on while also taking it extremely serious. They are unapologetically honest, which in my experience is the #1 thing needed in recovery. Many of the things they said to me during my time there still stick with me (a year later) and help me navigate life!
I tell anyone that has a loved one with Substance abuse or mental health issues about beachway.
There is no other place like itü§ç

Making the decision to go to Beachway was, by far, the most positive and impactful experience of my life. The entire staff was incredible, as was the community as a whole. I felt safe, seen, and supported throughout my stay, and even now, as I continue my healing journey at home. I was completely set up for success in my healing journey thanks to Beachway, and I will forever be grateful.

Spending 91 days in treatment is no small journey. But I can confidently say that my time at Beachway changed my life and saved my life. From the very first day, I was met with genuine kindness, compassion, and a level of care that felt deeply personal. The staff, Therapist and Trauma team approached my healing with a holistic perspective. The entire team at Beachway, from the maintenance, kitchen, housekeeping, therapy team all bring a clear passion for what they do. This is not a one-size-fits-all approach. The care I received was individual, thoughtful and always grounded me with respect and empathy. After leaving Beachway, I have a new definition of bliss. The tools, insight, and renewed sense of hope that I did not think was possible. I am incredibly grateful for Beachway and being part of my healing journey.

I went to Beachway in the beginning of 2024 because I was dealing with terrible anxiety and panic attacks and their website looked so promising. I loved that it emphasized a holistic approach since I've tried so many medications and none of them worked, just gave me side effects or worsened my symptoms. I had a very high deductible of $20,000 and I was told that would be the only expense that I would receive. However, I got billed later on for labs for $1,400 and also a bill from them for staying in their intensive outpatient housing. When I tried to call to ask them about this because they were basic labs and shouldn't be that expensive, they won't answer the phone or call back. But they sure will answer right away if you're seeking help. Also, when I got to Beachway they had me talk to doctors who prescribed me medications. I really didn't want to take them given my history but I was desperate. The medications didn't help and once I got home I stopped taking them.

I will say that their facility is beautiful and the food is amazing. I did love the therapists but it's not very personalized. It's about a 30-45 minute individual session once a week. It's a lot of group classes that start to get very repetitive the longer you're there for. The trauma program was the most helpful thing and I am really glad that I did that.

Overall, I don't feel like it was worth the money that I spent FOR ME. I wish I would've found a good therapist near me and done more holistic approaches on my own. However, If you or a loved one is going there for drugs/alcohol/even certain mental health situations, I can definitely say it's worth the money. You can't put a price on saving a life.

I just wish they would have been more upfront about how expensive it was going to be and hidden expenses. And the fact that they don't answer the phone about billing questions or call you back just makes it seem like they're greedy.

I owe Beachway my life for sure. I won‚Äôt lie and say that I loved every minute of it because I didn‚Äôt. A lot of it was very painful, because confronting inner demons is painful. It was a lot of group therapy (especially given how afraid of people I was going in), but they truly helped me gain sobriety and face down my trauma. And they put up with a lot of my crazy behavior while I was going through withdrawals in detox. Like any rehab, you‚Äôll get out of it what you put into it. Surrender to the process for best results. Rehab isn‚Äôt a magic wand that makes problems vanish. Rehab gave me the opportunity to accept the ways in which I cause my own suffering instead of blaming everyone around me, while surrounded by professionals who prevented me from hurting myself while my dried out, and helped me identify the underlying causes of my addiction. It will be tough. It will be scary. It will be worth it. I wish I‚Äôd gone sooner. The staff there are wonderful and don‚Äôt get enough credit. Thank you Beachway.

As a woman in her 50's, I've had my fair share of many trials and traumas. I've tried traditional therapy to help ease the anxieties, fears, and stresses that they caused. I was searching for more ways to help and Equine Therapy was suggested.  I didn't know what to expect coming to Beachwood Center for Wellbeing, but it turned out to be much more than I could have ever imagined.  It was truly transformational !!!  I strongly feel that it wasn't happenstance; MY 'chosen' horse and therapist were beyond a perfect match for me. Thank-you for all the time and sacrifices that you put into helping others in such an amazing way.  I am forever grateful for this life changing experience!‚ù§Ô∏è

I finally have piece of mind thanks to Dr. Desantis. After many years of evaluations for my daughter, we finally received a diagnosis that makes sense. Dr. Desantis took the time to listen to me and my daughter‚Äôs teacher since  we are the ones that are with her the most and know her best. I never felt heard before when it came to my daughter being diagnosed. Now everything makes sense and I am so grateful that my daughter will now receive the proper care and treatment that she deserves. Thank you.

Dr. Britney Cannon is amazing!! She has been working with my kids for 2 years. We got in with this practice quickly after being referred. Appointments are flexible and we have been seen at both locations as needed. I even love speaking with Midnight Hall in billing. She is so personable and responsive.

Dr. Cannon taught my kids different ways to think about things and really reached them on their level. After our move to FL from VA (2022) my son was acting out in school so badly we had to place him in virtual school. Dr. Cannon saved him and my sanity!! Dr. Cannon knew exactly when my son was ready to go back to school. She went the extra mile participating in his transition IEP meeting and provided invaluable information and advice for the school administration. My son returned to school 1/8/24 after being home for 1 year and 4 months. He has not had any problems since returning. I can‚Äôt speak highly enough about Beacon Pediatric. A true blessing to my family.

Beacon has been amazing for our family. We switched to this practice when we were unhappy with another therapist at a different practice for our daughter. We knew it was the right fit as soon as we met Dr. Cannon. She tested our daughter and discovered she has ADHD. Dr. Cannon has helped her with Executive functioning challenges so much! She also started seeing our pre teen son. She has dramatically changed our family atmosphere and approach. We are so thankful and highly recommend!
The step by step process was easy to follow to get an appointment. Dr Cannon was wonderful. She was easy to talk to, professional, knowledgeable and my son loved working with her. Highly recommend.

We have tried multiple times to get our son in with this company. We've tried phone calls with voice messages left, but never a reply back. We did receive ONE email and got the insurance switched over to them, but once again never got another reply nor an appointment. We've been at this for over a month. I don't know how they keep lights on if they can't even get patients in. Don't waste your time, go somewhere else!!

What a wonderful team! Mrs.Beckman was able to give our one month old exercises to strengthen her mouth and latch. She was kind and very informative. She's done her own world renowned research as well! Orlando is lucky to have her üòä

We were referred to this wonderful team in 2023 for my daughter, and our experience was fantastic! We were taught effective exercises to help our newborn with nursing by strengthening her lip, cheek, and tongue, and we saw significant improvements in a matter of weeks.

We were referred to Debra Beckman after our newborn was not transferring milk well during breastfeeding. We were exhausted and stressed and Ms. Beckman greeted us with positivity and empathy and assured us our baby would improve in no time.

She performed a thorough muscular exam and showed us easy and effective exercises to do with our little one. She even showed us a side lying bottle feeding technique as well as a better way to burp our baby. She allowed us to film all the exercises and answered all of our questions.

After practicing the motor exercises for a few days our baby was noticeably eating better. She quickly began sleeping longer stretches through the night I assume due to her ability to take in more calories during the day. She is growing well and doing so much better thanks to Ms. Beckman.

We are so grateful and happy with Debra Beckman‚Äôs expertise and help. We highly recommend seeing her! It‚Äôs never too early to see a speech pathologist especially one as amazing as Ms. Beckman!

Highly recommend Ms Beckman! Very knowledge kind and will help you holistically without need for interventions unless absolutely necessary. Lactation Consultant told me that my baby needed abbreviation I went to Beckham. I did the exercises and to this day. My baby is extremely normal and perfect.

My husband and I recently got a 9 month old black Labrador pup and she is so amazing but was a little timid and lacked confidence. So my husband did some research and found The Bed N Barkfest for training. We signed Remi up and she completed her two weeks of training and did great! We got picture and video updates everyday, instructional videos for us to use the training at home and a packet with everything we needed to know. Heather and Abby took Remi on field trips to ensure that Remi was able to complete all the commands in different environments and face stressors with confidence, and when she wasn‚Äôt in training she got to socialize and play with all the other pups there. Remi did great and enjoyed going everyday! She is now a more confident pup and listens so well, we have learned a lot also and will continue her training at home! We are so glad we did it!

We brought our 3 year old pit mix for play n train with Heather, and it was amazing! He already knew basic commands but needed improvement with listening on the first command, walking on a leash without pulling, socialization, not jumping on people when he greets them, etc. At play n train he had the opportunity to interact with other dogs and do training throughout the day + go on field trips to get comfortable in dog friendly stores. One of my favorite parts of the program was that everyday I received pictures and training videos to see his progress! It‚Äôs been two weeks and we‚Äôve already seen so much improvement. After the ‚Äútraining handover‚Äù now I know the best approach and commands too. We all learned so much and now I look forward to using Bed N‚Äô Barkfest for doggy daycare, boarding, and grooming!

We've been using Bed N Barkfest for our boston terrier puppy, Lola, since she was a little over 3 months old and we are SO HAPPY with Heather and all of the staff. Lola loves getting dropped off at daycare, smothers everyone with love, plays hard all day, and comes home a very tired and happy puppy. The interaction with so many dogs from a young age has made her great with all kinds of dogs. The photos we get totally make our day, too! We'll be using Heather for more training with Lola really soon and she will have an overnight stay in the near future. We trust them, love the ease of pick-up/drop-off, and feel like Lola is in wonderful hands when she can't be with us.

The whole process was easy from start to finish. Ms. Gil made my son feel comfortable, and she explained everything to us without using a bunch of confusing terms. I‚Äôd absolutely recommend her to other parents.

Ms. Gil was super kind and made my daughter feel really comfortable. She explained everything clearly and helped us understand what was going on. We‚Äôve already started using her suggestions and they‚Äôre working!

LoAn at Beeyond Play has helped our son tremendously, I cannot recommend her enough!  As a fellow clinician (Physical Therapist) i needed guidance and direction to help my son with behavior/sensory issues, that is out of my realm. My son was treated in her clinic as well as at his school and it made a world of a difference.  He looked forward to therapy days and had so much fun with the therapy play. I have had the best experience at the Eau Gallie location. My son has been going there for years. The RBT‚Äôs and BCBA‚Äôs always go above and beyond for my child. My son is 4 1/2 years old and has been with behavior basics since he was 2. We were able to recognize and see the need for early diagnosis and treatment which I won‚Äôt lie, at first felt daunting and overwhelming but somehow God put us right where we needed to be. From the moment I stepped into Behavior Basics, I felt supported, listened to and have always taken comfort in knowing that each day my son is there, he is safe and cared for. For those of you that also have a child on the spectrum any level, trusting someone else with your child is difficult as safety is a huge priority because they do not always understand basic things to keep themselves safe from harm. (Situational awareness, wandering off, etc) I was able to feel confident that he was safe when I dropped him off and when he was receiving therapy with his RBT. I also feel blessed that since day one, I have been able to actively take part in my sons plan of care, learning how to mimic the goals set and am able to continue to teach my son even at home. This was so important to me. I needed help and guidance on how to manage and work through some of the challenges that we‚Äôve faced throughout my son‚Äôs life and I have always had that help from my BCBA and RBT‚Äôs. The staff has been so supportive and has been helpful every step of the way and we have seen so many positive changes! We feel so thankful and blessed to be a part of a wonderful facility that truly cares for their clients and their families who were probably like me in the beginning, felt lost and in need of guidance and help. I can now give my son the most opportunities for growth, learning, love and happiness! We wouldn‚Äôt be where we are today without our team at Behavior Basic‚Äôs! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!

On February 2, 2024, I visited the Brevard office in Eau Galle to gather information and potentially enroll my son, who has been diagnosed with ADHD and autism, for therapy. I chose this therapist because they collaborate with my son's new school, and I believe he could benefit from their services. They informed me that they needed to confirm if they could accept my insurance and if they had availability to accommodate my son. Despite making numerous follow-up calls, we struggled to get updates as the responsible person was often unavailable, and our calls were rarely returned. When we did manage to connect, the information provided was insufficient, or excuses were given. I had to visit the office multiple times to push for progress or seek an update. It took them four months to finally inform us that they were unable to accept our medical insurance due to billing setup issues and that they did not have space available to treat my son as they were at full capacity. The communication and handling of this matter were unprofessional. I could have utilized the time to find an alternative provider, but unfortunately, options are limited in this county.

Our experience receiving therapy from this company has been top notch!  Owners, staff and therapists are the best at their craft!  Not only are they there for our children but, are always available to assist us parents with whatever help we need.  As the parent of a child on the Autism spectrum, I have experienced highs and extreme lows.  There is an overwhelming feeling of constant uncertainty on this journey.  However, with the right support, life can be much easier on the entire family unit.  Behavioral Initiatives, LLC has become more than just a local business for us, we consider them family.  I have never felt more comfortable around another group of professionals as I feel with them and having my child being left in their care.  I can honestly say that without the therapy they have provided for my girl, we may have been quite distraught at this stage of her life.  She had made great strides!  When she started she was completely non verbal.  Now,  she is minimally verbal, knows some sign language and uses a speech device to help her communicate what she cannot say yet.  They even helped her with potty training,  which I felt was virtually impossible!  This was accomplished with the help of this awesome team!  Her maladaptive behaviors have decreased significantly, especially meltdowns, crying, frustrations and escaping.   This is something to celebrate!  The parent trainings they provide teach us parents and caregivers how to properly approach our children in different difficult situations.  It helps us to manage stress well and effectively  de-escalate our children.  Ultimately, harmony can eventually be restored in the home.  I don't know where we would be without Behavioral Initiatives, LLC.  I would 100% recommend their services to any family that has a child with Autism or related disabilities.  Our family is ever so grateful!  We appreciate you Behavioral Initiatives, LLC!  #ABAworks

Thank you Behavioral Initiatives staff for the wonderful years of love, development and growth you have brought to Luis‚Äô life. Behavioral Foundation Centers is a truly inspiring part of the Volusia County community. Even though I‚Äôm not a parent of a child receiving services, I have witnessed the genuine care and dedication this team brings to supporting children with developmental disabilities.
Their personalized ABA programs empower children to grow, gain confidence, and reach important milestones. It‚Äôs clear that everyone at the center is deeply committed to making a real difference in these families‚Äô lives.

This is a different understanding of a unique world of my child. We did not have the understanding nor answers on how to start. My mom told me about ABA therapy and I reached out. Started this therapy at home and the sessions were emotional. It was tough but I need my child to understand how to use their behaviors and emotions in the correct way. After in home therapy, my child went to the center. With no to one word. Now my child uses words to explain how they feel etc. it's night and day in a good way. 2 year update!!!!!

My son went there from 2020 -part of 2021. I do NOT recommend this facility. The staff is quick to send your kids to a "group home" or mental institution.
