First timer here üëãüèæ. My friend and I were nervous about getting on the horses. Our instructor Emily was excellent at making us feel comfortable with the horses. Beautiful views, over all I definitely recommend.

Very well organized and thoughtful clinic with helpful and pleasant staff. Very easy to make an appointment with reasonable prices. We brought in a mom and baby cat to be spayed and neutered. Got there a tad early with forms in hand and was out in 15 minutes. We returned around 4:30 for pickup and got our babies back by 5 pm. We had a onesie for the mom and a neck collar for the baby to ensure they didn't try overly licking their stitches. It's been 5 days since surgery. The clinic called to check on the patients. I'm happy to report both mom and baby are covering just fine. Would highly recommend the folks over at this clinic.

The prices are unbeatable, & I have yet to experience a *major* issue with my animals here. But the organization & wait times with this place are out of control. Liz used to have this place operating well but it's been worse & worse since she left. Steve is the only one here who seems reliable.
When the surgeries are done I used to get a call to come pick up the dog. Whether 1130am, 2pm, 4pm, whatever. They would integrate pickups thruout the day. Today I received no call. They just always say to be here by 5 when they close. So I got here at 5 and the waiting room was slammed full. Appears that no one got a call today & they planned to have all pickups at once......
I've worked a low cost clinic before & we could do surgery pickups staggered at the end of day & have everyone checked out in 45 mins. But this clinic cant handle that kind of efficiency. I'm sitting here writing this review at 630pm still waiting to check out my dogs in a room full of people!! I was "on the checkout list" 1.5hrs ago. They have a sign stating that first come isn't the procedure here & please be patient as checkin/out can take up to an hour. Well today I waited 2 hours to get my 2 dogs & I'm not gonna be coming back to do this ever again. The current staff are completely unorganized. They sat there checking out 20 feral cats 1 by 1 to the regular rescue people that do daily dropoffs, while ignoring every other patron for an hour. A single ounce of organization would tell you that the regular dropoffs should have their own pickup time at the end. AND that anybody "on the checkout list" should not be sitting in your lobby 2 hours waiting as every other animal goes home and I sit there in front of your face being ignored. The woman who does checkins & checkouts refuses to make eye contact like she's scared of conflict. She sent another girl out to get me from my car when they were finally ready to check out my dogs. She doesn't have what it takes to run this high pressure position at the front of a fast paced clinic. They're not gonna be able to handle the masses they try & book until they find another Liz.
On the topic of quality of care?.... I have gotten what I expected from a low cost clinic. Some questionable neuter procedures, a heartworm positive dog once that nobody bothered to call & let me know was positive before pickup.... but luckily I've avoided any major issues. While sitting in the lobby for 2hrs waiting to checkout today I heard the receptionist tell somebody that her dog ACCIDENTALLY GOT MICROCHIPPED BECAUSE THE TECHNICIAN GRABBED THE WRONG PAPERWORK! Other ladies in the room started chatting very concerned about "what else did they mess up back there?!" And it's just really sad to know that these things happen way more often than the reviews may tell you. I've gotten dogs home before who didn't receive the vaccines I paid for. Simple "mistakes" but it's not okay to be happening so often in a medically professional environment... Honestly the neuters I paid for today were pretty concerning! The lady who brought my dogs out to me told me 1 was pretty swollen & the other was "even more swollen... you definitely need to ice him"
ICE HIM?! I
've never in 12 years of animal work heard anyone advise to ice the incision on a dog. That advice was really concerning as to their staff training & honestly the last straw for me. Nobody there seems to understand how a simple neuter works & it's truly baffling to me how many things they can manage to screw up on a simple simple procedure.

My buddy Franklin was neutered today. Opened the doors happily and early before 8am. The entire staff was informative, friendly and overall amazing. The scheduling process and day of texts were top tier. The location was easy to find and the office super clean and well organized. Thank you for all you do Brevard Spay and Neuter. I appreciate you.

As a dog trainer, I refer all my clients to this place for their spay and neuter and teeth cleaning. They‚Äôll even look at your dog if you ask him to for other things while they‚Äôre under anesthesia. Like a lump or a spot that you‚Äôre concerned about. Highly recommend!

I'm not going anywhere else unless their closed and need help now for non-emergency.
You walk in and the two behind the counter are very knowledgeable,  polite, loving, compassionate and very well organized.
The Vets are the same and really care for not just ur pet but for you and ur concerns.
Not only that but the price is unbeatable AND they sometimes give you a break even on that.
10 star minimum in my opinion.
Thanks to all the staff and Doctor's.  God bless you all always...Dan and Tawnya
Very caring and knowledgeable doctor. He treats you with compassion and makes you feel comfortable. So glad he was available to help my family member.

MJ is simply amazing!
I came to MJ with horrible pain in my shoulder that was affecting my everyday life. From the first session, she listened carefully, explained what was going on in a way I could understand, and built a treatment plan that actually worked. She‚Äôs incredibly knowledgeable, but also kind and encouraging ‚Äî she made every visit feel safe and motivating.
Thanks to MJ, my pain is gone and I feel stronger and more confident using my shoulder again. She truly cares about her patients and goes above and beyond to help.
If you‚Äôre dealing with pain and need someone who knows her stuff and cares deeply about getting you better, MJ is the one. She rocks! üí™üî•

I‚Äôve been going to this place for PT after my knee surgery and I genuinely love it. The energy is great, everyone is in a good mood, and it makes the whole process feel lighter. The therapists know what they‚Äôre doing and I‚Äôve seen real progress in a short time. They were also super kind and patient when it came to dealing with my insurance, which I know isn‚Äôt easy. You can tell they actually want to help. üíõ

I tore my ACL and this place helped me get my full range of motion back. KP is great, she really cares about her patients and works with you to help heal you. Would highly recommend doing physical therapy here with KP.

This place is mostly fine, though be aware that they will keep booking appointments past your script if you don‚Äôt keep track of it.
The physical therapists have around 5-6 patients at a time and most of the work is done by trainees and college students. Some therapists pay a lot of attention, others basically avoid you, so be prepared for a mixed bag experience

I can‚Äôt say enough good things. KP has been amazing as a therapist for more than one orthopedic problem I‚Äôve unfortunately had. She not only is a fantastic therapist with an amazing amount of knowledge and skill but she keeps me comfortable in what can be awkward circumstances! Time is my most valuable asset and they are always ready. When I have had a schedule conflict the other therapists have also been excellent. Highly recommend!

Bridge Physical Therapy and Performance is an outstanding facility with an amazing team led by Dr. Alec Hyde, Dr. Victor Garcia, and Dr. Alex Decker, who are not only highly skilled but also compassionate and passionate about what they do. Their expertise in physical therapy, pitching and strength and conditioning programs are un matched, providing athletes with a complete performance edge. What truly sets them apart is their dedication to making sure every athlete feels cared for, supported, and equipped to succeed both in recovery and in performance. You can tell the entire staff genuinely loves their work, and it shows in the exceptional care and results they deliver.

We couldn‚Äôt be happier with our experience at Bridge. Our son has completed 10 pitching classes along with strength and conditioning sessions, and the progress has been remarkable. It‚Äôs clear that the training is paying off ‚Äî his technique has noticeably improved and continues to get better each week.

Bridge is incredibly professional, with a fantastic team of experts who work closely with him to refine every aspect of his performance. What really stands out is how engaged our son is ‚Äî he genuinely looks forward to every session and always shares his practice videos with his pitching coach to get further feedback. That ongoing support and commitment make a huge difference.

We‚Äôre extremely happy with the results and the overall experience. We highly recommend Bridge to anyone looking for top-tier baseball training for their child.

We‚Äôve had such a wonderful experience at Bridge Physical Therapy. From day one, the staff has been nothing but kind, caring, and incredibly helpful with our son. They‚Äôve made him feel so comfortable that he actually asks when he gets to go back!

He recently told his therapist how much he loves coming and didn‚Äôt want to leave when the session was over‚Äîhe says it‚Äôs a fun place! For a kid in elementary school to feel that way about physical therapy says a lot. We‚Äôre so grateful for the care and encouragement they‚Äôve given him. Highly recommend!

Bridge PTP is amazing! Decker is a top-notch trainer who knows how to get results while keeping workouts fun and motivating. The gym is clean, well-equipped, and the community is awesome. Highly recommend!

Our son isn't primarily a pitcher, but working with this coaching staff has made a huge difference in his overall performance. The training has significantly improved his strength, accuracy, and throwing mechanics. The attention to detail and personalized coaching have been incredibly valuable. Highly recommend ‚Äî amazing staff, great environment, and truly dedicated to helping athletes improve.

We have seen such a difference in our son since he began with Cara Bridge two years ago. He reads with confidence and clarity, even volunteering to read in class and during assemblies. The entire staff at Bridge Speech Therapy are kind, competent, and committed to seeing every student succeed. We are grateful to have found them!

We love working with Mrs. Kiersten!  Our son looks forward to his time with her each week!  She quickly established a fun-filled environment along with intentional and well thought out lesson plans for him during their time together.  We are thankful to have found Bridgespeech and Mrs. Kiersten!

We have had a wonderful experience at Bridge Therapy for language and literacy based services.  The scheduling was easy and the evaluation was very thorough.  My child loved working with the therapist. He made excellent progress and gained confidence in the areas he was struggling.   The therapist regularly went above and beyond to support and communicate with us and provide helpful tools to use at home and at school. I would highly recommend.

Bridge Speech Therapy has been a lighthouse in the storm for our family. At a time when we were struggling to find answers for our daughter's learning journey, one conversation with Cara Bridge gave us hope and encouragement. We are now almost 2 years into working with her and our daughter is excited to read and is a confident reader for the first time ever. The magic Cara Bridge has created working with our daughter is exceptional. Words cant describe our thanks for all of her help.

Cara Bridge is knowledgeable, competent, organized, experienced, and professional. She is also really a pleasure to work with, which is worth so much when you are going through hard times. She was a great resource for us in so many ways, but her advanced training in a wide variety of methods of treating all the different issues in Speech Pathology such as receptive/expressive language disorders and dyslexia was the main reason we sought her out. After trying several different speech therapists and making little to no progress, we decided to make the drive an hour or more each way to see Cara. We did this for a little over a year and it was worth it. We have had significant progress since starting with her.  We are still on the journey, but therapy with Cara got us ahead leaps and bounds and now we know we are on the right track. Her speech evaluations were much more comprehensive and detailed than I found elsewhere as well.

I also would recommend from our experience at Bridge the other speech therapists that work with her, both Kristies are just as competent and professional.

Thank you Bridge Therapy! We will miss you all!!

We are so grateful for the amazing progress our son has made with Samantha and the Bridge Therapy team. He has been working with them for the past 2 years for Apraxia. Samantha and the team of therapists are all patient, kind, and engaging. They truly care about the progress of my son and provide helpful feedback each week. Samantha has so much knowledge in the field and her passion for helping children is very evident through her work. Our son loves his sessions and always looks forward to going. Couldn‚Äôt recommend more!

My son has been attending Bridge Therapy for a little over a year now. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this establishment and the beautiful people that work here. We have had the most amazing experience working with Rebecca and other speech therapists here. I am thrilled with the progress my son has made in such a short amount of time! His teachers and family members  have all noticed a huge difference in his speech and a boost in his confidence with everyday conversation and in reading. After every session I get a report on what they worked on together and how his progress was for that day. I highly recommend Bridge Therapy!

We are so grateful for everything Samantha and the Bridge Therapy team have done for our son! Rebecca has been so kind and patient week after week, and our son looks forward to each session. He‚Äôs eager to practice what he‚Äôs learned, and we‚Äôve been given tools to help him succeed, thanks to the knowledgeable and dedicated team. We‚Äôre delighted at the progress he‚Äôs made over the last two years and highly recommend Bridge Therapy to anyone seeking skilled speech-language pathologists who put their hearts and souls into helping their clients.

The therapists at Bridge Therapy are fantastic ‚Äî caring, dedicated, and truly invested in the progress of the people they work with. The quality of therapy is excellent, and the team goes above and beyond to provide the best support. Highly recommend!

We have been with Bridge Therapy for well over a year now and I‚Äôm amazed at the progress my son has made! The team of therapist have all been incredible to work with and have been so kind and wonderful. I can never thank them enough for helping my child find his voice and for the guidance they provided me as a parent to help us navigate apraxia of speech. Sam is so hands on and attentive to every family in her practice, she makes you feel so at home. She is incredibly knowledgeable and supportive. Our therapists Becca and Maggie have been an invaluable part of our journey and I could not ask for better therapist! I‚Äôm forever grateful I found this practice and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking speech therapy services.

Our dearest Maggie took care of our daughter back in 2023. When she was recently diagnosed with speech delay I was so lost and figuring it all out was so overwhelming. Thankfully Mrs Maggie was nothing but excellent with my daughter. My daughter  got very comfortable with her they developed a really beautiful relationship and I could see lots of progress within weeks of her receiving therapy. Mrs Maggie always was available to answer any of my questions and gave me very thorough information about every session she had with my daughter. I would wholeheartedly recommend her for any speech needs.

My daughter has been going to Bridge Therapy for over a year so far, and we are SO pleased with everything! From their friendly faces, to their researched techniques, to the progress and improvements my daughter has made in her speech! I am so thankful we found Bridge Therapy to help with my daughter‚Äôs Childhood Apraxia of Speech. Their knowledge is immeasurable and the support they provide cannot be compared! My daughter loves going there, loves that she gets to ‚Äúplay‚Äù so much while there and really enjoys that she learns and people can understand her more and more each session!

Our family is so thankful for Sam, Maggie and her entire team! Maggie is so dedicated to each child she helps and we could not be more thankful!!!
Not only have they helped our daughters speech, they have created a support system with their team, and helped us reach out and find resources and other groups and families that are also in the same situation as us and can relate!

Our family absolutely LOVES Bridge Therapy!! They have created this amazing community and support systems through their therapy! They are family oriented and help us learn how to help our children!! Sam and Maggie are always reaching out with events and support groups that can help benefit us as parents or our children with speech disabilities! The progress my child has made, is UNBELIEVABLE!! Without them, I have no idea where we would be or how my child‚Äôs speech would be.
When we started 1.5 years ago with Bridge, my biggest goal was for my child to be intelligible and understood for kindergarten. They made that happen, and so much more. She is now in kindergarten and is confident in herself and her speech, and has not had communication issues thanks to Bridge Therapy and all the hard work they have poured into my child.
The best thing I have ever done for my child, is put her in Bridge Therapy and trust in their process!! Their knowledge, skills, and kindness go far beyond any therapy office we have been to before!
I would highly highly recommend Bridge Therapy to anyone and everyone who has any concerns about their child, no matter how small!!

I cannot express enough gratitude for the incredible support my son has received at Bridge Therapy! My son has been working with Maggie since 2021 for apraxia of speech. He has made significant progress with Maggie‚Äôs help! She is very knowledgeable, empathetic, patient, and kind! My son is also on the autism spectrum and Maggie has always taken the time to understand his unique needs and has always tailored her strategies and activities to his learning style and interests. Maggie has truly made a difference in my son‚Äôs apraxia journey!

The support and guidance I receive as a parent from Bridge Therapy are invaluable. Maggie has equipped me with the tools and strategies I need to reinforce what my son is learning in therapy, which has allowed me to help my son at home between sessions.  I have learned so much from Maggie!

I wholeheartedly recommend Bridge Therapy and Maggie to any parent seeking speech therapy for their child! Their dedication, expertise, and kindness are unmatched! I am so thankful for Sam, Maggie, and their entire team! They have made such a positive impact on my son‚Äôs life!

Maggie is a loving & caring individual on top of being an excellent speech therapist, she worked with my son who has an Apraxia of speech diagnosis for a couple of years, theres no better option than choosing bridge therapy for specialized care.

My grandson has been supported by Bridges for over 3 years.  I have to clarify that it‚Äôs actually our whole family that has received the support.  The Bridges team is knowledgeable, highly professional, and, most of all, caring to the child and the family. My grandson has progressed from a nonverbal 3 year old to a talkative, smart, happy KG student beginning to mainstream into general education classes.  As a teacher, I tried many things with my grandson without success.  It was the expertise of the therapists that opened the door to his voice and his learning.  We have worked with 5 Bridges therapists and have been completely satisfied.  I highly recommend their services.

We have been with Bridges for some time now and they have become a part of our family. The therapists are kind, thoughtful and patient and the staff is knowledgeable and giving in helping us navigate this journey. We are very thankful and fortunate to have them. They will always be a recommend for us.

I can't say enough good things about BBT. From the moment I contacted them, I was met with warmth and professionalism. Their team is truly outstanding.

Their team is highly skilled, empathetic, and tailored the sessions to my specific needs. They create a safe and nurturing environment.

They consider every aspect of a person's well-being, which results in effective sessions.

BBT has been providing amazing and personalized therapy to my son for years. I have built such a close personal and professional relationship with the owner and our RBT. It has been nothing but a pleasure knowing we have such caring and knowledgeable people helping to make a difference in our lives. Highly recommend!

I'm very disappointed. Bridges Behavioral Therapy came out for an evaluation. They missed the first appointment as they "got lost". They came back out, did the evaluation, and were never heard from again. After a whole month passed, I called and left a message as no one answered. No return call. Never heard back. Do better!

provider_name: Bridges Behavioral Wellness/Psychology Group of Tampa Bay
review_text: Dr. Ginns is amazing! I highly recommend!

My son has been receiving speech and OT services for over a year and we have been thrilled with every aspect of the clinic. He's had the same SLP and OT since he started and they have an amazing relationship with him. The owner, Ashley, works really hard to make billing and insurance as easy as possible. She cares about helping families and it's been very apparent compared to other centers we have used.

This center is Wonderful! My son has gone there for years for OT, and I cannot say enough good things about this place. The therapists are wonderful, the office staff is great. My son has advanced so much while in therapy here, they truly care about their patients!

Such a wonderful place my child has been and is still receiving the up most therapy and support from this establishment. The team here is immaculate. They take time with my child. My child has progressed tremendously with all of his therapy. My child loves the staff, and I love the staff as a parent. It has truly been a blessing to have found this establishment.

The place to go!

My son has been lucky to work with Ashley over the past 3 years. She is always prepared, engaging, organized, and fun! We are thrilled to see her running Bridging the Pieces, and seeing the excellent staff and interns who gravitate to her office.  And most recently, her online Zoom sessions with my 10 year old have been terrific!

My daughter started seeing Ashley to receive speech therapy 5 months ago. She is developmentally delayed and has sensory processing disorder.  My child started therapy kicking and screaming.  Ashley is confident and took on the challenge with patience and grace. By the third session, my daughter was willingly running into Ashley's arms. The changes in her speech and behavior have well exceeded our expectations.  She is like a different child. Ashley has helped give our child the confidence to participate more socially and communicate more effectively. She has been the biggest blessing and we can't thank her enough for changing our lives.

Mrs. Ueda is the best of the best in South Florida. She goes above and beyond‚Ä¶our child LOVES her and looks forward to every session. We are forever grateful we found her and for the genuine love and help she provides our family! Highly recommend!!!

Amazing professionals, I highly recommend them!
Ueda is very nice, sweet, patient, and very professional! I'm glad to find professionals like them!
Ueda is kind and caring. Highly recommend!
Very attentive, i see improvement. Thank you so much

I am truly grateful to Bright Kids Behavior Inc.
for the professionalism and dedication of their entire team. From day one, I felt supported and heard. The therapists are patient, well-trained, and show a genuine commitment to the progress of the children and the support of their families.
Communication with the supervisors is clear and consistent; they are always available to answer questions and adjust the treatment plans according to individual needs. The intervention programs are well-structured and evidence-based, which gives us great confidence.
I 100% recommend Bright Kids Behavior Inc. to any parent looking for a committed, caring, and professional team in the ABA field. ‚ù§Ô∏è

So happy and grateful that more kids may have the opportunity of services, specially with the team and owners that I know are compromised with the kids and family. My daughter is actually receiving services and I so happy with her progress, RBT, BCBA, the administration personal in the back. God bless this place and thank you for the great job to our Special needs children.

I visited Bright Kid Behavior and was very satisfied with the service. From the moment I arrived, the staff greeted me with kindness and professionalism, making me feel comfortable at all times.
The place was spotless: very clean, tidy, and with a hygienic environment that inspires confidence.
Without a doubt, it's a place that cares about its customers and maintaining a safe and pleasant space.
I highly recommend it!

Bright Star is an amazing place!   All the staff members are excellent!   They are friendly and very professional.   They are very caring and compassionate in caring for all the children.  My daughter took her baby there and simply love them all.   Atlas receives physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy.   Thank you so very much Bright Start for taking such great care of my precious grandson, Atlas.   You are all a true blessing to us all.  We love you!!!

My son was cared for by the nurses and staff at BrightStart for 6 years and everyday was a blessing. He received occupational therapy, physical therapy, and speech therapy at BrightStart, five days a week, and I never had to question if he was getting the best care. They always went above and beyond to offer support and encouragement throughout the years and really were like our second family. I am so grateful for each and every person that played such pivotal roles in my son's development and would highly recommend BrightStart Pediactrics to anyone.

BrightStart has been caring for my medically fragile child for over 2 years now and I could not be any more happy! Putting your trust into some to care for your child can be hard but when your child has special needs it's extremely difficult! The staff is always compassionate and caring! The center is also very clean and organized. We love our family at BrightStart!

Bright Start Pediatrics was a game changer for my family.  Having this "daycare" available for my medically fragile child filled his life with more love than I could of ever imagined. We, as a family, made life long friends and family at Bright Start.  My son was cared for by nurses medically but they were also cared for by the same nurses motherly! I never had trouble getting my son to go to "school."
Bright Start was always there for us! We will forever be grateful for Bright Start in Sanford and Ms. Linda who is the fabulous owner.

Thank you Bright Start and Ms. Linda. The Seeman's love you.

My daughter has been attending BrightStart over four years and the staff is amazing! They love the children and therapy goes over and beyond for children to meet their Goals. The nurses and aides are professional and so kind! I would highly recommend this facility!

provider_name: Brighter Days PPEC of Palm Bay
review_text:
We are so thankful for Brighter Days PPEC! From day one, Director Jessica has gone above and beyond to make it a safe, fun, and loving environment for medically fragile children. She is truly passionate about what she does, and it shows in everything‚Äîfrom water play days and ‚ÄúMake-A-Buddy‚Äù projects to adorable school pictures. Jessica understands firsthand the challenges families face and makes parents feel comfortable and supported.

The nurses here are incredible‚Äîcaring, attentive, and truly invested in the children‚Äôs well-being. Our daughter, who has many special needs, receives all of her therapies (OT & ST) during the day, and she absolutely loves being here. They have truly become our extended family.

We are so grateful to have this option in the community‚Äîit was so needed. Enrolling was easy, and we can honestly say it‚Äôs the best decision we‚Äôve ever made for our daughter. Thank you for everything you do!

provider_name: Brighter Days PPEC of Palm Bay
review_text: My son attends brighter days at their palm bay location. They have been absolutely wonderful with him. He has several medical needs, is deaf, and special needs. They give him a place to feel loved, included, involved, and safe. He is a toddler and never has had a hard time being dropped off or picked up by transport which tells me he likes it there. He has surgery and they have been a huge help in caring for his surgical site and even calling me to check on me and see if there is anything I need assistance with. The whole process was simple to get him signed up and has been an overall great experience for my family.

I am nothing but extremely grateful to Crystal ADKINS. I was so fortunate to find her, she is so positive and helped me making the right decisions. She was thoughtful,caring and supportive. I will miss her.‚ù§Ô∏è

I‚Äôve had the pleasure of working alongside Crystal for several years and she brings a warmth and compassion to her her work with clients that leaves them feeling heard and seen. Crystal is amazing at what she does and I will continue referring to her for many years to come. You‚Äôre awesome Crystal!

I've been seeing Crystal for some time now, and it's been such a great experience with her. She really cares about how I am doing and gives me helpful tools to use. Getting in touch with someone to set up an initial conversation/appointment was easy. And since then there's always been good and easy ways to communicate with Crystal if needed. I reccomend using her if you need someone professional, kind and helpful.

Crystal listens, offers a plan, incorporates feedback, and tailors your care for YOU. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about her. I am not on the other side of this journey yet, but I know I will be. Thank you, Crystal, for your help and guidance. I wish everyone‚Äôs psychiatric experience could be with someone like you.

I began my treatment with Crystal 2 weeks ago for severe depression, anxiety, and insomnia.  All I can say is that I am so happy, pleased, and grateful that I found her!  She is extremely professional, caring, and knowledgeable.  She carefully and patiently listened to all my questions/concerns/fears, and explained the best treatment for me in great detail.  I have seen a significant improvement in my conditions already.  I highly recommend Crystal!

I had a very long wait to get in, but it was well worth it. This agency is amazing!!!!! The therapist my son has had here have been beyond great thus far. They're so informative, sweet, hands-on, very well educated, and very helpful with giving me the right tools and understanding to take home. My son loves his therapy sessions with Ms. Jennifer and Ms.Nilda. He tells everyone his therapy is amazing! Ms.Isabella also helped me so much with navigating through the school system steps and insurance plans that best suit my sons needs. They're amazing!!!

I truly recommend brightside therapy, Isabella is not just an amazing therapist but the most compassionated person that I know when it becomes to kids, my Daughter Loves coming to see her and Elizabeth her OT, even when my daughter struggles with mood swings they always make sure she stays calm, as a mother I'm always welcome to come and watch my daughter sessions, she always worked around my schedules when I was on maternity ! We definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a great therapist. Thank you!

Horrible horrible online therapy. My partner had two sessions and his family was charged for three months!! The therapist he spoke to insulted him told him he was the boy who cried wolf. He was told he was an attention seeker. Do not waste your money on garbage

Update.-
Don't make this about your company, that you take pride on this and that. Her maternity leave is not in discussion, I'm a mother of two and I totally understand and that is why we were loyal to her waiting 4 months, I even sent another referral for OT by e-mail and I didn't get a reply or call from any of you.
This is about a 2 years old that needs therapy and I sabella was careless, selfish, she made everything about herself, she pointed the issue about her family needs but didn't care about my son's needs and we waited for her, what was she talking about?. Shame on her for discharging my son right after I asked for more often therapy sessions, to a therapist, instead of being professional, polite, caring, respectful with her patients, she could have let another therapist take over BEFORE and not after she's back. She made us wait and then discharge my kid without any consideration. I think she just took things personally and sent my son away because she didn't like we couldn't adjust to her schedule. Otherwise, how would you explain her behaviour?

I didn't know I was on "will call", I had to ask by text mesaages the week before for dates available the following week.

Lastly, you made a call AFTER I received the discharge letter. Why? So you can have  on record  that your company made the effort?
Again, I don't think you treat my son fairly, equally. My son lost 4 months of his life plus another few months looking for another therapist. Never felt so mistreated.
That is my experience with Brightside Therapy.

---------

Isabella seemed to be nice and respectful but once you can't adjust to her schedule she will show her true colors.
In all sessions I never received a summary of what she's done in that day with my son, just vague comments. I just kept thinking is normal till my son start saying words.

She never said how long she'd be gone for maternity leave, I thought we had to stick with her so we actually ended up waiting 4 months.
Once she's back she texted me asking when I'm available and I said: 'Please, the sooner the better, any time, any day'. And then suddenly she texted me again 2 hours before a session was cancelled and I said no, it doesn't work for us. She didn't actually set sessions for us that week, she was trying to cover that spot with my son so I said politely: 'I feel like we are not getting very often sessions' and she just discharged my son just because we couldn't adjust to her schedule, after we waited for her 4 months so now my little one now has to wait another few months because there's a waiting list everywhere.
Isabella was very unprofessional and disrespectful, made everything about herself and her family, she even said doesn't appreciate people not understanding her family needs which makes no sense coming from someone very unprofessional, had zero consideration with my son who needs help and had zero emphaty for others.  My son was the patient here, not her.
I do not recommend Brightside Therapy at all, no one else reached out to me to set appointments when she was out, I even sent another referral, after months she said she received it but I never got an e-mail back, it's very dissapointing and unfortunate that this place it's still on business because they clearly need to improve the way they treat their patients. We felt very mistreated by them.

At Brightside Therapy they really go above and beyond for their patients! Our daughter has been receiving speech therapy for several months and her speech has improved so much, and she absolutely loves going to her therapy sessions. We are so grateful to everyone at Brightside Therapy and I highly recommend them!

Brightstone is such a great place to work! I have been here since February of 2024 and have felt supported since day one by my direct leadership and the senior leadership in the company. They really listen to you, and they make an effort to improve operations/clinical policies to best serve the clients and the employees! Joining the Brightstone team was one of the best career decisions I've ever made.

My son has been attending Brightstone therapy since about a week after they first initially opened up. This therapy center is really great for children with autism. They work with you and your child. One on one trainings. It‚Äôs amazing. We see the progress that my son and the goals that he has met . If you have Medicaid they definitely will take it . Thank you again bright stone team

Terrible company. Fake personalities in management. They pretend to care and be a "people first" company with a "work life balance" culture, yet they let me go due to emergencies and hardships that they knew about prior to hiring me. Even though I'm a skilled, experienced RBT who has communicated every step of the way. I wouldn't cover for them during my first week of training in a completely different center because I didn't have safe navigation, so they counted each of those against me. I had to leave mid day because we were facing an eviction and they just drop me the very next day.  How cruel and inhumane. Not even the common decency of a conversation, like "hey we noticed this - whats going on? How can we support you?" Nothing. They expect everything from you with no flexibility or support in return. They were going to make me work an entire day for them pretending that everything is fine so ill do a good job just to fire me at the end of my session. Aparently I wasn't one of the favorites, so I wasn't even worth the time of day. Overall terrible experience. The kids are just piled up ontop of each other, the center is loud, they are not equipt for safety and maladaptive crisis behaviors, they give you no proper training for central reach, and they are way under staffed in management. No fairness or respect. And to think I accepted a $3 pay cut for this experience. Do yourself a favor and avoid this company as a client and an RBT.

I started training last year with Mrs Kaitlyn and I feel amazing and have been doing great everything is perfect I‚Äôve been trained to intermediate in a year time frame would definitely suggest school aged kids like me thank you Mrs Kaitlyn for all your help and kindness

Bristol Rose is the absolute best out of all the horse places we have been to! They treat their horses wonderfully, you can tell how happy, well fed and well treated they are. The owner Katelyn is amazing, she is so sweet, patient and informative! She is really great at teaching lessons for kids of all ages.

I attended the cow sorting/barrel racing clinic in June 2023. I paid $75 to ride one of the clinics horses. When I got there they put me on one of the Bristol rose horses (the one that keeps pulling on the reins) I got off and left. I told them that I paid the $75 to ride one of the clinics horses for a reason and still got put on a horse that I didn‚Äôt want to ride. Bristol rose reached out to me and said that they were going to do another riding clinic around thanksgiving and they never called or text to let me know the dates. They took my money.

Normally great food, great atmosphere and great service.  The latter 2 items still great.  The food, a grouper sandwich was lacking much grouper.  I'm sure that was singular mess up so I have maintained the 5 star rating.  Definitely will be back.
Kaitlynn and Tahleiha are the best to learn how to ride horses with i would recommend 100%

The team at Broad Horizons is excellent and we highly recommend their services. It took us quite some time to find a good fit for our daughter and were so grateful when we found Broad Horizons. Our daughter successfully completed her treatment plan and didn‚Äôt want to leave the practice because she  enjoyed her time there so much. I liked that each therapist takes the time to meet with the parents after each session to review what was covered and areas we can reinforce at home.

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Broad Horizons Speech Therapy. I came to them during such a vulnerable time, unsure and overwhelmed, but from the very first interaction, I felt supported and understood. Their team is not only incredibly knowledgeable and thorough, but also deeply compassionate.

They took the time to truly understand my child‚Äôs needs and created a plan that was both effective and encouraging. The progress we‚Äôve seen has been incredible, not just in speech, but in confidence too.

If you‚Äôre a parent navigating the world of speech delays or developmental concerns, I wholeheartedly recommend Broad Horizons. They don‚Äôt just treat speech, they treat your child with care, respect, and genuine love for what they do!

As a parent it can be intimidating to reach out for help when you notice your child needs some support or is not meeting some milestones. Broad Horizons makes this process so smooth and they genuinely care about helping you to understand each step. My son LOVED going to see his therapist each week‚Ä¶just building his confidence alone along with increasing his communication skills is something we will forever be grateful for! I highly recommend Broad Horizons to anyone!

Broad Horizons is amazing. We had a hard time finding a speech therapist in our area, and we were happy to find out they could provide therapy to our son via video. The experience has been great. Ms. Henry is amazing. She makes my child feel comfortable. I also appreciate the communication with the administrative staff.

My 2 year old son has been receiving speech therapy services at Broad Horizons for about 6 months now. He went from speaking about 10-12 words to now over 70. His receptive and expressive language have improved greatly and he is saying new words daily now. Both Ms. Henry and Ms. Farinella (Paige) are incredible SLPs and I recommend them highly. Also, the staff is receptive to feedback and open to collaboration as me and my 4 year old daughter attend my son‚Äôs sessions. Sitting in sessions allows me to implement what happens in sessions at home. We are looking forward to continuing with Broad Horizons:) I share this opinion as both a stay at home mom and former preschool teacher!

Lea has been a huge help to me this year!  I first visited Brookline Physical Therapy after my knee surgery.  She worked with me to develop exercises to strengthen my knee, most of which I could continue to do at home without any special exercise machines.  She also spent time working on my knee to help the muscles around it loosen up and advised me on what I should and shouldn‚Äôt be doing until my knee got stronger.  I was so grateful for all the did for me that, when I hurt my lower back this summer, I returned to Brookline Physical Therapy so that Lea could help me once again.  I strongly recommend Brookline Physical Therapy for anyone searching for a physical therapist.  Lea‚Äôs knowledge and kindness make it a wonderful place!

I have been having Therapy with Brookline for over a year now after an accident that damaged my Back, Neck, and Shoulder. Yes, it has been a long road, and one I am not sure I could have traveled without the care of Lea and John. You guys are the best of the best, you know how to help the pain and promote the healing, and get me ready for surgery. A simple thank you would not be enough. If anyone needs the service for excellent Physical Therapy, go to Brookline you will be so pleased you did!

I sought therapy for arthritic pain in my hip. Lea listened to my needs and designed a program that was easy to follow and very effective. She also helped me design a home routine that has improved my quality of life.
It's really nice to find a provider that genuinely cares about you and your health.

I highly recommend Lea for physical therapy. She is excellent at explaining the specific causes of your pain, providing results oriented therapy modalities and follow up advice to maintain good health. She is both caring and genuinely supportive.

John and Lea Vesguerra are some of the nicest people and Physical Therapy Specialists with the most effective and unique approaches to aiding in your recovery and physical therapy goals including for my child‚Äôs physical therapy recovery. I highly recommend their services to any and everyone who need more than just the basic physical therapy approach including for children. Thank you Lea and John for your incomparable services. I‚Äôm ever so grateful to have such wonderful Physical Therapy Specialists.

I had my stroke in March, and I was so anxious about if I could ever go back to school. I am happy to say that I did the ICAP program and completed my classes within the extended period of time my professors offered without dropping due to medical needs. I finished one of my classes with a 93%, and I feel so confident now!! I owe so much to the team here and if you're unsure about going, do it! They tailor the time in therapy to whatever your goals are, and help you get better while having fun.

The staff is friendly, enthusiastic, and non- judgmental. Anyone who walks in the door is welcomed and encouraged. The staff meets each participant at his or her own level. There is no need to feel embarrassed or apologetic. There are no comparisons. Everyone is given one-on-one attention and appreciation.

After surviving a stroke 10/20/22 I was blessed to have a wonderful SLP Cynthia at Brooks and she recommended BRAC. I‚Äôm so thankful I‚Äôm able to fellowship and communicate with others with out judgment or fear of embarrassment. The staff is more like family. We work daily to improve our speaking and making memories at the secession that are engaging and educational also learning about the different types of Aphasia and how our brain works. I‚Äôd recommend Brooks Rehabilitation Aphasia Center (BRAC) to folks and families that were blessed to survive and struggle with Aphasia to join us ASAP!!!üó£Ô∏èüó£Ô∏èüó£Ô∏èüó£Ô∏èüó£Ô∏èüó£Ô∏è

The Aphasia Center is friendly, non-judgement, and understands me because I had a stroke in April 2022. It helps me communicate and my confidence because I had and still have anxiety and I‚Äôm shy. To the Aphasia Center thank you so much.

The Aphasia Center staff and members are welcoming, and give support to each other.
As a members there, feelings that I am getting better but still not out the woods, yet. Still improving.

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Home Health - Daytona Beach
review_text: My PT (who is also the manager for this location) Stephanie Crandall was great to work with - setting aggressive goals and challenging me in my recovery.  Also, post Brooks PT, she left me with good a set of exercises including some to do in the pool (my request for aqua since I like to exercise in the pool) to continue my long-term recovery for my hip replacement.  I feel great and restored so much mobility and strength in only 10 weeks post-surgery. I have had experience with physical therapy twice before in my past in Brevard County with other providers (just moved to Volusia) and this experience was by a wide margin, the best and significantly exceeded my expectations.  Everyone is friendly to interact during your journey to recovery.

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Home Health - Daytona Beach
review_text: Brooks is an amazing company with amazing workers and therapists. There home health team is inspiring and caring in everything that they do. Unfortunately, I‚Äôm not sure how much the company cares about how their employees conduct their personal lives. My mother has worked here for over 10 years and she along with my father kicked me out of their home after the hurricane. I suffer from severe mental health issues, so them doing this has taken an even larger toll on my mental health. Sad to see such a wonderful company employing such an evil person.

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Home Health - Daytona Beach
review_text:
We can NOT rave more about Brooks Rehabilitation! My nana had a left hip and elbowing fracture and we received PT and OT from Brooks for her. Both therapist were AMAZING!!! LaRae especially has our hearts! She was so kind and caring. She always included my nana in all conversations even when it was hard because she is hard of hearing. She was thorough and careful to look at all angles of healing so that my nana had the best chances of a positive outcome! She was incredibly knowledgeable and always explained how and why she was doing each exercise. She remembered the details of my nanas care each time and was such an encouragement to our family as a whole! I think my mom and I looked forward the therapy sessions with LaRae as much as my nana did üòÉ. LaRae became part of our family and we wish she weren‚Äôt so amazing at her job so she could have kept coming back! üòâ
Brooks Rehabilitation was perfection!!

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Home Health - Daytona Beach
review_text: I have been a patient of Brooks over 20 years. They have helped me gain strength, flexibility and mobility  in my body. I love the entire staff because they treat me like family and not just a patient. They care about my recovery and encourage me to keep moving. The building is always professional and clean. I would recommend my friends and family because there is no place like Brooks!

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Home Health - Daytona Beach

Very pleased with Brooks Rehab in Deltona.  Mary was amazing; she was very thorough and explaining everything that we would be doing for my PT.  I definitely received the results that I needed and I‚Äôm so happy that I went here.
The staff are so friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating.  Highly recommend using Brooks for PT.

My family has been coming to Brooks for Pt, pediatric OT & pediatric speech for awhile now. We have the most amazing experience from seeing friendly Ms. Betsy at the front counter, to when the kids go back to Mrs. Jen, Mrs. Amber, Mrs. Laurie & Mrs. Cassie. They've helped my family tremendously with everything and we greatly appreciate all they do for us. I've personally had a great experience seeing Sam, Jill, Lashanda & Randy for PT when I had my car accident and needed help getting on the mend.

My expectations of improvement after spinal surgery weren‚Äôt very good.  After 29 days in inpatient therapy and two months of in home therapy, I thought that I‚Äôd shown as much growth as I would.  But, Mary and Michelle came into my life!  Good cop (Michelle) and bad cop (Mary).  After a few visits, I was told, by the bad cop, not to bring my wheelchair back. I remember crying when she showed me that I could walk without feeling my feet.  Mary was relentless; showed no pity but demonstrated lots of compassion.  When I worked with good cop, Michelle, I soon found out that her sweet persona in no way interfered with determination to make me achieve my goals.  I am always impressed by their intense focus on everything I do.  I learned quickly that therapy begins as soon as I was greeted.  If I didn‚Äôt stand from the seat correctly, I had to do it over.  If I didn‚Äôt position myself properly in the walker, I was immediately corrected. Mean cop even made me open the door for myself.  When I snitched to Michelle about Mary making me open the door, she made me do it too.  Great teamwork;  both focused on helping me get better.  I appreciate that that both of my therapist observed closely and adjusted therapy accordingly.  I love that they explained what they were doing and why.  I‚Äôm grateful that they never tired of my (and my husband‚Äôs) many questions.  Mary and Michelle and the entire staff are remarkable.  From the warm greeting from Dee when you enter Brooks until you leave an hour later, I felt respected and genuinely cared for.  My therapist at Ascension St. Vincent‚Äôs and my in home therapist recommended that I get to Brook‚Äôs as soon as I could.  Great advice; great experience.

Like to give a special shout out to ALL the employees at Brooks Rehab Dunn Ave! Especially to Rob & Michelle! They not only gave me awesome therapy services but they were also great teachers! From a person that asks lots of questions behind the mechanics of recovering from a "Massive Rotator Cuff " tear, from not ever having any shoulder issues, they were both outstanding! Thanks again.

My husband received OT, PT, and Speech therapy at this location. This is the best group of people from the therapists (could not ask for better ones) to the assistant (love her energy and smile) to the front desk, she is "Dee Bomb"! I cannot recommend this location for therapy enough. Whether it's for an adult or child they are awesome!

Love everyone at Brooks Rehab in North Jacksonville (Dunn Avenue)! Dee and Teresa are always friendly and welcoming when we arrive‚Ä¶ Michelle is continuously finding fun ways to incorporate my son‚Äôs therapy with his interest. I genuinely feel that the people at Brooks Rehab NorthJax care about their patients and their families!
Rob & Meagan are excellent Physical Therapist! They are both professional and very knowledgeable. I recommend them your PT needs.

I have been a patient at Brooks Rehab Ortega for more than one issue. The staff here has improved my quality of life every time. I credit Ashley with my very successful total knee replacement recovery. Today I saw Marie for my intake appointment for a new issue, and right away, she improved my understanding of my problem and the plan ahead. Thank you, Brooks Ortega!

I saw Marie for Pelvic Floor therapy and she was amazing! At my very first appointment I could see why my provider so highly recommended her. She was very thorough and always explained in depth what was going to happen at each visit. She was patient with me and worked with my schedule to make sure I got my sessions in. I definitely recommend her and this facility!

After aimlessly navigating over a decade of being misdirected, discouraged and disappointed with the ‚Äúcare‚Äù I‚Äôve received from numerous health care providers, I finally have been guided in the right direction. I have struggled endometriosis and pelvic floor dysfunction for as long as I can remember.
I was referred by my surgeon to see Marie Bogh at Brooks a few months after my laparoscopic excision. At the time, I was experiencing long-term discomfort and developed new symptoms after surgery including urinary problems. At first, I was extremely skeptical and honestly, I was already running low on hope and had little belief in myself. However, through working with Marie over the last few months, I have done a 180. Not only has she helped me physically, but she has taught me more about my condition in a way that didn‚Äôt leave me feeling hopeless. In fact, I feel empowered.
If you are thinking about trying pelvic floor therapy, please do yourself a favor and give it a shot. I know it can be scary. I was so close to not giving them a call because I didn‚Äôt believe that it could help but it has been life changing. I feel so grateful to have found Marie, especially after dealing with so many cold and dismissive providers in the past. She is empathetic, patient, and a great listener. Usually, I hate going to any type of doctors appointment but I didn‚Äôt dread going to pelvic floor therapy. I looked forward to seeing what I could improve on and see how much I‚Äôve progressed at every session. Marie is knowledgeable and also kind and it felt like talking to a friend. This type of therapy can be really uncomfortable with the wrong person but it wasn‚Äôt awkward at all. She always remains professional and never crosses boundaries.
Pelvic floor therapy is such an intimidating thing to take on especially if you experience pain and/or have trauma. But Marie is understanding and I grew to trust her and she didn‚Äôt ever once push forward with anything that I was uncomfortable doing. Be ready to put in physical and mental work. She will push and encourage you in a motivating way. You‚Äôll be surprised with what you accomplish with her help. That‚Äôs also something I learned: it‚Äôs okay to ask for help.
Now that I understand more about my body, I have the power and tools necessary to move forward with my life even after being discharged. Coming here has been such a positive experience and all of the staff are so kind and welcoming. This is a great place to start your healing journey!

I had a knee problem present in early 2021. Slowly I got worse then I sought out an orthopedic doctor. It took the ortho some time to figure out my problem which resulted in surgery. The recovery was what nightmares are made of but then angels arrived, Ashley and Nick. I am forever indebted to them both for their care and compassion. Also, special shout out to Cassandra at the front desk who always has a smiling face and always playing my old school jams.
Very professional, thorough .. Marie was fantastic !  Helped me understand symptoms and how to treat root cause s - so thankful

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Outpatient Clinic - San Pablo
review_text:
Joanna and Mallory provided excellent treatment during my many visits for shoulder (s ) rehab.
I especially appreciated the teaching aspect of my sessions and the graphics to follow for my in home exercises.  They were very kind to print them to be used at home.

I appreciated the explanations of the progress i could reasonably expect if i followed the daily exercise directives.  Throughout my treatments I was able to see progress in my ROM , sometimes only slight progress but overall at the conclusion of my treatments,  a very big improvement in my ability to perform the activity that i normally do.  These activities include home improvement projects and  household chores which was a challenge prior to  the rehab.

Considering my age which is early 80s,  I was pleased to make the impressive progress in my strength and functionality at the conclusion of the program.

Thank you Brooks Staff.

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Pediatric Clinic - St. Augustine
review_text: Brooks has been a life line for my family. Our experience with Brooks has been life changing. I'll start by saying I have a very neuro diverse household. Four of my children have been in the doors of this facility. We've done it all... speech , PT and OT. It has been very meaningfull for all of my children but especially my littlest one who has ASD. The care he has received here has improved not only his life but the life of our entire family. What I have learned in my time coming to Brooks with my children has made me a better parent. The parent education portion of their care has given me a much better toolbox for handling what comes my way. I have learned so much about how to help my children from proper hand writing skills and how to pronounce the letter R to bigger life challenges like sensory issues, learning how to fall safely , and how to help a child who is completely diaregulated find peace again. When I came with my youngest I honestly wondered more days than not how I was going to simply make it through my day. Those days still happen sometimes, but they are much less frequent and now when they do happen I know I can handle them because my toolbox is well equipped.  I'll never be able to thank all the wonderful staff here enough. I am forever grateful.

provider_name: Brooks Rehabilitation Pediatric Clinic - St. Augustine
review_text: We just adore this place! Our CP girlie does all of the therapies offered at Brooks & they have all been absolutely life changing & life giving. The team at brooks takes time to learn each child‚Äôs interests and often base their therapeutic work off of that-leading to happy kids who engage in their therapy discipline. I can‚Äôt imagine parenting without her OT, PT, & Speech team. They feel like family-all the while they‚Äôre using their expertise to show us as a family how to best love our child!

Risa is an amazing professional who clearly knows what she‚Äôs doing. She is very patient, flexible, and works very well with kids. Risa goes beyond by providing advice about equipment that can be used at home, advice on how to do her exercises, and provides tips on how to incorporate her teachings into everyday life. Risa is an excellent therapist! My 3.5 months old son loves her and even after one visit he made progression (right torticollis). Risa gave me bunch of really good exercises for homework which help a lot to keep developing my little one. I and my son highly recommend her!

My daughter, who is currently 5 months old, was diagnosed with Torticollis when she was born. Risa has been working with her since she was 2 weeks old. Risa has helped us learn different stretches and exercises in order to help my daughter, and she has made tremendous improvement over these last few months! review_text: My nephew is my world, I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better place to treat him and keep him safe! Keep up the good work

Amazing experience 90+ minute tour of exotic animals. They all have a story to tell and many different personalities to meet along the way. Definitely worth the drive out there. We attended for a birthday party. Use the restroom ahead of time, wear sneakers and big spray!

My husband and I went on a tour for my birthday and WOW what a great place! The founder Christin and our tour guide/10 year volunteer Stephanie were both so kind, knowledgeable, and passionate about the animals. My animal loving heart is happy knowing a non-profit like this exists.

We had so much fun meeting all kinds of animals here. We went in the morning a few times and got to hear the wild noises of animals across the property waking up. It was amazing to see all the birds and animals interact with each other and the owners. You can tell how passionate and caring the owners are and all the love they put into giving the animals the best life. We look forward to visiting more and spreading the word about such a unique and beautiful place!üêí thank you for the tour!!

We had an awesome time! The tour is great, filled with tons of information about the various animals. And we went at 1 p.m., so we got to see the feedings of several of the animals, specifically the tiger! It was such an impressive sight. Great for all ages, and the list of animals grows often, so there will always be something new and exciting to see.
Great experience. The animals are very well take care of. The owner was very nice and explained us everything and answered all of our questions.

I was referred to C.H.O.O.S.E. Physical Therapy LLC by a trainer at my gym, and I‚Äôm so glad I followed through. Patrick was my physical therapist, and his background working with a Major League Baseball team really showed‚Äîhis expertise was top-notch. Even though I‚Äôm not a pro athlete, he treated me like one, with incredible care and attention.
The entire team was fantastic. The office staff kept everything running smoothly and on time, and everyone was friendly and professional. I learned so much about my torn rotator cuff‚Äîhow to heal, strengthen, and manage it going forward. The experience was not only effective but empowering.
Highly recommend C.H.O.O.S.E. to anyone looking for knowledgeable, compassionate, and results-

I was referred to CHOOSE PT by a friend to try their mechanical traction for low back pain caused by herniated discs I suffered in a car accident 6 years ago. Prior to seeking treatment at CHOOSE, I was unable to lift weights  or do strenuous work without risking flare ups and serious pain.

My initial appointment was with Martin and I had just experienced a flare up that morning. Martin did his evaluation and performed a manual release procedure on my Iliopsoas muscle that got me back to functional very quickly.

Follow up appointments with Martin were a combination of physical therapy and mechanical traction. Both of these treatments were instrumental to getting me back to where I am today. Martin showed me techniques for strengthening my core and engaging them while doing weight training.

It has been roughly three months since my last therapy session with traction, and I am able to do most of the weight training exercises I was doing before, and I've been able to do some very physical work in the field at work that would have caused flare ups and pain prior to going to CHOOSE for therapy.

Martin is a brilliant therapist and I can't say enough good things about his practice and how they approach recovery from injuries.

Thank you Martin and staff! You guys are the best!

Yvonne was terrific! I worked with her over 3 months and improved my mobility, strength and balance. I am 83 and now able to play golf again, after a 20 year hiatus, twice a week. She takes a personal interest and doesn‚Äôt pass me off to some trainee which has happened several times in the past. I highly recommend her if you want positive results.

Amy , the  owner of CHOOSE PHYSICAL THERAPY and ALL the therapists that work there are highly qualified and make sure each patient‚Äôs care is individualized and the best plan of care is given for every patient. I had a shoulder injury and post surgery have been treated with the best manual therapy , given proper exercises AND I‚Äôve experienced DRY NEEDLING for the first time . Wow it has really made a difference in decreasing my pain increasing my range of motion and is helping me return to my previous active lifestyle. I highly recommend not only this clinic but also adding Dry needling into your treatment plan. They are credentialed and have expert experience and you will be in great HANDS  with CHOOSE PT!

I have an ongoing incredible experience working with Yvonne at C.H.O.O.S.E  Physical Therapy for chronic pain , balance and mobility .She is not only skilled but caring and attentive. Each session is thoughtfully tailored to my needs and a remarkable improvement has been the outcome. Her dedication made a huge difference in my recovery.
I highly recommend  C.H.O.O.S.E .physical therapy to anyone seeking a team of expert and compassion physical therapy.     ‚ÄúTop Notch !‚Äù

We have nothing but excellent things to say about Melanie and CAP Speech Therapy.  We started working with Melanie shortly after our daughter turned two years old, as she was flagged as having very limited vocabulary at that point.  As new parents, we were very anxious and stressed about the situation.  We worked with several therapist and simply couldn't find the right fit for us.
None of them seemed to be doing much, and certainly weren't working with us to give us tools to help our daughter's progress.
Then we came upon Melanie and CAP Speech.  Melanie took the time to handle all of our (countless) calls and emails, explained the process every step of the way, and always spent extra time with us at each session to give us additional tools and guidance.  It become more about the team effort to help our daughter excel and catch up, and it become effortless to continue the work with our daughter between sessions. And unlike with other therapists, with Melanie we saw the exponential growth in our daughter's speech happen from day to day, week to week.  Melanie really connected with her, understood what she needed, and pushed her at the right pace to make great progress in her language.   Fast forward to now, our daughter won't stop talking (for better or worse, lol).  Our kids love when "Miss Melanie" comes over and they rush to give her hugs at the door -- they see her as a member of the family now.  It's going to be bitter sweet when we no longer have her stopping by for her sessions.  We absolutely recommend her (and frequently do) to any parents in need of speech services.

Melanie sees my youngest son for speech therapy. She‚Äôs his new favorite person, and he gets so excited every time he sees her! She is very professional and knowledgeable. We‚Äôve seen improvement in our son‚Äôs speech within the first month of therapy, and with his behavior as well as he was constantly biting his brother or other children when he became frustrated and couldn‚Äôt communicate. She also teaches us techniques to promote and support his speech as well. We appreciate her so much!

Melanie Cap has changed our lives! When we started with her, my son was non-verbal. After working with her he is now talking up a storm. My son can be very difficult but Melanie is so wonderful and patient and really meets him at his level. It‚Äôs easy to see that every session is tailored to his needs. We had tried speech therapy before but never saw results until we found CAP Speech Therapy.

CAP speech and Melanie helped our toddler so much! We were referred to Melanie when my daughter was 18 months old and not really talking. From the beginning, Melanie was able to help guide our family with the tools and knowledge to help us progress. Our daughters progressed greatly after about a year and a half working with Melanie! She was right on track!!! I cannot say enough amazing things about Melanie and Cap. Speech therapy!!!

Melanie is the most qualified speech therapist with the best methods for success! My grandson adores her! Melanie is so kind and personable and I highly recommend her. My grandson‚Äôs language skills have improved tremendously. Forever grateful for her professional expertise.
