provider_name: CORA Physical Therapy St. Lucie West
review_text: The team at Cora is amazing and they truly care about your recovery! I came in not being able to walk around the block without pain and weakness, thinking this was something I would have to live with. Their competence at identifying the true issue and making fun new ways to strengthen the problem areas has alleviated my pain and got me to where I can even go back to the gym!

provider_name: CORA Physical Therapy St. Lucie West
review_text:
I have been going to this clinic since March.  I could hardly walk, with pain from my sciatica, neck issues and frozen shoulder. Couldn‚Äôt get on or off the table with severe challenges,.  Even feeding myself and dressing was painful and humiliating.  With the help and care from Harshal who developed a thoughtful plan I can now walk with more confidence, hold my phone and water bottle.  I can cut my food and get it in my mouth with much less challenge.  Started walking a bit,
I would recommended this clinic to anyone who is interested in getting better and doing the work with a wonderful team

provider_name: CORA Physical Therapy St. Lucie West
review_text: I loved this team of fun, empathetic professionals. They were understanding and listened to me through one of the most arduous physical recovery situations I have ever been through in my life. They are highly recommended!!!

provider_name: CORA Physical Therapy St. Lucie West
review_text: Hello my name is Bert Pantaleon and I‚Äôve been going to core physical therapy for two years there‚Äôs a gentleman there name Herschel he runs a really nice tight shift there he‚Äôs great at what he does he takes care of me every time he does very educated you guys are blessed to have somebody like him working there thank you very much and I appreciate everything he does for me

Starting with walking in the door I was met with a big welcoming smile from the receptionist asking me to sign in.  Then I was given to a PTA who really worked me, but that is what I was there for.   He continued to torture me (lol) for 10 weeks.  Lo and behold at almost 80 years old I feel more confident in my balance and walking!  I would recommend Cora‚Äôs Therapy to everyone if they want to get better!
Stuart Cora Rehab is the best I‚Äôve seen. The entire group of associates are very professional and have made recovery from reverse shoulder surgery better than I could have imagined. Thanks so much.

A few months back, I went to CORA for 12 sessions of physical therapy. When I was there, the therapists that worked with me were mainly Kristen and Matt as well as Madison and Chris. They certainly made me more aware of the manner in which I stretch, exercise and how I pay attention to what my body is telling me. I would recommend that any potential client take what they say seriously and consider using what they learn from them long after the therapy is completed. Office staff there also did very well and made sure that my appointment times were properly managed. Thank you to everyone at CORA.

I went to CORA for a little over 6 months for PT on my shoulder/rotator cuff and Madison,Matt,Hailey the entire staff is just great.I actually miss going there. they listened to my questions and concerns would definitely go there for PT again if I have to

I had never needed physical therapy until I fractured my upper arm in a fall. This injury is very hard to recover from and requires a long period of PT. I was so fortunate to have found this clinic and could not recommend them more highly. I would give them 10 stars if I could! All the therapists have been excellent, taking me from no mobility or strength to a high degree of range of motion and increasing strength. The sincere care and expertise of each therapist has made my recovery so much easier. I look forward to my visits even though the work is hard. Also appreciate the administrator who does the scheduling, very demanding, and she is always patient and helpful. Hope you will choose Cora Physical Therapy in Stuart if the need arises. The best!

Mike, Tosha, Teddy, and the rest of the CORA team were fantastic to work with. I was in PT for 5 months with 2 issues, going about once or twice a week. They really went above and beyond with their customer service. Everyone was professional, kind, respectful and encouraging. I loved their focus on small improvements over time rather an all at once strategy. They also were accommodating in the best way, and never made me feel pressured to go beyond my abilities physically. I think they are the best PT provider in the Jacksonville area, and I would absolutely come back if I need PT again. I also recommend them to anyone looking to go on the therapy journey as they'll be your caring guide towards better health.

I had physical therapy for my knees twice a week, for 6 weeks, during April and May, at this location. It was my first time doing physical therapy ever, so I didn't know what to expect, but by the end of it, I couldn't be more satisfied with the experience. I felt a difference for sure; my muscles got stronger. The therapists and the staff there were very knowledgeable, super nice, friendly, and approachable. They answered all my questions and provided a gym routine to follow once my time with them was coming to an end. I still use the app they recommended me to use to keep track of my progress. If I ever need physical therapy again, I will check for sure if the same therapists (Mike and Tasha) are still there before I go. My mom had physical therapy a few years ago at the same location, but her experience was totally different than mine. The funny thing was that me and her didn't talk about it while I was deciding where to go, because her opinion would have been a factor not to go there if she would have told me about her experience then. Luckily for me, the therapists that my mom had to deal with are no longer at that location.

Therapists at this location , one short chubby male PT and African American lady do not truly work with patients but ignore during therapy sessions. When confronted both therapists had attitude were very condescending and did not finish session. I m a medical professional and I know for a fact they are harming their clients but not doing quality work. Will never go to this location! Stay away unless you want to waste your money and time for nothing

I would not recommend to anyone for the simple fact that they have caused me so much stress and a huge waste of time trying to get this figured out. They‚Äôve also told me they will reach out to me and never actually do so. This has been going on for months now and still not resolved.

if you are in need of a professional, friendly, knowledgeable physical therapist, call and schedule an appt with mike, you won't be disappointed, he is committed to helping you reach your goals, if you're muscles and joints, are tight, mike, will get you right

Arrived and there was only one therapist on the floor and they played Spanish music the entire time.  I don‚Äôt understand Spanish and some Spanish people don‚Äôt understand American so just LEAVE THE MUSIC OFF or play instrumental music which is universal.

These Joseph, Jameil and Denivette are very nice and professional employees which were very cooperative with my questions and help

this was my first experience doing physical therapy and i had the best experience. Michael was the best! He made sure to check-in everyday and make sure I was doing okay. Cora is one of the best physical therapy places that I ever been to this place is so nice and so clean such a wonderful staff akesia very nice Lauren very good lee ann wonderful Ryann great worker positive vibe valerie good job Brendan he has a positive attitude Qing he knows¬† stuff over all these workers they're such a wonderful individual in their own unique ways may the good lord bless and keep üôè them in perfect peace and love üíò and unity¬† from your truly Fernando Simpson

provider_name: Cadenza Center for Psychotherapy & the Arts
review_text: The therapist my kids saw while there was amazing.  Their billing practices are horrible.  You must keep a credit card on file with them. Most of the time they'll bill you the next day. When they're experiencing a lull in seeing patients, like during the summer they'll start randomly charging your card. In August they told me that my insurance company didn't pay them on time in July (but they paid timely every other month). This is when the hinky billing started. They charged me for 3 visits in one week. I paused my kids treatment for a month after confirming I did not owe them anymore money. I called to resume treatment and was told I had a past due balance.  Remember, they have my credit card on file. When I called to speak with the manager, she charged my card. So had I not called to resume treatment, she would have never charged my card. She claims the new charges are from August. I reminded her I spoke with her on 8/29 and she said I was all paid up.  She then said she didn't realize I have two kids. They're TWINS.  Oh and when the therapist call you to review the progress of the children, they charge you for that as  well.  I know a billing quota culture when I see it.  They definitely have billing goals/ required that they'll make from you.

provider_name: Cadenza Center for Psychotherapy & the Arts
review_text:
I am really big on reading reviews before going somewhere, specially if that somewhere is for my child, CADENZA‚ÄôS having less than 5 stars is a true example that  people mostly write reviews only when they have a bad experiences.
My son Was diagnosed as type three (severe) autism, nonverbal in April 2025; we got suggested to Cadenza by the coordinator of his previous daycare, and, oh my God I am so grateful she did that! my baby has just been in Cadenza for three weeks and he is already grabbing markers, socializing with other kids, Not crying at drop off, engaging in circle time, sharing his toys and books with other children, saying more words, making better eye contact, thing he‚Äôd never did before! he stopped bitting, he even throws his arms to the therapist when we arrive, transition and separation was horrible.
I cannot wait to see our baby‚Äôs daily improvement at this center and with this amazing team, Jenise, Vanessa and Valerie my family and I are deeply grateful to have crossed paths with you guys and so thankful of all the love and dedication you put into our baby and every child You have. We are so lucky. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts üôèüèº‚ù§Ô∏è

review_text: This place should be shutdown because they are charging clients for psychological evaluations whereas the insurance pays it. So they are chatting twice as much!! That‚Äôs not right

provider_name: Cadenza Center for Psychotherapy & the Arts
review_text:
BLACK WOMEN BEWARE!
As a Black woman seeking mental health care, my experience at this office has been deeply troubling, frustrating, and discriminatory. From the outset, I encountered obstacles and unprofessional behavior that left me feeling dismissed and unheard, largely due to selective policy enforcement and racial bias.
When I initially tried to schedule my appointment, I was told by a staff member that I could not make the appointment without a card on file, despite the fact that my insurance covers the full cost of the treatment. This staff member‚Äôs refusal to make an exception prompted me to request speaking to the office manager. The office manager, after calling me back the following day, made a one-time courtesy and allowed me to schedule the appointment with the understanding that once I received my card, I would update the office. I ordered a card specifically for this purpose because the office required a card to be on file. I was told the card would take five to seven business days to arrive, and once I received it, I promptly updated their system on December 19th.
From the outset, their staff enforced policies against me unfairly, claiming that my activated and valid card was declined, which resulted in the cancellation of my critical mental health evaluation. This evaluation was a necessary step in managing my treatment and medications. Despite having provided my card on December 19, they claimed it wasn‚Äôt activated and canceled my appointment for December 26.
On January 6, 2025, I called the office with the intention of resolving this matter and speaking to the office manager. I calmly explained what had transpired, my frustration over the appointment being canceled, and the way I was dismissed. At that point, the office manager dismissively stated that the card ‚Äúprobably wasn‚Äôt activated‚Äù‚Äîa statement that belittled me and implied that I was too incompetent to properly handle something as simple as activating a credit card. This comment made it clear that she was gaslighting me and deflecting responsibility for the error on her end. As I gave her the same card details for the second time, she confirmed that the card was accepted.
I had provided the same card details December 19th, so why was it only now being accepted? The only difference was that I had confronted the office manager regarding their mishandling of my appointment. I strongly feel that the staff member initially declined my card and canceled my appointment because I had requested to speak to the office manager, which shows the office‚Äôs blatant discriminatory behavior. The office made the decision to apply the policies selectively‚Äîrefusing to accept my card and blaming me for their error just. It was clear their decision wasn‚Äôt based on any real issue with my card but instead reflected discriminatory practices. This experience reinforces harmful stereotypes often directed at Black individuals, particularly around financial irresponsibility, which is deeply hurtful and discriminatory.
When I rightfully expressed frustration about how this mishandling delayed my care, the office manager dismissed me, she flatly refused to acknowledge the inconsistency, weaponized harmful stereotypes about Black women being angry or unprofessional and ultimately dismissed me, refusing my service altogether.
She ultimately denied me further care because I refused to overlook her gaslighting. My frustration escalated, but I still asked to speak with a supervisor or the doctor, and I was told to send an email to their office. I sent a detailed email explaining my experience, laying out my concerns about the mistreatment, the clear inconsistency in how policies were applied, and the unprofessional behavior I‚Äôd encountered.
Rather than acknowledging or addressing the situation, the doctor herself perpetuated this bias by siding with her staff without ever reaching out to me for my side of the story or investigating the matter further.

provider_name: Cadenza Center for Psychotherapy & the Arts
review_text: When I needed help with my daughter, Cadenza was there. She is on the spectrum and had other mental health issues as well. Today she is a strong, independent woman of 25yrs. Lives on her own and has friends... her goals in life. Thank you

My porties from Caladesi are the best! The mostly black dog is ‚ÄúLuna‚Äù and she is 8; the mostly white dog is ‚ÄúMolly‚Äù and she is 5. We got them from Caladesi when they were eight weeks old, to the day. Lisa is the most competent and caring breeder - she has a huge yard and her whole porch is dedicated to each litter of puppies. These pups are well trained - fully potty trained and socialized before adoption - and Lisa‚Äôs advice regarding their characters and personalities is spot on! The only drawback with these dogs is how smart they are. Sometimes I realize they‚Äôre training me! Whose house is it? ü§≠ And ‚Äúwater dog‚Äù is fully deserved, both love the pool when I let them in it (or forget to keep eyes on them when they‚Äôre in the lanai). These dogs are the best we‚Äôve ever had, so loving, smart, and beautiful. They don‚Äôt shed either. Lisa provides pedigree information, and requires careful attention to the pups‚Äô needs. It‚Äôs clear Lisa breeds these dogs out of love for the breed, care for the puppies, and carefully screens anyone who would like to adopt. I highly recommend Portugese Water Dogs in general, and Caladesi Portugese Water Dogs in particular!

No words can describe how much we Love and adore our two Portuguese water dogs we were fortunate enough to get from Lisa. Both of them are so loving and bring so much joy to our family. Wonderful temperament and very smart. Most importantly, Lisa is always there to answer any questions or just to share stories and experiences with as they grow and immature.
If I could get five more pups from her, I would do it in a heartbeat, but I think my spouse would kill me.....‚ò∫Ô∏è

We received our Portuguese water dog over a month ago from Caladesi Portuguese water dogs.  We named our little guy Dock‚ÄîI know, not the most original name considering our love for the water‚Äîbut his middle name is Strawberry, so that helps add a little flair!

He‚Äôs been doing so well. I had planned to bring in a trainer, but he‚Äôs been such a quick learner that I‚Äôve taken on the training myself. He already waits patiently at the door before going out, waits for permission before eating, and hasn‚Äôt had a single accident in the house‚Äîwell, except for one that we can‚Äôt really blame him for. My husband has a golf putting green in his office that looks a lot like grass‚Ä¶ so Dock just did what he thought he was supposed to do!

We gave him his first haircut recently. Since it's been so hot, we opted for a more practical summer cut instead of the traditional Portuguese Water Dog style‚Äîbut don‚Äôt worry, he‚Äôll be rocking the classic look come winter.

He‚Äôs already been out on the boat a few times and absolutely loves the water. He fits into our family so naturally‚Äîit feels like he‚Äôs always been with us.

Thank you for being such a thoughtful and responsible breeder. It‚Äôs clear how much care you put into your work, and it made the whole process so smooth for us. More breeders should follow your example!

I would more than recommend.  Not only is this the best breed we have ever had, But the breeder is top-notch.  Thank you for our family member, We are forever grateful.

Lisa was fantastic from the beginning all the way through our adoption of our beautiful Portuguese Water Dog, Remi. She cares deeply for each of her puppies and for the breed in general, and she only uses the highest standards for her litters. She has so much knowledge of the background of the breed and can answer all of your questions. Also, she is very particular about how she places the puppies and wants to match them to get the very best outcomes, which worked very well in our case. we love our dog and would highly recommend Lisa to anyone interested in getting a wonderful Portie!

We got our beautiful Portie from Lisa this past summer. She is currently 10 months old. She is super smart and absolutely devoted to our family. She is in great health and just loves to train.  Lisa was super easy to work with in the process of getting our pup and we were traveling from PA!  Lisa was always prompt with communications and updates and really took the time to learn about us and our goals to select the best puppy match for our family. I couldn‚Äôt be happier with our puppy!

I am writing this review from the dual perspective of an employee and therapist. When I first arrived in Orlando 5 months ago, I had no intention of staying beyond a few months. However, after discovering Camen, my plans quickly changed‚ÄîI‚Äôve since chosen to sign a lease and remain in the area.

As someone who holds high standards for ethical and professional practice, I am often cautious when evaluating organizations. That said, Camen has exceeded my expectations. The administrative team is responsive, communicative, and efficient when it comes to scheduling and managing changes. The management team fosters a warm, welcoming environment and maintains a genuine open-door policy.

What stands out most is the compassion shown to employees, particularly those managing their own diagnoses. As long as there is openness to feedback and a willingness to grow, Camen provides a supportive space to become a quality therapist. The support for students is also outstanding‚Äîconsistent, thorough, and shared among all analysts.

In short, I am grateful to be part of the Camen team and look forward to continuing my journey here. Thank you for welcoming me into this community.

I will say this is the best place for my son . Jeremiah has grown so much because of Tiffany and Yesenia, he‚Äôs quite unrecognizable. Also I for one am a crazy over bearing mother and they are so sweet and understanding. My son went from somewhat non verbal to completely verbal , he wouldn‚Äôt use the toilet and they also got him to use the bathroom. I really feel like this place was heaven sent. Although I‚Äôm hard to deal with I love them all so much. I appreciate them more than they will ever know. I highly recommend them. Admin is amazing , Aba is amazing in my personally experience.

Camen handles their clientele with professionalism and dignity. The kiddos come in, get their ABA (facilitated with much love from competent staff) and are returned to their caregivers safely and with improved behavior. Your child will be safe here and will also make gains in their everyday life, making routines easier for caregivers. Fill your ABA needs here!

This location of Camen is a great option if you are looking for a school and an ABA therapy place in one! They have a well-equiped team of therapists and analysts that truly care about your child, you will be satisfied with your experience at Camen!

What I love most about Camen, specifically this location, is the how dedicated each staff is to not only their clients but the families they serve. Seeing the clinical director Kayleigh continually advocate for all of the therapists, while tirelessly seeking ways to improve even the smallest processes, is the reason why Camen is thriving. With all of uncertainties of ABA in the area, the one constant is the hard work each member puts into creating a supportive environment!

We love Camp Mojos! Camp Mojos is not merely a dog daycare; it is an enrichment camp that operates in a pack style. That means that your dog will have small playgroups with dogs of similar temperaments. Camp Mojos gave our dog Talisker such thoughtful play and enrichment. Not only did Tali have fun playing with dogs of his similar play style, but he learned commands and his training at home was reinforced by the camp's enrichment activities. The counselors are expert at reading dogs' body language and anticipating problems before they occur - they gave us great suggestions for ways that we could enhance Tali's training and development. We honestly cannot say enough good things about Camp Mojos - we just left Tallahassee in May, and we have not found a dog daycare that comes close. The camp counselors truly love your pet!

We love Camp Mojo‚Äôs!

Our dog Birdie is shy/scared around new people and takes a bit of time to warm up, but absolutely loves going to daycare once she does. We were so happy to find Camp Mojo‚Äôs when we moved to Tallahassee. They really gave her time to warm up and went slow with her. Now it‚Äôs her favorite place in the world! It gives me a lot of joy to see her run in and give kisses to every staff member. And we also love the daily pupdate. They do tons of enrichment with the dogs and keep them in small groups. I feel like it‚Äôs well worth the cost.

Thanks so much for taking great care of our Birdie!

I have been singing the praises of this facility for years until now! Clearly there is a lead person at CM that is not friendly.  Not always but the edge is clearly there for all to experience. I love the staff there and my dog has loved going to CM three days a week for 2 years.   My investments over the past two years are in the thousands of dollars.  On holidays I brought food for the crew.
So I was amazed at how non-caring their manager was when I adopted a new dog and asked for an opportunity to bring him into the Camp family.  First, no response, except to tell me I needed vet clearances, which I quickly obtained.  Six weeks rolls by and I have now asked multiple times for a dog trial visit.  So I called and reluctantly pulled my existing dog out of their program.  The person I spoke with could only cite staff rules.  Oh my what a disappointment.  Customer facing people should be customer friendly.  I guess Camp Mojos has more than enough customers as she seemed quite satisfied with losing my business.

My husky used to be a regular at daycare at Camp Mojos a couple of years back. I have since moved to a new city, and I‚Äôve tried several daycares here‚Äînone of them come close to Camp Mojos. They stand out not just for how well they care for the dogs, but for the level of intentionality behind everything they do.

There‚Äôs a real structure to the day: scheduled activities, daily photo updates, and thoughtful programming that makes it clear they‚Äôre not just filling time‚Äîthey‚Äôre engaging your dog. One time, they even had the dogs make artwork. That kind of creativity and attention to detail is uncommon.

If Camp Mojos ever expands, I hope Orlando, FL is next‚ÄîI‚Äôd sign my dog up immediately.

My dog always leaves Camp Mojo‚Äôs happy and exhausted! I love the one on one enrichment they do as well as the daily ‚Äúpup-dates‚Äù with lots of pictures and a cute summary of my dog‚Äôs day. All the staff are very sweet and friendly. You can tell they all love dogs and make sure to give each one special attention.

We visited Camp Run-A-Mutt to have our Pomeranian (Pepper) complete a temperament test. Mike was FANTASTIC with Pepper! She is shy around other dogs but being able to view the interaction live on the Mutt Cam reassured us Pepper was in good hands. Excellent customer service from the front desk as well. Dr. Brandi is AMAZING and has a wonderful team that makes this business successful!  Pepper will soon be a regular here! Thank you Brandi & Mike!

This is an amazing business.  Mike and staff do a phenomenal job of taking care of your dogs whether it be daycare or boarding.   If you have to board, rest assured there is always one or two staff who stay overnight with the dogs; they are never alone like most places.   If I could give Camp Run A Mutt more stars I would.

Such a great experience every time! Our dog spent a week there while we we‚Äôre out of town, and this was our third time, and we absolutely love it, and so does our pup. We love that we can check in via the cameras, and we love that our fur baby gets to roam around with lots of space and lots of friends.

Edit 2/2: Since the timing of my review seems to be a concern, I‚Äôll clarify. After Maeve‚Äôs stay, I decided that communal boarding was not the right fit for us. A recent trip left me scrambling to find boarding and reminded me of our experience (and how I wish I felt comfortable with facilities like this). After reviewing the photos and videos from 2023, I decided to share our experience.
While I appreciate the business responding, their focus appears to be more on the timing of my review than on the substance of the concerns. Even if I had reached out at the time, it would not have changed our experience nor would I have been comfortable with any explanation, as it seems we have different views on what‚Äôs acceptable. My intent here is to share information transparently so that others can make informed decisions for their pets.

Edit 1/2: I‚Äôve added a photo showing the date they were taken in response to the owner. I also figured out how to add videos so I‚Äôve added those as well. And again, there‚Äôs no reason for one dog to be restrained in an area with 20+ off leash dogs. Several of them were herding her around the yard, which isn‚Äôt an inherently negative behavior, but the point is how this can make the restrained dog feel vulnerable and potentially display fear-based behaviors.

My dog, Maeve, stayed at Camp-Run-A-Mutt in 2023. I hate leaving bad reviews so I chose not to but recently came across the video I took of her when we got back home after her stay (of which I‚Äôve attached screenshots). There are a lot of positive reviews for this business, and it makes me wonder if anyone else has had a bad experience and also chose not to say anything. I‚Äôm not looking for any response from the business, I just want to put the situation out there for people to consider when booking a stay for their dogs.

I saw a sore under her chin the day she got home from her stay. It looked so bad in person that I initially thought maybe another dog had bitten her. But I remembered there were a couple of times I checked the cameras and saw her itching under her chin and just didn‚Äôt think much about it at the time. She must have been allergic to something on site, but that‚Äôs not the issue. She was supposed to get a bath on her on her last day (which I paid extra for), and I‚Äôd assume someone would‚Äôve seen it and notified me if she was bathed (or bathed properly). So the thought that she was neglected enough for no one to take note of her constantly itching enough to cause a wound like that, for the sore to not be noticed at all, and them taking my money and not bathing her (or she was bathed and someone saw the sore and chose to not tell me - I‚Äôm not sure which is worse) put such a bad taste in my mouth.

I also have a video recording of one of the live streams where Maeve is the only dog on a leash out of ~30 dogs. The worker was walking her around the yard and visibly tugging on the leash to make her walk. If you know anything about dog behavior, one dog being restrained and the rest being free causes anxiety in the restrained dog. They was tugging on her when she was visibly cowering because she was anxious. I have no idea why she was leashed but I can say for an absolute fact that she doesn‚Äôt have a mean bone in her body to have caused an issue to warrant that. I have a problematic dog, bless his heart, and she is not that. And even if something did happen, remove her from the area and call me. In the video, the worker eventually takes the leash off of her, she walks over to the fence line and gets pushed against the fence and bullied by another dog RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE WORKER and they didn‚Äôt react at all. I included a series of screenshots of this since Google isn‚Äôt allowing me to add a video.

This review is not a dig at the owners of the facility, because I imagine it‚Äôs difficult to manage a business like this and stay on top of everything. But due to our experience with the staff at the time, it wasn‚Äôt worth returning or even making a huff about it with them because it wasn‚Äôt going to change Maeve‚Äôs experience.

I can't say enough good things about Camp Run-a-Mutt Gainesville. They've totally raised the bar of doggy daycare and boarding. I've taken Huckleberry at least 20 times, including a 3-night boarding stay and have always had a great experience. Not to mention, they do a fantastic job at trimming his nails. I would highly recommend CRAM Gainesville to anyone looking for doggy daycare, grooming, or boarding!

I been seeing Dr Campbell for the past two months, and I'm extremely happy with the results. From the very first visit, he took the time to understand my concerns and tailored a treatment plan that has made a noticeable difference. I've experienced significant
improvement in shoulder and foot mobility and pain ,I feel better overall.
The staff is friendly, the office is welcoming, and appointments are always on time. I highly recommend [Dr Campbell  at sport Rehab] to anyone looking for quality chiropractic care'

There are Chiropractors....then there is Dr Campbell. Had a Serious Back issue and after my visit today, I feel Great!! I used Dr Brian Campbell before I took off to California...and when I got back and had an issue....I ran to his office. Thank you Dr Brian Campbell.

I had some lower back issues and Doc fixed me up in one visit, recommended some stretches for the problem area, and had me feeling back to normal. For most issues, it takes a dozen visits, one time fixes are not the norm, trust the process!

Friendly office staff. They were able to accommodate me last minute for an appointment.

Dr. Campbell is the nicest guy and a master at what he does. The relief from pain I felt after leaving their office was night and day. I cannot recommend them enough!

If I could give Dr. Campbell‚Äôs office 6/5 stars I would. Amazing communication, super friendly staff, and incredibly efficient with their timing during appointments. I will send anyone that mentions needing an adjustment or chiropractic work, and I will continue going here when I am in need!

Thank you for everything!

This place absolutely amazing! The amount of care I see in the therapists, and how well they interact with their clients is incredible. Can Do has so much to offer, and they really go above and beyond to help the kids as much as possible.

I have been taking my daughter for over a year. Mr.Collie has been wonderful with her and helped her alot, he makes speech fun for her. I have had to see a few of the other therapists and they are all amazing. Their whole team is amazing!!! I absolutely recommend them to others.

My son has been going there since he was 18 months old he's about to turn 3 and let me tell you this group of individuals really go above and beyond with there clients my son loves it there so much and loves all his therapists.  He's come so far because of them and I couldn't be more happy with the services he gets. Highly recommend Stephanie and Jo for occupational therapists and Neil and Theresa for speech therapists. Thank all of you for how hard you for work for not only my son but every other kiddo there. I speak for most parents when I say we truly appreciate it.

We attend speech & OT.  Mr. Neil and Ms Jo are simply superhero‚Äôs.   We have seen a HUGE improvement with my son!    They talk with you (parents)  and explain everything they are doing, working on,  how we can help at home.  They engage with the littles like they‚Äôre best friends, so gentle and kind. The  Front desk has been very helpful with getting us scheduled as well.   Super affordable  self pay rates.   All around a great place for my son,  and no long waitlist! Very happy here

My 8 year old son has been coming for a while now, and I have nothing but great things to say about the entire staff and the way they help. Everybody is always so courteous and you can tell the therapists are passionate about helping children. My son always looks forward to come to his speech sessions. Mr. Neil has been great and I‚Äôve seen a huge improvement since his lessons started! Keep up the good work :)

provider_name: Canine Academy Dog Training, Anna Nylander
review_text: My husband and I recently rescued Bennie.  Bennie had behavioral problems that we were doubtful he would never overcome.  Luckily, I was referred to Anna.  Bennie‚Äôs first interaction with Anna did not go well.  He tried to eat her! Now, she and Bennie are best of buddies.  I have noticed a change in Bennie‚Äôs behavior. He is listens and is more obedient.  He is an adorable and loving dog.  Anna helped us in more ways than she will ever know.  Anna‚Äôs love and understanding of dogs shows.  Anna was worth EVERY penny!! So glad we met.  She and I have become friendsüòä THANK YOU ANNA FOR EVERYTHING!!!!!!!!!

provider_name: Canine Academy Dog Training, Anna Nylander
review_text: My mom and I recently adopted Chloe, a tiny Maltese/poodle who was rescued from very abusive owners. We were looking for a way to get Chloe into better shape- Chloe has a lot of trauma and fear, she also gets startled and barks very easily. We have brought Chloe to stay with Anna for 3+ days twice now! And chloe and Anna have a very lovely bond. Anna definitely knows how to train/ communicate with animals in ways that most people don‚Äôt! She really is a dog whisperer. And Chloe is on her way to become a service dog. We couldn‚Äôt have done it without the training Anna has provided + the constant tips and reassurance we receive from Anna almost daily! Im so relieved my Chloe has a safe place to learn and I thank Anna for that!

provider_name: Canine Academy Dog Training, Anna Nylander
review_text: We adopted Chloe in February 2023 - she was abused and only a year old. Our goal was to train her as a service dog for a family member. We immediately started training at PetSmart to socialize her. She did well and even though she progressed through 4 private training classes and passed the intermediate class at PetSmart she did not know how to sit (part of her abuse was that she was kicked.) We scheduled a boot camp with Anna and she went to her home for 3 days. Chloe learned to sit and we are so proud of her! We continued at PetSmart through the Advanced class and then scheduled another boot camp with Anna to address distractions, barking and to learn her service (interrupted behaviors.)  Chloe made so much progress. She is doing much better with distractions and has truly learned interrupted behaviors as her service. It is actually amazing how she learned this so quickly. Chloe is starting to make progress with barking and Anna taught us lots of ways to continue to address this with patience. Anna has been available daily for our questions since Chloe finished boot camp and has provided lots of reinforcement. We absolutely plan to do one more boot camp in a few months for correction, maintenance and reinforcement of service dog behaviors. Anna is a dog whisperer and we completely trust her.

provider_name: Canine Academy Dog Training, Anna Nylander
review_text: I am sorry to say that Ana didn't live up to reviews. We asked Ana to come and meet our Basenji and see weather or not they get along. Our Luna loved Ana. So we agreed to a 4 part training session.  For $550.00. Our first session was at a pet store . We met there so that Luna could meet other dogs and start socializing her. But what I really was hoping is That Luna could be trained so that we could go to public places with her.the next session was at the same place and again Ana brought her dog with her telling us that her dog would be there to make it easier for Luna to except other dogs. Luna would growl when dogs came near her. Well we went to the park with Luna and wanted to see Luna's reaction through the fence. . It wasn't good. We called Ana and asked her to meet at the park the next time but made excuses not to. We needed to go away for a couple of days so we made arrangements with Ana to watch LUNA. WE WANTED TO SEE WHERE SHE WOULD BE STAYING AND SO WE SAID OK BEACH HOUSE IN HOLLYWOOD.  We'll it turn out that is not where she stayed. Ana wasn't honest with us. Will picked her up at Ana,s home but couldn't let us in because she said her dog was very sick and had diarrhea all over the house. We don't believe that. Any way we still wanted to give Ana a chance we contacted her and told her that we were very upset with all of this. And wanted her to work with Luna and her walking. She agreed.  In a couple of weeks she said. When we called back she was sick. We then asked for the money back for the 2 remaining lessons. We haven't heard back from Ana. Long story short Ana is not someone to leave your dog with and as far a training she basically tells you what to do..she doesn't train the dog in our case.

provider_name: Canine Academy Dog Training, Anna Nylander
review_text: Anna is amazing and can do what no other trainers can! Aside from being genuine and easy to talk to, she truly LOVES dogs and knows everything about them! She can answer any question you have and she‚Äôs good at explaining new commands. Before meeting Anna, we used an app to train our chihuahua puppy virtually and she didn‚Äôt learn anything. Now, Anna has taught us command that we can use in any situation and our Gigi has mastered them! So grateful to have found her. Thank you, Anna!
Staff is amazingly nice! & the dogs are so well-behaved, the residents enjoyed themselves! Can't wait to have them again!

My 3mo Cavapoo was in need of emergency care after ingesting something she shouldn't & not only did they provide the proper and immediate care to her, but they also provide our family comfort. The hugs go all around. Thanks

This organization is nothing short of amazing and joining as a volunteer was the best decision. Not only do they provide emotional support for those in need, they are also providing the knowledge for children and adults to properly care for dogs. With very precise and honest evaluations, the canines chosen for therapy work and their owners are given the privilege to attend nursing homes, hospitals and schools. The staff is always so friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable. Canine Assisted Therapy continues to provide me with the experience of bringing joy to so many people with the help of my furry friend. This organization brings smiles to thousands of faces by creating bonds between human and canine.

I had the opportunity to meet with Debra Berger and her staff and was very impressed by their overall organization and by their standards and process to effectively select, train and place their volunteer Pet Therapy Teams.

It was clear from their passionate presentation and from the other comments and information on line, that they truly provide levels of service that facilities could use as a standard when deciding to establish a relationship with any organization offering Pet Therapy Services.

As a pet owner who understands the power of a loving relationship with his dog, it was exciting to learn about the positive impact that Canine Assisted Therapy is having in our community.

Great organization serving people from all walks of life. The canine volunteers paired with their humans receive professional and appropriate training and then are placed at the best location needing their services including schools, nursing homes, and rehabilitation centers. The organization's leadership is passionate about the services provided and strive to achieve positive outcomes for all involved. I highly recommend this organization and believe it is the standard that every pet therapy program should follow!

We have been using Canine Cabana since our dog Leia was a puppy (she is almost 10yrs old now) and she loves going there. The staff is always friendly and attentive to the pet's needs. On our most recent visit Kayla went above and beyond. Our dog became ill during her stay and Kayla not only kept me informed of the situation, but also arranged for a vet visit and got our girl taken care of. If you are looking for a place for your dog, whether it is a day stay, training or lodging, consider Canine Cabana, you won't be disappointed.

Canine Cabana is amazing. Everyone that works there is friendly and professional. They offer all kinds of different services for your dog and their training program is top notch. I am a neurotic pet parent and their level of service checks all of my boxes!  My dog loves going to Canine Cabana and they have the best enrichment activities!

Absolutely love this place! I‚Äôve been using their daycare and training services, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the care and professionalism they provide. The staff is incredibly friendly and clearly passionate about dogs ‚Äî my pup gets so excited every time we pull into the parking lot!

The daycare is a fantastic way for my dog to burn energy and socialize in a safe, well-supervised environment. And the training has been a game changer ‚Äî the trainers are knowledgeable, patient, and really take the time to work with both the dogs and the owners.

I feel completely at ease leaving my dog here, knowing she‚Äôs in great hands and actually learning while having fun. Highly recommend to any dog owner looking for a reliable, caring, and professional team!

My dog Paisley loves Canine Cabana! The staff is loving & friendly,  my dog boards & goes for baths, She's usually very shy and nervous when going to places but not here! We Love the staff, they do a good job at keeping the place clean and they always put the pets/clients first.

We absolutely love this place. From the moment we stepped in-we are family. I was hesitant and a bit freaked to leave our 4 months old puppy for a day of orientation. I got a phone call in the middle of the day with updates and when we went to pick him up- our pup was happy and relaxed-tells it all. We just finished 'puppy social" part of the training program and very happy with results. looking forward to next level of training. highly recommend this place

Joseph at K9 Command is nothing short of magical with dogs! I know four people who have used his services, and they all rave about the transformations he's made with their pups. His expertise and passion for training shine through in every interaction.

I can‚Äôt wait to get my own dog to him‚ÄîI'm even willing to drive an hour to make it happen! That says a lot about my confidence in his abilities. If you‚Äôre looking for someone who truly understands dogs and can bring out the best in them, I highly recommend Joseph at K9 Command. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!

Worked with Joe on training our 2 yr old lab Skye.  After our first lesson, we were already seeing results, and after the 2nd lesson her progression is outstanding.  Skye continues to improve working 10-15 minutes twice per day.
Joe's s insights into dog behavior helps you understand what your dog is thinking as she is learning.  He definitely knows dog training.  I would highly recommend him for training your dog.  Pleasure to work with.

I can‚Äôt recommend Joe enough! My foster-to-adopt dog, Alfie, was terrified of people, reactive to dogs, and bit his leash on every walk. After just two sessions, he‚Äôs calmer, learning commands, and even let Joe pet him! Joe‚Äôs patience and understanding made a huge difference ‚Äî Alfie is finally starting to relax and enjoy life.

Very concise and informative hands-on instruction. Lots of useful tips and detailed reading material. Also provides list of places offering products discounts. My dog was focused and enjoyed his training time. We highly recommend Canine Command.
Joe from canine command made training my puppy fun and easy, all with a positive attitude! I would highly recommend him to train your dog!!

called this campus to ask a question that i could not find the answer to on the website, the woman i spoke to was very rude and nasty and made me feel like i was dumb for not knowing the answer. calling was a big step for me since im autistic so this has been a major set back for me.
A wonderful organization that spreads hope to the disabled through the unconditional loyalty of assistance canines.
AWESOME place!!! Wonderful staff!!! Clean, friendly, warm atmosphere....  Wonderful trainers and dogs...

Canine Companies is a wonderful company.  My granddaughter has to have a service dog . They are here to get paired with their dog this week, along with 6 other families. The training that the handlers put into these dogs is unbelievable. We just did an outing with the dogs to a business mall . The dogs stayed focused on the person they were paired with.  I loved watching them all in action this morning. I would recommend them to anyone who needs one . Mind you, it takes up to 2 yrs before you can begin getting paired with a dog. But it's worth it.
Update: We had to go back up to get recertification. Now we're good for 1 yr.
Love these people who take care of all the dogs. There were more families there  to get paired with their dog.

I've been a volunteer with this nonprofit for over ten years.  It has an important mission, providing highly trained service dogs free of charge to people with disabilities.  It's a wonderful place to volunteer and they create a feeling of family for all involved.

We decided to start one-on-one training with Chip because he was an excessive barker and had difficulty following directions. He was also prone to escaping out the front door and running down the street (we live near a busy intersection, so this was very dangerous). Chelsea has been so knowledgeable and patient with Chip (and with us!). She has taught us many commands to use with Chip, and Chip has made incredible strides in listening, obeying commands, and controlling his barking. And Chip adores her, which is just an added bonus. We weren't sure if training would work, but Chelsea has completely transformed our dog!

With the stress of traveling overseas for two weeks, I needed to find someone who was willing and capable of taking care of my brand new baby girl ‚ÄúBella‚Äù. Chelsea went above and beyond working with our four month old, Yorkshire Terrier. She was considerate and understanding, knowing the stress that I was going through leaving Bella behind. I received multiple pictures and videos of Bella‚Äôs day. I was reinsured that I found the right person for the task. With a different time zones , me being a day ahead, it made it a little difficult but Chelsea was considerate with answering my questions about Bella‚Äôs eating habits. She went out of her way to ensure she was eating and gaining weight. I'm sure you can see in the photos Bella was extremely happy. Chelsea bought Bella home upon my return and we were given a report card of all the things Bella was introduced to. This was more than I expected. We appreciate all that Chelsea has done.

Barkley spent a week with Chelsea on puppy training. Chelsea went above and beyond working with our shorty jack Russell who is only 12 weeks old . Her communication and follow through with us was outstanding! Just after a week, Barkley has better manners. We have 3 private classes to go and with Chelsea‚Äôs guidance we feel confident Barkley will be on the right path to be an awesome doggie. We highly recommend Chelsea!!

Chelsea was so helpful in teaching us how to work with our new puppy. He's doing great, and all the impulse control work she did with him helped immensely. He was like a different and much better behaved pup after every session.

I would highly recommend Canine Connections LLC for any and all your training needs! Chelsea knows what she is doing when it comes to dogs and their behaviors. We have a little corgi  who needs training to become a proper gentleman of society. Chelsea was the perfect person to help us do that! Her training program is personally tailored to you and your  pets needs and it truly shows! She found what works best for us and Sevro and now we are armed with the proper tools to help him be the best dog he can be!

Canine Counselors came highly recommended to me by my boss ‚Äî and wow, what a game changer. Working with Danielle has truly changed our lives and set our golden retriever puppy, Ford, up for lifelong success. We started the program when Ford was about 3.5 months old, and I can confidently say it was the perfect time to begin.

From the very first phone call, I felt a huge sense of relief. I reached out feeling overwhelmed, like we were doing something wrong, and Danielle instantly helped us realize that everything we were experiencing was totally normal for a young puppy. Her reassurance, expertise, and calm, kind approach gave us the tools we needed ‚Äî not just to train Ford, but to feel confident and capable as new dog parents.

Danielle is incredibly knowledgeable and truly passionate about what she does. She took the time to explain the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind every method, always tailoring the training to fit Ford‚Äôs unique personality. Her support went far beyond the basic obedience work ‚Äî she instilled in us the skills to keep growing and reinforcing good habits at home.

One of the best parts of the program is the lifetime access to group lessons and annual check-ins, which we plan to take full advantage of. It gives us peace of mind knowing that we‚Äôll always have continued guidance as Ford grows.

Thanks to Danielle, Ford is quickly becoming the best boy in the world ‚Äî and we feel empowered and equipped to keep him on that path. We are endlessly grateful and can‚Äôt recommend Danielle and Canine Counselors enough!

Amazing program! I cannot recommend this company enough and we were lucky to get Delvin as our trainer. Angie, our 2 year old Lab, has learned so many new habits and skills that have been crucial in adding value to our daily lives and routine. Delvin is caring, knowledgeable and extremely attentive. We appreciate him and Canine Counselors, such a worthwhile investment for our family‚Äôs wellbeing. Thanks!

We had an amazing experience working with Nora as our dog trainer. From the beginning, it was clear how knowledgeable and thoughtful she is. Nora was incredibly patient‚Äînot just with our pup, but with our older dog who loved the lessons to steal the treats. She took the time to explain the ‚Äúwhy‚Äù behind every technique, which really helped us feel confident in raising a well-behaved dog.

She guided us through the tricky puppy phase with practical tools and consistent support. One of the things we appreciated most was how available she was to answer our questions, even outside of scheduled sessions. It made such a difference to know we had her guidance when new challenges popped up.

Thanks to Nora, we have a happy, obedient good boy‚Äîand we feel empowered to keep reinforcing the lessons she taught us. Highly recommend!

We had the best at home training experience with Canine Counselor. Our trainer, Nora, was patient and very informative. Our puppy, Lucy, began with Nora when she was about 9 months old and Nora gave her all the tools to become a well behaved, social and less reactive dog. Now we are able to take Lucy for walks, go to stores and have her around the house without destroying toys and furniture. Nora is amazing.

We had such a great experience with our trainer Nora. She was so kind, helpful and patient with us in getting our golden retriever puppy Lily to being the best dog we could have ever imagined. She learned sit, stay, bed, leave it, drop it, paw, wait, side, and more! Our biggest lesson was getting her to walk good on leash without pulling and now we can take our puppy anywhere! Definitely recommend Canine Counselors. And again, a huge shout out to Nora! ü´∂üèº‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Canine Linguistics - Dog Training and Boarding
review_text:
We brought our Rottweiler Juicy, all the way from Huntsville, AL for vacation and she had the time of her life! She did a week of daycare only, but made tons of friends and clearly had a blast. The staff handled her with so much love and care, she was treated like family. They took the dogs hiking, swimming, and kept them active and happy.
