Yvan is so in tune with each and everyone of my dogs he‚Äôs helped me train. From the obedience to the bitework aspect. No one else I would train with for French Ring or suit sport.

Every session we had together was extremely personalized and you feel apart of the the DRDT family right away ‚ù§Ô∏è

Finding the right dog trainer is like finding a needle in a haystack.
There are a lot of people who call themselves dog trainer's.
They all tend to follow cookie-cutter way of teaching.
At Down Right Dog training, it's not a business it's a passion. They make your dogs training into a game .
Your dog is playing and doesn't know he is getting trained.
They work with all size and all different breeds of dogs.
Yvan Granados is not only the highest ranked Decoy he is also a veterinarian.
No other trainer have the years of experience and the knowledge that he has.
He trains every dog based on that dog's needs ( no cookie cutter training).
We have been going to Down Right Dog training for almost 1 year.
My Belgian Malinois Roky is working on French Ring sport .
We (Roky and me )train with Yvan 2x week.
Thanks to Yvan Granados' training, Roky has
been able to overcome some issues such as dog reactivity , fear of decoy stick, and full bite suite.
Roky looks forward to his training sessions.
We will continue to training with Yvan Granados for a very long time .
ROKY LOVES ‚ù§Ô∏è HIM !!!

Lissette Bretos & Roky

I love Down Right Dog Training! I sent my dog  Julie to them for 6 weeks and when I brought her back home I noticed how much more attentive and confident she was. The training is holistic and positive as well as accommodating to all dogs with different skill sets. Now that she has a good foundation, it‚Äôs so much easier to teach her new skills. Julie is always wagging her tail during training and I can tell how much she loves it!

Where to start‚Ä¶Yvan is AMAZING!!! He was referred to me from my breeder and my training mentor to work with my Giant Schnauzer for bitework and honestly it‚Äôs such a gift when I find people who can truly work my girl!  His understanding of dog behavior and ability to read body language is something you do not see often and Rowena has grown from working with Yvan for PSA after only 2 seminars and I cannot wait till we see him again!

I‚Äôm back with another update! I‚Äôve officially done 3 seminars with Yvan and my girl continues to grow! Absolutely love the dog she‚Äôs turning into!!!
Patricia was the most helpful person I've spoken to after calling over a dozen similar businesses just today! What an amazing person to have, helping children every day... Thank you!

I wholeheartedly recommend this center. My son have been receiving their services for a few months now and the improvement we‚Äôve noticed is amazing. Maria and the group of team members (OT, PT and speech) work as an integrated group to meet each individual need. They have been instrumental to my family and are always giving feedback, recommendations and education on different matters to support our loved one.

This is a wonderful center. All therapists are kind.  My daughter has excelled in her motor skills and fine tuning her handwriting.  Patty was amazing!  Mar√≠a and Alex were tentative, kind, and always available to answer any questions or concerns I had.  Spring camp is also amazing.

Dream, hope and believe therapy offered speech, OT and PT for my son. While receiving these therapies, he has significantly improved. Every member of the staff is kind, competent, and caring.   Maria, the owner treat them like their kids. They all love her. Additionally, she also provides spring and sumner camp. She has all the kids engaged in various activities that they can use in their daily lives. Excellent place and staff. Highly recommend them. Our children are in good hands.

This clinic and its therapists are amazing! They go the extra mile to accommodate to your schedule and to make your kid work and enjoy the therapy. My daughter has progressed through the years with them and continue to improve. Thank you DHB!

Stopped in and Emily and Kiersten were bartending. Kiersten was a sweetheart! Very nice, informative and personable. Told us the brewmaster Scott is very creative with flavoring the new brews. She was right. They have some good combinations and flavors.  The Brangus beer and pineapple cider were good.

There was a beer and pizza special for $13. We should have stuck with just the beer.
Pizza looks good but lackluster. Not much flavor. Would not get it again.

Would return for beer or cider and because Kiersten and Emily were nice.

Such an Awesome brewery a few minutes outside of Gainesville and it was my first time visiting the tech hub area. I had a great experience trying out a few of the NA drinks, will come back for the food and food trucks another time. The Brewery is spacious with a few board games. I'll definitely be coming back to visit again.

Daft Cow Brewery is located within the San Felasco Tech Center just south of Alachua in the back north of the complex.

The brewery is the cleanest brewery I have ever visited and that includes the two single stall room co-ed bathrooms.  Two seating areas with the bar sandwiched in-between.  There is an event room just as large as the brewery space accessible through large adjacent doors. This space is available for rent and houses local bands for customer entertainment on various nights and brewery events which include Bingo and Trivia.

The whole complex is powered by solar panels in the walkway corridor and features a food truck on most days.  The brewery has their own small offerings of food. Sorry no picts of either the food or beverage menu. However, their website is up to date with that information.

The brewmaster seems to favor IPA's with about six to seven different types. We love IPA's so this is great for us.  He also has his recipes expertly down pat. This guy has everything down to a science and all of his offerings of brews are incredible.  Sizes include 5, 10, and 16 ounce glasses with the option to get your own growler filled.   Taste samples are happily provided if unsure about making a choice.  If alcohol isn't your thing, they offer non-alcoholic beverages.

Leashed dog and child friendly with games on the premises.  I highly recommend giving this brewery a try.
This is the best brewery in the world. It is super pet friendly and they have the greatest beers!

We have been here once before and it's been great both times.  The atmosphere is relaxed and the beer is great.  Cold beer and great service from Danny, Kino, and Rachel.  Plenty of variety for all beer lovers to try.

As a mother of a child who attends Daily Miracle PPEC,I can honestly say this place has been a true blessing for our family. From day one, the entire staff has treated my daughter with so much love, respect, and care. They go above and beyond every single day, and it shows in the smiles and progress we see in our little girl.

The nurses, therapists, and all the staff members are not only highly professional but also deeply compassionate. They understand the unique needs of each child and make sure they feel safe, included, and loved. It‚Äôs clear that this isn‚Äôt just a job for them ‚Äî they genuinely care about the children.

Daily Miracle has become like a second home for my daughter, and I can‚Äôt thank them enough for the incredible support they provide, not just to her, but to us as parents too. We feel truly blessed to have found a place where our child is so well cared for and cherished.

I wholeheartedly recommend Daily Miracle to any family with a child who has special needs ‚Äî they truly live up to their name.

A daycare, especially one for special needs children, must have loving, caring and professional owners and staff. Daily Miracles  PPEC has exactly that. The owners of this family business are of the highest quality, both personally and professionally. Dailys and her husband Luis are excellent parents themselves so they are well suited to care for your little ones.

The staff's professionalism is unmatched‚Äîthey are not only highly skilled but also genuinely compassionate and attentive to every child's needs.

The team goes above and beyond to ensure each child receives top-notch care, creating a safe, nurturing, and supportive environment. Communication with the staff is seamless, and they are very understanding.

The first time I met the owner, the place had just opened. We just knew that was the right place for our daughter. She had been to PPEC before so we had expectations.  We could tell the owner was truthful, sincere, and cared about what she does.  The place is always CLEAN and welcoming. All the staff members are respectful. Our daughter‚Äôs first day at Daily Miracle was amazing.  They took care of her so well that we laughed, saying that it was a day spa for special children like ours.  Dailys and her staff have brought so much joy in the life of our daughter.  They are caring, loving, and committed to what they do best and it shows everyday. All parents with a special child should have an ally like Daily Miracle. Life is so much easier!

Advocating for your child is hard enough especially when they need extra care. It‚Äôs rare when others do the same for your child. Dailys PPEC has advocated for my child from the start. Love that even when they can‚Äôt help they will find answers for you. Plus the growth my child has grown due to their services along with companies they work with! My fav part has to be the low ratio. One nurse for 4-6 kids, and one ABA per child or two. Plus the activities they do are inclusive to each child need! Highly recommended.

Having completed both pre and post rehab for my right hip replacement, I cannot say enough about the assistance I received from the highly qualified staff at the Watson Clinic Center for Rehabilative Medicine.
The PTs and their teams were not only knowledgeable experts in their field but worked hard right along with me as they encouraged me to get back to being in the best physical condition possible.
I would highly recommend this facility and its team of professionals and will certainly hope to be lucky enough to be in their care if an occasion arises.

The photo is looking out of the Arts & Music windows on the second floor. It was raining .The Arts& Music program offers a space for patients and their "people" to relax.  It can help people find an outlet for the stress that comes with cancer.

My experience at highland physical Therapy was great. Chris, Ray and Brian were great. They were always positive, freindly and always pushing you a little more every session to reach your best. At the beginning when you are at the high pain level they never pushed you more than you could handle and the time you got to the last session you are ready to be on your own with confidence. The exercises were easy. (Sometimes) They had me laughing. Overall a great Therapy session. üëç Highly recommend Highlands physical therapy department.

My review is specific to the physical therapy department. I went for a shoulder problem and saw Brenna first. After that, it was mostly Casey. Both of them were great and I would like to thank Brenna and Casey for their help and guidance through my rehab.

I was able to complete my physical therapy sessions and today  I rang the bell signifying completion. I'm done! I was pleasantly surprised that after one session with Brenna and the team, my pain was reduced 50%. One session! That was amazing. Now, after a month of PT, it is not quite back to pre-therapy range of motion, but the pain is no longer there unless I really overextend my arm. I leave with 98% range of motion and almost no pain.

When I first came in, putting on a shirt or coat was like feeling knives in my shoulder. When I rolled over at night, I woke up from the sharp pains. I was uncomfortable to say the least. Now, I am able to dress without pain and sleep normally and pain free.

Since today was my last day, I needed coaching for what to do at home. Casey did a great job of coaching me how to keep stretching and improving. She gave me five new stretching exercises, which can be done as part of my home workouts. I'm confident in achieving full range of motion, that last one percent, with home stretching and exercising.

I want to add that everyone who worked with me on the Watson Clinic team was fantastic. Poor Joe was assisting me the first day and had to endure "Joe, you are a bad man!" jokes when the stretching hurt. But Joe, Kylie, Cory and the others were great.

This is my first time ever doing physical therapy so I don't know what I could say to improve the experience. Perhaps, letting me know up front that wearing casual clothes may be best (but not necessary) would have been nice, but I figured it out quickly.

Overall I enjoyed the atmosphere as it was positive, friendly, and encouraging. Everyone was eager to see progress and happy when it happened.

All in all, I highly recommend Brenna, Casey, Chris and the whole team at Watson Clinic Physical Therapy. You are all fantastic at your work and wonderful new friends.

My review is specific to the physical therapy department.
I would like to thank Chris and Sarah for the excellent care & for their outstanding help and guidance through my recovery from my knee surgery.

After one more scheduled PT I will  be complete with my scheduled physical therapy sessions for my knee surgery.
I would say I feel about 85% back to normal.

Something I was not able to do when I first started my PT was to satisfactorily bend my knee.
Now I feel that I have turned a corner & am all but where I hope to be with my total recovery.

They educated me through the process on what to do and not to do.
They made me feel confident and independent that I could achieve ongoing results on my own with a comprehensive home plan.
The detailed exercise take home printouts were extremely helpful & appreciated!!!

I always looked forward to my next appointment & very much enjoyed the very positive atmosphere & continuing encouragement, & affirmation that we ‚Äúwill get there!‚Äù

I highly, highly recommend Chris Ninan and Sarah at Watson Clinic Physical Therapy.

One thing that could have helped me personally would be to have had  a better clarity on which of the new exercises we do in our PT Sessions that I was to focus on to do at home & which previous one‚Äôs I was supposed to stop doing at home until my next appointment.
Having a personal cell number to be able to text Chris for clarification would have been helpful for me.
Watson Clinic‚Äôs My Chart communications are slow & has to be checked regularly, to stay current with communications.
Text messages to personal cell phones are definitely more effective.

Today, I took my fur baby for a couple of vaccines and an overall checkup. I met both Jennifer and Dr. Lee. Dr. Lee took her time examining my baby and thoroughly explained the issues that go along with a senior dog. It was a wonderful experience. My baby and I felt extremely comfortable in this new location. Additionally. My interaction with Jennifer was also great. Dr. Lee is beautiful and has a wealth of knowledge. I will definitely return to this facility for my pet's needs.

Dr. Lee has been my  animals' vet for about 13  years (dog and cat). She has been fantastic, compassionate, very knowledgeable, professional, and caring. I have always been quite comfortable with her medical expertise and care. She has provided superior surgical needs for my pets. I would also recommend her boarding services. I know my pets are provided with  excellent care and attention while I am out of town. In conclusion, I must  compliment her staff. They are all helpful, pleasant, and caring. It is a pleasure interfacing with her and her  entire staff.
Patricia C.

I called to schedule a drop off via on a Saturday. They don‚Äôt offer this type of option for Saturdays, so I ended up scheduling what I thought to be a regular appointment for a Monday. Finally to realize they booked a drop off appointment for the Monday, they were charging the day admission fee and hospitalization fee for each of my cats(2). Neither had even been seen by a doctor. Lack of transparency, terrible communication and definitely trying to get money the easy way. Nasty way to make business

The staff has always taken good care of my pets. Recently I rescued a cat with severe matting, who needed to be neutered & fixed up. Everyone took action. The techs all tried shaving him as much as he‚Äôd let them. Dr. Lee found his uti and sent home some antibiotics. Dr. Ranalli neutered & made sure he was pain free and healthy under the light sedation and finished the job of shaving his mats. His prognosis is now excellent thanks to the wonderful team here! My dogs are also well taken care of. You see my aussie has anxiety and allergies, so Dr.Lee figured out the right supplements to make her less anxious and itchy. My siberian husky is well but he loves to come in once in a while for daycare. This is the best place to take your pets!
Dr. Lee genuinely cares about my pets. She always calls or texts me to see how they‚Äôre feeling after treatment. They also let you know the amount of anything they plan to do for them (tests, etc.)

Kristi is everything I could have hoped for and more in a therapist. Therapy can seem daunting, but from the first session she made me feel comfortable. She truly cares about her patients. She is super flexible and even able to try to fit me in if something comes up abruptly. I am forever grateful to have found this practice. I highly recommend Damron Counseling for anyone in the Tallahassee area searching for a therapist!

When I first contacted Kristi Damron
I was in need of a therapist yesterday. She got me, and made
arrangements for me to see her
very quickly. I find Kristi warm,
very empathetic & engaging. She
is an incredible resource for various clinicians & professional
services in the area. She
knows people! That has been an unexpected bonus for me.
Kristi is a very kind and positive person; she is kind and encouraging. I feel heard and
cared about by Kristi, and that is so key for me.
I also very much appreciate that Kristi is open-minded, flexible, and is very accessible to her clients.
I recommend her highly! 17 stars!

Kristi Damron lied to me and said the other therapists that work there work in the afternoon. She also kept making excuses to not see me or the other therapists to see me. I looked at her website and it said they were open 9am-6pm. I had contacted her over email and she said that she can see me, but then the next day I called  she said she doesn‚Äôt have the time to see me basically. Don‚Äôt go to this place if you don‚Äôt want to receive dishonesty from this therapist.

Kristi is so warm and welcoming. The office space makes you feel right at home. It doesn't make you feel like you're walking into a doctors office. The counselor's at Damron Counseling are knowledgeable and make you feel heard. Highly recommend them.

Kristie is a patient and empathic listener.  She is also a dedicated advocate for her clients, and very well-versed in our mental health system.  This combination is part of what makes Kristie such a wonderful therapist for individuals struggling with a wide variety of mental health concerns.  I would absolutely recommend her counseling services to my own friends and family with the utmost confidence in her ability to provide support and strategies to cope with life‚Äôs challenges!
An awesome dog trainer. Helped me get my pup Kobe trained, even though Kobe was a bit of a trouble maker Daniel took his time and helped Kobe learn everything he needed to. Thank you so much Daniel.
An awesome dog trainer.  Helped me find Chico our Service Dog.  A very kind spirit that cares for humanity.  Thank Daniel De La Rosa.

My son adored Darlene. He looked forward to his sessions and loved the innovative ways they worked together on his speech. She genuinely cared about him and always found activities related to his interests. They played games, took walks, worked outside when the weather was pleasant and did various hands on and interactive activities. His speech soared and i couldn‚Äôt be happier. His confidence improved and now he doesn‚Äôt think twice when in a group of kids. He‚Äôs totally comfortable and participating in conversations. Thank you Darlene for your kind, sweet and caring approach ‚ù§Ô∏è

Darlene has been working with my daughter, Vivienne since she was a toddler, and the transformation has been nothing short of extraordinary. Vivi is absolutely thriving under her care.

Darlene is not only highly skilled as a speech therapist, but she is also one of the kindest and most compassionate people we‚Äôve ever met. She has a natural gift for connecting with children‚ÄîVivi adores every moment with her and looks forward to their sessions with joy and excitement.

Her consistency, punctuality, and radiant disposition make the entire experience seamless and uplifting. We feel truly blessed to have her as part of Vivi‚Äôs journey, and we are eternally grateful for the dedication, patience, and love she pours into her work.

If you are looking for a speech therapist who combines expertise with genuine heart, Darlene is simply exceptional. She has been a light on our path, and I cannot recommend her highly enough.

Darlene has worked with both of my kids.

In 2016, the pediatrician notice delays with my daughter, who was about 2 years old at the time. The pediatrician referred me to Darlene.  She was simply amazing with my daughter.  The quality of care and speech therapy service she provided to my daughter helped her overcome her delays.  Because of this early intervention, my daughter was able to transition smoothly to an early learning center.  Ever since, my daughter has excelled in all of her subjects.  She is quite the social butterfly.
In 2021, my son was exhibiting the same delays as his sister. But his situation was a bit different having been diagnosed with autism.  My son was enrolled in the public school system, which was suppose to provide speech therapy.  There was a lack of consistent services and the fact that he had little to no progress, I had to remove him from the public school system   So, I brought him to Darlene.  At the time, my son wasn‚Äôt functionally speaking.    Now, my son is able to verbal express his needs and is able to have conversations with family and friends.
My kids have always enjoyed going into their sessions with Darlene. I feel that she connects well with the kids and makes the experience for them a fun and enjoyable one.  My experiences with Darlene have always been well informed and positive.
Darlene is wonderful! She makes sessions fun and engaging, and helped my daughter make progress with her speech and communication!  Highly recommend!

I have never had a Dr. listen to me so closely and show as much care as Dr. Darwin. She‚Äôs absolutely amazing! Knowledgeable, patient and wait for it‚Ä¶ she has a sense of humor!  I am so glad I was recommended here. I had immediate relief on my first appointment and actually gained some understanding on what‚Äôs going on in my body. The front desk was as sweet as she was. Great experience! I would recommend anybody that needs a great chiropractor to go here. üôåüèæüôåüèæ

The staff is very welcoming and super friendly. Dr. Darwin does an amazing job at explaining everything step by step and why she will be doing it. Clean office and willing to accommodate for appointments if changes need to be made. Would recommend to anyone who needs a chiropractor.

Office staff is so kind and helpful! I was miserable from a tweaked back and they were able to get me in same day. It is very easy to get appointments that fit easily into your schedule.
Dr Darwin is patient, kind, very knowledge, and just amazing.  I am so thankful as she has gotten me through quite a few sports injuries. Very highly recommend for your chiropractic needs!!!

My back was really hurting and they worked me in even though they were busy. Dr Darwin is very good! I felt relief the first day and by the third day my back was much better. Everyone there is kind and caring.

Two stars only for the nice staff. It's easy to get an appointment, and they are pretty much always on time.
I've been going to the office since October. I'm pregnant and was assured that the doctor knows how to treat pregnant women. Well, she doesn't. I have been suffering from sciatica pain first on the right side and, since November, on the left side. The right side got resolved after I went for acupuncture. The pain on the left side has been making my life miserable since mid November. Every day pain. Every time I stand up and start walking. Not even once Dr Darwin has admitted that she is not able to help and referred me to a different practitioner. Nope, she would just schedule me for another appointment. She would sometimes ask me if I felt better after her adjustments, and my answer was always "no." This Monday was her last "treatment" after which I drove straight to another office. At least, I wanted to get a second opinion. Can anything be done about my sciatica pain? Well, after their first treatment I felt much better. It still hurts, but the pain has reduced by 40% and I'm able to stand up without pain in 8 out of 10 times.
I just wish Dr Darwin admitted her inability to help me. That says a lot about a person.

I dropped off a beautiful yet disregulated husky, pit, chow mix that pulled me down the road on walks, jumped on me and left bruises every day, was willfully defiant upon being given even basic commands, tried to attack every squirrel and rabbit he saw and frightened every pet parent in my neighborhood. Three weeks later I picked up a dog that resembled mine, only he was well mannered, calm, respectful and obedient. Because I have certain physical limitations, I was truly afraid I was going to have to rehome him to keep me from being injured by his over excitement on walks and such. But, Zach and Savannah worked miracles on my beautiful boy and now he and I are both safe on walks, and so are the neighborhood pets and critters. I can't say enough positive things about their training program. My dog is calm and obedient ALL of the time now. If you were wondering if it's worth the money, I priced out the cost of a torn rotator cuff, lost wages and pain and suffering for me as well as the cost of surgery if my dog were to get away from me and be hit by a car. Either of these scenarios are much more expensive than the training program. It is totally worth it! I can truly enjoy doing things with my best friend now without fear of the what-ifs. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Very well trained staff and always extremely attentive. By far the best experience with any dog daycare/boarding I've ever had! Can't express enough how amazing these people are and how helpful they are to accommodate whatever your situation may be
My Penny went for her first grooming session here today. She looks beautiful and seemed very relaxed when I picked her up. The staff is super friendly!

I am so happy Das Hund Haus was recommended to us!!! We have used  all of the services offered and have been so happy with the results.  The trainers are top notch! Our Peanut loves going to daycare! Everyone is so kind and caring! Highly recommend!!!

Working with a new fur baby(young boxer mix) who was aggressive with other dogs in the home. Zac is patient and knowledgeable and explains and demonstrates everything. Progress is really noticed after 3 sessions. I‚Äôm so pleased. Highly recommend!

We had an amazing experience at the Ranch for our corporate event! Arlene was wonderful, and the staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming. Our entire group had such a fun time, and everyone is still talking about it. The hospitality was top-notch, and they took great care of our team members and their families. We can‚Äôt wait to come back for another event!

First off, I‚Äôm so glad I found this ranch to celebrate my daughter‚Äôs birthday. From the moment I took the tour, I knew this was the perfect place for such a special occasion. I had the pleasure of meeting the owner‚Äôs son, who took his time to walk me through the lake house and show me all the amazing amenities we could use during the party‚Äîincluding the refrigerator and the sound system. It was truly an awesome tour.

Arlene and the rest of the staff were absolutely wonderful. I can‚Äôt fully express how grateful and happy I was with the entire experience. The horseback riding, the interactive tour, and the petting zoo kept both the kids and adults engaged and entertained. Everyone had a fantastic time, and the children were especially impressed.

Thank you so much again to Arlene, her team, and Paola for helping make this day so memorable for my daughter and for me. We‚Äôll never forget it.

We absolutely love Davie Ranch! It‚Äôs such a special place for kids and adults to get away from the daily hustle and get connected with nature and animals. The kids camps and clubs truly give kids that real outdoor childhood  experience we‚Äôre often missing these days, where they simultaneously get to learn responsibility, compassion, and socialize. Everyone who runs the ranch and the counselors are the kindest people who care for your kids like their own.

We had such a wonderful experience at this family-friendly ranch! The tour was about 45 minutes and perfect for our three toddlers under three. Miss Cynthia, our tour guide, was absolutely AMAZING ‚Äîso patient, informative, and gentle with the kids. She took her time to show them how to properly pet each animal, which made the whole experience extra special.

The highlights included learning all about the horses‚Äîfrom their colors to fun facts like ‚Äúsocks,‚Äù which are really just the white coloring on their feet. We loved petting the tortoises and feeding the donkeys and goats. The pig was adorable lounging by the lake, which was so beautiful to look at‚Äîwe even saw ducks splashing and taking a bath!

Parking was easy, and the entire visit was adventurous and full of fun. We loved it so much and can‚Äôt wait to come back soon. Highly recommend for families with young kids!

First off I would like to say the professionalism 10/10. I had my baby 1st birthday party here on 9.13.25 and everything was PERFECT!!!!!!!!! I would definitely recommend having a party at this ranch! The coordinator Arlene is the BEST! She made sure everything was taken care of! & the Owner Paola is such a sweetheart!!!! Thank you for allowing me and my family to create memories at your ranch!!

provider_name: Day & Evening Pet Hospital & Surgical Center
review_text: I have used Day and Night for 5 years now and every visit has been a great experience for both myself and my Bella.  Today was an emergency visit. When I called and explained what had just happened they told me to just come straight in.  So appreciated as I was upset!  The tech and the vet we saw were calming and reassuring from beginning to end!  Due to being a senior on a fixed income I so appreciate them always being thorough in going over costs and choices.  In the end they were so very reassuring that both Bella and I are resting easy at home now! Thank you! Your kindness is so very appreciated!!!

provider_name: Day & Evening Pet Hospital & Surgical Center
review_text:
I absolutely love this place. The front desk staff are always so kind and friendly, and I‚Äôve seen almost every doctor here & I‚Äôve really liked them all. They never use fear tactics and always treat my dogs with such care. This is by far the best vet I‚Äôve ever been to.

Before coming here, I had another vet tell me my dog had only six months to live. I went to Dr. Camp for a second opinion, and he reassured me that wasn‚Äôt true. That was four years ago, and my dog is still perfectly healthy today!

While I usually see Dr. Camp, I‚Äôve also had appointments with two of the other vets, and they were wonderful as well. They always give me straightforward, honest information and truly care about my pets. Maybe I‚Äôve just had bad experiences before, but these guys are the best. I‚Äôll always recommend them and continue to bring my dogs here.

review_text:

review_text: I am so pleased with the care my family member is receiving at Daytona Health and Rehab. All the staff are compassionate, caring, and kind. review_text: I am a new resident at the facility.. They have the best staff.. This place is very loving. The Nursing staff is amazing an all my cna's that have worked to me are so great to me. Hector an Becky in Admission are wonderful and amazing people.. The love and affection that this facility gives is so great.. I'm so greatful for being a New Resident at this location.

review_text: My experience from A to Z has been amazing. Hector M. Has exceeded my expectations. provider_name: Daytona Beach Health and Rehabilitation Center
review_text: Updated review: 10/8/2025 I‚Äôm truly grateful for the opportunity to be part of this amazing community and had hoped everything goes well. So far, some of the staff here is pretty good specially Hector who was the admissions coordinator and goes above and beyond to help people who are struggling and going through a difficult situation. Hector is very well spoken but no longer works there. After years of struggling but facing challenges nonetheless honestly though positive at first it quickly changed & once I saw what really happens behind closed doors and  what this place is versus how they portray themselves. My honest opinion about Daytona Beach Health and Rehabilitation Center is that they are one of the very few places in this area even all around Volusia county which does aggressive false advertisement and in reality they treat patients and staff unfairly not like a family or community members like they claim . please please stay away from them for God‚Äôs sake and your own. Unless you have no other choice. this is the worst place & read all the paperwork they ask you to sign before you are considered another for profit case. Verbal grievances or complaints or passing the blame to someone else should not have happened at all. Basic human decency and respect is lacking. Underpaid or disgruntled workers, frustrated people and poor lack of service along with inadequate services of employees on shift and other people providing services was hard to overcome . While I did meet a lot of good patients and staff. Management is totally lacking expertise and empathy. Everything is on camera but not monitored 24/7 as per staff and other patients . After reporting major safety concerns and incidents that occurred to myself and others I had to make the tough decision to discharge my self so I don‚Äôt end getting more seizures and end up in the emergency room every 2  days. I went in on oct 1st and once the tipping point was reached I left on the 7th. On the 3 after the second seizure and fall, it took 30 mins of lack of communication and decision making by staff members involved to call 911. My date of birth was incorrect inspite of my requests from day 1 among other things. Sorry this is not what I signed up for. I don‚Äôt want to get into any more specifics or drama because in life I learned the hard way that for profit agencies only care about you if you bring in money. They lie through their teeth and pretend to care. It‚Äôs sad that in 2025, this can still happen! May Hector be happy wherever he goes and hadn‚Äôt been treated the way NHS did after 9 months of hardwork. No one knows who is above Lori the administrator and the information of corporate or higher ups. Every error is blamed on someone else and there is no accountability even though there are cameras everywhere. Just sad and unnecessary. I hope I don‚Äôt ever have to go back to put up with all the stress, drama and lies. The services provided are excellent and affordable.The work ethic is not very good and they are not very knowledgeable or professional. Hector was a good staff member who worked hard to make sure everyone is happy and well taken care of. It‚Äôs hard to find someone who is honest and trustworthy as well as experienced in this field but still has a lot of empathy and compassion. Though I was under the impression that everyone I met at this facility is very kind  but I learned the truth after 7 days. The stuff no one tells you about. This post might be deleted soon but I don‚Äôt care anymore. May God bless you all and guide you always. Hector helped me overcome a lot of challenges and was very supportive throughout the whole process but the pressure was too much and he just quit. I am sad and pray for all who were here or are now or will be here for the future. Thank you for everything. If you know you know. Google their real reviews. The citations, the patient complaints and even lawyers in town. Since when this business was opened and till now they have become one of the worst places for senior citizens and law abiding citizens like me. I am disappointed

review_text:

Under their guidance, my dog not only learned basic commands but also developed a newfound sense of confidence and happiness. The training sessions were engaging, filled with positive reinforcement, and tailored to meet the specific needs of my dog. Debbie not only trained my dog but also taught me invaluable skills to continue the training at home. I am beyond impressed and grateful for her patience, expertise, and passion for helping dogs and their owners thrive together. Highly recommend Debbie to anyone looking to enhance their dog's behavior and deepen their bond!

Deb‚Äôs knowledge in canine behavior is amazing !!!
She  breaks down actions and reactions with Kai in Service Dog training that goes beyond instruction but into the bond between us together as a team.
We would highly recommend Deb
Debbie is an awesome trainer.  She has lots of good ideas for both competition dogs and just house pets.  I love working with her.

I should have noticed the signs from the beginning which was Nov 2024.  Dedicated never found my daughter an OT OR SPEECH therapist. We only had the PT service. review_text: I've had the pleasure of knowing and learning alongside Erin in a professional capacity, and I can't recommend her highly enough. review_text: Ray is an amazing therapist and always goes above and beyond to create a safe and empathetic space for each of his clients. Not only is he client centered, but also trauma informed.
