provider_name: Deeply Rooted Psychotherapy of West Palm Beach
review_text: Ray is an exceptionally skilled and insightful clinician. He has a remarkable ability to make you feel safe, seen, and heard. His approach is highly versatile and client-centered, as he tailors therapy to meet each person‚Äôs unique needs. With his deep knowledge and relatable nature, I would wholeheartedly recommend him to anyone I care about who is seeking therapy.

provider_name: Deeply Rooted Psychotherapy of West Palm Beach
review_text: Ray is a phenomenal therapist that anyone would be lucky to have. He is compassionate and well versed with both mental health and addiction. I appreciate that he uses a person centered and trauma informed approach. If you‚Äôre looking to start therapy or haven‚Äôt found a therapist you connect with, I highly suggest reaching out to Ray.

provider_name: Deeply Rooted Psychotherapy of West Palm Beach
review_text: Brooke is a true gem. Compassionate, caring and does amazing work with first responders. If you‚Äôre looking for an excellent therapist, Brooke is top notch.

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Dr. Williams and the entire team at Deerwood Clinic Every time I‚Äôve reached out, they‚Äôve been incredibly responsive and quick to assist, even on short notice. Whether it‚Äôs for regular check-ups, last-minute prescription refills, or answering my questions about Jacob‚Äôs care, their responsiveness and professionalism have been outstanding.

Dr. William is not only highly knowledgeable but also genuinely compassionate, always taking the time to explain everything thoroughly and put my mind at ease. The staff, too, is wonderful‚Äîthey‚Äôre friendly, attentive, and clearly love what they do. Jacob, my dog, can be a little nervous, but they handle him with such care and patience that he always leaves happy (and with a wagging tail!).

We are big fans of the Deerwood Animal Clinic!

Our dogs have been patients of this practice over the years, and Dr. Rebecca Williams and her team have guided us through everything from basic required shots to neutering, seasonal allergies, and more.

What I like best about the practice is that it is consistently bright, cheerful, and very clean. They also have a custom app that is very helpful for scheduling appointments. You'll also love working with Ashley at their front desk (smiling & waving in this photo)!

I took my little 8 week puppy Bailey into Deerwood Animal Clinic this morning and I had a great experience! The staff was more than friendly with my puppy and I could tell they genuinely cared about her well-being. Dr.Williams was polite and professional and explained everything very clearly. I‚Äôm glad I chose this veterinarian clinic for my puppy.

Not understanding their policies at all. I wanted to book an appointment, new client. Rabies distemper, the normal. Before I step on their property, before any services are provided, before I even see the waiting room I‚Äôm supposed to give them $100 over the phone. Never heard of such a thing. Ever. Called other vets in the area and they agreed it‚Äôs absolutely ridiculous.
In response to your comment: comparing yourself to concert tickets and a hotel isn‚Äôt professional. You‚Äôre a doctors office and should have, at least,  a little tact. I understand respecting your time but a business relationship goes both ways. It‚Äôs not 100% all about you. You‚Äôre also $60 more than 4 other vets in the area for office visit and regular vaccines.

We took our kitty yesterday to Deerwood Animal Clinic as our cat had been lethargic for several days. Dr.  Williams checked her out and ran several tests on her.  Dr. Williams called today  and gave us the test results.  She recommended an antibiotic for our kitty. Dr. Williams and her staff are so good, and friendly. Our kitty was so calm with them.  We have been coming to Deeerwood Animal Clinic for years and will continue to do so. Our kitty is on the upswing and starting to acting like her active, fun loving self.

I am a local PT in a different specialty and always refer clients who need one-on-one, tailored orthopedic physical therapy to Defy.  The feedback I get from patients is that they are personable, professional, with great attention to detail and amazing customer service. They have had excellent results from athletes trying to recover from injury, to patients trying to avoid surgery, to people wanting to maintain fitness and age well.  Kelsey and Tara have built an amazing reputation in the community and are a valuable resource to other providers like me, who want to recommend the best to our patients.

Tara is most spectacular.  She looks at full body (and not just one area of obvious pain) to figure out the source of muscle tightness to develop effective exercises.  I had 2 knee replacements and Tara took me that extra mile to bring me back to the level of mobility I wanted.  I am so grateful for her analytical ability and her caring attitude.  Tara is simply the best.  She has my deepest gratitude.

I have Ehlers Danlos in addition to another condition affecting my muscles.  Everyone at Defy therapy has been very supportive ,understanding & excellent at offering me relief even at the first visit! Every Penny has been worthy! Great investment in my body. Defy is not your typical physical therapy location.  I would highly recommend Defy Therapy

Defy Therapy and Wellness is top notch. Not only do they work with clients one on one, they take the time to examine the body as a whole. Tara is amazing: She really gets to the root of the problem and sends a realistic at home plan that really works.  Kelsey, the owner, is super helpful and they enforce all Covid-19 mandates. Wish I could give them 10 stars. Highly recommend.

Kelsey is a wonderful therapist. I‚Äôm about to turn 30 and started feeling a slight discomfort in my lower back. I decided to come in and see her and one minute into the session she saw able to see hereditary flaw in my back. I am now on back strengthening workouts. A week later my posture is showing improvement. I am super happy she identified this now before it was to late to fix. Kelsey Is very professional with amazing positive vibes. I would not go to anyone else. I highly recommend her.

This was our first visit for my paraplegic son to Dr. Diaz.  He spent time with my son and showed genuine interest and compassion for his well-being.  He provided valuable resources for us to obtain a new wheelchair and truly demonstrates what a physician should be.  We are so happy to have found such a wonderful doctor.

Absolutely love this clinic! The staff is professional and the environment is clean and welcoming. Dr. Yunier Armenteros is hands down the best‚Äîknowledgeable, caring, and truly goes above and beyond for his patients. Highly recommend!

Every time I walk into Dr. Omar Diaz‚Äôs office, I feel completely at ease. He always takes his time during the visit, explains everything in detail, and makes sure I understand what‚Äôs going on. You can really tell he cares about his patients and is genuinely interested in helping. His kind manner, patience, and professionalism stand out, and it‚Äôs obvious he has a lot of experience and truly loves what he does. I feel confident and well taken care of with Dr. Diaz ‚Äî I highly recommend him to anyone looking for a doctor who actually listens and cares.

Del Prado Medical Center and especially Dr Omar Diaz is the best primary care physician I‚Äôve ever had. He is caring, thorough and  listens to everything and always helps me I‚Äôve been going there almost 5 years and recommend them to everybody!! Thank you Dr Omar Diaz I appreciate you!!

I had a very positive experience at Del Prado Medical Center. From the moment I arrived, the staff was attentive, welcoming, and efficient. The level of care and professionalism exceeded my expectations.

Dr. Yunier Armenteros, in particular, was outstanding. He took the time to listen, explain everything clearly, and made sure all my concerns were addressed. His warm demeanor and thorough approach made me feel confident and well-cared for.

Highly recommend both the medical center and Dr. Armenteros for anyone seeking quality healthcare with personalized attention.
Very friendly, excellent service, I recommend it.
Excellent work, very good service üëç
Excellent service and a very professional team
Very kind and professional
Very professional, attentive and mastery in their work, the best, I recommend it

Thank you Gerry and the Delta Force K-9 team!!!! You have trained our dogs for over 20 years and we wouldn‚Äôt have trusted anyone other than you and your team with our Doberman! You taught us how to overcome a behavior issue we thought was impossible. We couldn‚Äôt be more thankful and appreciative of you and your team!
We highly recommend anyone looking for a dog trainer to contact Gerry at Delta Force K-9

We have completed basic and advanced obedience training with Gerardo and his team. Enzo has learned to sit, stay, down, come and more. He is able to go up and down stairs and learned to follow commands at a distance. They have took great care of him during his stay and you can see they are passionate about teaching the dogs new tasks. This is a very professional, clean and honest facility. I would recommend them to anyone looking to train their dogs. We can‚Äôt wait to bring him back for protection training.

Huge thank you to Delta For K-9 and the amazing work they did with my Xoloitzcuintli Diego. They took a small hurricane of a dog and taught him manners and how to behave and they will certainly be seeing him on Saturday classes! Lovely school and staff and 10/10 experience
Jerry is the best most knowledgeable dog trainer.  He loves what he does.  He has trained 3 of my dogs. I have known him for 10 years.  I highly recommend.

They really did a great job with my dog and with helping me learn how to correct my dogs behaviors. My Labrador retriever already had basic obedience down, having taken several classes at Petsmart with him. But he needed further reinforcement and this program was and is fantastic for him. I can‚Äôt thank Gerardo and Enrique enough for helping me with my boy. Walking on a leash is no longer stressful, and my dog is more obedient. The weekly Saturday classes are phenomenal, helping him not to forget everything he learned during boarding.

I can‚Äôt say enough great things about the physical therapists here. From the very first session, they took the time to truly understand my needs, listened to my concerns, and developed a personalized treatment plan.

I appreciated the simple online intake form, and email communications. They took their time with me and answered all my questions.

Their knowledge, patience, and encouragement have kept me motivated throughout my recovery. They explained every exercise clearly, adjusted things as needed, and genuinely cared about my progress‚Äînot just physically, but also mentally. I always left each session feeling better, stronger, and more confident in my recovery.

Thanks to Dr. Daumy I‚Äôve made incredible progress and feel like I‚Äôve gotten my life back. If you‚Äôre looking for a compassionate, skilled, and dedicated physical therapist, I highly recommend this place.

Absolutely love my experience here! If you are looking for a good PT clinic please look no further. This is not your traditional clinic with bands and calm shells. Mike & Thai are experts that love to see people fully return to doing what they love! They use objective measures and evidence based methods so there‚Äôs no guessing. To top it off, they are genuine and down to Earth people. Every session is challenging but fun! I walk away feeling like I‚Äôm getting closer and closer to my goals. They are well worth the investment for your health! Special shout out to the best - Thai!! (sorry Mike)

My experience was great, staff was professional and willing to not only treat but educate. I came in not sure why my back was killing me, and left understanding what muscles to strengthen and active more. Also tried dry needling for the first time a different modality that I‚Äôd recommend.

I cannot express how grateful I am to Dr. Thai at Delta Performance and Rehab. I have been seeing her for months due to a frozen shoulder and through her guidance I have been able to overcome the limited mobility and immense pain I was suffering from. I was taught how to properly execute stretches and engage muscles I didn‚Äôt know existed and sent home with a plethora of information that I will use in the years to come. Book now. I promise you will look forward to every session.

My experience at Delta Performance and Rehab has been exceptional, thanks to Dr. Mike and Dr. Thai. Both doctors demonstrate remarkable professionalism, expertise, and genuine courtesy during every visit. They take the time to thoroughly understand your concerns, clearly explain treatments, and always ensure you're comfortable. Their approach is not only effective but genuinely caring. Highly recommend Delta Performance and Rehab Dr. Mike and Dr. Thai truly set the standard in physical therapy!

I don‚Äôt generally leave reviews but I must say, this visit was well worth one. Unfortunately, my daughter suffered a slip and fall head injury in dance and suffered an awful concussion. This office was very prompt and extremely accommodating. They were able to get us in on the next day. From the very moment we walked in, Mia greeted us with a smile and had us complete paperwork regarding symptoms to prepare for the doctor. We were then called into the room by a nurse named Yvette, and she was such a delight. She was able to calm my daughter‚Äôs nerves, and we even shared a few laughs, which made everything that much smoother while she asked her intake questions. Shortly after we met Dr. Qui√±ones-Pag√†n. I cannot tell you just how much we loved her!!! She was very thorough and knowledgeable. Made time for us to ask questions and answer them with ease. Also educated us both on this type of a diagnosis and what were some things we could expect. She gave us her recommendations and did very thorough testing. She was able to get all documents ready for Physical therapy and documents to take care of any school accommodations my daughter will require. All in all, we left there feeling much better because of the care this team gave together. Thank you Memorial Healthcare Systems.

Great doctor. My son with cerebral palsy has been seeing her for over 2 years and he has made great improvements thanks to her treatments. She takes a considerable amount of time during every visit answering questions and talking through plans/procedures. Dr. Qui√±√≥nez is someone I recommend to anyone looking for a caring and knowledgeable physiatrist

We drove a long way to see this doctor, and while she knew we were driving through a torrential downpour, she had no sympathy that we were a few minutes late to the appointment (as I‚Äôm sure many people were that day). She was in the office and said that she could not see our son who had suffered a recent concussion. I am curious to know why she even got into this profession to begin with, as it‚Äôs certainly not to help children. Absolutely pathetic display of compassion from this so-called doctor.

This doctor is heartless. My daughter (3 YO) had an appointment at 9am at the Joe DiMaggio in Wellington. I drove from Miami, left 1 hour and 40 minutes to arrive at least 20 minutes early. I ran into two accidents, got to our appointment at 912 but had to run to the bathroom first because I had been holding it. When I come out they said the doctor could not see my daughter because I went past the 15 minutes grace period. That‚Äôs just heartless. My child has a fractured skull and it was advised she sees Dr. Quinones within a week. What kind of doctor refuses to see a child in this condition. Wish I could give no stars at all, but not an option.

I am so greatful to have Dr. Pagan. She explained everything in detail and so I understood it. She really listened to our concerns. I never felt rushed or an inconvenience.  I Thank you, Dr. Pagan for you help.
This office is listed but there's a sign in the door that says all access florida clients, go to rockledge. Not sure why it's even listed here. Update needed. Don't waste your time and fuel.

Citizen Taxes down the drain/toilet. This dept in Palm Bay should close for good at these employees can't answer a phone ringing for 3 hours. You go to the building and these lazy employees have a public service office door closed with Lock and with a ring camera at the door. They will let you ring or knock the door with no answer. Again all employees there are just robbing and stealing taxes money as they don't move a finger to help. A family member went there trying to get help after getting abused by a ex boyfriend, no money to eat... And she has to deal with these other government employees abusers of the system.

Y'all took my Medicaid 3 days before colon surgery & 7 days before uterus surgery. I have colon cancer and possibly uterus. Getting ahold of anyone is impossible. SS said they need me to follow up with every Dr appointment. Now I had to cancel all 14 apts this month and have no doctors.ü•¥ Can't even get in the oncologist for infusions.üò°

I have been to that office. I needed assistance with help for my adult disabled son.  No one in the office could help me. I was told everyone was out. I finally was able to sit and discuss the issue with someone who then called her supervisor and explained the situation to him. He said there was nothing he could do. If you can avoid dealing with them. Stay away you will only end up frustrated and angry.

How in the world does someone have to stay on hold for 3 hrs and 20 minutes- still counting!!!! JUST to inform you that I have uploaded my documents because none has even looked at my renewal online and it's OVER 30 days!!!!!!!! Government needs to know that people have to sit on hold 6hrs in two days so that they can process their ONLINE services!!!!! All the while on hold being told to go online!!!!! Last agent after two and a half hours on hold NO APOLOGY!!!!!

Design Therapy of Miami is an asset to our community! They are always giving back to help make our community even better. From donating customized painted shoes to kids with cancer and sponsoring a dinner at the children‚Äôs hospital, to collecting backpacks for kids in low income schools and hosting movie nights, their hearts are clearly in the right place.

We have worked several times with Design Therapy of Miami.  Their unique approach at social therapy is like non other.  Not only do they work on skills such as speech and occupational therapy but they also work on social skills.  They brought a group of kids to our DIY Studio and we worked with them on wood projects.  It was a great experience for the students and they really seemed to have enjoyed themselves.  I love that they are teaching them everyday skills!!
Design Therapy of Miami is a strong network of clinicians who are leaders in the field.  They also collaborate with schools and other team members which promotes even more carryover of skills.

I absolutely love this rescue!! I became involved when a pup was dumped at the canal and they became his rescue. Joann worked tirelessly to help us to help (peanut) find a forever home. We fostered him for 3 months and this dog rescue was a dream come true. I miss peanut everyday but I know he is in a great home!!!

We found ourselves in a situation that no one wants to be in. My 94 year old mom has a 14 year old dog that she adores.  But she has fallen 3 times in a short period of time trying to take care of the dog.  This is even with aides in the apartment keeping an eye on her. This last time she fractured her elbow. And she had fed the dog a Twix ice cream bar that resulted in colitis and the dog having to be cared for at the vets.  Along with her social worker and physician, the family realized that she was no longer able to keep the dog.  And if a family member could take her that wouldn‚Äôt work because every time she would see her, she would want her back.  I reached out to Jo Ann at Destiny for Dogs.  She returned my call quickly and set out to find our Shana the right home.  It only took 2 days.  The care and support that I have received from Jo Ann is priceless. She helped to make an upsetting situation manageable. I can‚Äôt thank her enough.

I am forever grateful to Joann for her exceptional compassion, expertise, and dedication to rescuing animals in need. Her selfless efforts played a pivotal role in saving Lola, a loving dog who required a nurturing environment and tender loving care to flourish.

Joann's professionalism, kindness, and patience were evident throughout the entire rescue process. Her ability to connect with Lola and understand her needs was truly remarkable. With Joann's guidance and support, I have no doubt Lola will blossom into a happy, healthy, and loving companion.

Joann's passion for animal welfare and her commitment to finding forever homes for deserving animals are inspiring. Her work is a testament to the profound impact one person can have on the lives of others ‚Äì both human and animal.

I highly recommend Joann to anyone seeking assistance with animal rescue or rehabilitation. Her expertise, empathy, and love for animals make her an invaluable resource in the community.

Thank you, Joann, for being a guardian angel to Lola and for showing us the true meaning of compassion and kindness.

I am only giving Joann and her rescue organization a five star rating because I can‚Äôt give her a six star rating. Women and organizations like this don‚Äôt come around often. And you feel blessed when you find one.  This has to be a calling for Joann. Seldom in the outside world do you see such dedication, love and caring. It defines the word passion. We were cared for as much as our wonderful pet. Medical issues forced a rehoming. This was a very stressful time for my partner. We had no idea the process could be like this. From start to finish just amazing. Joann‚Äôs network of people and professionals are truly caring. You can come to Destiny for Dogs with complete confidence, even when your heart is on your sleeve. True angels reside here.

Just wanted to share this with you all, I have a roommate that has cancer,he inherited his grandmother's Yorkie Jake. Jake is 15 years old and jumped off the couch,not really sure how he even got up there and hurt his rear legs. I called this place to get some advice. I spoke with Joanne who runs the rescue and cannot tell you what a pleasure it was. She's very compassionate and extremely knowledgeable about dog's. She even offered to send Jake to her own vet and help with expenses. Never have I felt such warmth from someone in this field.  She went above and beyond to get me information on Jake's situation. I highly recommend her for your needs if you are ever in the same situation. Thank You Joanne, you are truly an Awesome Person. Linda Turner

Services provided are great.  Life and Social Skills Training classes are remote which is great because it reaches more people.  I work from home so it's very accommodating for me and my family. The staff is warm and compassionate.  I highly recommend the company because you are destined to find the kind of help you are looking for.

Doing this type of work takes a special kind of person. I found that in Ms. Chatman. My son is 2 years old. When he's with her he lights up. Even though he's young we knew that having him start with her early on would be best for his continued development. She's professional, accomodating, and gentle. I would highly recommend the services here.
So glad I was recommended here!! My child and I are so appreciative of their services. Some people were born with the gift, and they are! We recommend!

provider_name: Developmental Center for Infants & Children / Early Steps
review_text:
***A Traumatizing Experience with Early Steps (Howard Phillips Center & Orlando Health)***

I reached out to Early Steps, part of Orlando Health and the Howard Phillips Center, for support with my medically complex 7-month-old daughter. After 3.5 months in the NICU and multiple surgeries, I was desperate for real help.

My husband and I work remotely but my work schedule is less demanding. After waiting 3 months to be scheduled, my day nurse and I attend this virtual meeting with Jennifer Galindez, Lora Torres, and Mary Marshall for my daughter‚Äôs evaluation. During the virtual intake, I mentioned giving my daughter a taste of peanut butter and banana. The team never asked how. They assumed I was feeding her spoonfuls and reported me to DCF the next day.

I was horrified. DCF came to my home unannounced. They photographed my baby, her room, and feeding tools. Three days later the case was closed, found to be unfounded‚Äîbut the trauma remains.

Early Steps caused more harm than help. They do not offer hands-on therapy, and their staff lacks the compassion and communication skills required to work with families like ours. Be careful before trusting them with your child‚Äôs care.

provider_name: Developmental Center for Infants & Children / Early Steps
review_text: These are great services to evaluate your child for delays and get support in early age. I can not be more grateful for everything that Early Steps offered to my family. First of all, the evaluation was done in a very professional way. Then, we got an amazing,knowledgable, positive, full of energy therapist Elizabeth Burns. I honestly think God blessed us with her. She helped me as a mom to become an every day therapist for my child , and also she told me about all the additional tools that I can use to help my daughter catch up with her development, such as Medicaid,  OT, PT, Speech,ABA, Joyful Music classes, and others. I still cant believe that Early Steps services are free. These services helped us a lot in more than one way. If you, as a parent, have any doubts about the development of your child, just call for evaluation.  It doesnt cost anything, but you can help your child to catch up while not wasting time in crucial early age.

provider_name: Developmental Center for Infants & Children / Early Steps
review_text: This program truly deserves Zero stars. If you live in a low-subsidy neighborhood, with a non-caucasion child, you WILL NOT get a answer from this organization. Their unresponsive attitude displays that children of ethnic races are not important. I would suggest that you speak with your child's physician and get a referral that is far from this place.

provider_name: Developmental Center for Infants & Children / Early Steps
review_text: This is a good place to take your child if they have  experience abuse. I went here when I was younger for abuse. We had group chats with others going through the same situation.  This program help me a lot even when I became an adult.

provider_name: Developmental Center for Infants & Children / Early Steps
review_text: Early steps helped my son get into a school and are helping him with services he needed and my son is so happy with his school he loves it there thank you early steps for finding a place for my son to be around people just like himself

provider_name: Developmental Therapies And Beyond | ABA Therapy | Speech and language therapy | Occupational therapy
review_text: We‚Äôd recommend DTB to everyone. All the staff is genuinely so kind hearted, welcoming, and dedicated to the children.  Our little one has made such amazing growth in such a short period of time. We can‚Äôt thank you all enough, we are so grateful for Nicole, Nick, & Luis for all that you‚Äôve done. We are especially thankful for Julie(Yuli)- you made his days so much brighter while helping him thrive.

provider_name: Developmental Therapies And Beyond | ABA Therapy | Speech and language therapy | Occupational therapy
review_text: Our daughter has been attending Developmental Therapies and Beyond for over 5 years, and we have never been anything less than thrilled with the staff and the service at DtB. Jused and company have been fantastic.  We are thrilled with how far our girl has come and love watching her continue to thrive. So much of her growth and development is thanks to DtB

provider_name: Developmental Therapies And Beyond | ABA Therapy | Speech and language therapy | Occupational therapy
review_text: Jay has so much love for her team and the children that go to her facility. I‚Äôve seen many kids make amazing progress.

provider_name: Developmental Therapies And Beyond | ABA Therapy | Speech and language therapy | Occupational therapy
review_text: DTB has been a great experience. The team is very supportive, and there‚Äôs always someone available to help when needed. It‚Äôs a positive environment where you feel valued and encouraged to grow.

provider_name: Developmental Therapies And Beyond | ABA Therapy | Speech and language therapy | Occupational therapy
review_text: Excellent  place to grow up ,team members are like a family ,providing a nice environment to the kids, our first reason to go there everyday. All kids enjoy a pleasant place .they can share ,improve personal and social skills for sure it's the best location üëå.

provider_name: Devereux Hospital And Children's Center Of Florida
review_text: If I could give this place a -100 I would!!!!!! staff can never answer any of my questions they say they have EIP plans for the children but when you ask for details they always HAVE to give you a call back no matter who you speak with (FUNNY isn‚Äôt it).. In addition I have been trying to get my family member moved because every visit he has a new mark or BLACK EYE all from a staff member by the name of Victor!!! I have asked to have him moved (I would even pay for the transfer) and I never received an answer‚Ä¶ The CEO and president Do Not Care about these poor babies‚Ä¶. all they want is the money‚Ä¶. I had to looking into a lawyer and still no luck (Would post pictures but I respect my family‚Äôs privacy)

provider_name: Devereux Hospital And Children's Center Of Florida
review_text: Ggs

My daughter recently went for a 1-hour horseback riding lesson that also included horse grooming, and the experience was absolutely wonderful. From the moment we arrived, Lisette, the owner, was so kind and friendly. She made us feel welcome right away.

My daughter‚Äôs trainer, Tamara, was equally kind and patient. She treated my daughter with such care, making the lesson both fun and educational. My daughter had an amazing time and hasn‚Äôt stopped talking about it since!

We‚Äôre already looking forward to coming back for the summer camp. Highly recommend!

** UPDATE **
My daughter just finished a 2-week summer session at horse camp, and I can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about it! She loved every single minute and wouldn‚Äôt have missed it for the world. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by Lisette, the owner,  one of the kindest, sweetest women I have ever met. As a parent, knowing my daughter was in such caring and capable hands gave me complete peace of mind.
Every day was packed with fun, engaging activities. My daughter came home excited to share stories about horse painting, water play, and even a grooming competition that she couldn‚Äôt stop talking about! The atmosphere was joyful, safe, and full of learning and laughter,  truly the highlight of her summer.
I will 100% be sending her back every chance we get. Horse camp has become a must-do for us, and I‚Äôm so grateful we found such a special place. Thank you, Lisette and team, for creating such unforgettable memories for our family

We had a great experience using Lisette and her team to help us achieve our equestrian badge. We had a total of 10 girls and they all had a wonderful time learning to care for and safely ride a horse. Would recommend to any Girl Scout troop looking to obtain their equestrian badge.

My two children have been attending Lisette‚Äôs horse camp for 3 years now (Summers/Christmas and Spring breaks)  and they love it!  They count down the weeks/months until their next session.   Lisette is a wonderful teacher and the kids have many opportunities to care for and ride throughout their day.    My daughter loves Lisette‚Äôs horses so much that Lisette hosted a small birthday party for her and 4 other friends!   Lisette is a loving and nurturing teacher and I know my kids are always in wonderful hands when they are with her!  We are grateful we found Lisette!

Make sure you go to the back of the lot once you arrive!!! When we got to this location, we were worried because the first spot is quite run down, making you feel bad for the poor animals at display. However, if you keep walking to the end of the lot, you will find what you definitely were looking for, a nicely maintained, well managed and clean place where you can really connect with the animals. Another plus, there is a lovely walk in the woods you can do with your little ones for free. We will be back here again and again.

I have known Lisette for 4 years and have trained with her for 2! Through my experiences with her I have learned so much horse knowledge and rider knowledge. Her training has made me into who I am today and that is a confident, strong, learning,  relaxed rider. She teaches all the fundamentals of horsemen ship like grooming, tacking, ridding, and horse welfare. I have volunteered at her camps for quite a few years and they are always so much fun and a great learning experience. By the end every kid loves the horses.
When teaching lessons she teaches each client different and adjusts to their needs  to move them forward in their ridding and you start to see a difference after a few lessons. Lissette herself is a hard working woman who takes her business seriously, and an accepting person who welcomes anyone from different paths of life. I can‚Äôt wait to see how this business grows in the future and I will be looking forward to it.

My dogs have all loved going to Rachel for swim! Hydrotherapy helped prolong my old dogs life. My two current dogs have been going since they were 4 months and love it. Its perfect way to release energy and get exercise for them. Cooling activity in the Florida heat!.

We took our 12 year old German Shepherd who has arthritis to a hydrotherapy session with Rachel. His quality of life improved after just one session! We are now rebooking to have him swim again! Rachel is incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. You can tell she loves what she does and helped our dog to feel safe in the water. The smile on his face is a testament to her wonderful services!

I don‚Äôt think 5 stars are enough for the amazing job Rachel does. She is absolutely wonderful; so patient, kind, and funny. This therapy has been life changing for my dog. I have a pitbull mix named Bonnie, and she absolutely loves it.

We first started going because Bonnie had an ACL tear, and the surgery was quoted at $6,000. I wanted to find other ways to help her heal and lose some weight, and that‚Äôs when I came across Rachel‚Äôs page. It has done wonders for Bonnie.

I would recommend Rachel to anyone. She truly cares, and the results speak .

BEST CANINE SWIMMING!!! We brought our Golden Doodle, Lucky, who‚Äôs usually very nervous‚Äîespecially around water. But Rachel was absolutely amazing! She was patient, professional, and clearly experienced. She made Lucky feel comfortable and helped him build confidence during his swim.

By the end, Lucky was tired out and happy, which is the best kind of day! We're so grateful to have found Dip N Dogs. It‚Äôs such a safe, fun, and loving environment. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a caring spot for their fur baby. We'll definitely be back!
My pup Brie loves to swim with Rachel! The atmosphere is very relaxed and enjoyable. Rachel supplies lots of toy options and a crisp clean pool. Can‚Äôt wait to schedule our next swim.

New to the area and needed a new groomer in town. I took my dog and my cat and they did a lovely job! Both smelled divine and looked cute as can be. I‚Äôm very picky about the kind of cut on my Maltese but I think it‚Äôs been my favorite grooming so far! Service was very quick for both of my pets

DO NOT COME HERE.
I am posting on behalf of a family friend who came here to get her dog groomed. This particular grooming appointment took longer than usual which was suspicious.
The groomer very obviously chopped the dog‚Äôs ear off and tried to reattach it back on so that nobody would notice. The dog was taken to the vet where the ear fell off easily. The vet mentioned the dog could have bled to death. On top of that, this place NEVER mentioned the dog was bleeding or that anything occurred. I am DISGUSTED and outraged for her! This is not okay! Beware of this place! I will be telling all of my friend‚Äôs with dogs in Estero to steer clear of this place! Attached will be disturbing photos.

When I walked in I didn't see any staff. But I could hear a machine running. I yelled hello three or four times and then I saw somebody vacuuming or something in the back. They didn't hear me so I whistled like the hood people! And it shock them! First off let me just say I'm thankful that there is a animal store with animal products that I'm looking for. I don't care about anything else but what I want. So many people are struggling in this world. And it's hard not to worry about what's important to you. Don't let the evil taint you. Be thankful and have an attitude of gratitude. I'm not sure what the employee was going through but for some reason I understood. I humbled myself and I walked out grateful and thankful. I love dogs and obviously somebody else does because there is a business here with dog products and what I got was actually a reasonable price.

I did not take the time to look around to see everything but there was a variety of items and and that's awesome.

Excellent service!! They did a FANTASTIC job on my little pups,Krypto üê∂‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èüòçWill definitely come here again!‚Ä¶..Update: As you can see in the recent pictures, Dipidy Dog took away my pup‚Äôs stains around his little face, all GONE!!!!!! He‚Äôs so white and clean now! Thank you Dipidy Dog, you are the BEST!!!!!
Absolutely loved the staff and loved how well they took care of my puppy! They were so sweet and kind especially since I was a last minute walk-in. I‚Äôm so pleased and plan to come back, thank you!!

My experience at Direct PT with Dr.Shannon has been great! I originally came in with chronic shoulder pain and limited range of motion in my shoulder.
From my first visit Shannon conducted a thorough evaluation and listened carefully to my concerns. She developed a personalized treatment plan that made sense and clearly explained the rationale behind the exercises. Dr Shannon adapts exercises based on my ability to perform and has a positive and encouraging attitude.
Thanks to her expertise and guidance, I have made incredible progress. My pain level has decreased significantly and range of motion is increasing daily .
The entire team at Direct PT is fantastic. The administrative staff is always friendly and made scheduling a breeze . They have an upbeat attitude which sets the tone from the second you walk in the door . I highly recommend Dr. Shannon and this clinic to anyone in need of physical therapy.

Dr. Shannon has been wonderful! She has done a great job of picking up my rehab protocol where my home PT has left off! I love that the entire visit is spent with the her and not being handed off to a tech. She's been able to taylor my appointments to what my body needs.

I went to Direct Orthopedic following knee surgery and had the pleasure of working with Dr. Shannon.  She was fantastic.  She knows how to be supportive and challenging at the same time. She genuinely cares for her patients and is extremely knowledgeable. She was able to get me back to running and playing golf within five weeks of surgery!  I would highly recommend Dr. Shannon as well as Director of Orthopedic Therapy.

Incredible staff with great communication,  Rachel, and Madison are at the front desk and welcome everyone walking in the front doors. Rachel sends out reminder texts for appointments regularly. The business is clean and well lit. I especially like the DOT app that helps with at home pt. I have had 12 sessions with Sydney and I can‚Äôt recommend her enough. My lower back and hip feel so much better and my core is getting stronger every week! The personalized sessions of pt are the best I‚Äôve had in Jacksonville.
I highly recommend Direct Orthopedic Therapy.

I have received very caring, very personalized attention at Direct Orthopedic Therapy.  My PT (who is a doctor), Dr. Cage, does everything he can to help alleviate my pain, to help me work toward healing, and to help me just feel better.  You really know that your health and well being are important to them.  You aren‚Äôt just a number.

I've been a Diversity K9 customer now for 2 years.  My Staffy, Abbey attended the 30 day board and train program.  It is an excellent program.  She is a frequent "boarder" due to my work travel schedule- she absolutely "loves" the facility and staff.  I appreciate the fact that I have the option to sign Abbey up for on- going refresher training or enrichment activities during boarding or daycare.  These courses have made a tremendous difference with my girl.  If you've ever owned a guardian breed, you know how stubborn they can be.  They need routine, positive training and commitment from their owners to build good manners with obedience.  It's a journey and can be achieved with the right training program.  I have the highest respect for Tracey, Nicole and her entire staff at DK9!   The work they do with canine training - especially large, guardian breeds it's incredible.   My Abbey listens very well.  Her manners and behavior in public or at the vet are excellent.  I no longer worry about my dog- it's the others - untrained- that concern me.  I can't recommend enough the board and train program followed by the refresher sessions.  It's simply outstanding!

I cannot say enough good things about Diversity K9!! We‚Äôve done everything from their in home training sessions, to boarding, to daycare with training, to private lessons at the facility! We‚Äôve consistently done daycare with training almost weekly for our Maggie to keep fresh on her obedience skills. Kate and Nicole especially have also been great at helping me address her reactivity issues! Maggie always looks forward to going and loves the staff so much! It‚Äôs so obvious the care and love they have for my special girl, and they always make sure to send me a ‚Äúreport card‚Äù with updates about her day! If you want to know your pup is being cared for, definitely CHOOSE DIVERSITY K9!!

I have been bringing all 3 of my dogs here since they were puppies. Tracy and her team are amazing. We do boarding all the time and did their board and train as well, and the results are top notch. They've helped us with basic training and addressing problem behaviors. I know when I board my dogs here they will get plenty of attention and exercise, they are always wiped out for a few days after. I go out of my way to board them here. They even take pictures and videos and send them to you without you asking for an update if your dog stays for a certain number of days, which is always so appreciated.

We love the team at Diversity K9. All of the trainers and staff really care about the wellbeing and health of our dogs. Trainer Nicole worked with both of our dogs and it‚Äôs been great. They‚Äôve learned leash manners, basic commands and tricks. The team is careful to watch the dogs, especially now it‚Äôs getting to be summer and we have a flat faced pup. We do daycare here because we‚Äôve heard horror stories about the daycares that have large open play areas with tons of dogs. The staff here lets the dogs have time in smaller play groups and does a great job of matching temperament. We can‚Äôt say enough about the team. Our dogs come home and nap all day after a visit to Diversity.

I have about a million great things to say about Diversity K9 and it starts with the people. They are extremely professional, patient, and caring. I have a very anxious pup and they have been great at building his confidence, as well as training him. He used to be scared of other dogs and people but he now plays with pups at daycare and has even learned to let a few people at Diversity touch him.

I also like how safe the facilities are. When we first started bringing my dog there, he was an escape artist, and I was afraid he'd somehow get out. They have several safety precautions in place so an escape is almost impossible.

I highly recommend Diversity K9 for training as well as boarding.

provider_name: Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions LLC
review_text: I have been working at Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions for a little over 3 months now, and I can honestly say it is the best place I have ever been employed at. As soon as I walked through the doors, I felt welcomed and appreciated. Eric and Ellie continue to encourage me as I learn and grow, and I have already been witness to several beautiful success stories between Ellie and her patients. This is a place where people are seen, heard, and loved- employees are no exception. Authenticity is hard to find sometimes, but DSSS is a place run by genuine, loving hearts. I‚Äôm excited to continue in my journey here!

provider_name: Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions LLC
review_text:
As a student seeking observation hours for graduate school, I feel incredibly fortunate to have found Divine Speech and Swallow Therapies. From the moment I reached out, Ellie and Eric were not only welcoming but genuinely enthusiastic about helping me! Their commitment to supporting students is unmatched‚Äîthey go above and beyond to ensure you gain meaningful insight into the field.

Observing at DSSS has truly opened my eyes to areas of speech-language pathology I hadn‚Äôt considered before, especially cognitive therapy, which I now see as a potential career path. Ellie is one of the most passionate and dedicated clinicians I‚Äôve ever met. Her care for her patients is sincere and deeply impactful‚Äîshe‚Äôs the kind of clinician everyone deserves.

Eric has been equally amazing, working closely with me to coordinate observations that align with my interests. Their partnership and professionalism have made this an incredibly enriching experience. It‚Äôs refreshing and inspiring to see such passion and excellence in action‚Äîsomething every aspiring SLP should witness. I can‚Äôt recommend Divine Speech and Swallow Therapies enough!

provider_name: Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions LLC
review_text: After several months of searching for help for an issue of chocking when I was eating my daughter found Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions.    We called and set up an appointment to see if they could help.     I was looking at a future of feeding tubes which would greatly limit my quality of live.    I began going 3 times a week.    Ellie understands how the way many muscles work together and how to strengthen the ones that get out of sink to help you reverse damage caused by age or other  problems.     I have not had an issue with chocking in almost 2 months and could not be happier.     The people there are all very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.     I really feel they deserve more than 5 stars but that is as high as I get to mark it.       I recommend them to anyone needing help.

provider_name: Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions LLC
review_text: This summer I had the pleasure of doing my observation hours under Ellie at DSSS. I witnessed firsthand the kindness, respect, and care she shows her patients. Ellie really goes the extra mile to treat her patients not just as customers to get in and out of clinic, but as people with real lives and goals. Not only this, but she is incredible at what she does. In the short time I spent observing under her, I witnessed improvement in several patients and saw her magic at work. There is a reason people come from far and wide to work with her. She has taught me many lessons that I will take with me into my future career as an SLP. :)

provider_name: Divine Speech and Swallowing Solutions LLC
review_text: Dr. Ellie and her Team are exceptional. They have embraced our family and more importantly our son. Dr. Ellie is warm, patient and positive. Our son has improved his speech and has blossomed since we began pediatric speech therapy sessions with her. She has communicated a plan, adjusted as needed and always puts our son‚Äôs needs first. If we could give 10 stars, we would. Thank you Dr. Ellie and Team!

provider_name: Doctor of Women's Health Physical and Occupational Therapy
review_text: I had a great experience at Doctor Of Women's Health.  I came to the facility after my double mastectomy and was fortunate enough to be put in the healing hands of Tiffany W.  She worked to break up my scar tissue, lymphedema massage and to bring back range of motion to my arms.  She was so knowledgeable with every aspect of my treatment. She was a  constant support and showed me beauty in my scars both physically and mentally.  My time there may be done, but I will always credit her with my ability to move forward!

provider_name: Doctor of Women's Health Physical and Occupational Therapy
review_text:
Tiffanie was my PTist to help me heal after delivering my son. I had pretty bad DR but she graduated me out of treatment because it‚Äôs nearly resolved. Throughout the treatment, she has been so kind and thorough and sensitive to the unique challenges a new mom would face - we‚Äôd adjust treatment plans around my ability to care for my son. It really helped minimize a lot of the pressure I felt. I don‚Äôt have a village and my son isn‚Äôt in daycare - I brought him in to every appointment and the staff love seeing him. There were toys in the exam room for him and I‚Äôd ask the front desk ladies if they can watch him while I use the restroom before leaving and bless them, they have always been so happy to and never made me feel like a burden for bringing him along.

Thank you so much to Tiffanie and the staff for taking care of us!

provider_name: Doctor of Women's Health Physical and Occupational Therapy
review_text: I am very thankful for Mandy Porter‚Äôs helpful suggestions on how to handle my pelvic floor situation. She always had a smile for me and gave me printout papers on exercises to do at home til our next appt. Always worked patiently with me to correct the way I wasn‚Äôt breathing properly for some exercises. I will miss her. I‚Äôm glad I had the opportunity to work with Mandy. She is very knowledgeable about her profession.

provider_name: Doctor of Women's Health Physical and Occupational Therapy
review_text: Marla, Physical Therapist and the ladies at the front desk were all warm and welcoming and made me feel at ease.   Marla is an excellent therapist who knows her stuff and is always ready to answer any questions and provide encouragement.   I highly recommend Doctor of Women's Health Physical Therapy!   If you need their services please don't be afraid - GO!   I waited a few years to go because I was afraid.  I am so glad I went and you will be too!  Thank you Marla and staff!

provider_name: Doctor of Women's Health Physical and Occupational Therapy
review_text: I came here prior to my diastasis recti repair surgery to try to strengthen my muscles as much as possible. Even though I couldn‚Äôt close the gap without surgery due to a hernia PT made a huge difference. I‚Äôve been doing post OP PT here as well and it‚Äôs been a huge help in regaining muscle strength. I highly recommend this office for anyone struggling with any pregnancy and postpartum issues. I honestly wish I knew about this office when I was pregnant and would have come here then as well!

provider_name: Dog Training Club of St Pete
review_text: Awesome training facility run by very dedicated volunteers. Nobody here is paid for their time, and yet they continue to give! Liz, who runs the 4-H youth program, is absolutely amazing with kids of all ages, even those on the spectrum! I have been attending classes here for over 5 years! I wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere else.

provider_name: Dog Training Club of St Pete
review_text: Love these dedicated dog trainers. I took an out of control puppy there, and they helped me guide him into the most amazing dog who enhanced our lives for 17 years. Now, I'm back for scent training with a mature dog that needs stimulation and challenge. We are both having a blast.

provider_name: Dog Training Club of St Pete
review_text: I have learned a lot in my 1st week at Puppy 2 class . I would highly recommend this to anyone who is getting a puppy for the first time. You have to start in puppy 1

We were dismissed from the class cuz my 1 year old Great Dane was too excited. A lady let herself drop to the ground and then in drama queen style she spent 5 minutes getting people to help her up   She is the one that did this dramatic display. By the way I‚Äôm 70 year old male

review_text: We took our fresh from the Aussie farm that she came from to get a bit of obedience training, the trainers were helpful, friendly and knowledgeable on dogs. We did a six week course and had homework each week. They did a great job and tell everyone as they are a nonprofit.

provider_name: Dog Training Club of Tampa, Inc
review_text: The place is really nice, everyone that is teaching are friendly and all are experienced in training and offer their guidance and suggestions freely. They also require all dogs have current/up to date shot records before they start classes. All around a really good experience!

provider_name: Dog Training Club of Tampa, Inc
review_text: We loved it what a great place.  It's super clean and you can tell the the people there enjoy helping others.  The first time we went we took a group class the other folks in the class were super nice and helpful.  We took a private class and I'm so glad we did. I'll share this our dog knows what she is doing in the ring I feel its me the human who needs the training.  Looking forward to the next class.

provider_name: Dog Training Club of Tampa, Inc
review_text: Great trainers for basic puppy obedience.  We have used them for several decades, always with great result. Lot's of barking! Plan any headache medicine accordingly.

provider_name: Dog Training Club of Tampa, Inc
review_text: We are attending the Puppy Manners class with Paula and absolutely love it so far! She is  extremely knowledgeable and the things we‚Äôre learning are highly applicable to our day to day with our pup. Our puppy loves it too!!

Chelsea, Cheyenne, Maria, and Kari are all amazing! They are knowledgeable, caring, understanding, patient and attentive. They provide such a high quality experience and even are available via text! I would recommended this experience to every single pet owner! Give you and your baby the tools to succeed! Here‚Äôs a pic of my baby on her first day! üòç

We had an amazing experiencing with DTE ! Our golden (Remus)  did the platinum program ( basic/advance obedience) to help prepare him  for intro into service dog training. 10/10 recommend and cannot thank the staff enough ! Cheyanne and Chelsea are amazing with evaluating and helping you choose which program would be best for you and your companion‚Äôs needs along with answering any/ all questions you may have  . The trainers, Jaeden and Maria , are super helpful and offer great feedback on your companion and ways to help you and your dog succeed in their program! We saw an immediate difference in Remus within just 1-2 days of him training in the classes and it has boost his confidence level . He looks happier and shows a more confident and prouder stance in how he represents himself. We couldn‚Äôt be more proud and happy to be part of the DTE pack !!!

I‚Äôm amazed how far my pups have come in just 5 sessions! I was at my wits end thinking that my only option was to rehome one of my dogs. The aggressive behavior between two of our dogs had made our home a battleground with fights that could become bloody. They‚Äôve now learned to be in the same room and not tear into each other.  We are enjoying our time together and are so grateful that we didn‚Äôt give up on them. Cheyenne has taught us how to utilize teachable moments and create opportunities to maximize each of our pups different motivators. We also learned how to divert their energy into productive activities that help to keep them happier and less bored. They are ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù dogs and the anxiety level in our home has decreased significantly. I can‚Äôt recommend them enough. Don‚Äôt give up on your dogs! I‚Äôve learned as much or more than my dogs have,  and I‚Äôm so grateful that I found Dog Training Elite.

We have a great time with Mia‚Äôs training! Dog Training Elite was the best decision for me and my dog, we have learned so much and it just keeps getting better!! Maria has been doing an amazing job with Mia. I know Malinois can be very high driven but you guys have give me the confidence to train my dog and I‚Äôm very proud of her!!

I cannot say enough about Dog Training Elite Orlando! One month ago we had a 3 month old puppy who was biting everything, jumping on everything (furniture, counters, people) and was only interested in chewing on our blankets, socks, shoes, and couch, and was completely uninterested in his toys.
