Cheyenne and Maria have both been amazing and the results speak for themselves. Best decision we ever made! If I could give more than 5 stars I would.

provider_name: Dog Training Elite Palm Beach County
review_text: Hi my name Jan. I have 5 years old Shizu. She like to bark to people and big dog, very aggressive. I met Josephine on March, 2025. She is a good dog training, she is listening my problem, understand, kind and good communication. She help me fix the problem of my dog in the right way. Her technique is simple and easy for me to follow and all work. My dog listening to me and understanding and behaving since I work with Josephine. She is more calm and not so much bark anymore. I will recommend everyone who needs help with your dog. Josephine definitely can fix your problem and give a great advice what we need to do to fix our problem with your dogs. I am happy üòä.

provider_name: Dog Training Elite Palm Beach County
review_text:
We started using Josephine 3 weeks ago and we are very happy with the progress our 15 month old English Bulldog criminal has made. She has learned to walk on a leash without pulling. She has learned come and place. Matilda is happier with the structure Dog Training Elite has given our household. We are looking forward to the group classes and improve her socialization skills.

A quick follow up on how Matilda is doing. Matilda is the queen of our neighborhood. Our neighbors cannot believe how well trained she is. Her attitude is 100% better, as is mine.
She is a pleasure to walk and we have a lot of fun doing it.

provider_name: Dog Training Elite Palm Beach County
review_text:
Who Says You Can‚Äôt Teach an Old Dog New Tricks?

My neighbors certainly did! However, Josephine, the owner and lead trainer, proved them wrong!!

Storm, our 11 year old rescue, was out of control when anyone rang the front door bell. He would charge ahead of us, and bark aggressively‚Ä¶non stop.  After only 2 lessons with Josephine using DTE‚Äôs proven methods, and us reinforcing them daily, Storm now stays in his ‚Äúplace‚Äù when the doorbell rings, and is learning to be ‚Äúquiet‚Äù.

We just finished the 5th lesson, and we can confidently and safely walk Storm by our side around our neighborhood. He ‚Äúheels‚Äù, is not pulling, or distracted by other dogs and is focused on the commands. If we stop, and he‚Äôs told ‚Äúdown‚Äù, he goes down with chest and elbows on the ground. This is the hardest command to follow as it means total submission by him.

We highly recommend Josephine and her side-kicks, Gracie and Dottie :) The DTE program she is using was developed over 45 years. We learnt that success with Storm would only be possible with mutual trust, consistency, positive reinforcement, and most of all‚Ä¶working with him at least 15 minutes everyday.

Thanks Josephine, for teaching Storm, our old dog, new tricks!!!

provider_name: Dog Training Elite Palm Beach County
review_text: Before training, our year and a half old frenchie was reactive and had no manners! Safe to say he was running our house. After the first session, we noticed a HUGE shift in his behavior! Now that we are 4 sessions in, he is more confident, less reactive and respects us. It‚Äôs been amazing to see his progression! We highly recommend Josephine Grace with Dog Training Elite Palm Beach County! It has changed our household.

provider_name: Dog Training Elite Palm Beach County
review_text:
We got a rescue puppy who ended up being a completely different mix than we thought. We thought he was a small breed but ended up being a German Shepard/boarder collie mix and was timid and aggressive with age.
I was feeling completely helpless and really didn‚Äôt think we could keep him but I wanted to try one more thing.
Josephine came to our house and as much as she taught him, she taught me more. He gained respect for my authority and I gained control.
I no longer have any fears from him! We have had parties with 20 people, multiple different dogs in and out of the house, doors left open and more. We are now confident he can be a part of our family forever. ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Dog Training of Tampa Bay, Inc.
review_text: We left our Golden Retriever puppy with Natalia and Melody for the board and train program. We couldn‚Äôt be more pleased with the results. They‚Äôve done an incredible job! Her walks are now a breeze, and she‚Äôs a well-behaved puppy overall. Her Golden nature hasn‚Äôt changed at all. Not only did they train her, but they also loved and took care of her. After the board and train program ended, they provided us with a two-hour lesson. Melody even came to our home for a follow-up session. We‚Äôre always welcome at the facility for any additional sessions.

provider_name: Dog Training of Tampa Bay, Inc.
review_text: Natalia did a great job training our 3 year old St. Bernard. Not only does she know her stuff when it comes to dogs, she treated us and our dog (Atlas) like family!  I would recommend anyone with any bread of dog to go to her for training!

provider_name: Dog Training of Tampa Bay, Inc.
review_text:
My family adopted an 11mo German Shepard and he turned out to have Dog Aggression, Human Aggression and a very high Small Prey Drive - He tried to kill our cat several times (the cat is quick) tried to bite guests (guests would try to pet him even though they were told NOT to pet him or try to engage him). So after about 1.5 years of training with other trainers we were referred to Natalia and Ivan by a breeder friend we trust immensely.
Zeus spent 7 weeks with Natalia and her team and our only regret is we didn't send him to her sooner, not only did she ease his DA so we could go out in public, he has become buddies with our cat and has even befriended strangers on nightly walks! I NEVER thought I would see the day where he and Chief (the cat) are buddies and while it did require maintaining his training and some time, it was the best thing we ever did. He did not lose his personality, he was not shocked into submission, Natalia created a relationship with him and with us and taught us how to properly engage with him and train with him. We were so happy with the results we sent another dog to her for training. If you are at your wits end and don't know what else to do. Go see Natalia - She is truly spectacular.

provider_name: Dog Training of Tampa Bay, Inc.
review_text: I've had both Natalia and Grace train dogs for me and both have done a WONDERFUL job.  I got constant texts, photos and videos.  Natalia trained our blind, 2 yr old Great Dane (Rolex) and Grace trained our 8 mo old Great Dane pup, Poppy.   We just got Poppy back from Grace after 4 weeks and she is a different dog.  MUCH more responsive, especially with the recall, which was a HUGE issue prior to training.  Most importantly, she retained her happy-go-lucky, sweet baby girlness.  It is very clear to me that dogs LOVE their trainers.

provider_name: Dog Training of Tampa Bay, Inc.
review_text: Professional and very down to earth people who are at the top of their passion. The awards, accolades, and accomplishments speak for themselves. We had our 7month old German/Dutch Shepherd here for 4 weeks of training. It was a great experience for us and our puppy. The quality of care and expertise Ivan, Grace, and Taylor showed was great! They not only taught our dog but they also taught us "how to" from here on and make themselves available if we should need any help  in the future. Can't say enough about this camp and what they do. Thank you again Ivan and Grace for everything! Love you guys!

I don't know where to start, but Paul is the truth. My dog Oreo has some behavioral issues with whining, excessive energy, and destructive behavior at times. I met with multiple trainers before Paul, all said the same thing: Oreo needs more exercise, or an e-collar, or wanted thousands for a board and train program. All Oreo needed was structure and guidance, and that is what Paul offered.

In two hours, Paul addressed all my concerns and issues and gave me the knowledge I needed to work successfully with him. From the moment Paul stepped in and started working with  Oreo, I saw a major difference. He went from whining and jumping to being quiet, peaceful, and calm. When we went outside and started the heel process, I thought I was looking at a brand-new dog, it was a complete 180 from the walk we had that morning. After that day, Paul was there to answer my questions and to check in on Oreo's progress and was even willing to meet again to help me.

Overall, choosing Paul was the best decision for me and Oreo. He has changed the relationship I have with Oreo for the better. I see it, and others around me see it as well. My neighbors all compliment Oreo on his progress on how far he's come in the month and a half since we started training. I added a video of him walking next to my other dog, something I could never get him to do without being distracted or trying to play.
Paul was excellent offering great insight! He trained us to better help our dog.  His 2 hour class was invaluable information.  We highly recommend Paul!

Paul is wonderful! Very knowledgeable and gives you easy to follow action plans. We saw a difference in our 6 month old puppy after just the 2 hours, and we feel confident that we can build on it. Would highly recommend Paul! Wish we would have found him sooner!

I was skeptical when my wife told me she had someone coming over for just a couple of hours and that was supposed to be sufficient for the training of our new puppy. However, I was pleasantly surprised and quite amazed at how impactful that 2 hours was.

Our family of five sat around the living room and Paul gave us such amazing insight and provided some examples and taught our family, children included, how to interact with the puppy while providing ‚Äúcorrection‚Äù. There was a great improvement in several areas of our dog‚Äôs behavioral issues before Paul left.

The continued ‚Äútraining‚Äù is so effortless and simple that it does not feel like a chore at all. Thank you so much Paul. Our dog is already so much better behaved and she will only get better. Having a calm, well behaved dog is a gift that keeps giving for years to come.

Do yourself a favor and call Paul if you want to learn how to guide your dog to better behavior while creating a calmer and less stressful environment in your household.

What an amazing experience we had with Paul! No selling of expensive packages, no pitch, just pure knowledge and passion for what he does. He spent so much time with us and was patient with our stubborn pup Rex. Within 45 mins Rex was already taking to the new commands and walking better on a leash. We feel confident that Rex will continue to get better each day, and we‚Äôre grateful we got Paul in our corner!

I have an Australian shepherd who has been dog-reactive for the first 4 years of his life. It was extremely frustrating and exhausting, constantly avoiding dogs. I couldn‚Äôt go anywhere with my boy, he was extremely reactive to any dog in sight, and this severely limited the things we could do together. Now, because of dogspeak, we are going on pack walks with his dog friends!!

Elizabeth Snyder and each person on the team at dogspeak are passionate members of the dog world, and do an incredible job with both dogs and owners. Elizabeth helped me take my nervous boy from reactive and stressed, to a calm and happy companion. I will be forever grateful, because now I can have my best friend with me everywhere I go, without the fear of him reacting. We are even going to finally be able to participate in agility trials, which is something I wasn‚Äôt sure would ever be possible. Dogspeak is an amazing place, and I highly recommend this business for all of your dog training/boarding needs!!

We took our dog Bruno to dogspeak after trying a different trainer who wanted to medicate him for life. Our vet recommended dogspeak and it was the BEST DECISION we have ever made!! Bruno was a reactive/aggressive dog to anyone outside of his circle. After his training program he can walk in crowded areas very relaxed and happy! Beth addressed all of our concerns and even went above and beyond! She trained our dog but she also gave him so much confidence and gave us soo many tools for our future! This program transformed our life with our dogs! The team truly loves dogs and our Bruno loved being there!!
Beth did super with Lulu. Her group classes are fun and never the same. Recommend her if you want to have a better life with your dog.

My husband and I adopted Finnegan from a shelter in December. He was a very shy, not socialized 6 month old puppy, and while he did well with us and was mostly fine with our two cats, he was dog selective and meeting new people was very scary for him. Enter Elizabeth and her team!

We are now confidently fostering another dog (see pictures), and Finn is so good with him thanks to Elizabeth working with him (and teaching us how he needs to be introduced to other dogs)!

We‚Äôve learned so much, and Finnegan is a much more confident now 1 year old dog who enjoys going on adventures and has other dog friends.

We absolutely recommend Dog Speak for all of your dog training needs. Finnegan absolutely adores her and her team, and we‚Äôre so thankful for their help!

Draco is our 20 month old half pitbull half Belgian Malinois. Raised and partially trained in DC. He was re-homed to us. He was loving but super energetic, always jumping up and very mouthy. (Wanting to put his mouth on everyone). Always demanding attention when we were working from home.  He had selective listening. Beth asked us: ‚ÄúIs there anything he will do 100% of the time?‚Äù
Nope. That‚Äôs when we knew we needed DogSpeak.

In 4 weeks of Board and train he is a different dog. He no longer jumps up. No more biting. He can walk off leash and follows all commands (No, heel, come, sit, place etc). But even more amazing is that he now entertains himself. Finds his ball, plays with his bone, takes his naps when he wants them. Unbelievable. He even achieved his AKC Canine Good Citizen ribbon before we took him home!
If you have a high drive dog, don‚Äôt bother with traditional training. It won‚Äôt work and everyone will be frustrated.
We couldn‚Äôt recommend Beth, Barry, Jamie and Haley any more than we have !
Thank you all!

We rescued a little girl from the local humane society, and wanted her to have doggy companionship during the week. I looked at several places, but Doggiedayz was recommended over and over.
The first time we walked in I was greeted by Sadie, who was so genuine, and happy to see us. The facility is clean, and well staffed, and their prices are very reasonable. Piper was nervous that first day but they were so kind and encouraging.
Two months later I can say we are so happy to have found Doggiedayz. The staff is kind, and genuinely happy to see us. It may sound corny but they truly do treat us like family. I literally have zero complaints. When I drop Piper off she bursts into the place like she's just won the lottery. When I get her back she is a sleepy happy puppy. It's a win win.

What an excellent  feeling it is to be able to trust this wonderful dog day care.  The staff is loving and caring and knowledgeable.  The dogs get two walks each day and the facility is in a perfect location.  We can‚Äôt say enough good things about leaving our beloved pet where he‚Äôs so excited to be.  He's got his buddies to play with and we feel confident he's well looked after.  It‚Äôs a win for all.  Highly recommended.

Super-friendly staff are a pleasure to interact with and they are terrific with the dogs! Our dude had an absolute blast there on his first half-day and we are definitely going back for more. Highly recommended

This is Copper's favorite place in the whole world! We have been going for over 3 years and the staff remain wonderful, conscientious, and patient with my big guy! Copper has made so many friends (human and dog alike) and has so much fun at doggie dayz!!!

Bonus points: when your dog plays matchmaker with the manager. Sorry ladies, he's taken!

I just wanted to thank all the people and staff at Doggy Dayz for the genuine love, and kindness they give to all the dogs. I cannot express enough gratitude to you all for how lucky I feel to have found such a wonderful place for my puppy. Sincerely, thank you!

I‚Äôve known Liam for years, and he‚Äôs always been top-notch in both character and professionalism ‚Äî but this last month really blew me away. My golden retriever, Finny, just came back from a month of boarding training with Liam and he‚Äôs a completely different dog in the best way possible. The transformation is amazing ‚Äî he‚Äôs calm, confident, and walking off leash perfectly on the very first day home.

Liam‚Äôs training knowledge, patience, and consistency are unmatched. You can tell he truly understands dogs and genuinely cares about their progress. I can‚Äôt recommend him highly enough to anyone looking for real, lasting results.

Thank you, Liam, for going above and beyond ‚Äî Finny and I are both better for it! üêæ

Liam is an outstanding dog trainer who truly cares about both the dogs and their owners. From the very first session, they took the time to understand my dog‚Äôs personality and tailor the training plan to fit his needs. I appreciated the clear communication, practical advice, and consistent follow-ups. The results speak for themselves my dog‚Äôs obedience, focus, and overall behavior have improved tremendously. I highly recommend dogifi dog training to anyone looking for professional and compassionate training.

Liam is an excellent, seasoned trainer‚ÄîI highly recommend his services!

He maintains a professional, calm demeanor while working, though he was clearly compassionate to the unique needs of Mina.

He helped me immeasurably with reactivity and other disruptive behaviors.

Appreciated the flexibility offered in scheduling sessions and adjusting them to specific concerns I had with Mina.

Also, appreciated the insight Liam provided for training equipment - e-collars, leashes, crates, a temporary muzzle, etc.

I liked that he was opposed to using shock collars‚Äîhe always had a rationale for what he would recommend for and against, which is to say he was thoughtful and conscientious in his approach to dog training. He has high ratings for a reason.

üòá 5 star üåü service for sure!

My girl kitty and her baby Koda are both being trained by Liam- the Dogifi and I couldn‚Äôt be happier!! I was having a very hard time with potty training and 4 days with Liam and we are not having any more accidents. And that isn‚Äôt even the actual training we are doing!! Right now kitty is being boarded for a month for advanced training and he gives me daily updates and videos!!!

Frenchies are one of the best breeds (in my opinion) but a very difficult one as well. Coco is not a puppy anymore and I thought you could not teach an old dog new tricks but Liam proved me wrong! She was having a hard time with accidents in the house but that is not an issue anymore! Thank you dogifi for making what seemed impossible a reality!!!

Finding a Care Center for our four-legged family member can be a challenge. The Doglando Staff cared for my yellow lab, Belle, years ago and now they have my rowdy Corgi, Johnny B Good, on a weekly basis. I know that under their watchful eyes, JBG will have his very best day every day; and if I travel out of town, he'll be taken care of as if he were in my home. Doglando is one decisionI can say I got 100% correct.

I cannot recommend Doglando‚Äôs PTPD program more for your new puppy!! Do it!! Our girl started here at 12 weeks and at 15 weeks is already confident and social around other dogs and people, and she is almost completely potty trained (only accident was when we forgot to take her out after eating). The people here clearly love dogs and understand their behaviors, needs, and wants, and help you to understand them too, which has created fiercely loyal members! Every dog owner we‚Äôve met there are on dog number 2 and 3 with Doglando and have dogs who are so well adjusted. We really regret not taking our 15 year old girl here, who, even though we tried on our own to socialize her, is anxious around other dogs and new people. If you are thinking about Doglando, run, don‚Äôt walk to their puppy classes, you will be so happy you did. Charli is learning and growing every day and loves it here - we look forward to the next level of puppy development!

Cowboy was the first puppy I‚Äôve ever had, and a crazy little Australian Shepherd at that! In looking around for some help in raising a puppy, I found Doglando- quite literally a little slice of Heaven for dogs, and the most wonderful ‚Äúvillage‚Äù to support Cowboy and I in his development that I could have ever asked for! Cowboy started out at Doglando at around 5 months of age (he‚Äôs 2 years old now), entering the Pre-K9 Level 1 program. This program involved him going 3 days a week, focusing on enrichment one day a week, skill building the other 2 days. Some of his skill building days consisted of recall, crate + pedestal exercises, physical handling (massage/settle, which he just eats up now), just to name a few! Along with the Pre-K9 Level 1 & 2 program, came weekly group classes, where I learned and worked on building a relationship with Cowboy, absorbing all of the training info to use throughout the week at home! Now at 2 years old, Cowboy and I are going on all sorts of off leash adventures, that I have more confidence embarking on with him than I could have ever imagined!! All thanks to the weekly Pre-K9 classes and the work we‚Äôve been able to do on our own to further strengthen what we‚Äôve learned.

Doglando‚Äôs Pre-K9 programs were quite honestly life-changing. They established a wonderful sense of community, and have educated me on so much regarding dogs‚Äô needs and the lifestyle for them Doglando lives by! If it weren‚Äôt for them, Cowboy and I wouldn‚Äôt have half the adventures and relationship we have today!! The staff at Doglando is so wonderful, they all love their job tremendously and want only the very best for the dogs- it shows big time! Cowboy is always so excited to see them at Doglando and out in public at any events!! He knows the turns that lead to Doglando all too well, sleeping peacefully in the car until we get to East Colonial, immediately sitting up in the seat, eager for us to pull into a parking spot and go see all of his favorite humans and dog friends! Along with, running around with giant sticks the handlers bring to his attention, meditating in the pond, enjoying all of the elements and space Doglando provides!!

All that being said, I could not recommend Doglando enough. If you‚Äôre looking for weekly dog enrichment with a wonderful community of people, look no further! Doglando is truly the best of the best.

My husband and I have been bringing our golden retriever Moose to Doglando since he was 11 weeks old (he is now 9 months) and have nothing but the absolute best to say about our experience here! When we first began looking for a doggy day care to bring our pup to when we are at work, there was no comparison. Most other places were overcrowded and only had a small turf area for the pups to play in. In addition, Moose was able to join the pre-k course and get puppy training as well. When my husband and I went on the tour of Doglando, we left there saying how Doglando was like a heaven for dogs‚Äîacres of open grass, woodlands, water areas, and even a sand yard and obstacle course for the pups to play in!

Not only is the enrichment center amazing, but the individuals who work here are even more incredible. Moose‚Äôs body always starts wiggling uncontrollably when we pull up to Doglando because he is so excited to be there! You can tell how caring and thoughtful everyone is from the pure look of excitement on his face when he sees the team. Not only does this team love Moose like I do when he is there, but the team has gone above and beyond to help guide me throughout the nutty puppy (and now adolescent) trouble stages that we go through. From helping us with early socialization, training advise and guidance, enrichment, and even helping introducing Moose to swimming, they have been incredible.

If you want to have your pup stay busy and enriched while in a place filled with people who love him/her just has you do, I would look no further than Doglando.

We‚Äôve been coming to Doglando for 10 years now with our senior dog and about half a year with our puppy, and this place is absolutely wonderful!
They have plenty of outdoor space to let dogs be dogs, to run around, swim, and  play. But they also have indoor spaces for when the weather turns, or if your pup would benefit from less distractions, so doggies don‚Äôt miss out on the enrichment they deserve. They offer grooming services, a doggie bus for pick up/drop off, and also have quality pet food available for purchase at their facility to make life  easier for you and your pup.
Caring individuals are always actively working with the dogs so they can better adapt to their human‚Äôs life. The dogs safety, health and well-being is Doglando‚Äôs number one priority. From providing dogs with quality food and fresh water, to making sure all dogs are up to date on vaccines and that the campus is free of harmful bacteria/parasites that may reside in the ‚Äúwild‚Äù. They‚Äôve really thought out all aspects of ‚Äúdoggie daycare‚Äù to make them the best, but also unique in this industry.
From training classes, to enrichment and skill building there is something here for you and your pups! You won‚Äôt find another place like them.

provider_name: Dogs In Bloom - Dog Training, LLC
review_text:
We have a five year old Black Mouth Cur with a strong prey drive and high anxiety. Coconut is an incessant barker who wouldn‚Äôt always come when called. She spent three weeks boarding and training with Tracey at Dogs in Bloom and came home a much calmer, well behaved dog. Her recall is great and her barking has decreased tremendously. She‚Äôs learned to ‚Äúgo to her place‚Äù and stays until given permission to move. Tracey also helped with some of the basics and corrected some of our mistakes in training which was a big help.

Tracey has given us the tools to work with our sweet girl going forward. We‚Äôre very grateful to have found her, and would recommend her to anyone looking for training.

provider_name: Dogs In Bloom - Dog Training, LLC
review_text: Tracy is an exceptional dog trainer who truly understands the unique needs of every canine. She worked wonders with our Pekingese, skillfully drawing out her best qualities and instilling confidence in her. This experience was not just an investment in our dog but a transformative journey for our entire family. The atmosphere in our home shifted dramatically from chaos to calmness, creating a serene environment where we could all thrive together.

provider_name: Dogs In Bloom - Dog Training, LLC
review_text:
Would like to share our experience with Tracy. We have a Lab/Golden Retriever mix puppy. Within a few short months, we had an 80lb out of control puppy who was lunging, jumping on everyone, barking constantly, dragging us to the ground on leash and causing complete chaos in our home. We were stressed and upset and had no idea how to train him. Thankfully we had Tracy with her training camp to get our dog back on track. She gave our dog a brand new start and, most importantly us too!
Tracy has shown us how to communicate effectively with our dog, and to be consistent and confident with his training going forward. I share videos with Tracy of our training, and she gives us great feedback which is so helpful.
Cannot be more thankful to Tracy for giving us a whole new outlook with our dog who we love so much.
And our dog Parmesan thanks her too! ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Dogs In Bloom - Dog Training, LLC
review_text: I highly recommend Tracy as a knowledgeable and caring puppy trainer. She helped us with Duke, our Shepherd Malinois mix, from his first week home, offering valuable guidance as he grows. We're excited for Duke to attend ‚ÄúPuppy Camp‚Äù and board with Tracy, knowing he'll be safe and well cared for while we travel.

provider_name: Dogs In Bloom - Dog Training, LLC
review_text: When we contacted Tracy, we were in such need of help with training our puppy Cooper. He was out of control and no matter what we did we could not get him to stop counter surfing, jumping on the couch and beds, jumping on people, constantly grabbing laundry out of the laundry hamper, grabbing the hand rags off the counter‚Ä¶ the list goes on!!  Having 2 smaller kids made it really tough for us to give Cooper the proper training he needed. We researched trainers in our area and what the training was like. Tracy had a great reviews and we watched her videos on her website. We knew she was going to be the best trainer for Cooper. We did the 3 week training and my husband and I could not be any happier with the results. When he came home he was a different dog, much well behaved. We stuck with the training she taught us when she brought Cooper back home. She didn‚Äôt only train Cooper she taught us on how to continue with the training him so he didn‚Äôt go back to his bad habits. 4 weeks later with having Cooper home, he is still doing great! Having Copper trained by Dogs in Bloom was the best decision we have made in a long time and it was worth every penny. Cooper is happy and so are we!

Stella graduated from day school last week and we‚Äôve already started group classes with her at Dogsense. I honestly can‚Äôt say enough good about this place and it‚Äôs trainers every single one of them has just the right amount of patience and they are all incredibly helpful so that you understand the goal and how to get there! Stella learned so many things while in day school and we‚Äôve practiced every day which is the key I highly recommend Dogsense if your looking for a good training facility

Dogsense has been such an amazing experience as a dog owner. The people at Dogsense are so patient, caring, helpful, and passionate about what they do. We utilized the day school and group classes for our toy poodle puppy, Ruby. Not only does she love going, but so do I. They create such a positive and energetic learning environment and I definitely have enjoyed bringing my puppy there for classes. My puppy has been growing and learning so much that I‚Äôm genuinely sad to part with them when classes are over. I would recommend Dogsense to all dog lovers. You won‚Äôt regret it and the people there are very special.

Baxter and I had a great experience during our training time at Dogsense. With Ms. Debbie's training technics, Baxter has become a much more calmer and obedient dog. Well worth the money we paid. üòç

Very consistent in the training with All of the trainers. Very pleased with the results so far. We've completed level 1 and highly recommend the day school before the levels. Owners need to understand that they have as much responsibility in learning the commands as the dogs do..üòâüòä

My dog and I completed all 3 levels of obedience training, and now she is on her way to earned AKC Tricks titles. She was very late to the game -starting at the age of 5 - however, determination, consistency, and a positive spirit is the recipe for champions.

Highly recommend to any dog owner!
I love that there is always something fun going on whether it be a photo op, arts and crafts, games, etc. I also could not speak more highly of the staff. Every staff member I have ever interacted with has been the absolute nicest, most helpful, and knowledgeable. My dog has had some issues adjusting after moving to a new apartment and the staff has been incredible with letting me know how he does each day and even providing recommendations and reassurance.
Dogtopia Downtown Orlando is truly the best daycare around. The staff is incredible! They truly treat your pup like their own!

Dogtopia Downtown Orlando is the best dog daycare around! This location goes above and beyond in regards to safety and cleanliness. Everyone is super helpful and friendly and my pup and I are so lucky to have this place close by! Highly recommend!
Excellent knowledgeable staff. Great place for day care for your four footed family members. Reasonable cost.
Very friendly staff and clean facility! I know my dog is taken care of when I drop her off. I love that they do theme days and have lunch and snack options you can purchase for your fur baby.

I love that they are an indoor doggie daycare in the Florida. So my dog can play with other dogs without getting overheated. They also often have special events going on like treats for purchase, raffles, and photoshoots. Highly recommend!

We absolutely love Dogtopia! Our dog Gus has been attending their doggy daycare for several months now, and we couldn't be happier with the experience. It's clear how much the staff genuinely care about all the dogs in their care! Gus always comes home happy and tired after a day of fun activities.

Dogtopia is also incredibly convenient. We appreciate the flexibility of being able to bring Gus in any day of the week. Plus, it's such a bonus to be able to easily schedule nail trims and other spa services while he's there. It saves us so much time and hassle. We highly recommend Dogtopia to any dog owner looking for a caring, fun, and convenient daycare option!

Dogtopia Fort Myers has been such a blessing for me and my pup! From the moment we walked in, the staff made us feel so welcome. They really take the time to get to know each dog‚Äôs personality, which gave me peace of mind leaving mine there. I love how clean and organized the facility is, and the playrooms are bright and safe.

One of my favorite parts is the live webcams‚ÄîI can check in during the day and see my dog playing and having fun, which is so reassuring. The team also does a great job with updates and genuinely cares about each dog‚Äôs well-being. My pup always comes home happy and tired (the best kind of tired!).

If you‚Äôre looking for daycare, boarding, or just a fun and safe place for your dog to socialize, I highly recommend Dogtopia Fort Myers. They truly treat your pet like family.

I brought storm in for the first time this past week and he absolutely loved it! He uses all his energy and has a blast with his friends there. The daily events are also something so exciting for him, and I love coming to pick him up with a surprise picture. Highly recommend!

Dogtopia of Fort Myers is just the best! My dog absolutely loves it. And while I can‚Äôt say enough good things about the daycare, my favorite is boarding him there. My dog actually gets excited when I pull out suitcases now! The facility is so clean, the staff is so kind, and I can always see my pup on the webcams. My family feels really lucky to have found this great place!!

provider_name: Dogtopia of Jacksonville at the Avenues
review_text: I could write for hours about how incredible the staff is here! Mt husband is deployed and I work in the ER for 12 hr shifts with a six year old to juggle and I have brought my dogs to pretty much every boarding/daycare place around Jax. NEVER ONCE HAVE THEY BEEN SO HAPPY SO WELL BEHAVED AT HOME (which is a godsend because at that point I am exhausted). The moment we pull into the parking lot they start to wiggle their whole bodies and cannot wait to get inside and play! They always look and smell so wonderful when I pick them up and I can tell both the dogs absolutely adore the staff (i usually have to walk with them to the dog entrance of any dog daycare to get them to be okay to leave me). The staff is beyond accommodating and works with my schedule and truly give my dogs so much love and attention I have noticed such an improvement in their overall happiness and behavior in just three sessions being here!  They are constantly playing and only have them in a small area for meals and a small break, otherwise they are outside or inside playing ALL DAY. I check the video cameras and love seeing them so happy and socializing. I would recommend this location to ALL dog owners they truly go above and beyond in every way and have exceeded my expectations more than I am able to put into words. We have been going through a rough patch and not being able to be home as much as usual was too hard on my high energy dogs and now with Dogtopia I am not stressed or worried about them at all and they come home and completely pass out. ONE OF THE BEST PARTS is the affordability for the incredible care they receive. I have paid double or more at other places and they are put in kennels for long periods of time during the day but not at dogtopia! My only regret is not finding them sooner!! Anthony , Lilac, Jacob thank you for being so helpful and welcoming and the two dog experts i had on Saturday the 21st who came in early and stayed late you deserve the recognition for your work and assistance and I feel terrible I cannot remember your names. See, I could go on for pages but you will not find better care for your dogs anywhere!!! Thank you all again we will 100% be regulars now!

provider_name: Dogtopia of Jacksonville at the Avenues
review_text: We have been taking our sweet golden girl Phoebe here since last October and she loves it. We had to push back her meet and greet originally due to a hotspot and they were so nice and understanding about rescheduling. We have also had concerns about making sure she only is given what we pack due to her stomach issues she deals with and the manager Rick made sure that the coaches know only to give her what we pack. Phoebe gets excited in the car just like she does when she goes to her grandma's house (which she loves going to her grandma's house) once she realizes where we are going. The team here is so nice and cares about what is best for our girl and even are excited when Phoebe walks through the door. They are even able to get her to dress up for photoshoots unlike when we tried at home and had no luck. She has so much fun with the staff and all of her friends she has made here.

provider_name: Dogtopia of Jacksonville at the Avenues
review_text: Just a couple days ago, we dropped our dog off for boarding. Of course I made the reservation incorrectly and I showed up 10 minutes before the door is even opened. Kimmy was SOOOOO cool about it! No huffing and puffing, just the usual big smile and friendly hello. We drive by 2 other Dogtopia‚Äôs on the way to the location on Phillips HWY by the Avenues mall  because it is as if the staff at this particular location looks at ‚Äògoing above and beyond‚Äô as the starting point. They have never failed to give the best customer service regardless of the friendly face that greets you at the door. Montana loves it here too‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Dogtopia of Jacksonville at the Avenues
review_text: I took my dog here last Tuesday. This is the only place he had been to in months. It was a visit to hopefully board him for my vacation at the end of the month. A few days later he starts acting strange. He picked up giardia. The infection spread and in a really freak and very quick chain of events he developed pneumonia. His kidneys failed his white blood cells were depleted and this turned into a pyothorax which led to sepsis and he passed away. I have no way to absolutely prove this is where it came from but he had literally gone nowhere else and only briefly went outside to pee and poop on a leash due to the heat over the past couple weeks. The timing and incubation period is too precise to be coincidental. I immediately took him to the vet at the onset of the symptoms but it was too late. Despite spending thousands to try to save his life he passed away. I'm honestly devastated. Please quadruple check that you are sanitizing everything. I am hoping no one has to go through this again.

provider_name: Dogtopia of Jacksonville at the Avenues
review_text: They took great care of my puppy and he slept great when he got home. Hard to do with a husky.

Donner Physical Therapy is an excellent choice for rehab after surgery. From the moment you walk in they are friendly and make you feel welcomed. The therapists are very professional and dedicated to making sure you are on the right road to recovery. They are knowledgeable and friendly and instill the confidence needed to make a full recovery. I highly recommend this facility

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about my experience at Donner PT! Jonathan played a huge role in my recovery after my arthroscopic knee procedure‚Äîhe was professional, knowledgeable, patient, and always reassuring. Every visit left me feeling encouraged and confident in my progress. The rest of the staff showed the same genuine care and warmth, making me feel truly supported every step of the way. Donner PT has created such a positive, welcoming environment for anyone recovering from injury, and I‚Äôm so grateful for their help in getting me back on my feet!

Just cannot say enough about Donner Physical Therapy!  The staff is amazing.  After not getting results at another facility, I am being treated by Donner Physical Therapy and I am on my way back after knee surgery.   THANK YOU again!!!  Very highly recommended!!

I think it deserves 10 stars!!!!!
Matt and his team are the Best! This is my second time getting PT there, and knowing from my past experience, I am absolutely confident that I will be back to 100 percent soon! Thank you Matt and team for everything you do!
Two of my kids have been to Donner for PT! We wouldn‚Äôt go anywhere else. They‚Äôre the BEST OF THE BEST! We highly recommend their PT practice.

provider_name: Double H Animal Massage Therapy and Rehabilitation
review_text: Melody is a fantastic Equine massage therapist! She massaged my mini and had him feeling absolutely wonderful. Highly recommend to anyone in the area looking for equine massage!

provider_name: Double H Animal Massage Therapy and Rehabilitation
review_text: I had my horse massaged as a pro-active measure, he is 20. He thoroughly enjoyed by his reaction. I also use essential oils on him and recommend as them.

I had such a great experience with Perez Rosbel. He was friendly, professional, and very straightforward, which immediately made me feel at ease. From the very beginning, he created a safe and comfortable space where I could truly open up about myself and my struggles without judgment. If I had known how easy and reassuring this first session would be, I would have scheduled my appointment much sooner.

What stood out the most was his ability to listen with compassion while also providing clear, practical guidance. It‚Äôs rare to find a provider who can balance empathy with no-nonsense advice, and Dr. Perez does exactly that.

As a Latina, it was especially meaningful to connect with a provider who understands cultural background and nuances. That sense of connection and cultural awareness made the entire experience even more comfortable and supportive.

I left my appointment feeling heard, understood, and hopeful about moving forward ‚Äî and I am genuinely looking forward to my next session with Dr. Perez. I highly recommend him to anyone who is seeking not only professional care but also someone who truly ‚Äúgets it‚Äù and makes you feel valued as a person.

I was so impressed with my experience with Dr. Santana. He is an exceptional doctor who truly cares about his patients. He‚Äôs knowledgeable, compassionate, and skilled, and I‚Äôm so grateful for his care. He helped me overcome a health issue that had been bothering me for years. He was always patient and understanding, and took the time to explain my treatment options in a way I could understand. The staff was also incredibly friendly and helpful including Dr. Jos√© and Jenny, just like the rest of the staff. I highly recommend Dr. Santana, and in general this office to anyone needing a compassionate and skilled doctor.

One thing I look into a facility that will handle my health and well being, is the people. I can absolutely say with 100% clarity that this place has the most caring people. The providers care so much that they are willing to listen and go above and beyond to make sure you are your best in every way. I recommended Dove Behavior to all I know who have to battle every day for a healthy mindset. Jose , is one of the most outstanding providers I‚Äôve met in my life, god bless him and his wife for proving the services they do. I‚Äôm a happy I was able to find someone like Jose in my life to help me fight my daily struggles. Thank you üôèüèΩ

I had a wonderful experience with Jose Crossier. He's compassionate, knowledgeable, and truly listen. His professionalism and patient-centered approach made me feel heard and understood. Highly recommend!"

We found the right place for our parents. The therapist is nothing but amazing, his energy and calmness that he brings into the session is nothing like i have seen before. At first we were intimidated with coming into therapy. However, the moment you walk in through those doors all those doubts, worries, & cares goes away. 10/10 would recommend if you are looking  for a place to find peace and be healed. Thank you

Changed a few months ago and am extremely happy here. Everyone is compassionate with our senior dachshund. We have a few times needed service at the last minute and are always accommodating. As you can see, our little George is happy also!

I‚Äôve been taking my pets here for years.
I‚Äôve seen the different doctors. They‚Äôve had some really good ones.
The office staff and techs are respectful and professional. They work as a team ensuring the correct info and details are addressed at the visit and check out. They inform me of costs and ways to save.
The techs are advocates for my pets. They have been for years. They do their best to communicate when they can. They‚Äôve helped me find solutions. They‚Äôve helped me say goodbye to my elderly pets. They‚Äôre compassionate and the reason why I‚Äôve kept coming back. They show up to ensure each patient gets the best care. So when appts may be delayed, I know it‚Äôs for a good reason.

I am thoroughly impressed with the service I have received from this veterinary clinic. The staff's kindness, patience, and understanding, particularly with my puppies, have been amazing. I still remember the day Dr. Irelan passed away and would like to offer my condolences to his family. May he rest in peace. The addition of the new veterinarian has been a valuable asset. She is amazing!  Thank you for your outstanding dedication to providing exceptional animal care.

I highly recommend Dr.Bob Ireland‚Äôs office! They take amazing care of my puppies every time I come in! Their staff is so friendly and helpful! I couldn‚Äôt be happier with them! Anyone looking for a new vet or puppy vet please give them a try!

KIM IS AN ANGEL! This is a nurse there, and she is made for work woth pets. Patient and kind, she seated on the floor to be anle to examined our dog that sufffers with anxiety. We tried at least 5 other places before and it was the only place he was able to be treated. We are glad and thankful!

Thank you Kim and Dr Deborah you both did an amazing job! God bless you!

provider_name: Dr. Christiana Marron - Physical Therapy Fort Lauderdale
review_text: I worked with Dr. Christiana for the first time after hearing great feedback from family and friends. Within 5 minutes she was able to unpack my physical issues, which I thought were all related to my back and discover there were other areas we need to focus on instead. Just in one session with her I could tell she had a beyond intimate understand of the body and put me en route to solving my "back" problem. Also, she cares. Most people in the medical field these days spend little to no time getting to know and working with their patients. It's all about how fast they can get you in and get you out. Not with Christiana. She was beyond thorough and took a comprehensive history. A total breath of fresh air and someone who absolutely found their calling in life. Looking forward to following her advice and going back for more.

provider_name: Dr. Christiana Marron - Physical Therapy Fort Lauderdale
review_text:
Hands down the best PT experience!

From the moment I walked in the door, Dr. Marron far exceeded my expectations. At my very first appointment, she took the time to thoroughly assess my medical conditions and develop a personalized plan to prepare me for my future knee replacement surgery while also helping me progress from a past surgery. Her attention to detail, expertise, and commitment to patient care are unparalleled.

The three-month wait for an appointment? Absolutely worth it. Dr. Marron is truly in the top 1% of the PT field‚Äîalways up to date on the latest innovations and techniques. Her approach isn‚Äôt just about exercises; it‚Äôs about long-term success and sustainable recovery. If you‚Äôre looking for a physical therapist who is knowledgeable, compassionate, and results-driven, look no further.

provider_name: Dr. Christiana Marron - Physical Therapy Fort Lauderdale
review_text: Dr. Marion is excellent. Very thorough in her evaluations and takes the time required to accurately assess your exact needs to prescribed treatment. I was very pleased with my i still appointment and look forward to my treatments.

provider_name: Dr. Christiana Marron - Physical Therapy Fort Lauderdale
review_text: Dr. Marron came highly recommend by a friend for shoulder PT. Dr. Marron is who you want taking care of you. Listening to you, assessing you to find root problem and coming up with treatment plan to get you to where you need to be. She gets it and has multiple resources to aid in recovery.

provider_name: Dr. Christiana Marron - Physical Therapy Fort Lauderdale
review_text:
I can't thank Dr. Marron enough!! She first helped me about 3 years ago when I was having extreme sciatica pain and didn't think I could walk again without surgery. Thanks to her knowledge and skills, I have been able to walk without surgery. She is very kind, understanding, and really knows & cares about what she is doing. She knows how to fix your problems and then get you on a routine to keep you that way.
This visit was for my neck pain and mostly my drop foot issue. Once again, she was able to get me back on track and I feel much better.
Thank you Dr. Marron &
thanks to assistant Chloe

I first went to a doctor after experiencing knee pain and was diagnosed with a torn meniscus. I was told surgery was the next step, but I was hesitant to jump right in. That‚Äôs when I came across Dr. Dan‚Äôs marketing and decided to reach out, truly the best decision I could have made.

Not only did I learn practical ways to strengthen my knee and manage the pain without surgery, but I also genuinely enjoyed working with him. He‚Äôs a good person, full of knowledge, and easy to trust. I can be a hard critic and a tough sell, but at the end of the day, I trusted Dr. Dan, and my knee pain is now pretty much completely gone.

As a healthcare provider myself, I respect the quality of his care and his evidence-based approach. I‚Äôll admit I was skeptical at first, was convinced I would need surgery, but this experience has been such a pleasant surprise. Thank you, Dr. Dan‚Ä¶you truly are the best!

Dan is a miracle worker!  I came to him with a lower back issue that I‚Äôve been dealing with for 18 months. He was able to diagnose what was happening within our first session. He is very knowledgeable and was able to explain everything to me in simple terms. Dan also gave me specific stretches/exercises to help.  Within a week the issue was gone. I‚Äôm continuing to follow his instructions and have been pain free for 2 months now.

Dr. Daniel comes so highly recommended by people I trust, and it‚Äôs easy to see why. His name consistently comes up in conversations around healing, professionalism, and genuine care. The way others speak about their experience with him says everything, thorough, attentive, and results-driven. I already feel confident in his expertise and the level of service he provides. It‚Äôs rare to find someone with both skill and heart.

I have been working with Dr. Dan for several weeks now, and I can honestly say it has been one of the best experiences I have had with any medical professional.

I have dealt with intermittent lower back pain for over a decade. After a particularly bad episode that left me barely able to walk a few feet without pain, I was referred to Dr. Dan by a family member.

Our initial consult was over the phone. Dr. Dan was attentive and asked thoughtful, probing questions to truly understand what I was going through. He did not rush the conversation and made me feel heard from the start.

When I visited him in person at his studio, he spent a full two hours carefully assessing me. He genuinely wanted to understand the root causes of my pain. Throughout the assessment, he explained in detail why my body was reacting the way it was. That educational component was invaluable. It was not just about what I needed to do; it was about why it would help.

At the end of the assessment, he laid out a clear 12-week plan, discussed potential outcomes, and gave me targeted mobility and strength exercises to get started right away. He set realistic expectations but also gave me hope and confidence in the process.

Now, after several weeks, I feel stronger. If I do get lower back tweaks, they are not as painful and the pain dissipates quickly. It is a radical improvement over where I was just a few weeks ago. There's more sessions to go and I know I'll only improve more and more.

I never felt rushed, and I always felt understood. Dr. Dan combines expertise with genuine care and a commitment to educating his patients. If you are struggling with chronic pain and want someone who will truly partner with you in your recovery, I cannot recommend him highly enough.

I had an excellent experience with Dr. Dan, New Horizons Physical Therapy.
From the first session, Dr Dan took the time to thoroughly assess my condition and create a personalized treatment plan. His professionalism, knowledge, and encouragement made a real difference in my recovery. The clinic was clean and well-equipped. Thanks to Dr. Dan I‚Äôve regained mobility and strength much faster than I expected. I Highly recommend Dr. Dan to anyone seeking quality physical therapy care!

review_text:
Dr. Dei is the best Physical Therapist and person! She always makes me feel welcome and validated. Her patience, care, and warmth is inspiring!

provider_name: Dr. Gs Urgent Care Coral Springs FL
review_text: My son hit his head late at night and we were so concerned we decided to take him here for a quick visit. The girls at the desk were very nice, followed by Jack the medical assistant also very nice, and saw the NP Bianca. Left with ease and comfort. Bianca even called us the next day to check in. 5 star service all around

provider_name: Dr. Gs Urgent Care Coral Springs FL
review_text: Came back from a cruise sick with coughing fever and fatigued. Doctors ran chest X-ray for possible pneumonia but found no definitive diagnosis so they gave me shots daily for five days as a precaution due to my history with bacterial pneumonia which hospitalized me twice before. Thankfully I am improving each day. Everyone was kind and respectful. It‚Äôs a nice urgent care and very convenient.

provider_name: Dr. Gs Urgent Care Coral Springs FL
review_text: From the reception, the nurse, doctor and radiology staff, my experience was amazing. They showed courtesy, compassion and a true level of professionalism. I highly recommend this facility if you need to be seen by an urgent care. They even called the following day to check on me and ensure that I am doing well. I‚Äôm extremely pleased with the service offered and will choose this facility if ever I need urgent medical treatment.

provider_name: Dr. Gs Urgent Care Coral Springs FL
review_text: I am truly disgusted and appalled with the actions and attitude of the receptionist Iggy or Izzy or whatever she calls herself. After getting my test results back on 9/24/25 and having negative side effects from the prescribed medication that the Dr told me to call them if it were to occur, When I called to speak with the doctor the FIRST time I was instantly placed on hold for 1 hour 10 minutes and 41 seconds, during which i called back with my other phone to see what was going on. Iggy/Izzy or whatever her name is answered the phone with an attitude as if I was bothering her, then when I asked if its customary to place a patient on hold for over an hour without even checking in on them from time to time or God Forbid that she get up and tell the Dr that her patient is having a bad reaction and is very concerned about his diagnosis, NO, she proceeds to tell me that she did her job by transferred me and that she did not put me on hold and that it wasn't her fault that the Dr didn't answer with the mist disgusting attitude ever. I left my name and phone number with her to have the Dr. Call me back to go over my side effects and my diagnosis and i have yet to receive a phone call to this day 9/30/25. So I ended up going the ER and was given additional medication and was given documentation in regards to my concern. It is so unfortunate that this 1 representative has tarnished my relationship with your company. Both Dr's that I saw were ABSOLUTELY AWSOME & the nurses are GREAT, I have ABSOLUTELY NOTHING NEHATIVE TO SAY ABOUT THEM, THEY WERE AMAZING, but whatever her name is needs some training in regards to her mannerism and etiquette.

provider_name: Dr. Gs Urgent Care Coral Springs FL
review_text: Short wait..Pleasant staff.  Took care of my issue efficiently. Very pleasant and knowledgeable LPN on duty. Took care of the pharmacy script immediately. Would definitely use their services again if the need arises for minor issues.
I have been going to Dr. Brandon for about 10 years. I wouldn‚Äôt want anyone else adjusting me. I feel so much better getting check regularly for subluxations with Dr. Brandon.

After going to a chiropractor who was only trying to upsell me,  then discontinuing my insurance I knew it was time to change.  After my consult and first two adjustments Dr. Brandon is truly a practicing professional that is interested in her patient's health other than their pocketbook.  I'm a 71 year old senior that couldn't be happier to have decided on making an 80 mile round trip to be in her care.  I will continue to see her regularly because I am confident she will make me feel far younger than my age.
Jeff Z.

First off, I wish I could give 100 stars! Dr. Brandon is so amazing where do I even begin? I had been a patient (a VERY inconsistent patient) for the last two years. I would go to get adjusted along with my daughter (3) and son (9). I could always tell a difference after visiting but just didn't make regular chiropractic care a priority until April of this year. I was in a head on collision at no fault of my own this April and was 23 weeks pregnant at the time. It left my car totaled and my body very banged up.

Being that I was 23 weeks pregnant the overall consensus from any doctor I spoke to was we can't help you until after the baby is born. I was left with whiplash, back pain, and severe pelvic pain which was terrifying given that we are on a countdown to me giving birth. It was very discouraging, until I went back to Dr. Brandon.

Flash forward a month and a half. I have seen Dr. Brandon 2-3 a week and what a lifesaver and MIRACLE worker she has been. I still have a way to go to be back at 100%, but every time I am adjusted I can feel a difference for the better. This is my third pregnancy and for the first time I have people asking me, how do you feel so good? How are you so comfortable at this stage and moving around so easily? I give most of the credit to Dr. Brandon. This is my first pregnancy with regular adjustment and the first pregnancy where I still feel amazing at 30 weeks AND after a bad car accident!

Every time my pelvic pain comes back, one trip to see Dr. Brandon and the pain is gone! Her continued care has greatly improved my quality of life in more ways than helping heal the injuries from the accident. I have always suffered from horrible allergies and congestion, issues that are almost completely nonexistent after her routine chiropractic care.

Let's not forget to mention she is also beyond amazing with children. Patient, kind, and so gentle, there isn't anyone else I would trust my littles with! I cannot wait to bring our newest addition for his adjustments with Dr. B! If you've been searching for a great family chiropractor then search NO MORE!!!

Dr. Brandon, thank you for making affordable chiropractic care available and for improving the quality of mine and my children's lives through your work!!!!

Dr. Brandon has been adjusting me throughout my pregnancy and I can definitely feel a difference!  She takes her time with you in the room and is very knowledgeable on a variety of topics.
I will be bringing my newborn to her once born!

We have been seeing Dr Brandon for a little over a month. For the first time in over 7 years I do not have chronic hip pain (I‚Äôve been to physical therapy and seen several chiropractors regularly for several years)! Her approach to treatment has been gentle yet straightforward. I would highly recommend scheduling a time to receive treatment.

provider_name: Dr. Justin D'Arienzo, Psychologist and Relationship Expert
review_text: This premarital course was a 5-star experience. Although it was online, it felt close, clear, and very well organized. Dr. Justin D‚ÄôArienzo, the clinical psychologist who conducted it, demonstrated great knowledge and sensitivity, guiding us through fundamental topics such as communication, conflict management, finances, and values as a couple. Each session was practical and deeply reflective. At the end, we felt prepared to build a marriage on solid foundations. I recommend this course to any couple who wishes to start their life together with maturity, awareness, and real tools for daily life. Thank you!! Dr. D‚ÄôArienzo.

provider_name: Dr. Justin D'Arienzo, Psychologist and Relationship Expert
review_text: This course was amazing! It helped us improve our communication and understand each other better. The lessons were clear, practical, and easy to follow. I highly recommend it to any couple preparing for marriage!

provider_name: Dr. Justin D'Arienzo, Psychologist and Relationship Expert
review_text: Took the premarital course and it was fantastic. very in depth and gave me and my fianc√© a great approach to our marriage. we really set aside the time to align our goals and talk through a lot of things we needed to focus on.

provider_name: Dr. Justin D'Arienzo, Psychologist and Relationship Expert
review_text: Dr D‚ÄôArenzio was very professional, approachable, accommodating, and very personable. He does what he says he will do, and gives you clear, concise, and direct instructions. He is available for follow-ups, and does not make you feel like you are not important. He took the time to ask questions and explain every step. There was no question he invested time in the process. provider_name: Dr. Justin D'Arienzo, Psychologist and Relationship Expert
review_text: Hello world, me and my fianc√© took this course as we are soon to be wed and had a wonderful experience! It is affordable, self-paced, and easy to navigate. Watching the videos and completing the activities allowed us to connect more with one another, find out things we didn't know, learn about effective communication and so much more. We are pleased we took this course! We completed the course together and I think that made all the difference! To any couple that wants to take an online premarital course, definitely take this one! We are equally more ready to say I do than before! You will not be disappointed! We shared moments together, learned more about each other, laughed and just truly connected. We have a deep appreciation of each other now after going through this course! #frommisstomrs #2025newlyweds

review_text: Dr. Lago is super thorough and truly cares for her patients. You can tell she is very passionate about what she does!! She is super easy to work with.

Dr. Fishman is so wonderful he listened. He was compassionate, and he really truly made me feel like he was concerned about what was going on. Dr. Fishman provided me with excellent medical service since I met him in my first appointment. In addition, they provide PRPs (Platelets Rich in Plasma) treatment at their office. Also with Dr. Fishman is Dr. Romero another specialist physician that work with joints.  I definitely recommend team of physicians and practice.

Amazing Dr. and Staff

I have been suffering with chronic back pain for over a year. I initially had an appointment with another Orthopedic, but not for a few weeks out. I decided to Google to see if I could find someone and get in sooner. I read the reviews for Dr. Fishman which were impressively all great. I called the office, grateful if I could get an appointment in the next week and to my surprise, they told me I could come in that morning. I gladly took the appointment and Dr. Fishman was exactly what the reviews had said, compassionate, patient, and knowledgeable. I recently started PT at his office and the therapists there, as well as the front desk staff are also excellent. Would highly recommend this practice.

provider_name: Dr. Patrick Bartholomew: Family Foot & Leg Center - Cape Coral
review_text: I‚Äôve been seeing Dr. Bartholomew for quite a while with a number of foot issues. They just go to work and they‚Äôre done before you know it. These are the pros that make things look easy. Dr. Bartholomew is one of those. he is quick, compassionate, and smart, and very skilled. The staff is also excellent, engaging and appropriate. He gets my highest recommendation.

provider_name: Dr. Patrick Bartholomew: Family Foot & Leg Center - Cape Coral
review_text: Dr. Bartholomew and his assistant were very professional and caring. He explained everything to me and did the procedure to remove my toe nail. provider_name: Dr. Patrick Bartholomew: Family Foot & Leg Center - Cape Coral
review_text: Dr Bartholomew and staff are amazing. From the second you check in to the moment you leave they are there to assist you with everything. provider_name: Dr. Patrick Bartholomew: Family Foot & Leg Center - Cape Coral
review_text: This visit was my first time to see a foot doctor and I had no idea what to expect. Dr. Bartholomew and his staff were friendly and caring, which put my mind and nerves at ease.

provider_name: Dr. Patrick Bartholomew: Family Foot & Leg Center - Cape Coral
review_text: Thank you for seeing me today on short notice. I am looking forward to having my feet feel like they are mine again. The young girl that helped me was very nice and professional.

I have been seeing Fran at Dr. Physio to help rebuild strength after major abdominal surgery. She has an incredible combination of skills, blending expert knowledge with a compassionate, personalized approach. I look forward to our sessions - filled with challenges and fun! And I always leave feeling stronger both physically and mentally. She recently switched offices to Delray, and she's so amazing that I happily drive an hour each way to see her! Thanks to her guidance, I have changed my approach to aging and overall wellbeing. I highly recommend!

Fran is a brilliant kind gifted angel.  My husband has Parkinson‚Äôs.  He had fallen several times and was slowing down.  The neurologist referred us here. The only PT I was familiar w was the traditional ‚Äúsports therapy‚Äù.  After the first session I nearly cried.  This is not sports therapy ‚Ä¶ this is neurological physical therapy.  The difference is amazing.  Exercises involve multiple tasks involving the brain and body.  She rarely repeats an exercise ‚Ä¶ which makes the hour so  interesting.  And appropriately challenging.  My husband has improved greatly.  Almost no falls. He is stronger and more confident.  He looks forward to his 3 sessions per week.  We love Fran and are continually impressed w her skills and manner. She is an angel.

We have also had the opportunity to use the other physical therapist and have found them to be equally engaging and kind and professional and amazing.

I tried to make an online appointment and filled out the information. The next day, I received a call, but I was feeling too unwell to answer. I called back the following day, and they mentioned that they needed to verify my insurance before scheduling. I provided the necessary information and was told they would contact me that day, but I never received a call.

The next week, I left another message, and they informed me that they couldn't proceed because my insurance info was incorrect. I tried to call again to ask for an email address, but no one answered. I waited until the next day and inquired again. This time, they told me to send a referral via email, which I did. However, they claimed that the referral doctor‚Äôs signature was missing and that they couldn't schedule my appointment.

Despite my insurance not requiring a referral, it took five days just to try to make an appointment, and in the end, I gave up. I'm a sick person and am exhausted from trying to make this appointment. I had been communicating with a receptionist named Claria throughout this process. Even the hospital appointments aren‚Äôt this difficult.

My mom absolutely loves coming here, and their therapy has really had a tremendous impact on the quality of her life. The staff is always great to work worth. Her therapists Fran, Lenny, and Arif are extremely knowledgeable. I think what also really helps is that they genuinely care about my mom‚Äôs wellbeing. I would certainly recommend Dr Physio and his therapists to anyone looking for Physical Therapy.
My wife Mary has been attending Dr Physio since February battling a bad phase of Parkinson‚Äôs.She has made steady progress with the help of the amazing and caring staff.

provider_name: Dr. Rob Poliszuk PT, DPT, CSCS (The Mobile Physical Therapist)
review_text: Dr. Rob is the best. Not only is he really skilled at his craft, but also he's a good guy and hilarious. Win win. I had some sort of deep rhomboid sprain (shoulder/trap muscle) back in May (I think I lifted too heavy in a class) and stopped working out to let it heal...but it never went away. I went to the chiropractor who then sent me to Dr. Rob and he tried so many different therapies to get this muscle to ease up. It took several sessions (sans insurance at that!) but I didn't actually do the home exercises until it got acute (my bad). In retrospect, I reaaaally wish I had just listened to him and started those earlier because I'm pretty sure it was the combo of the exercises + the last few sessions with Dr. Rob that finally healed my injury!!! It only took 4 months (I legit thought it was permanent) but I'm so grateful Dr. Rob was relentless in trying to figure out how to get to the bottom of it. He also got me over my fear of working out again and got me back to my classes despite my injury (it was necessary and I hadn't realized it). I honestly never go to PTs but I will def be back.

provider_name: Dr. Rob Poliszuk PT, DPT, CSCS (The Mobile Physical Therapist)
review_text: For years Dr‚Äôs gave me referral to take physical therapy‚Ä¶ but I will go one or two or three time and then I did not go anymore. This is because I didn‚Äôt like to go out to physical therapy‚Äôs places. One day I saw this advertising on Facebook. Offering physical therapy at home. I called and here I am. I am taking 3 physical therapy each week at home. . I am so happy. I had balance‚Äôs difficulty and pain in my lower back.Now I feel  much better, my condition improved. I even feel younger. Thanks to this Great program, created by Dr Rob Poliszuk . Thanks to my therapist, Jeannette, very profesional and she takes her time to guide me through the process to improve my limitations. I hope others can benefits of this program.

provider_name: Dr. Rob Poliszuk PT, DPT, CSCS (The Mobile Physical Therapist)
review_text: Dr. Rob Poliszuk is hands down the best Physical Therapists I've been to in years. He is very knowledgeable and pays attention to your body and what your complaints are about the pain you're experiencing. I've always been very active and I came to see him due to lower back and hip pain that was affecting my ability to train. My condition has improved tremendously with my pain level much lower than when I first started seeing him. He gives you home exercises that you must do in order to see progress with your condition. The best part is that he is a 1-to-1 PT and will give you total attention for the entire session. After trying a few other physical therapists, I have found the one I will stick with because he is simply the best. I'm looking forward to a stronger lower back and posterior chain with all of the knowledge I've gained with Dr. Poliszuk.

provider_name: Dr. Rob Poliszuk PT, DPT, CSCS (The Mobile Physical Therapist)
review_text: Dr. Rob is very knowledgeable and great at what he does. I have a lower back injury that I got over 2 years ago while deadlifting and ever since then I‚Äôve experienced pain in my lower back. With his therapy and exercises the discomfort has decreased significantly and I can now perform movements that involve my lower back with more confidence and much less pain. You should definitely see him if you suffer from a chronic pain or injury!

provider_name: Dr. Rob Poliszuk PT, DPT, CSCS (The Mobile Physical Therapist)
review_text:
Dr Rob is an amazing physical therapist. The very personalized therapy that  he gave me in my home,  healed my injury.
Dr. Rob is very wise and extremely caring. He gave so much time and attention to my health and well being.
He was always available by text and phone in between sessions.  He‚Äôs a great physical therapist, and I highly recommend him.

Kaitlin Griffith, PA-C is truly one of the most compassionate and attentive Physician Assistants I‚Äôve ever had. From the moment you meet her, she makes you feel heard and valued. We can‚Äôt thank Dr. Harris enough for the support she‚Äôs given our family. Dr charpentier is the best. Jessica at the front always accommodates us when needed and she is super friendly. The techs always greet waffle as well which is so sweet even when they aren‚Äôt working with us. We‚Äôve taken all our family dogs and here and now my precious waffle!

They know exactly how to handle the difficult dogs which I appreciate more than I could ever express. I would recommend this vet to everyone. The most affordable I‚Äôve found that can actually handle my dogs. My dogs have been banned from a few other places for no good reason. So I‚Äôm so grateful for the staff and doctors at this clinic. For reference, I have two bad chihuahuas. I work on training everyday but I still have a lot to learn too.

Boy oh boy, putting down your fifteen year old family pet is HARD.

This team was so darn considerate, helpful and kind. The hand written card they sent us days later made me cry all over again.

Thank you for helping our family though and incredibly tough time.

Please BEWARE of this vet.  We lost our fur baby due to incompetence on an echocardiogram.  She doesn‚Äôt know what she‚Äôs doing.  We found out the hard way when she sedated our pup who shouldn‚Äôt have been sedated.  We have since found out that other vets do not sedate for echocardiograms.  We trusted her with our baby and got burned.  We will forever regret the day we took him there. I regret not asking more questions because she never expressed any potential risks.  I regret not getting a second opinion from another vet, but we trusted her and now regret it.   He would still be with us if we hadn‚Äôt taken him there.  We gave her a happy dog who played with his toys everyday, loved to go for the mail, chase lizards and go for rides.  She gave us a body to bury.  To make matters worse she lies to people about how many times she has done this.  Also, take a look at what she did to the dog in the Deb Schultz review.  Something is very wrong at this clinic and it should be investigated.

Drove up from Parkland because I kept hearing great things about Draxen Farms, had to try it for myself! My 10 month old Border Collie had the best time with Mike and his team. Great people and over all a fun and relaxed day. Definitely bring some sunscreen and snacks too!

My dog Kona and I had so much fun at Draxen farms this weekend! Mike is so kind and knowledgeable and made us feel welcome, and took his time individualizing each dogs training and herding lessons. The dogs really have a blast out here. It‚Äôs a great way to exercise them physically and mentally. And it‚Äôs so fun watching all the dogs unique styles as they herd the animals. Bring water cause it‚Äôs hot. Snacks too and plan to spend a little time out here. It‚Äôs a lot of fun! Thanks mike for having us, we can‚Äôt wait to come back!

Mike is 1st class My Husban and I had a great time with our two pups We also met a very nice couple with there pup. Lots of fun watching  the dogs work the sheep. We plan on doing this on a regular basis  Well worth the money
