WOW! Duran‚Äôs K9 training has completely transformed my 6 month pup. Briggs stayed for a one month beginner/off leash training course and has come back the most perfect dog. Following all basic commands, stays in place (with distractions- ducks, cats, other dogs), nicely walks on and off the leash, and is overall in much more control of his energy. Most importantly, they took the time to teach us how to communicate with our boy to maintain what he‚Äôs taught him. With each class we attended, we were more and more impressed with his advancements. I cannot recommend this training program. We will for sure be back with any future doggies!!!

Duran K-9 is amazing! I couldn‚Äôt be happier with the training and care my dog received here. From day one, he was professional, knowledgeable, and genuinely passionate about working with dogs. He took the time to understand my dog‚Äôs specific needs and behavior issues and created a training plan that actually worked.

You can tell he really prioritize the dogs‚Äô safety and well-being. I especially appreciated the regular updates and videos ‚Äî it was so reassuring to see my dog making progress and having fun at the same time.

After training with Duran K-9, my dog is more confident, obedient, and happier overall. I‚Äôve learned so much too ‚Äî they made sure I felt supported and equipped to continue the training at home.

If you‚Äôre looking for trustworthy, effective dog training with a personal touch, I highly recommend Duran K-9. They truly care about the dogs and their families!

Best investment ever. After doing a lot of research I found them and once I contacted them communication was very clear, detailed and easy. I had concerns that were patiently addressed and even some changes in my schedule that were accommodated without issues. Jorge is amazing, he definitely has a gift and the knowledge. The place is very clean.. spacious.. carefully designed to do the job. Our puppy did the three weeks obedience training. He did a lot of leash pulling, barking at everything/everyone, not being comfortable around other dogs. By week one his behavior had already transformed tremendously and it just got better as time passed. Still the same sweet puppy but with noticeable discipline. With every visit we learned everything that was added to the training and worked with him one on one. The last class was at home where Jorge took the time to help create a safe space and routine as well as walking with us in the neighborhood to teach us how to use the puppy and our new skills outdoors too. We love how this process turned out, we can now enjoy different activities and include our puppy in all of them. Highly recommended.

Before reaching out to Jorge, our dog Theo struggled with leash pulling, excessive barking, running out the door, and being overly excited. From beginning to end the whole process was smooth and efficient. We chose the 4 week basic and off-leash board and training program. Jorge is an amazing trainer! His owner training sessions were very thorough and filled with clear instructions on how to maintain the proper structure. I also enjoyed receiving videos of Theo on his progress throughout training. Theo is completely different after his training! He is now able to go on walks without pulling on the leash and go off leash as well. He is no longer barking excessively and he is able to hang out in the house in his place. Jorge‚Äôs wife was a sweetheart too. I highly recommend them for any of your dog training needs!

A Game-Changer for Our Family and Our Pup!

When we noticed that Alpy, our Micro Bernedoodle, was no longer responding to commands and had developed some challenging behaviors, like constant barking and jumping, we knew we needed help. That‚Äôs when we discovered Duran K9 Training on social media.

After watching several of their videos, it was clear we had made some early mistakes, like giving Alpy too much freedom too soon. Their content alone was incredibly eye-opening, and we immediately felt this was the right place for us.

Alpy spent **three weeks at their training facility**, and the transformation was unbelievable. He came back a completely different dog, focused, responsive, and so much more in tune with us. He now follows commands instantly, and even when he tests boundaries, a single correction is all it takes.

We are beyond happy and grateful for Jorge and the entire Duran K9 team. They not only took excellent care of Alpy, but gave us the tools, structure, and guidance we needed to strengthen our bond and truly communicate with our pup.

Thanks to their program, the stress and frustration have turned into joy and confidence. We couldn‚Äôt recommend Duran K9 Training enough!

I am very impressed with both Drs.Angie and Tyre. They both are dedicated in making one feel better. They use special techniques in getting swelling down and fluid retention gone. Dr. Angie And Dr. Tyre are amazing and willing to help figure out what the issues with my hip and foot. They are amazing and you should definitely go to see them.

Last summer I took my dog to aTaming Tarzan course at Peggy Adams Animal shelter. The course was held in an outdoor pavilion. Upon arrival there were childrens preschool dividers separating the dogs, 9 dogs. This was not a good solution. They attempted to put my 95lb dog and I in the middle of the pavilion with only 3 sides. When that didn't go well, they seemed very bothered that we had to rearrange the dogs to accommodate us.
This is the description of the class. "This reactive dog training course is a specialized training program designed to help dogs who exhibit reactive behavior, such as excessive barking, lunging, or growling in response to specific triggers. This class employs positive reinforcement techniques to teach dogs alternative."  My dog is adopted and leash aggressive with other dogs. This setup is not condusive to dogs with actually aggression. We got very little individual instruction. Throwing food on the ground is the main technique used to distract your dog. My dog is VERY good motivated but was so overwhelmed she didn't care about hotdogs. The second class she expected us to start walking our dogs past each other. That was definitely NOT happening for at least 3 of the 8 dogs. When Jamie came to check in with us and I told her that my dog was struggling with this food on ground distraction technique. She told me that I needed to put my dog on medication! I'd literally spoken to this woman 3 times for less than 10 total. There an on boarding zoom call. The zoom call with 8 pet guardians was completely unproductive and Jamie clearly hadn't actually listened to what the dogs actual issues were. She didn't even suggest individual training. Just straight to medicating my dog. My dog is not aggressive in general. She lives with a kitten. I was so shocked that this was her best advice for me. I wrote to Peggy Adams and told them that the class wasn't a good fit for my dog. They graciously refunded the entire amount of the class. If your dog has true aggression issues with other dogs I wouldn't suggest that you take this class or any class from this lady.

From the moment I walked through the doors, I was met with compassion, professionalism, and a genuine commitment to helping children reach their fullest potential. Early Path Pediatric Therapy is amazing choice for OT services, especially because of Prema! As an OT, she has a gift for connecting with kids and bringing out the best in them. Her patience, creativity, and passion for her work are truly inspiring. If your child needs therapy, I highly recommend Prema - she's amazing!

I cannot express enough gratitude for the incredible work our child‚Äôs occupational therapist Prema has done. From the very beginning, she approached our child with so much patience, care, and professionalism. It‚Äôs clear that she not only understands the needs of children with special needs, but she also truly cares about their progress and well-being.

Thanks to Prema's support, our child has made wonderful improvements not only in her motor skills and coordination, but also in her confidence and willingness to try new things. Each session is engaging, purposeful, and tailored to our child‚Äôs unique strengths and challenges. Her therapist celebrates every little win with us, and that makes all the difference.

One of the things we appreciate most is how she communicates with us after every session. The way she explains what was worked on, how our child responded, and what progress was made is truly amazing. Her clear and thoughtful feedback helps us better understand the hard work and dedication she puts into each therapy session.

As a parent, it's incredibly reassuring to know that your child is in the hands of someone so skilled, compassionate, and dedicated. We are truly thankful to have her on our family's team!

Great energy!! Since the beginning I‚Äôve seen them take a personalized, child-centered approach, ensuring that each session is purposeful and aligned with developmental goals. They have been exceptional, bringing creativity, patience, and clinical expertise to every interaction. Their ability to build trust and engagement has made a significant difference in our progress.
Prema‚Äôs work is absolutely incredible! She goes above and beyond to ensure her clients success. She has so much love and care for what she does, simply beautiful to see!! üß°üß°

Be prepared to get ignored when you only want the best for your child! I sent out a email requesting a new therapist for my son being that the one he has is extremely busy. She is amazing, however my child needs a SET schedule out of a whole month he was only seen ONCE. I sent a email requesting a change and haven‚Äôt heard nothing ! Also his therapist who is STILL ASSIGNED to him is still doing NO SHOWS! EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to no other parent.

I know that the people who work with and for Early Steps have a rough go of it. There are thousands of children who need their services and only so many providers and resources to go around. I personally had the BEST experience with this entity while my daughter was in early intervention, which is why I am reviewing them. I had efficient and professional support, I was able to get the services my child needed and through providers that we absolutely LOVED. I only wish that intervention carried over just a bit longer than 3 years old (a gal can dream, can't she?). Thank you so much to all the staff that assisted and served us through the year and a half that we were involved in Early Steps. We are more appreciative than you will ever know!

My pediatrician sent out a referral to Early Steps to get my son to see a Speech Therapist. I received a call the following day from Early Steps and they took down my information. She told me that a Speech Therapist and a Coordinator would send me an email with a Zoom link soon. It had been three days and I received no email so I thought maybe they accidentally wrote down my email incorrectly. I spent hours trying to get a hold of Early Steps. A woman named Alexis from the front office finally answered the phone. Alexis was extremely rude and unpleasant to deal with. I explained to her my situation and politely asked questions. She took an aggressive and combative tone almost immediately and basically told me she couldn't help me and there was no one I could reach out to for help.
This left a bad taste in mouth and I will be looking for a different Speech Therapy program for my son.

Early intervention is FUNDAMENTAL for kids with a delay! This program does not take their purpose serious enough! So DISAPPOINTED that I‚Äôve been trying to contact them for four weeks leaving voicemails and sending emails but not hearing back. Will update my review if I ever hear back from them.

UPDATE
They have contacted me. Still waiting for an evaluation. Started trying to contact them since April and the appointment is for the end of July.

2nd UPDATE

Evaluation was July 30th, is now OCT 9th and it seems like we‚Äôre finally gonna start early intervention.

I WISH I COULD GIVE 0 STARS. BEEN WAITING 6 MONTHS FOR THERAPY FOR THEM TO TELL ME THERES NO ONE FOR THE AREA. Um maybe try spreading people out????!!! THIS IS TALLAHASSEE NOT MIAMI OR A BIG CITY. JUST AWFUL!

We had a good experience. They stay on top of things  I was contacted right away and kept track of through the entire process. They did not leave me hanging and always answered my questions and followed up. We received speech and OT services through private contractors with this program and they were both wonderful. They also took us through the steps needed to get my son into a pre-k program that will provide the continuing special services he needs . I would def recommend we had no issues and it was very helpful.

I was nervous going into this because I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs happening with my son. From the moment my coordinator came to see us for the initial visit I felt better. Today we went to the Early Steps building for the second screening. My coordinator (Amy) was there and I think that‚Äôs really important and made me feel more at ease. The process was painless for my son and even fun. They are incredibly helpful as well. üòÇ my son decided to poop the moment we got there and they were not shy to help me instead of watching me struggle. They aren‚Äôt quick to label or judge your choices as a parent. The women I dealt with today were nothing short of spectacular. I am excited to continue this and get my son the help he desperately needs. It‚Äôs so much better feeling like these people are in your corner rather than feeling as if you‚Äôre being looked at. Love them ‚ù§Ô∏è

At first I was unsure about the program. After waiting for them to contact me for over a month I was finally able to get in touch with them myself. I was given the number of a woman named Erica who was going to be the coordinator. She stated my sons dr gave her the wrong contact information for me... ok whatever I let it slide. After that things seemed like they were looking up. I took my son to the evaluation where I was told they had 30 days to find him a provider. After that I never heard anything else. So after 2 weeks I contacted them. Erica told me she should be hearing back from a provider by the end of that day and then she would contact me. Of course she never did. As the 30th day approached I messaged Erica again asking what was going on. Then she was a little rude with me stating that she told me she would call me when she found someone. Which is not at all what she had originally told me. So on the 30th day she finally said she found someone and that the therapist would contact me. The therapist contacted me the following day and made an appointment for 10:00 AM on a Monday. At 9:30pm!!!!! Sunday night she texted me to inform me that she had to reschedule for 1:00 Monday instead of 10am which I was fine with considering I took the entire day off from work anyway. Then at 12:30pm on Monday, 30 minutes before the appointment she texted me again canceling and said she would call me that evening to reschedule, she never called. The following day I messaged her and asked when we could reschedule. At that point she told me the coordinator would be in touch with me. So now I still have no idea what is going on. They only provide service until 3 and my son will be 3 in March. They have dragged this process out so far that now they won‚Äôt have to give him service at all!!!! I‚Äôm extremely upset with the way this has played out.
They are angels.. helped us so much .. will be forever grateful. Special thanks to Tarsha, Sage, and Rachel
I have 3 kids and i brought them in and i needed to bring my sons car seat back to the car andi brought my daughter out and slipped down the hill and twisted my ankle

The receptionist Kanesha was so unprofessional. When she called she didn‚Äôt even tell me what company she was with and just started asking questions. Did not consider my time after I told her I was on a short break and would call back later. She couldn‚Äôt pronounce my children‚Äôs names continuously to the point where I didn‚Äôt even know who she was talking about. After asking at least 15 times if I could call back and starting an argument with me she told me she‚Äôs canceling our referral, which she obviously didn‚Äôt even read because she didn‚Äôt even know the problems we were referred for which are clearly written in a referral from the pediatrician. She basically argued with me for 8 minutes and hung up on me. I understand that this company offers free service but with that customer service I would rather pay for people who actually consider the patients and their families and leave us with a good first impression, not people who are starting their first jobs and don‚Äôt understand basic human courtesy.

My son had his evaluations today and everyone was so caring and attentive. They did everything they could to make him comfortable and relaxed. They have such an amazing program and I am super thankful for their assistance.
Ms.G get 5 start. They not paying her enough for all that she gives. This women goes above and beyond the call of duty.
Ms. G and Pray are AMAZING! I‚Äôm so glad I have them to take such good care of my child.

provider_name: Easterseals Florida, Treasure Coast Early Steps
review_text: I especially want to thank Nordia Roman, my first case coordinator at Early Steps. She is an excellent person, a quality worker who cares about people and I could say a thousand more things about her. Without really knowing me, she gave me the support that I needed at that time. Unfortunately, they assigned me to someone else because I was not in their area. It was terrible and frustrating because the other person did not really care about anything. But thanks to Nordia, who was always there, despite not being my coordinator anymore, she continued to support me until they assigned me another one. Which was good. Thank you, Aubrie Sutton, my last coordinator, for finishing this program in a pleasant way‚Ä¶ Thank you to all those people (Therapists) who really helped me and my baby. Sometimes the process is frustrating but never give up‚Ä¶ Thank you all‚Ä¶

provider_name: Easterseals Florida, Treasure Coast Early Steps
review_text: I went to Early Steps because obviously I‚Äôm noticing a delay with my child when I first walked in things seemed promising until my appointment was 30 minutes late. I understand things happen but I had another appointment I had to be at by 12:40, which is why I arrived on time. I am not sure who this person is that works within the staff but she kept coming out and making comments about my child comments like wow he really can‚Äôt focus or wow he really can‚Äôt read or wow he can‚Äôt even look at that book , let‚Äôs take out me being a ‚Äúmama bear‚Äù and being offended and just say there are ways to go about saying things without offending someone. This was not even the person who does the clinical evaluation. I felt like my child was being judged, it was an awful feeling. I am concerned as it is. I will just go through Fiddlers in a couple of months.

provider_name: Easterseals Florida, Treasure Coast Early Steps
review_text: Got a referral for early steps for my son for his speech delay and the lady that that they sent out to my house seemed friendly at first however as Time passed on she was became very unprofessional I honestly thought that for her it was just a job like she didn't really care didn't have a real interest or passion for helping kids she purposely miss a appointment one time and then now strangely couldn't come back to work and they were going to switch over to virtual visits and I accept to sign up for it in she told me that she would send over the link so that I could sign up and she NEVER did smh pathetic!

provider_name: Easterseals Florida, Treasure Coast Early Steps
review_text: Great place. The therapist they are sending to my house is in the process of helping my son and his progressing Thank you

provider_name: Easterseals Florida, Treasure Coast Early Steps
review_text: Awesome staff. No complaints so far.

Worst Place Ever!!! I dont even know how they stay in business, they must be scamming the insurance companies! They never returned any phone calls I finally get an appointment set after 3 weeks of trying to communicate with them and they cancel the appointment on sunday. My daughter really needs her ABA back! Now going on 4 months with out her services she has regressed and I will now have to start over. Thanks for nothing!!

Had an eval for my son with Dr. Walker he was very kind, understanding and knowledgeable. He took the time to talk to us and explain the next steps in our son‚Äôs plan. Only issue I have is trying to contact the office to schedule appointments is difficult many times I‚Äôve called and got nothing but the voicemail. With that being said once I was able to get through Vanessa was very helpful and was able to schedule all the appointments our son needs. Can‚Äôt speak much of the after care as of yet.
Great place, people, and environment. My son has been going for about 3 years and has improved tremendously. Kim, Shannon, and Dominic have been amazing.

I have done the parenting class which I learned so much my son who is 4 with a disability is in school there and receives services. I would give 10 stars he‚Äôs improved so much and loves teachers and staff.

Such a bright and happy place! My 5 year old son was only there at the charter school a week, he needed a different program. But the staff is great, the class rooms are decorated out for a ton of fun. The play grounds are very nice. We were sad to leave it

The worst school. My son arrived with his nails pricked like his fingers were pricked. He was terrified. He also arrived with bacteria on his hands, mouth, and feet. Because of the unsanitary conditions, they cover the teachers. They should call the school department since the children don't speak. I was so depressed that I couldn't take legal action, but I cry out for the autistic children and the abuse that keeps the children away from the married teachers.

I love this school for the simple thing: my kids love this school. They go happy every morning, they leave happy every day. Staff and teachers are super nice, super friendly. I feel safe to have my autistic kids in this school. It‚Äôs so sad now for kindergarten they did not get a spot there. Even thought I give 5 stars! And keep up the great work, team!

This is a terrible school treat kids bad and always have problem and stuff coming up and treats my autistic child like a nobody and don‚Äôt even do they‚Äôre job right calling you about every little accident is a health alert even for a little sneeze

I‚Äôve been trying to reach out to the director of the school for two weeks now and every time I call the excuse is she is busy, or she is in a meeting. I am really disappointed on how they run this program because this shows that a concerned parent can never get to speak to someone in charge of the place.

The teacher Ms.Silva has a disgusting attitude and speaks to you in anyway. The school has not even bothered to reach out to me or my sister and the main director seems to not care about child safety there at all. I will be emailing the school and the district as well until I am heard.
I love it for my daughter. They are very consistent with updates. The pictures are great memories.

Brought our daughter for evaluation. They are exceptionally warm and friendly &have a welcoming environment for both parents and toddlers.  their dedication goes beyond just providing a service, they genuinely care about the well-being of both the children and their families. a valuable resource for parents navigating the early stages of childhood development. Thank you!
I took my son for an evaluation and the staff was great üòä they were super helpful and friendly.
Very nice, friendly, and accommodating

We had such an amazing experience at East Side Acres Ranch with Beth! We had made a reservation a couple of weeks ago for my birthday and came all the way from Miami. Unfortunately, our reservation was canceled due to flooding from the rain ‚Äî which was totally understandable ‚Äî but we never received the cancellation email.

Even so, Beth and Luis were so kind and still let us in. Beth took the time to show us around the ranch, and we‚Äôre so grateful she did! She was incredibly knowledgeable, personable, and you could tell how much she (and everyone here) truly loves the animals. Despite the mix-up, they really went above and beyond to make it up to us, and we left with nothing but good feelings. Highly recommend visiting ‚Äî such a special place run by amazing people! Thank you Beth & Luis!

We were there for a family trip n let me tell u it was an awesome choice ,3 generations of family had da best time ever... We all enjoyed da time spent interacting wit da animals , it was personal n not rushed , so much to do n see ... Can also purchase local artists products like pens collars brackets keychains tee-shirt hoodies, snacks, food n much more... Staff n owner r incredible people friendly helpful informative... Will definitely return... An entertaining place for family fun, a date, birthday celebration, group outing or if u just need to get away n be in a calming environment...Go check dis beautiful spot out...

What a great place to bring your kids to experience a working and clean farm. The owners were super nice and it is very clear that the animals are well taken care of and loved. The price for admission is very reasonable and includes the cost to feed the cows, sheep, alpacas and goats. It is a great way to have a couple of hours of fun and learn about a working farm.

First time there and this place was adorable. Loved all the animals not to mention the family who owns the farm was super nice and took there time with you. I would recommend it we had a great time üòä definitely will be back!

We had so much fun! Definitely recommend. The price includes unlimited animal feedings, as long as the animals are hungry. You can pet and even hold some animals. Best weekday morning spent. The farm is exceptionally well kept and the animals are healthy and happy looking. They take pride in the care and wellbeing of their farm and animals. I would go daily for some animal therapy if I could! 10 out of 10!

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this neighborhood veterinary clinic. I recently rescued an abandoned and neglected senior dog, and this is where I brought her for a full check-up. Dr. Bowens and his incredible team of compassionate professionals took such wonderful care of my new girl.

Even though I‚Äôve only been there twice, they make you feel like family from the moment you walk in. From the friendly front desk staff to the anesthesiologist and Dr. Bowens himself‚Äîeveryone was genuinely kind and attentive.

The prices are also fantastic. Our most recent visit was for a dental cleaning, which included five extractions. I was fully expecting to pay double what I was charged. I‚Äôm still in shock‚Äîand beyond grateful.

We truly can‚Äôt thank them enough.

Thank you, Claudio and team! They did an amazing job taking care of my baby, Lani, with her surgery. My dog is so happy now. Very reasonable pricing as well.
They also took care of her while I had car trouble when picking her up and helped me get back on the road. Incredible Vet, I'll never go anywhere else.
My 3rd opinion for my dog and I will never go anywhere else from here on out. Thank you, Eastside. So happy and comfortable knowing my baby is now cared for by you guys.
ü•∞üíØ‚ù§Ô∏è

They treated my animals very well but when I got pet insurance I needed copies of the soap notes and it took over a month, almost 2 of politely calling and asking for them For them to finally send me them. And thats only after we were forced to go "karen" mode on them on the phone call, which we finally received them that day

These people care about your pets and for the connection the owners have with them.  They know pet is a family member and have done amazing things to ensure the welfare of families.   I can't overstate the kindness they have shown.  You won't regret trusting your fur babies here.  Amazing kindness and top notch care.
Love this vet office and everyone in it!  Down home country atmosphere and they ALL truly care about these fur babies!  Dr. Bowers and his entire staff are amazing!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
Brought my little kitten that was sick, they got us in pretty quick and everyone was very nice ! The Dr. was great ! My kitten is much better now. Definitely recommend this clinic!

Friendly, caring and courteous service.  I could tell my pup was in good hands.  The team was very knowledgeable and informative. They were on time for her appointment.

Previously, my pup was in dire need of emergency surgery and they caught the issue immediately upon arrival.  They gave me the referral that saved her life.  I will always bring her to them moving forward.

Excellent vet, especially for vicious cats. At my previous (very expensive) vet, my angry orange tabby had to be aggressively injected with sedatives multiple times and it still took 3 hours before he stopped trying to kill the technicians and they could examine him. But at Edgewood, he was in and out in an hour, no problem. Dr Lee has decades of experience, never recommends more than you need, and is calm and collected. Highly recommend.

Very welcoming staff. Made me feel very comfortable and informed on my first visit with my new puppy. Dr. Lee provided me with sound advice as a new dog owner and was extremely professional and thorough with his check up! My pup loved her treat. Grateful to call Edgewood Animal Clinic my go to vet place!
The entire staff here at Edgewood Animal Clinic is professional, compassionate and friendly. They've taken wonderful care of my 2 mini dachshunds for the past 2 yrs. Highly recommend!

Edgewood children's Ranch changed my life... Turned me into a better youth and gave me the tools to take on this crazy world in my adult years. May ECR remain a pillar of all things good and righteous!

Edgewood Children's Ranch provides a vital residential ministry to  children and families in need of extra support, encouragement, and development in order to overcome challenges they are facing. They have a highly loving and dedicated staff, that is loving, teaching, and mentoring children and families to overcome deficits, learn at all levels of life, and set a course for a fulfilling future.

This ranch is absolutely beautiful and they want to help the children get their lives together to be wonderful members of society. They have a wonderful school curriculum and it‚Äôs Christian based which makes it a win win
I volunteered here with UCF and it was great! Some of the ranchers joined us and they were all great! They have a wonderful garden where they teach innovative growing techniques!
What a wonderful place to be on a Saturday afternoon for a barbecue picnic! If you're looking for a worthy cause to support, this is an ideal choice.

My 90 year old mom was referred to Fernando Miranda and the team at Effective Physical Therapy by our doctor. She had surgical repair for a right femor fracture and needed PT. I am so happy with her improvement in the limp and how she is stronger and more sure when she walks. Everyone from the front receptionist, billing and therapist are very courteous and kind. The care is absolutely personalized you feel the individual attention to each patient. They also offer other therapies like massage.  We will continue moms PT so she maintains mobility and strength at this stage of her life. I recommend them highly if you have any need of therapy.
Friendly family giving care always putting their patients first. Awesome and great people. It's got to be one of the best Physical Therapy center I rate it a üíØ over all.

I came to effective physical therapy with a strained/torn ligament in my forearm which was interrupting my daily life and activities. So far it‚Äôs been 2 weeks and I can already see so much progress, almost no pain, and will continue to come to ensure no further injury. Besides your normal exercises they have multiple treatment options that they tailor specifically to you. Prices are affordable and staff is very kind and friendly :)
Friendly, welcoming, explained everything, very knowledgeable, good appointment times, had great results. Would recommend to go see Dr. Fernando to my family and friends.

Fernando is Awesome
Best physical therapy place around. Individual attention focused on injury
Very quiet atmosphere which is great
Most places are not this quite
I luv it
He is very kind and very knowledgeable in all areas of the body that need attention
He has helped with my back and my knees after surgery
I feel so much better now!!!
His staff are very kind and helpful.
Thanks girls
Your Awesome

We had Mrs. Lindsey Leist for my sons speech therapy and she was AMAZING! My son excelled and mastered what he needed with her help and enjoyed every minute of it. She kept me informed and up to date on everything going on throughout the time she had him.  He will graduate speech this year and we will miss her dearly, but I'm excited to see how he continues to grow and excel with his language throughout his life.  The confidence he has now that he can be understood is irreplaceable.

I would strongly recommend Lindsey for her services! She has strong communication skills and a wide range of knowledge. She works well with children and makes sure that each plan is geared towards making that child successful by providing them with the resources and tools they need to achieve that.

She goes at the child‚Äôs speed and not only increases their speech abilities but she heightens their confidence. Throughout the several months, she significantly helped improve the child‚Äôs language skills.

Lindsey also takes in consideration to your needs as a parent and what your personal goals are for your child. I‚Äôve had plenty of interaction with professional speech therapists and I can confidently say that she is the one to book. if you‚Äôre consist, the results speak for itself

Lindsey truly did an amazing job at helping my son overcome articulation issues that were holding him back. She was prompt, reliable and caring. We were able to start services right away instead of months of waiting like most speech offices. I would highly recommend her to anyone with little ones having speech issues!

My son is in third grade and just graduated from speech! He loved Lindsey and is going to miss her. She was so great about communicating with me, having a set plan to follow and making learning fun! I am so pleased with his progress.
Lindsey is an amazing therapist with great resources, knowledge and experience.  I would strongly recommend Lindsey to anyone in need of a speech-language pathologist!

Rabbi Elazar Bloom is a caring and compassionate therapist. I have had the privilege to work with him for several years and have experienced first hand his empathetic approach and wisdom. His vast knowledge on couples and family dynamics, parenting, and his many years of experience as an educator, makes him a unique and effective therapist. As someone who also works in the counseling field, I highly recommend Rabbi Bloom to help you overcome challenges and improve your overall sense of well-being.

Rabbi Elazar Bloom brings not only depth, warmth and wisdom to his teachings, he also has a sense of humor and charm, that invites trust and ease to his students. With his guidance I have been able to develop greater awareness of my deeply embedded core beliefs. I highly recommend Rabbi Elazar's coaching services to anyone who wants to unleash potential and be their most authentic self.

Rabbi Elazar Bloom is my go-to referral for couple's seeking counseling.   Clients who have seen him are consistently impressed with his skill, wisdom, depth of insight, and perhaps most importantly, his calm and compassionate approach to healing.  I HIGHLY recommend Elazar Bloom as a therapist, whether you are looking as an individual or couple.

Elazar Bloom has a real depth in his understanding of the psychotherapy process. His ongoing professional development and knowledge and training in various trauma-informed and evidence-based modalities makes him well equipped to work with clients with many types of presenting problems, individual clients or couples. However, the training under his belt is only half of what Elazar has to offer. Elazar‚Äôs warmth and authenticity gives him a profound ability to meet each person in rich human-to-human encounters. These two commodities, each on their own being important, together are the makings of an exceptional therapist.

I have known Rabbi Elazar Bloom many years. He has the unique ability to blend his deep knowledge of Judaism (and Jewish values) and family therapy. His classes and lectures are both an eye opener and insightful, and most of all, practical and down to earth.

Elevate Recovery Lounge was the missing piece to my fitness routine. I‚Äôm in my 40‚Äôs and I love to workout but I often have to take it easy due to knee pain. The combination of the cold plunge with the red light therapy is a game changer on my body!  I don‚Äôt think there is a better way to treat your body after a good workout session. The lounge is clean, well-maintained and has a calming atmosphere. I strongly recommend giving it a try you won‚Äôt regret it.

The ability to elevate your performance with essential recovery tools right after training makes all the difference. Elevate Recovery, located at CrossFit Diehard, has truly been a game changer for my overall health. The immediate effects of the cold plunge, sauna, and red light therapy have been critical to my recovery and performance after every session. I highly recommend checking out this location for the best zenful recovery experience. The atmosphere is incredibly calming, with a zen vibe that enhances the entire experience. Can't recommend it enough! You can also join a good fitness family while your at it.

Elevate Recovery Lounge is truly a hidden gem in Daytona Beach! A warm and welcoming atmosphere. The staff is knowledgeable, professional, and genuinely cares about your health and recovery goals.

I tried their therapy and recovery treatments and was blown away by the results. I felt rejuvenated, energized, and more focused within hours. The facility is spotless, modern, and designed to promote total relaxation. Whether you‚Äôre an athlete, recovering from travel, or just looking to boost your wellness, Elevate is the place to go.

Highly recommend to anyone looking for top-notch recovery services with a personal touch. This place lives up to its name‚Äîyou leave feeling elevated.
Love the recovery lounge. The sauna and red light is amazing. The cold plunge helps so much with soreness. It‚Äôs so nice to get in after a workout.

The Elevate lounge is not just a recovery space; it offers so much more, from the cold plunge that I only regret for a millisecond after diving in, to the sauna that I eagerly anticipate enjoying after my workout. There's also the red light therapy that aids in alleviating my muscle soreness and enhancing my skin's appearance.

Elevate is truly special. As soon as I enter my 4-digit code, I know that during my time in the room, I can set aside all my daily worries and concerns. To be honest, I do bring both of my phones with me, but being in that space puts me in a different mindset. You really have to experience it for yourself. I could write endlessly about the Elevate lounge, but unless you try it yourself, you won't fully understand.

A major advantage is that you can personalize your experience; you can access the room anytime with your unique 4-digit code and enjoy this oasis that is safe, convenient, and an affordable investment in yourself‚Äîyou definitely won't regret it! Another huge plus is its proximity to the gym; it‚Äôs literally right next door. Daytona Beach has a true gem here at CrossFit Diehard.

Of all the ones I've been recommended, this is the best. My niece loves it and doesn't want to leave the office, which speaks volumes about the quality of the treatment. Aliana is wonderful with children

I found the best place to help me with my son's speech development. Liana is his speech therapist, she is simply incredible, loving, attentive, and my son loves her. Every time we take him, he is super happy and excited. He has been in therapy for 4 months and we have already seen a huge improvement in his communication. I highly recommend this clinic and his speech therapist Liana.

Great quality therapy. Karolina has been fantastic with our son. When he started a little over a year ago, he scored significantly below his age level. Today he‚Äôs graduated from therapy performing at or above his age level. The progress he‚Äôs made is all due to Karolina‚Äôs commitment and dedication to seeing him succeed. We are extremely grateful!

The office staff are very responsive and courteous. All emails and voicemails are responded to within 24 hours.

My daughter has been going to Elevate for almost a year now and has seen 2 different therapists within that time. Both of which have been amazing, and the progress she has made is incredible. She loves seeing Ms. Alex! She looks forward to it during the week and always says she had fun afterwards. Thank you for everything you all do to help our children!

I am delighted with the work of speech therapist Liana. My son has improved a lot since he started therapy with her. She is very kind and patient. Her work is sensational. Congratulations! I highly recommend her.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health - Fort Myers - Occupational Therapy, Speech & ABA
review_text: My son attends ABA,OT and speech at this facility. He has been enrolled for over a year and has made exceptional progress! The therapists and staff members are all very professional, kind and approachable.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health - Fort Myers - Occupational Therapy, Speech & ABA
review_text: Jasmine has been my son‚Äôs ABA RBT for 3 years and he absolutely adores her. She is kind and patient, and treats everyone equally. My son has blossomed under her guidance at school. Any child with Autism would be lucky to have Jasmine.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health - Fort Myers - Occupational Therapy, Speech & ABA
review_text: Super Friendly staff! Ms. Emily is the best speech therapist my son improved so much and absolutely adores her! Mrs.Maria the secretary always very helpful I recommend this place 100%  they made us always feel like family!

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health - Fort Myers - Occupational Therapy, Speech & ABA
review_text:
The young Psychiatrist I had threw a temper tantrum and hung up on me! Never showed any empathy from the start. Not sure if it is a race thing or what. Called the Manger to no avail. provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Brooksville
review_text: This place is a HOT MESS, and they are RUDE. If you are trying to get help now...or in the next year, go somewhere else. provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Brooksville
review_text: A mental health clinic with rude, condescending, disrespectful office staff and incomplete/inaccurate billing is ironic, to say the least. It's unfortunate that clients leave due to no longer being able to tolerate the front desk staff, even if they had a decent relationship with their provider. Do better. Quickly.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Brooksville
review_text: Had an initially okay experience until it came time for medications. Hilaire constantly prescribed a medication that I am allergic to in its generic form (anaphylaxia). It was both in my chart and we'd discussed it. When trying to switch providers, the receptionist I spoke to argued back and forth with me about the medication and refused to process my request to switch doctors (sent me the link and never responded). I went unmedicated for months before finally being able to get the necessary medication from my pcp instead. Just a horrible experience.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Cape Coral
review_text:

This impacts my ability to utilize all this EliteDNA has to offer because I have a job and cannot wait that long.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Cape Coral
review_text: Got a text to confirm my appointment and complete the registration. I did that, they said they‚Äôll send me a link and passcode 30 minutes before my appointment. How are you going to charge me a no show fee for ‚Äúmissing an appointment‚Äù when I was waiting for the link and on hold with your facility until my appointment time was over trying to get in contact with someone to figure out if my appointment was canceled or not. review_text: Doctors constantly move around, if not out of Elite. They call and cancel your appointment. provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Cape Coral
review_text: I highly suggest if you are having mental health issues, do NOT attend this facility.  The staff is extremely rude! If you truly want your mental health addressed with understanding and empathy, stay away from this facility.  Your experience at an office begins with whom greets you and beyond.  First impressions are everything.  I did speak with the office manager, Tammy and was not provided with the name of the individual to date but have contacted compliance.  Do better! Be better!

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Gainesville
review_text: My experience with Elite DNA Gainesville has been a blessing in saving my life. I recommend Calvina Hunt; she is amazing and so understanding. provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Gainesville
review_text: I will never come back to this place. I was told to be 15 mins early and I waited way too long to even be seen. My appointment was for 9am but the psychiatrist wasn‚Äôt even done with the previous client until 9:30. If you take longer than an hour for an intake appointment then that‚Äôs ridiculous. That‚Äôs way too long. I had my toddler with me and nobody cared at all that we were even here. I sat with him in the waiting area and had to chase him around cps he was impatient, hungry and tired of being here. Nobody bothered to check up on us or anything or tell us that the doctor would be with his previous patient longer. I ended up leaving since I have medical transportation and have my transportation scheduled. When I leave then everyone decides to come outside and bother me. I was ready to go home and so was my son we were over being there. Then when I was at home I had a police officer ask me if I was hurting my child, I was in shock. Why the hell would he ask me that? Well Apperantly the staff here said i was a concern or whatever and my son was abused. This is the biggest lie I heave ever heard in my life. The officer obviously saw that wasn‚Äôt true and left. I was mad at the staff and I only was mad at them, not once did I do anything to hurt my child that‚Äôs insane. I can‚Äôt believe they would make that crap up! Dont go to this facility they are the worst.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Gainesville

You have to take into account if they see an average of 10 patients a day that‚Äôs over 2500 per year‚Ä¶ if there are 10 negative reviews- that means there are A LOT of happy patients. review_text:

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Orange Park
review_text:
1st experience with them after doing my initial online registration and receiving an appointment for today at 2:15. After not receiving any more paperwork, links or any messages from them, I called today at 2:15 to find out what is going on with my appointment. The receptionist  was completely nonchalant in her attitude about it but looked up my information. She kept insisting they had sent me paperwork today at 1:40 p.m. through text message and it had been " clicked" on. I explained to her that I had not received anything from them through text or email. I had put my email address on the original online paperwork but she insisted that it was missing so we added it. There goes my confidence in their office staff, billing etc.

My biggest concern is her lack of empathy, apology, or concern that a potentially new( psych ) patient didn't receive  their appointment paperwork so they could be seen at their 1st appt and why does her computer say delivered, yet the patient is showing different?
According to her, they didn't have my email address on file either. I had put it in the original online paperwork. One mistake after another !!
She was cold and  cared less about me as a patient. She should not be in a CS position  especially in a psychiatric office. I was honestly a little upset and because I was having to reschedule for 2 weeks later. I mentioned to her that this was triggering my Bipolar and was not a good way to start a new relationship with a new therapist and their staff. She reminded me I could always go somewhere else.
So after so many red flags and hearing that, I don't think I want to waste my time and emotions going through all the initial start up conversation that goes with starting with a new therapist. You completely convinced me that this is not the place for me.

How is anyone who reads off a screen, and doesn't even look at you, a person whom you can trust. Zoom away boo boo.. Wonder how you handle this position in real life. Have a wonderful blessed day

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Orange Park
review_text: Unfortunately I cannot give this place anymore stars. Therapy has been wonderful and 5 star service BUT psychiatry has been horrible. I‚Äôm also a registered nurse and it‚Äôs sad what I have experienced here. They made a huge mistake for my care and in the process created more problems. They made me wait two months to see a new provider. The original one didn‚Äôt help me find good meds for postpartum at all. When asked to see another psychiatrist, they scheduled me for a new visit 2 months out. I patiently wait and come that day it‚Äôs the same freaking psychiatrist that I asked to not see anymore. I know‚Ä¶.shocking. Again, I was patient. They rescheduled me for another two months out and have been giving me such a hard time getting a refill of my antidepressant. After a week of calls from me and the pharmacy in which I ran out of meds, they finally called in a 30 day supply‚Ä¶..meaning I‚Äôll have to jump though these hoops again in 3 weeks since they can‚Äôt get me a follow up. So I will not have seen a doctor for 4 months while starting a new medication. Seems completely unethical and their fault. They need to know what they are doing to people. Maybe I can handle this right now but for the most part a postpartum mom shouldn‚Äôt have to struggle this much for help. Looks to me like Jessica White may be mad I asked for a new provider. But that‚Äôs just speculation.

review_text: i‚Äôve always had a hard time finding a therapist that i am comfortable with and can actually talk to and i found the opposite here. EMILY FRICKER is outstanding. she has changed my life so much and i will be forever grateful. she‚Äôs helped me find myself again and learn healthy coping mechanisms for my ADHD and anxiety. i highly highly recommend her to anyone who feels alone and is struggling mentally. provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Ormond Beach
review_text:
What a blessing to have come into Elite DNA Ormond beach. Exactly a year ago our son who was not even 4 years old was evaluated and accepted as a special case under doctor Barrett!

Where we were last year was dark, scary, lonely, exhausting, and hopeless. Our son needed help and his pediatrician knew it too. No psychiatrist would take him in due to age. It was a miracle to find Dr Barrett at Ormond Beach. One short in person visit, she saw how much our little boy needed early intervention that everyone else refused to offer. Our son has moderate autism and was non verbal. Along with a family history of bipolar disorder his father has. He unfortunately is developmentally delayed by a year due to these significant battles. He would self harm and harm others. He had seizures. He would cry and scream as if he was trapped in a box and could not get out.
She is an Angel! Dr. Barrett on every visit I let her know our gratitude for her time and goals she has for our son. He is 4.5 years old today and is no where near the child you saw a year ago! With her help we have him stable and she gave our little boy back to us! He is catching up like the turtle who wins the race at his own pace. But none of this could have been possible without her help. She was our only source of early intervention and she deeply cares about her patients like her own children or family.
Now our whole family see‚Äôs her. Our daughter for ADHD and my husband for his bipolar management.
I cannot thank Elite DNA enough for passing our son‚Äôs first evaluation for the doctors to view and the one that gave my son a chance of a normal childhood was Dr. Barrett.

We highly recommend this office at Ormond Beach! The front desk staff are always so kind and very understanding of scheduling as well. We have never had any issues.

As I said, it has been over a year. We will not be going anywhere!

Thank you Dr. Barrett again for helping our family. We thank God for you every day as we see our son Zyler, blossom and thrive. None of it would be possible without you!

If I could give 10 stars vs 5 I would!

**Pictures from a recent family vacation with grandparents to Panama City Beach
He enjoyed every second of it! ‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞

review_text: Called the Stuart office, Inquiring about an appointment and I got very blessed with the opportunity to speak with Jill. She was super knowledgeable, caring and helpful.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Stuart
review_text: My insurance changed at work so I tried this place because they accept my insurance. When asked what my previous medication was I answered and the practitioner started acting strange (and my medication is extremely common) . If you dont want an honest answer then don't ask the question and then make someone feel uncomfortable for telling you the truth. I have not been to a Dr in a few years because I have a hard time staying on a schedule or taking medications on a regular basis, i drink alcohol maybe once a week socially. I don't appreciate being made to feel like a drug seeker or a substance abuser. I supplied my general practitioners information and my previous Psychiatrist information for this place.to review. I regret every walking in the door of this place because my condition comes with rejection sensitivity and this encounter has been making me feel incredibly uncomfortable ever since. I have made contact with my previous Dr and they now accept my new insurance so I will be going back to them. I would not recommend this facility if you are hyper sensitive or have rejection sensitivity.

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Tallahassee
review_text:
Do NOT come here if you don't have stable insurance! I want to preface this with my negative review has nothing to do with my provider; she is wonderful and I'd still be seeing her if I had my old insurance. However, if you do not have insurance, expect to be charged an asinine amount to see your provider for 10 minutes and not be able to reach billing after calling 3 times in a week. I saw my provider last in February when I still had my old insurance and it was a very short visit. I did not follow-up in March because I got new insurance and was charged a $40 no-show fee. Understandable and this is industry standard. However, a little over a week ago I was sent a notice that I would be charged $450 for my visit in February. Not only is $450 for a single appointment an insane amount (and my provider is likely only making $60 an hour, if that, so where is the rest of the money going???) but Elite DNA failed to get this amount covered by my insurance back in February when I was still covered! All of my appointments had been previously covered and I wasn't charged a dime. The icing on the cake is that I got this notification and 5 days later $275 was taken out of my bank account by Elite DNA, and another $175 this morning. My account was nearly overdrawn and there is literally nothing you can do to stop them from charging you if you give them your card info. Do NOT do this! This all could be a horrible misunderstanding on my end but their billing department won't call me back, so here I am with $450 less in my bank account for a 10 minute appointment in February that was taken out of my account by them on a five days notice. Will be looking into my options.

Edit: In response to comment from business, I have tried to call twice in past two weeks and still have not had my call returned :( is there any other way I can contact?

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Tallahassee
review_text: Tan has CHANGED my life!!!! I have been in therapy for for 12 years. She is the first therapist that can understand my brain and help me see how beautiful life truly is. And I never thought I would say that. I am so incredibly lucky to have found her. If you're looking for a sign to find a new therapist this is it! Just make sure I can still book my weekly appointments!! üòä

provider_name: Elite DNA Behavioral Health Therapy & Psychiatry Clinic - Tallahassee
review_text:
I deeply regret transferring care to this office. I was scheduled to see Cassandra Melton, NP for continuation of care. I had my records sent over in preparation for the appointment, as I was at the end of my prescriptions and would need refills. it was a disaster from the start. When I arrived for my scheduled appointment, it was under a different name with all of my information. Somehow, they managed to mix my information and another patients information. We don‚Äôt have the same name. I don‚Äôt know how that happened. That made the first 35 minutes extremely stressful. I was even told that I wasn‚Äôt going to be able to be seen After waiting almost 2 months for an appointment. With persistence, I was seen. The office staff was visibly annoyed. The provider was visibly overwhelmed. Cassandra Melton was overwhelmed to the point where she had to cancel The appointment with her next patient. She walked into the lobby, found the patient and told her she would not be able to see her today because it was too late. As if the patient was late and not her office being unorganized. That alone upset me. These appointments are important for continuing medication that cannot be stopped abruptly. This provider did not agree with the 2 previous Providers I‚Äôve seen over the last 10 years. She went on to tell me everything that these providers were doing incorrectly. She even had the audacity to tell me after asking 10 questions that my diagnosis was incorrect. The same diagnosis that took me 2 years in a chair with a psychotherapist working closely with a psychiatrist to obtain. I have also been sent to other specialist to obtain other diagnosis that I have been living comfortably with to for some time now. Think this is my first appointment I did not want to change any of my medication‚Äôs. Unfortunately, that decision was not up to me. Cassandra Melton Refused to prescribe me the same medication I Have been prescribed for over 10 years. She decreased a prescription That has serious side effects if not weaned appropriately by 75%. This is extremely dangerous. Fortunately, I know how dangerous this could be, and I brought this to her attention. She does not agree. Her lack Of basic knowledge highlights her inexperience. If you are considering Looking for a new provider I would look elsewhere. I‚Äôve tried to work with Cassandra Melton To make me feel comfortable with the new prescription regimen however her lack of experience keeps her ignorant. I am concerned that she can Be so comfortable with diagnosing someone on the first visit, but Not trusting years of Records Supporting said diagnosis. I believe this woman Is endangering her patients Because she personally is not comfortable with their regimen. I also can‚Äôt shake the feeling of being judged while sitting in her office. Please keep in mind. I did not prescribe any of these medication‚Äôs that I am currently on to myself. This current regimen was created by a team of doctors. I‚Äôve worked with for several years. She wanted me to take a drug test before she would prescribe me controlled substances. Fine.
At the very same time that I was in her office, there was another new patient in the office beside me Who had not been to a provider in almost 10 years, had Not been prescribed medication in almost 10 years. Laurent and his team at Elite are the BEST!!!  Over the past 3 years, I have taken my 2 giant schnauzers to train with Laurent.  With both dogs being 100+ lbs, it was critical that they (and us as the parents) were well trained and could handle and be comfortable in any situation/environment.

In 2021, I took Ellie when she was 10 months old for the Doggy Boot Camp.  She trained (and stayed) at the facility for 6 weeks, and came home a different dog, with manners and understanding of what was expected of her.  The home training provided at the end of the program was critical to our success of following thru with training at home.  She continues to go to Doggy Day Care a few times a week and is a happy well-rounded girl.

In November 2023, we adopted 1.5 year old Bentley (who had some previous training), but appeared aggressive towards individuals upon first meeting.  I RAN to Elite for a consult, and ultimately enrolled in the 4-week Train and Play program.  Bentley goes everyday (M - F) for training and socialization with other pups.  He is such a smart boy, and really wants to please with whatever you ask him to do.  The training isn't over yet, but the results and feedback that we get from Elite each week are phenomenal!

I can't recommend the Elite program(s) enough!  They are experts at what they do, really dig in to understand your fur baby (and you as their human), and then BAM....make the magic happen!

I can't say enough good things about Elite Professional Dog Training. They truly transformed our walks with Teddy (Our stubborn adorable 4 year old Frenchie), who was very dog reactive. From the first session, Laurent and Josh‚Äôs expertise and understanding of dog behavior shone through. They tailored the training specifically for Teddy, addressing his issues with patience and effective techniques.

What I really appreciated were the regular updates and videos. It was great to see Teddy's progress in real time‚Äîboth the good moments and the challenging ones. This transparency helped us understand the training process and made us feel more involved.

Now, our walks are a joy! Teddy is much more relaxed and obedient, responding well to commands and staying focused. It‚Äôs incredible to see the progress he‚Äôs made.

If you‚Äôre looking for a reliable and effective training service, I highly recommend Elite Professional. They not only took care of Teddy‚Äôs reactiveness but also enriched our bond with him. Thank you Elite Professional Dog Training for everything!

Laurent and his team have been training my dogs for 15 years. The team is firm but loving and very effective in their training.  For me, he has trained Red (the best pitbull to ever exist. Seriously), Shadow (my peace and love English Labrador), Jewels (my wonderful giant German Shepard and Great Dane Mix), Fayre (My sweet and playful German Shepard, Little Miss Fay Fay) and Charlie (My loving, vocal and great sniffer blood hound).

My pup Bragi listens and obeys on command but never lost his personality. He is still the same playful, curious, lovable pup he was before the training. I was recommended to Laurent from a friend and i will recommend Laurent wherever, whenever without hesitation. I am a proud fur Mom of a 7-year-old standard poodle by the name of Ms. Hunnie.

Ms. Hunnie was a show dog since she was 5 months old. Once she retired, I noticed that she still had show dog mentality and was very stubborn, especially if she wasn‚Äôt being shown by her handler.

I love my fur baby and I want to continue to enjoy her. I knew that this transition was new to her as well as to us, and I needed help.

I didn‚Äôt just want anyone to help us with this new transition from being a show dog  to a loving, obedient, well-trained dog that we can enjoy inside our home and outside of our home.

After doing thorough research, we located Elite Professional Dog Training LLC
5001 North Ronald Reagan Blvd
Sanford , Florida 32773.
We met with the trainer, Laurent Gabriel,¬†and Josh.  We watched the interactions with our fur baby, Ms. Hunnie, and they not only won her over but us as well.

We decided on the Boot Camp 4-6 weeks, which meant she had to stay. But I will let you know that was very hard as well; however, the staff kept us updated with an update regularly. They even put up with me calling every single day until I became more comfortable. They also sent videos and pictures of her progress regularly.

I know this was a long review, but if you love your fur baby as I do, give them the extra love they need to be happy.

Thank you, Elite Professional Dog Training

What can I say to everyone at Elite i had the privilege of working with while my puppy went thru  training? The staff is well trained, extremely knowledgeable, and Laurent. Well, Laurent is just amazing. From the bottom of my heart thank you for all the work you put in to Daisy and myself, becoming a team and being able to take a reactive breed as a Cane Corso and to have her under full leash control(we made huge progress after our visit in Downtown Sanford). I really appreciate the way you train the trainer and not just train my pup. Guys Daisy and I can never thank you enough. It truly was a great experience and look forward to a lasting relationship with y'all. THANK YOU ALL AGAIN!!!!

Highly recommend Elite Pro Dog Training! I adopted my dog Ollie and he was very shy and wary of a lot of things. We put him in the Train and Play program and he came out of it with brand new confidence! Laurent and Josh did such a great job and Ollie loves them, especially Josh!

I have waited way too long to write this review! Elite has become like a second home to our girl Greta. My partner and I rescued Greta last November. She had been in a kill shelter in Clayton County, Georgia before a rescue in Ocala, Florida picked her up. Since the day we got her, we knew she was extremely smart. Almost too smart..lol. She was an extremely sweet girl around humans but struggled mainly with resource guarding and reactivity toward other dogs.

My boyfriend and I found Laurent and Elite online and it was single-handedly the best decision we've made for our girl. After giving her a home of course. After our consultation, Laurent suggested we enroll Greta in their train-and-play program so she could work on her socialization with other dogs along with learning essential commands. Not only did he train Greta, but us as well. He helped us be able to understand and communicate with Greta more. Laurent made it possible for Greta to trust us, listen to us, know when it's time to go wild and when it's time to reel it in, and most excitedly for us as dog parents, watch her play with other dogs. She truly is a whole new dog.

We now take Greta to daycare almost every single weekday. She has the best doggy friends, she loves Laurent and all of the staff at Elite, and she gets excited every day to go to Elite.

Whatever your dog is struggling with, Laurent, Josh, and everyone at Elite are the best people to help. They understand dog behaviors and help you understand them too. We are so so grateful to have found them. If you're considering taking your dog here, the answer is 100000% yes.

I cannot recommend Elite Professional Dog Training highly enough! From the very first session, it was clear that they possess an exceptional understanding of canine behavior and training techniques. Both trainers, Laurent and Josh are patient, knowledgeable, and truly passionate about helping dogs and their owners build a strong, positive bond.
Our 10 months mini Goldendoodle, Taj, had issues with issues such as jumping, biting, leash pulling, and just not listening, and within just a few sessions, we saw remarkable improvement Lead trainer Laurent tailored each training session to fit our puppy‚Äôs unique personality and learning style, making the experience enjoyable and effective for both us and our furry friend.
What sets Laurent and his team apart is their ability to teach with kindness and positive reinforcement, ensuring that training is stress-free and fun. They also provided us with clear guidance and practical tips for continuing the training at home.
Thanks to Laurent and his team, we now have a happier, well-behaved puppy.
If you're looking for a professional, compassionate, and skilled dog trainer, Laurent is the one to call!  Additionally, if your dog needs thorough training, their 4-6 week boot camp training is the best!

Emerald M is more than just a riding center‚Äîit‚Äôs a place of healing, growth, and genuine connection. We‚Äôre so thankful to be a part of it.
